For Mr. Holzer's twoact fantasy Nobody Heard the Lions Roar, takes place deep down in a manmade crypt underneath the library. Inhabiting the dusty space is an old, halfdotty anthropologist, who believes that postglacial man is buried near our library and is spending the declining years of his life digging him up.

title: STEPHEN BRIDGES
description: Stephen Bridges, former president of the Stained Glass Association of America and an authority on symbolism in liturgical art, died Saturday of lung cancer at his home in Greenwich Village. He wow 67 years old and lived at 125 Christopher Street.

title: Miss Shemel Wed To Coast Architect
description: Rabbi Ellie Berko: of Srm Francisco performed the ceremony at the home in Berkeley of Dr. and Mrs. Justin Simon.

title: HICKSVILLE SCHOOLS FACE STRIKE BY 90 CUSTODIANS
description: The Hicksville, I,. 1., school district is facing a strike by 90 custodians today, but all 10 of the district's schools are expected to be in operation, according to Superintendent Frederick Hill. Mr. Hill said last night that the teachers union had informed him its members would report to work on schedule.

title: Hundreds Arrested in New Hampshire Atom Protest
description: SEABROOK, N.H., Monday, May 2The state police moved into a crowd of about. 2.000 demonstrators against a nuclear energy plant and began arresting them yesterday evening, charging them with trespass in their occupation of the site of the proposed plant.

title: TWO MILLION IN MOSCOW PARADE BEFORE LEADERS
description: MOSCOW, May 1 (UPI)About two million flagwaving marchers paraded before the Soviet leadership today in May Day celebration on the sundrenched cobblestones of Red Square.

title: 39 Killed in Fighting at May Day Rally in Istanbul
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, May 1At least 39 persons were killed and about 200 wounded today when a giant May Day rally in the heart of Istanbul turned into a gun battle with ultraleftists pitted against the police and trade unionists.

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, MAY 2, 1977

title: 30 Shot in Sri Lanka
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka, May 1 (Reuters) The police today shot and wounded about 30 people here during clashes between rival Sri Lankan political groups on their way to May Day rallies.

title: Special Tactics Units of the Police Are Frequently Idle in the Suburbs
description: CHICAGO, April 29The police force in Highland Park, a welltodo suburb just north of here on Lake Michigan, has a Special Weapons and Tactics unit to cope with snipers or riots or other violence. It has never been used.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Olympic Committee Gives Athletes Means to Fight Amateur Sports Bans
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, May 1 (AP)The United States Olympic Committee ended its threeday meeting today by giving American amateur athletes a new bill of rights.

title: Thailand Cracks Down On Adoptive Baby Trade
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 1 (Reuters)The Government here has cracked down on a trade in Thai babies for adoption in Europe.

title: Yanks Beat Mariners, 52, for Holtzman
description: The Seattle Mariners ended their first visit to New York yesterday with the tiniest of consolationsthey outhit the Yankees, 138, but lost the game, 5.2, at Yankee Stadium.

title: Big Old Houses Selling Well Despite High Heating Cost
description: EVANSTON, Ill., May 1Along the North Shore, the rectangle of suburbs that stretches north from Chicago, the cold winter winds knife in from Lake Michigan and spring is a long time coming.

title: Use of Nuclear Power Condemned By Salzburg Counterconference
description: SALZBURG, Austria, May 1A conference of 100 scientists, environmental specialists and antinuclear activists from 20 countries today condemned the commercial use of plutonium as a source of energy and called for a steppedup fight against conventional nuclear power plants.

title: Senator Inouye Will See Carter About Release of Report on C.I.A.
description: HONOLULU, May I (UPI)Senator Daniel K. Inouye, chairman of the Senate Intelligence Committee, said today that he would soon meet with President Carter regarding Mr. Carter's objections to the release of a report on the Central Intelligence Agency. The Hawaii Democrat said Mr. Carter had phoned him and objected to one sentence in the committee's report.

title: The F.B.I. And The Law
description: BOSTON, May 1It is just a year since a Senate committee reported on the crimes and abuses committed by United States intelligence agencies. But memories are so short in this country that we have already begun to forget the chilling catalog of what was done.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: About 150 people picketed across the street from Morven, Governor Byrne's official residence, in Princeton, Saturday urging him to veto a bill to restore capital punishment in New Jersey. It's up to us to prove that we don't like the idea that the government is going to kill people to show that killing people is wrong, said Assemblyman Eldridge Hawkins, Democrat of Essex County.

title: Commodities: The Hunt Saga
description: The Hunt family saga in soybeans futures raises question of cornering markets, regulation and ethics. Page 54.

title: Dublin's Crackdown on I.R.A. Could Pay Dividends at Polls
description: DUBLIN, April 29The coalition Government of the Irish Republic is bearing dovirn harder than ever on the Provisional Irish Republican Army.

title: Music: Lande
description: The M. Elson gallery, 463 West Broadway, was transformed into Axis in SoHo, a new jazz cafe, according to the publicity, on Saturday evening. Tables were set close together around the highceilinged room, an organic .menu was served, and music was provided by Art Lande's Rubisa Patrol, quartet from San Francisco that records for the ECM label but has been little heard on the East Coast. The Elson gallery's music series will continue on succeeding Saturdays with more jazz in a more or less similar vein_

title: Schmidt Faces New Demand To Speed German Economy
description: WASHINGTON, May 1  Chancellor Ifelmut Schmidt of West Germany will come under considerable pressure, mainly from the leaders of France, Britain and Italy, at next weekend's London economic summit, to get the German economy moving faster and thus help liven up the world economy, according to sources close to the summit preparations.

title: Borodin Quartet From Moscow Back in New York After 4 Years
description: Playing in Town Hall yesterday afternoon, the Borodin Quartet reappeared here after a fouryear absence. Last year the Moscowbased group lost its first violinist and guiding hand, Rostislav Dubinsky, who left the Soviet Union. to live in the Netherlands, as well as its second violinist. They were replaced by Mischa Kopelman and Andrei Abramenov. Dimitri Shebalin continues as violist and Valentin Berlinskv as cellist.

title: Bridge:
description: New England players dominated the knockout team play at the Long Island Regional Championships at Hofstra University yesterday. Jeff Horowitz and Larry Bausher, both of New Haven; John Batcheller of Springfield, Mass., Jim Bennett of Hartford, clashed in the final last night with Allan Cokin of Providence, R.I., Steve Sion of Boston. Dave Berkowitz of New York, and Harold Lilie of Woodmere, L.I.

title: Cuban Delegation Is Picketed
description: ORLANDO, Fla., May 1 (AP)About 30 members of the Bay of Pigs Veterans Association, Brigade 2506, today picketed the hotel where 16 Cubans are attending an international citrus symposium. Rober to Carbello, head of the Miamibased veterans group, said the picketing, to protest what the group considers Cuba's violation of human rights, would continue through the delegation's weeklong stay at the symposium, which has drawn 700 citrus experts from 40 nations.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: A FORTUNE IN OLD TIRES: Cecil Heidelberger, who has been in the used tire business for 30 years, posing with some of the tiresestimated at between eight and millionthat occupy 10 acres behind his ranch in An

title: CUOMO DELAYS ENTRY INTO MAYORAL RACE
description: To take advantage of the free broadcast time that can help him win the recognition he now lacks. Mario M. Cuomo said yeiterday that he would delay the official announcement of his mayoral candidacy for a week or so.

title: Leonard Silk
description: A draft of the communiqu to be released after the economic summit conference in London next weekend has already been written. In fact, many drafts for the Downing Street affair have already been writtenin Washington, Ottawa, London, The Paris, Bonn, Rome and Tokyo. They have been Economic flying from capital to capiScene tal in an effort to find common ground among President Carter and the six other heads of government. Here Is a draft of our own, submitted without charge to the powers and bureaucrats that be:

title: West African] Group Said to Starve Dissidents
description: NAIROBI, May 1 (Reuters)Two young men from SouthWest Africa say they escaped from a concentration camp in Zambia where more than 1,000 SouthWest Africans were being held on a starvation diet on the orders of the SouthWest Africa People's Organization.

title: 39 Killed in Fighting at May Day Rally in Istanbul
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, May 1At least 39 persons were killed and about 200 wounded today when a giant May Day rally in the heart of Istanbul turned into a gunbattle with ultraleftists pitted against the police and trade unionists. Panic broke out as shots scattered crowd estimated at about 150,000 jammed into Taksim Square,

title: Metropolitan Area Relatively Efficient In Its Use of Energy
description: For cooking, heating, watching television, operating washers and driers and general traveling around, the average resident in the New YorkNew JerseyConnecticut metropolitan region uses about onethird less energy than the average person in the country as a whole.

title: Rockets Defeat Bullets, Capture Series, 108103
description: LANDOVER, Md., May 1 (AP)Mike Newlin scored 15 points in the fourth quarter today as the Houston Rockets defeated the Washington Bullets, 108103, to win their Eastern Conference semifinal series in the National Basketball Assocation, 4 games to 2.

title: New Alan Ayckbourn Play: Has He Become Serious?; Just Between Ourselves in London Shows All the Playwright's Touches
description: LONDON  Alan Ayckbourn, like Faust, works at night. He writes his plays in a series of postmidnight vigils, always at the last minute and in a tearing hurry.

title: Women Priests Are Called Real Obstacle
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 1 (UPI)The Presiding Bishop of the Episcopal Church says his denomination's women priests present a real obstacle to the eventual reunion of the Roman Catholic Church and the worldwide Anglican Communion.

title: The Standings
description: Monday, May 2, 1977

title: New York Council Panel Vows to Act on Problems Vexing Small Businesses
description: A New York City Council committee yesterday said it would act immediately to alleviate three common problems of small businesses throughout the citylack of adequate parking, insufficient security and red tape.

title: Judit Jaimes's Immaculate Pianism
description: It would have been very simple for Judit Jaimes to turn her Alice Tully Hall piano recital Sunday night into a selfadvertising virtuoso display. The three pieces of her program, sonatas by Berg and Schubert (D. 784 in A minor) and the Schumann Symphonic Etudes, have been treated as such, but the young Venezuelan pianist is not that sort of a musician.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: W.H.A. Playoffs
description: SEMIFINAL ROUND

title: Text of Carter Welfare Remarks
description: WASHINGTON, May 2Following is the text of a statement on welfare by President Carter.

title: Taxes & Accounting
description: What happens when a certified public accounting firm disagrees with its client over the need for disclosing the results of an Investigation into questionable payments?

title: Pirates in First Place With Aid From Braves
description: The Atlanta Braves, who have lost irfne straight games and have plunged close to the basement of the National League's Western Division, have been helping a lot of other teams with their pathetic play.

title: Carter Stresses His Commitment To Human Rights
description: LONDON. May 2President Carter, speaking to European television viewers today, proclaimed an undeviating commitment to human rights everywhere, and said he would maintain it until the last day I'm in office.

title: Panel Criticizes F.D.A. for Lack of Control Over Industry's Safety Testing of New Drugs
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The Food and Drug Administration has been lax in enforcing some aspects of laws regulating new pharmaceuticals, a special Federal panel that has been investigating the agency for two years concluded in a report made public today.

title: Dow Up by 4.32 on Rises in Orders To Factories and Building Outlays
description: The Stock market, buoyed by encouraging economic news, advanced moderately yesterday in slower trading.

title: Dividends
description: MONDAY, MAY 2, 1977

title: Common Market Confirms Disappearance of Uranium
description: BRUSSELS, May 2 (AP)The European Common Market toay officially confirmed reports that 200 tons of uranium mysteriously disappeared from a freighter bound from Antwerp, Belgium, to Genoa, Italy. in 1968. the incident was reported last week by The Los Angeles Times and The New York Times and by Paul L. Leventhal, a former Senate aide who told of the incident at a conference on nuclear power in Salzburg, Austria.

title: A Surprise For the Reformers
description: It's at least candid of President Carter and Joseph A. Califano, the Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, to admit that reforming the welfare program has turned out to be a more complex problem than Mr. Carter pictured it in his campaign.

title: Nation Lacks Food Export Policy Despite Crises, G.A.O. Declares
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The United States still lacks an integrated foodexport policy and a systematic approach to monitoring and managing supplies despite five years of repeated crises since the big Soviet grain deals of 1972, the General Accounting Office said today.

title: Books of The Times
description: Presently, The New York Times Book Review will publish an interview with Anne Tyleron the occasion of her seventh novel in 13 yearsand she will explain that she Is populating a town; that each new, thin book is simply an extension of the last one and that the need hasn't seized her, at age 36, to perpetrate the Big Novel, a fat compendium of all she thinks and feels about Original Sin in the Middle Atlantic States of America. Perhaps then we will wake up to the sinewy ambition, the fierce and lyric witness, of this guerrilla in diffident prose. Reviewers love her; readers, she deserves.

title: G.M. Votes Dividends Totaling $1.85 a Share
description: DETROIT, May 2The board of directors of the General Motors Corporation, which made a record $903 million in the JanuaryMarch period, today declared secondquarter dividends of $1.85 a share, a record for the period.

title: F.B.I. CHECKING REPORT OF PLOT TO DEFAME LUGAR
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP)  The Federal Bureau of Investigation is investigating allegations by Senator Richard G. Lugar, Republican of Indiana, that unidentified plotters tried to link him falsely to an alleged attempt to launder $1.35 million in illegal contributions to President Nixon's 1972 campaign.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Harassment of Meat Inspectors Is Laid to School Lunch Concern
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (UPI)A Green Bay, Wis., company that furnishes nearly half the hamburger for school lunch programs may have been harassing and even threatening harm to Federal meat inspectors, Assistant Agriculture Secretary Carol Foreman said today.

title: Faculty Puts Knowledge to Music
description: Sunday's appearance by the Pierrot Consort at Carnegie Recital Hall was the first anywhere for the new ninemember ensemble, which is composed of faculty members from Long Island University's C. W. Post Center.

title: May Day Crackdown by Madrid Brings Bitter Protest by Unions
description: MADRID, May 2 (UPI)Labor unions today accused the Government of Prime Minister Adolfo Suarez of severe repression of May Day celebrations throughout Spain and said 200 persons had been injured in Madrid alone when riot policemen broke up banned rallies.

title: McCannErickson Is Viceroy's New Agency
description: The Brown & Williamson Tobacco Corporation yesterday made its longawaited decision on a new agency for Viceroy cigarettes McCannErickson. The assignment is for creative work only. PostKeyesGardner does all the media planning and buying for the company.

title: Hearing on Laetrile Opens With Emotional Testimony
description: KANSAS CITY. Mo., May 2 (AP)A public hearing on the alleged cancer treatment laetrile opened today with proponents calling the hearing a kangaroo court and a psychiatrist testifying that the use of the substance was suicide.

title: Parks Stock Acquired
description: The Norin Corporation reported that as of last Friday Norin Foods Products Inc., a subsidiary, had acquired 471,000 shares, or about 92 percent, of the 511,083 shares outstanding of H. G. Parks Inc. The total includes 316,000 shares, or about 62 percent of the company's stock, which Norin had previously acquired from two controlling shareholders of Parks, a Baltimorebased meat products company. Norin had previously extended its purchase offer of $10 a share to May 13.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Buying a Bride: It's an Old Ashkhabadian Custom
description: ASHKHABAD, U.S.S.R.  The prospective bride's mother was willing only if the price was right16,000 rubles, 100 robes and some livestock. Otherwise she threatened to marry her daughter to a wealthier man.

title: Daniel J. Ferris, Longtime Leader In Amateur Athletics, Is Dead at 87
description: AMITYVILLE, LI., May 2Daniel J. Ferris, a leading figure in amateur athletics in the United States and abroad for more than 70 years, died early this morning in a nursing home here after a long illness. He was 87 years old.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Military Starting to Deal With Alcoholism
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The armed forces have quietly begun to cope with alcoholism, a far more serious and widespread problem than narcotics in the military.

title: Hemmed Up
description: Oscar de la Renta showed two: a loose dress in Donegal tweed and a leather tunic. Stephen Burrows showed a number of them, mostly sweater dresses. Mary McFadden's was pleated and bubbleshaped, and even Halston had a few, worn over his body sweaters.

title: SOVIET, AT U.N., ATTACKS HUMAN RIGHTS GROUPS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 2Serge N. Smirnov, the Soviet delegate at the United Nations Economic and Social Council, charged at a meeting of the Social Committee today that the International League for Human Rights and Amnesty International were poisoning ciotente and engaging in slanderous accusations aganst the Socialist countries.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Carter Stresses His Commitment ToHumanRights
description: LONDON, May 2President Carter, speaking to European television viewers today, proclaimed an undeviating commitment to human rights everywhere, and said he would maintain it until the last day I'm in office.

title: Stavisky and Goodman Differ Now on the Act
description: Once united in sponsoring one of the most controversial bills in recent years, State Senator Roy M. Goodman, a Manhattan Republican, and Assemblyman Leonard P. Stavisky, a Queens Democrat, have split on the measure, which requires that education expenditures in the New York City budget be maintained at the same proportionate levels as the average of three prior years.

title: Record Reserves Of World's Grains Expected by U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP)Barring sudden weather problems, world grain production should again outstrip consumption, leaving global reserves of wheat, corn and other foodproducing grains at, record levels by mid1978, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: Hanan Asked to Head Beame Campaign Unit
description: Mayor Beame has asked Timothy A Hanan, a close friend of Senator Edward M. Kennedy, to head his cam+ paign committee for reelection, City Half sources said yesterday.

title: People in Sports
description: When Sparky Lyle, the Yankee relief pitcher, and the former Mary Fontaine Massey stepped out of Marble Collegiate Church following their wedding yesterday, they discovered that their chauffeurdriven Cadillac was gone. Friends had replaced it with a 1936 fire engine, used years ago by Milton Berle on his television comedy show. The bride, the groom, the ushers and bridesmaids hopped aboard and rode itbells clanging and sirens blaring from the church on Fifth Avenue and 29th Street all the way to McTeague's on East 79th. There the reception was attended by teammates, coaches and the Yankee owner, George Steinbrenner.

title: Critic's Notebook: London Means Theater and the Theater Spells London
description: LONDONAn old man in a worn but wellbrushed topcoat chats with the woman beside him as the No. 15 bus starts and stop its way down Fleet Street. Just past the Law Courts, she gets up. Good bye, my dear, he says. God bless.

title: Carey Expected to Announce Today A Post for Containing Health Costs
description: Governor Carey is expected to announce today that he has created a cabinetlevel Office of Health Systems Management to carry out his program to keep healthcare costs from rising.

title: Carpenters Vote to Strike
description: PHILADELPHIA. May 2 (AP)Union carpenters in the fivecounty Philadelphia area voted last right to go on strike, after rejecting a contract proposal from two contractors associations.

title: Communist Changes in Laos Upset Easygoing Way of Life
description: VIENTIANE. LaosShortly after dawn, loudspeakers around this capital begin broadcasting revolutionary music and people leave for work. Most city people are employed by the Government nowadays, and in the hot season working hours are from 7 to II A.M. and from 2 to 5 P.M.

title: Energy Authorization Passed
description: WASHINGTON. May 2 (AP)  The House approved a $4.9billion authorization today for Federal energy programs, most of which Congress has already funded.

title: Mondale Will Meet With South African On Rhodesian Rule
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP)The Carter Administration, stepping up its drive for black rule in Rhodesia, is sending Vice President Mondale to Vienna for talks with Prime Minister John Vorster of South Africa, Administration sources said tonight.

title: Senate Panel Votes StripMining Curbs Similar to House's
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP)The Senate Energy and Natural Resources Committee approved today, 15 to 3, its version of legislation establishing environmental and reclamation standards for coal strip mining.

title: ELAM VANGILDER
description: CAPE GIRARDEAU, Mo., May 2 (UPI) Funeral services were held today for Elam Vangilder, a former baseball pitcher with the St. Louis Browns. Mr. Vangilder died Saturday at the age of 81.

title: Bruins Ready For Start of Final Playoffs
description: The Boston Bruins to the Montreal Canadiens: We're waiting for you, and we're ready.

title: Jersey City Candidates Take New
description: JERSEY CITY, May 2The three top mayoral candidates took to the streets today looking for the votes that could mean the difference between a firstballot victory on May 10 and a runoff election next month.

title: School Results
description: BOYS BASEBALL

title: S.E.R.A. Decision Delay
description: The Board of Estimate announced that it had postponed any decision concerning city financing of S.E.R.A., a controversial drug rehabilitation program in the Bronx that has been ac cused of using fictitious clients. The Comptroller's office had requested that the board terminate financing the program as of June 30. The board will hold a special meeting later this week to consider the Comptroller's request.

title: Key Segment of Package of Bills On Elderly Stalled in Assembly
description: ALBANY, May 2An elaborately heralded effort by the Legislature to fashion a meat package of bills benefiting the elderly on the eve of Senior Citizens Day inShe Capitol fizzled this afternoon when the: Assembly leadership botched a principarineasure that would have liberalized propertytax exemptions for people 65 years of age and over.

title: 2 Named in Counterfeiting
description: A Federal indictment in Manhattan charged two men, identified as Giu. seppe De Vivo of the Bronx and James Le Pore of Yonkers, with conspiracy to sell $2 million in counterfeit $100 bills. The prosecutor, Alan R. Naftalis, said Mr. De vivo ??perated the Mohegan Variety Store in Fort Lee and Mr. I.e Pore worked as a salesman In the store. The Indictment alleged that the defendants had delivered $109,800 in counterfeit bills last March.

title: World Team Tennis
description: LAST NIGHT'S MATCH

title: East College Baseball
description: STANDING OF THE TEAMS

title: FACTORY SHIPMENTS REACH A 6YEAR HIGH
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (UPI)Factory shipments rose 5 percent in March for the biggest gain in more than six years, the Commerce Department said today. The department also said factory orders gained 5.2 percent for the second largest monthly increase since December 1970.

title: 3C GASOLINE TAX RISE IS PROPOSED IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, May 2Transportation authorities in the House called today for a 3centagallon increase in gasoline taxes for highway improvements and a separately financed mass transit fund that cities could use to buy buses and trains.

title: Gas Pipeline From Alaska Across Canada Proposed
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The Federal Power Commission recommended today that a planned pipeline to carry natural gas from Alaska's North Slope be built across Canada.

title: CocaCola's Ewnings Climb 18.9%
description: The CocaCola Company, the world's largest soft drink maker, had an 18.9 percent rise in earnings on an 11.3 percent sales gain in the first quarter.

title: Sweden Beats Soviet Six; U.S. Team Defeated, 63
description: VIENNA, May 2 (UPI)Sweden put an end to Soviet Union domination of the world ice hockey championship today with a 51 victory over the previously undefeated team.

title: Notes on People
description: Only six years after Swiss women won the right to vote, a woman yesterday assumed oneof the highest offices in the land. She is Elisabeth Blunschy, a 54yearold lawyer who is one of 11 women in the 200member Swiss national council, the lower house of the parliament. Mrs. Blunschy was elected president of the council, which by protocol is considered the topranking position in the country. She succeeds

title: GRAINS & FEEDS
description: CHICAGO BOARD OF TRADE

title: A.C.C. Rejects Va. Tech
description: RESEARCH TRIANGLE PARK, N.C., May 2 (UPI)The Atlantic Coast Conference rejected Virginia Tech as an eighth member today in its first vote on expanding the conference since was formed in 1953. Commissioner Robert C. James said the reasons for the rejection would not be released to the public or Virginia Tech.

title: Corntech Agreed on No Trading With Israel for Mideast Contract
description: Comtech Laboratories, a Long Island manufacturer of microwave and satellite communications equipment, reported to the Securities and Exchange Commission that it had agreed not to trade with Israel as a requisite to landing a $19 million contract in the Middle East last year.

title: Gen. Svetlichn We will let him rot in the insane asylum!
description: The abuse of psychiatry for political purposes in the Soviet Union has a long and complex history. Prior to Stalin's death, the Soviet regime had no need to cover up political repressions.

title: Edward N. Cole, Auto Innovator; Retired as G.M. President in 74
description: KALAMAZOO, Mich., May 2 (AP)Edward N. Cole, a former president of the General Motors Corporation, was killed today when his twinengine plane crashed in a field 15 miles south of the airport in in a field 15 miles south of the airport in this western Michigan city.

title: ATOM PLANTS FOUND TO MISS TONS OF FUEL
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The General Accounting Office told Congress today that commercial nuclear facilities in the United States were not able to account for thousands of pounds of highly enriched uranium and plutonium.

title: W.A.C. Adds Las Vegas, Hawaii and Drops Bowl
description: DENVER, May 2 (UPI)  Western Athletic Conference officials voted today to add the University of Hawaii and the University of NevadaLas Vegas to the league to compensate for the departures of Arizona and Arizona State.

title: Belfast Stores Bombed, Railway Cut At Start of Protestant Ulster Strike
description: BELFAST. Northern Ireland, Tuesday, May 3Several Belfast stores were firebombed early today as a general strike called by militant Protestants began in this British province. On the outskirts of Belfast a powerful bomb ripped out railroad tracks on the BelfastBangor line.

title: CARTER WORD SCRAP WELFARE PROGRAMS FOR A NEW SYSTEM
description: WASHINGTON, May 2  President Carter declared today that the nation's present welfare system should be scrapped and a totally new system implemented.

title: Lawyer for Nixon Denies Hush Money
description: WASHINGTON, May 2An attorney for Richard M. Nixon said today that the final version of a transcript of a Jan. 8, 1973, conversation between Mr. Nixon and Charles W. Colson did not contain any references to hush money.

title: 1,200 Chinese in Pakistan Are Reported Under Siege By Mountain Tribesmen
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, May 2 (AP)Mountain tribesmen opposed to Prime Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto have cut off 1,200 Chinese laborers working on a ChinesePakistani highway project, an informed source reported today.

title: AirPiracy Trial
description: Airpiracy charges against four Croatians accused of having hijacked a Trans World Airlines jet plane last Sept. 10 are expected to be submitted today to a jury, which has heard five weeks of testimony.

title: SENATE VOTES CARTER BILL FOR $20 BILLION STIMULUS
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP)The Senate approved today, 63 to 15, a $20.4 billion appropriation bill to finance major portions of President Carter's economic stimulus program. Sponsors said the funds would create nearly one million jobs directly or indirectly.

title: People and Business
description: Shokiehl Uehara, chairman of the Taisho Pharmaceutical Company, reported the largest income$6 million in Japan last year, The Associated Press reported yesterday, Mr. Uehara, who is 79 years old, is a member of the upper house of Parliament. His son Shoji, president of Taisho, reported income of $2.3 million.

title: Bermuda Affirms Death Sentence
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, May 2 (AP)Peter Lloyd, the acting governor, said today that he had decided against commuting the death sentences of Erskine Durrant Burrows and Larry Winfield Tacklyn. The two were convicted and sentenced to hang in the 1973 shooting deaths of Gov. Richard Staples and his aide, Capt. Hugh Sayers. They also were convicted in the 1972 slaying of the police chief. George Duckett.

title: Gold Price Rises $1 An Ounce in Europe; Dollar Falls Slightly
description: LONDON, May 2 (AP)The price of gold rose by $1 an ounce in London and Zurich today while the dollar lost slightly against most European currencies.

title: New Center for Retarded Opposed as Obsolete
description: After all the horrors of Willowbrook the wretched conditions, the human misery, the exposes, the repeated contempt motionsthere is now a new, bright, beautiful building into which Willowbrook's retarded patients can be moved. And there is also a move afoot to keep the retarded out of itfor their own good, the critics say.

title: Post Asked to Retract Article
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP)Former President Nixon, through his lawyers, has asked The Washington Post to retract an article saying that he was aware in January 1973 of hush money being sought to buy the Watergate burglars silence.

title: LIBYAN HIJACKER BALKED BY PILOT AT ROME AIRPORT
description: ROME, May 2 (UPI)A Libyan used a knife to threaten the pilot of an Iberian Airlines jetliner today and said he would blow up the plane unless it was flown to Madrid. The pilot squirted him with a fire extinguisher and overpowered him.

title: Meadowlands
description: ENTRIES

title: Boeing Reports 80.8% Rise in Net; Lockheed's Is Up 11% for Quarter
description: The Boeing Company, the largest producer of commercial jet aircraft in the nonCommunist world, reported yesterday a rise of SO.S percent in firstquarter earnings.

title: Yankees
description: BATTING

title: Race Pileup Kills Motorcyclist
description: SALZBURG, Austria, May 2 (AP)Hans Stadelmann, a Swiss motorcyclist, was killed yesterday in a pileup at the Grand Prix of Austria race. Three other competitors were injured, but their attending physician said today that they were in satisfactory condition. They are Dieter Braun of West Germany, Johnny Cecotta of Venezuela and Patrick Fernandez of France.

title: Oil Slick in North Sea Said to Be Almost Gone
description: STAVANGER, Norway, May 2 (AP)The oil slick from the eightday Ekofisk well blowout had virtually disappeared from North Sea waters today and production began again at the offshore oil field after a fourday halt, officials said.

title: JUSTICES UPSET BAN ON HOUSE SALE SIGNS
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The Supreme Court ruled today, 8 to 0, that it is generally unconstitutional for a community to prohibit the posting of for sale and sold signs in front of homes in hopes of stemming the flight of white homeowners and thus maintaining a racially integrated community.

title: Dance: The Pauline Koner Touch
description: Pauline Koner is a solitary sensibility who picks and chooses from the prevailing choreographic fashions of any period and makes something quite personal out of them. Her company's program on Sunday afternoon at the Henry Street Settlement Playhouse featured works from the 1950's, 60's and 70's.

title: What's Cooking?
description: You can say this for the Joseph Jacobs Organization boy, are they nosy. Every year the J.J. folks (they're experts on the Jewish market) commission the Pulse Inc. to go through people's pantries in this area to see what Jews are buying, compared with nonJews.

title: Maryland Inconsistent In Lacrosse
description: The University of Maryland's position In the collegiate lacrosse world should satisfy almost anyone.

title: SADAT'S ZAIRE ACTION VIEWED AS POLITICAL
description: CAIRO, May 2President Anwar elSadat appears to have made more of a political gesture than a military commitment in announcing last night that Egypt will take over the operation of the entire Zarian air force, Western diplomats here said today.

title: Bond Prices Continue to Decline as Federal Funds Rate Holds Above
description: Bond prices continued to decline yesterday as the Federal funds rate traded well above 5 percent all day and dealers tried to figure out where the Federal Reserve wanted this key shortterm interest rate to settle. Trading activity was light as many tracers and investors waited to hear what Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve, would say in testimony this morning before the Senate Banking Committee.

title: Troops Patrol Streets Of Tense San Salvador
description: SAN SALVADOR, May 2 (Reuters)Troops on foot and in armored cars today guarded the main squares of this central American capital as tension mounted in the wake of the fatal shootings of eight persons in a leftist demonstration yesterday.

title: Opposition Leaders Meet
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, May 2 (Reuters) Pakistan's opposition leaders moved closer tonight to a dialogue with Prime Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto to resolve a twomonthold political crisis begun by opposition charges of electionrigging.

title: Vote Opposes Athletic Panel
description: DENVER, May 2 (UPI)The Colorado House voted today to abolish, the State Athletic Commission, which is in charge of both amateur and professional boxing and wrestling. The action was virtually identical to one taken earlier this year by the State Senate. However, the House set a July 1 date for abolishing the commission, a full year ahead of the phaseout scheduled by the Senate.

title: VW Predicts Improvement In 77 Sales, and Profit As Good as Last Year's
description: WOLFSBURG, West Germany, May 2The chairman of Volkswagen's management board predicted today that sales would improve considerably this year and that earnings would be at least as good as last year.

title: Grand Verdi Requiem by Collegiate Chorale
description: Verdi's Requiem, the nearest thing to a grand opera that was ever cast in the form of a mass, goes beyond the kind of devotional chamber works that we have come to regard as Richard Westenburg's stakedout territory.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, MAY 3, 1977

title: King and I, Reminder of Golden Age
description: Yul Brynner is a great actoror at the very least a great acting presencenot because of what he does but because of what he is. He strides on a stage caught in the in able spotlight of his personHe gestures, gesticulates, and moves with the certainty of an automaton and the grace of a dancer.

title: Experts Urge Controls on Device That Takes CrossSection XRay
description: WASHINGTON, May 2An expert committee called today for limits on the acquisition, use and fees for revolutionary new Xray diagnostic equipment that produces clear crosssectional pictures of the living body.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, May 2The State Commission of Investigation urged the State Senate today to strengthen further the casino gambling bill that was passed by the Assembly last Monday night.

title: Support for L.I. Strike
description: Members of the Hicksville Congress of Teachers voted to support a strike by 90 maintenance men, custodians and groundskeepers at the eight schools in Hicksville, L. I. The strike began yesterday over a salary dispute in a new contract, but classes were held. After school hours, according to a spokesman for the Civil Service Employees Association, the teachers voted not to cross picket lines today.

title: Seattle Slew Show Commands Kentucky Derby Spotlight
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 2How do you catch lightning in a bottle at a oneday yearling auction when you're bidding against some of the world's shrewdest horse traders?

title: Carter Signs Housing Measure
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP)President Carter signed today legislation adding about $400 million to Federal housing programs, the White House announced, The legislation increases authorized funding for housing assistance payments in the current fiscal year to $1.2 billion from $850 million. It increases funding authorization for public housing from $576 million to $595.6 million.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: About Hunting for Turkeys
description: Time is short for those who wish to obtain the special $2 permit needed in addition to a regular hunting licenseto pursue wild turkeys in the May 16to29 spring season in New York State.

title: JUSTICES UPSET BAN ON HOUSE SALE SIGNS
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The Supreme Court ruled today, 8 to 0, that it is generally unconstitutional for a community to prohibit the posting of for sale and sold signs in front of homes in hopes of stemming the flight of white homeowners and thus maintaining a racially integrated community.

title: 9 CAR INSURERS GIVEN RATE RISES BY ALBANY
description: Nine autoinsurance companies, including New York State's largest insuror, Allstate, have been granted rate increases ranging from an average 10.2 percent to 21;8 percent, the State Insurance Department announced yesterday.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SMILEIN The public is invited tonight at 6 to a fourhour event at the New School, 66 West 12th Street. A group of prominent writers and cartoonists will discuss Funny Business in America, exchanging opinions with and answering questions from the audience, and also creating some humorous art on the spot. The guest panel includes Mort Gerberg, Ed Sorel, Charles Saxon, Lee Lorenz, Herb Gardner. Jules Feiffer and Russell Baker. The program is a presentation of the freelance Cartoonists Guild with the Parsons School of Design. Admission is $3.

title: Celtics, Season at End, Face Uncertain Future
description: The Boston Celtics future is clouded with uncertainties that begin with John Havlicek. The team is in dire need of immediate frontcourt and backcourt help, and, unless the Red Auerbach magic of the past can work for the future, the Celtics reign as a National Basketball Association power may have ended Sunday with their playoff elimination by the Philadelphia 76ers. In Auerbach's 26 seasons with the Celtics, Boston has won 13 championships and 14 division titles, and has missed the payoffs only twice, the last time in 197071. First as the coach, and then as general manager and president, Auerbach built his reputation with lucky college draft selections and excellent trades, by picking up castoffs and by talking players out of retirement.

title: N.H.L. Playoffs
description: SEMIFINAL ROUND

title: Argentina Freezes Some Accounts
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 2 (Reuters)The Argentine Central Bank today froze the bank accounts of 16 companies in connection with investigations into a financial group accused of handling investments for leftwing guerrillas, The investigation focuses on David Graiver, a businessman reported to have died in a plane crash in Mexico last August before his financial empire collapsed.

title: Bell Asks Fast Criminal Code Action
description: WASHINGTON, May 2  Attorney General Griffin B. Bell today called the proposed recodification of Federal criminal law sorely needed and said he hoped the legislation will move promptly.

title: Myron Cohen, British Duo Put the Accent on Accents
description: The accent is on accents at the Rainbow Grill this week. Myron Cohen is telling stories in his assumed Yiddish, Italian and English accents, held together by his unctuous running patter. And the team of Lennie Peters and Di Lee, billed as Britain's premier vocal duo, who are making their American debut, bring to the room their own genuine English accents, which are a bit more down to earth than the elegant English accent that Mr. Cohen affects.

title: Pennzoil Reorganization
description: The Pennzoil Company and Pennzoil Offshore Gas Operations Inc. agreed on a plan of reorganization that would establish Pennzoil Offshore as an independent company. Subject to approval by Pennzoil Offshore shareholders at a special meeting scheduled for July, the plan calls for Pennzoil to convert its approximately 40 percent ownership in Pennzoil Offshore commonor 17.3 million sharesto the same percent direct ownership of Pennzoil's Offshore's assets and liabilities. Pennzoil Offshore as an independent Pennzoil Offshore as an independnt company terminating its affiliate relationship with Pennzoil. The company will be renamed the Pogo Producing Company.

title: Beame Sends List. to Parks Agency Of 200 Seeking Unadvertised Jobs
description: Mayor Beame's office has sent to Martin P. Lang, the Commissioner of Parks and Recreation, a list of 200 names of politically connected youths seeking unadvertised summer jobs.

title: Control Board Approves a CostofLiv ing Increase for Transit Workers
description: Acting swiftly and with little of its customary argument, the Emergency Financial Control Board yesterday approved a continuation through June 30 of longdisputed costofliving wage increases worth 16 cents an hour to 40,000 transit workers.

title: 4 Leftist Jews in City Assail Soviet
description: Four leftwing American Jewish editors have sent a memorandum to Soviet officials declaring they are deeply disturbed at the continuing violation of Marxist principles with respect to the Jews in the Soviet Union.

title: Students Barred in Drive Against Measles on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, May2(AP)School officials in the nation's most populous county barred thousands of students from class today because they had not received measles vaccinations.

title: Westinghouse Faces Contempt of Congress
description: WASHINGTON. May 2 (AP)Westinghouse Electric Corporation was threatened with contempt of Congress today after refusing to obey a House subcommittee subpoena seeking documents allegedly linking the Gulf Oil Corporation to an international uranium pricefixing conspiracy.

title: Deaths
description: Death

title: N.A.A. C.P FILES SUIT ON SPECIAL SCHOOLS
description: The New York City Board of Education was accused yesterday of routinely sending black and Hispanic problem students to special schools for the Socially Maladjusted and Emotionally Handicapped while seeking to help white problem students in their own schools.

title: Yonkers Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: BBDO International Net Up
description: BBDO International reported yesterday that its firstquarter revenues were up 18 percent over the comparable period of the last year to $22.3 million while net income rose 16 percent to $1.8 million, or .72 cents a share cornpared with 62 cents.

title: Japan Enjoys 3 Holidays of Golden Week By Taking a 7Day Vacation From Work
description: TOKYO, May 2Japan is celebrating goruden ooeeku once again, if that is not too active a verb to describe what the Japanese started doing last Thursday evening and plan to continue until next Friday morning.

title: Boyle Shows Up Without Notice At Hearing on Retrial in Murder
description: MEDIA, Pa., May 2 CAP)W. A. Boyle, the former United Mine Workers president, showed up unexpectedly today at a hearing of pretrial motions as his retrial for the 1969 murder of a union rival began.

title: MAJ. GEN. JAMES L. FRINK, WITH ARMY IN WORLD WAR II
description: Maj. Gen. James L. Frink, chief of the Army's Service of Supply in the Pacific theater in World War II, died Saturday in Greenville, S. C., where he was living in retirement. He was 92 years old.

title: MOBIL'S IRVINE OFFER TOPS $307 MILLION
description: LOS ANGELES, May 2The Mobil Corporation raised its bid for the landrich Irvine Company to $307.1 million in cash today and left open the potential for an even higher price if Irvine shareholderl elect to gamble on a sharp rise in the price of Mobil stock.

title: California Justice, Called Senile, Is Ordered by Tribunal to Retire
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 2A special tribunal of seven appellate court Justices ruled today that Marshall F. McComb, 82 years old, was senile and therefore unable to perform his duties as a Justice of the California Supreme Court.

title: Mrs. Carter Hostess To White House Aides
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP)Rosalynn Carter gave a box lunch today on the South Lawn of the White House for President Carter's staff. The President attended it, put his foot up on a piano bench and listened to Dixieland jazz.

title: ASSEMBLY DEMOCRATS FAIL IN BUDGET VOTE
description: TRENTON, May 2In a move that caught the leadership by surprise, the Democratic majority in the Assembly failed today to gain approval of the $4 billion budgetappropriations bill for the fiscal year 1978 beginning July 1. The vote was 31 to 36, with 41 needed for passage.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: OHIO RALLY PRAYS FOR URANIUM PLANT
description: PORTSMOUTH, Ohio, May 2They prayed for Jimmy Carter's soul here last night, petitioning the Lord to give the President the wisdom and the moral strength not to withdraw a planned $4.4 billion addition to the Government's huge uranium enrichment plant north of Portsmouth and thus lose some 600 new jobs to a more modern facility in Oak Ridge, Tenn.

title: About the Mets ...
description: Ray Sadecki has been put on waivers by the Mets, for the purpose of giving him his unconditional release, to make room for Jackson Todd, the 25yearold righthander who had been sent back to Tidewater so that he could pitch while the Mets were slogging through rainouts and off days. . . .Todd rejoined the club Monday in Los Angeles. . . .Sadecki may remain with the team as a batting practice pitcher and, once he clears waivers, could be reactivated at a future date if necessary.

title: Kahn Scheduled to Become Head of C.A.B.
description: Dr. Alfred E. Kahn is expected to leave his post as chairman of the Public Service Commission in Albany to accept President Carter's offer of the chairmanship of the Civil Aeronautics Board, state officials reported yesterday.

title: U. S. Sending More Supplies
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (UPI)A charlt. ered DC8 will fly 45 tons of Crations to Kinshasa for use by Zairian troops, the Pentagon announced today.

title: A Rebel Engineer
description: Just this year Mr. Cole had taken control of the Checker Motors Corporation, the taxi maker, at Kalamazoo. Those who knew Mr. Cole also knew that it probably would not be too long before some type of revolutionary cab, smaller, roomier and more fuelefficient than today's, would be rolling down the production lines.

title: Take Your Medicine
description: For the people who are trying to cut down on deaths owing to high blood pressure, a major problem is that sufferers are not faithful about taking their medication.

title: Jersey Father and Two Sons Drown When Boat Tips Over in Accident
description: LAKEWOOD, N.J., May 2 (AP)A father and his two sons drowned during a fishing trip on Lake Shenandoah herethe apparent victims of a freakish accident that caused their boat to capsize.

title: New Zealander Triumphs
description: PENANG, Malaysia, May 2 (AP)New Zealand's Graeme Lawrence won the Penang circuit races Grand Prix for cars for the second straight year today. Albert Poon of Hong Kong was second. Lawrence, in a March 76B, finished in 49 minutes 5.2 seconds in the 50lap race, held on the 1.2mile Esplanade circuit. Poon, in a Chevron B34, was timed in 50:33.8.

title: Sid Collins, Voice of 500, Apparent Suicide Victim
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 2 (AP)Sid Collins, the longtime announcer of the Indianapolis 500mile race, was found dead at his apartment today, the authorities said.

title: Maximum Term Given Attacker Of Woman, 82
description: A 19yearold youth who beat and robbed an 82yearold woman of $2 was denounced yesterday in Bronx Criminal Court as a fiend and a predator and was sentenced to the maximum term81A to 25 years in prison.

title: PRESIDENT REBUFFED ON 17 WATER PROJECTS
description: WASHINGTON. May 2The House Appropriations subcommittee on Public Works voted today to fund 17 of the 18 water projects President Carter wanted to kill.

title: Heavy Fighting Reported in Zaire
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, May 2 (UPI)About 50 Egyptian pilots and mechanics and an air force colonel arrived in Zaire today to help Government troops battle rebel forces in Shaba Province. Heavy new fighting was reported in the province.

title: Technical Issue in Arms Proposal Stirs Controversy in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, May 2A controversy has arisen over whether the Carter Administration made an unpublicized concession to the Russians in March during the Moscow talks on limiting strategic arms, or in fact closed a dangerous loophole that could have favored the Rusbsians.

title: The Penguin
description: He answers to Penguin because Ron Cey resembles the waddling Antarctic seabird, especially when he runs. Everybody also knows how to pronounce penguin whereas some people still don't seem sure how Cey is pronounced. It's not Cay or Cee or Cei, nor is it See or Sei; think of simply as Say, as in say a prayer for the opposing pitcher. Especially this season. While the Los Angeles Dodgers awaited last night's visit by the New York Mets, the 29yearold third baseman was batting .403 with nine homers and 29 runs batted in. And the

title: Addonizio Is Ordered Back to Jail
description: PHILADELPHIA,May 2 (UPI)Hugh J.Addonizio,a former mayor of Newark, was ordered back tojail today pending which reduced his 10year jail sentence an appeal of a Federal judge's ruling, Federal Judge Albert Maris of the Third for extortion.

title: Surgeon Calls Dr. DeMarco's Drug Irrelevant in Treating Gangrene
description: NEWARK, May 2A vascular surgeon testified today that several cases of gangrene that Dr. Peter T. DeMarco had treated with his patented drug procaine PVP would have healed just as quickly without any treatment at all.

title: Russian Pleads Guilty to Violating U.S. Fishing Laws
description: BOSTON, May 2Aleksandr Gupalov, captain of the impounded Soviet fishing trawler Tams Shevchenko, pleaded guilty today to criminal charges of violating the 200mile United States fishing zone regulations and received a $10,000 fine and a suspended ninemonth jail sentence.

title: Nuclear Talks Open in Salzburg To Evaluate U.S. Policy Changes
description: SALZBURG, Austria, May 2Confronted with new public hostility to nuclear energy and an abrupt change in American energy policy, some 2,000 government delegates, industrial representatives and academic specialists today began two weeks of discussion here on the future of atomic Dower.

title: Bridge: Berkowitz and Lilie Take Long Island Regional Title
description: Two young players who have been dominant in New York tournaments for the last year acquired another title in the Long Island regional championships, which ended at Hofstra University Sunday night. Dave Berkowitz of New York, who won the 1976 playeroftheyear title in New York, and Harold Lilie of Woodmere, the highestranked Long Island player, won the knockout team event, which had begun Friday night with an entry of 32 teams.

title: Sportswear Still Reigns, but It's Grown Softer
description: Sportswear took over the fashion world a few years back, and it hasn't loosened its grip, even though it may have softened its touch.

title: Hundreds Wait in Buses All Night For Arraignment in Atom Protest
description: SEABROOK, N.H., May 2Makeshift jails in four National Guard armories today held more than 1,000 persons who had been arrested for demonstrating against a proposed nuclear plant here. Hundreds of those arested had spent the night in school buses and National Guard trucks before being arraigned.

title: Some Doctors Reported To Torture Prisoners
description: COPENHAGEN, May 2 (AP)A group of Danish doctors says that it has reached the depressing conclusion that in ninny countries physicians are participating in the torture of political prisoners.

title: CARTER SAYS PRIORITY IS BALANCED BUDGET
description: WASHINGTON, May 2  President Carter told Congressional Democratic leaders today that his top priority was a balanced budget by 1981 and urged that new legislative programs be subordinated to the need for fiscal restraint.

title: Jets Still Alive on Dorsett
description: The Jets chances of obtaining Tony Dorsett, the Pittsburgh running back and the most heralded college player eligible for today's National Football League draft, remained reasonable yesterday because there were no trades for the first choices of the three teams that will pick ahead of the JetsTampa Bay, Seattle and Cincinnati.

title: U.S. Davis Cup Setback: A Matter of Priorities
description: The United States loss to Argentina in the Davis Cup American Zone final last weekend in Buenos Aires again dramatized the difference in priorities attached to this 77yearold international tennis series. In a country where terrorism and political unrest often produce international headlines, the match's nationalistic overtones were confirmed by flagwaving and the courtside presence of Jorge Rafael Videla, Argentina's President. Guillermo Vitas, Argentina's No. 1 player, who beat. Dick Stockton in four sets for the decisive point, does not need to win Wimbledon or Forest Hills this year to endear himself to countrymen.

title: Rutgers Ocean Study
description: Rutgers University won an $85,000 Federal grant to study ocean conditions that lead to fishkills. The grant, from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, will pay for research into why oxygen levels sometimes are lower in water layers near the ocean floor. The research will be done by, the university's marine sciences division in New Brunswick.

title: Chrysler Arranges $546 Million Credit
description: DETROIT, May 2The Chrysler Corporation said today that it had arranged a $546.5 million credit agreement with a group of 95 American banks to replace its previous $463.1 million credit agreement with 83 banks. A Chrysler spokesman said the move was of no great significance but that We just thought it was timely to do it now, coming off a record year.

title: Mets Box Score
description: METS (N.)

title: WALDHEIM ASKS HELP FOR POORER NATIONS
description: GUATEMALA, May 2  Secretary General Kurt Waldheim, opening the 17th session of the United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America, today underscored the need for an early breakthrough in the negotiations between industrialized and developing countries.

title: Supreme Court Summary
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The Supreme Court took the following actions today.

title: Rotten Ralph Plays Mr. Nice Guy For Be Kind to Animals Week
description: Rotten Ralph, a guestcelebrity cat from Philadelphia, upstaged both Sandy Dennis and Olivia NewtonJohn yesterday as the Humane Society of New York marked the start of Be Kind to Animals Week by opening a minicenter for pet adoptions.

title: About New York
description: There is this clown living in the West Side railroad yards who gets up every morning, walks his dog, buys the paper, has breakfast at the diner near 34th Street and 12th Avenue and then goes over to work bossing other clowns.

title: 11% of Teachers Dismissed By Delaware Schools
description: WILMINGTON, Del., May 2 (AP)School administrators throughout Delaware mailed out dismissal notices to one out of every nine public school teachers by the May I deadline.

title: The Editorial Notebook
description: After a long period of political immobility and a steady but low level of violence, there is once again dramatic movement in Northern Ireland. Hardline Protestant elements led by the Rev. Ian Paisley have called a general strike that began this morning. Their immediate objective is what they call a crackdown on the I.R.A., which in their extremist vocabulary means a return to the internment of suspects and the dragnet sweeps of Catholic neighborhoods that caused so much bitterness in 1971. Their ultimate objective is to do away with direct rule from London and restore the Protestant political monopoly that once existed Ulster.

title: Hebrew U. To Honor Ford
description: DETROIT, May 2 (UPI)Former President Gerald R. Ford will receive the Hebrew University Scopus Award at a dinner June 15 in Detroit.

title: 2 Named in Counterfeiting
description: A Federal indictment in Manhattan charged two men, identified as Giuseppe De Vivo of the Bronx and James Le Pore of Yonkers, with conspiracy to sell $2 million in counterfeit $100 bills. The prosecutor, Alan R. Naftalis, said Mr. De Vivo operated the Mohegan Variety Store in Fort Lee, N.J., and Mr. Le Pore worked as a salesman in the store. The indictment alleged that the defendants had delivered $109,800 in counter. felt bills last March.

title: TAX REPORT: MORE ERRORS, LATER FILING, HIGH RETURNS
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (UPI)Americans made more mistakes on their 1976 income taxes and many filed at the last minute. But they will be getting a record average tax return, the Internal Revenue Service said today.

title: U.S.Korea Shoe Talks Held
description: Seoul, South Korea, May.2The United States and South Korean officials held the first of a series of meetings this afternoon seeking an agreement on a voluntary curb by South Korea on controversial shoe exports to the United States. The United States delegation, which arrived this morning, is headed by Stephen Lande, a special trade representative. Korean officials discounted the possibility of an early agreement on the case.

title: U.S. Steel Expects Price Rises To Take Effect in 30 to 45 Days
description: PITTSBURGH, May 2The United States Steel Corporation expects higher steel prices will take effect within the next 30 to 45 days, J. Michael Curto, group vice president, said today after the company's 76th annual meeting.

title: THOMAS MALONE
description: VALENCE, France, May 2 (AP) Thomas Malone, 25 years old, an American basketball player with the MontpelHer University Club for the last five years, died of .a heart attack last night during a game against the La Voulte team, Malone, who was horn in Lima, Ohio, was in the second year of medical studies at the University of Montpellier.

title: Talks About U.S. Tank in Bonn
description: BONN, May 2 (Reuters)Secretary of the Army Clifford L. Alexander Jr. had talks about a new American tank with Defense Minister Georg Leber hero today. A Defense Ministry spokesman said they had discussed plans for harmonizing development of a new battle tank for the two armies. Mr. Alexander is on a tour of United States nulitary installations in West Germany.

title: BEAME PROPOSES END OF EDUCATION BOARD; ASKS DIRECT
description: Mayor Beame proposed yesterday that he take clear and direct control of the city's publicschool system by disbanding the salaried sevenmember Board of Education and replacing it with a commissioner of education appointed by and responsible to him.

title: Severo and Denis Hamill Share Prize in Berger Reporting Contest
description: Richard Severo of The New York Times and Denis Hamill of The Village Voice yasterday were named the joint recipients of Columbia University's 1977 Mike Berger Award for distinguished reporting, according to Elie Abel, dean of Columbia's Graduate School of Journalism.

title: MGM Plans Film On Hemingway's Life
description: Hemingway, a film based on the life of the writer and adventurer as recounted in Mary Welsh Hemingway's biography, How It Was, will be brought to the screen in 1878 by MetroGoldwynMayer. Jay Weston will produce and Sydney Pollack will direct the film, it was announced yesterday by Richard Shepherd, MGM senior vice president and worldwide head of production.

title: Two State Department Officials See Americans in Cuban Prisons
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (UPI)Two State Department officials left Cuba today after having Interviewed some Americans in prison. A State Department spokesman said the officialsFrank Willis of the Legal Division and Wayne Smith of the Cuban affairs officewere on their way back to Washington.

title: N. B. A. Playoffs
description: QUARTERFINAL ROUND

title: Money
description: Monday, May 2, 1977

title: Eugene Voit, ExHotel Executive; Once Managed the Schine Chair
description: Eugene Voit, a retired hotel executive, died Saturday in his home in Manhattan at 124 East 24th Street. He was 72 years old.

title: AUTO OUTPUT ROSE 2.6% DURING APRIL TO 814,029
description: DETROIT, May 2The American auto industry built 814,029 cars last month, up 2.6 percent from 793,460 in April, 1976, according to reports from the four manufacturers today.

title: BEAME PROPOSES END OF EDUCATION BOARD; ASKS DIRECT
description: Mayor Beame proposed yesterday that he take clear and direct control of the city's publicschool system by disbanding the salaried sevenmember Board of Education and replacing it with a commissioner of education appointed by and responsible to him.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: Senator Church Urges President To Reverse Position on Plutonium
description: WASHINGTON, May 2Senator Frank Church, accusing President Carter of pursuing a formula for nuclear isolationism, has urged him to reverse himself and go forward with the development of plutonium as a power reactor fuel.

title: Most ExFree Agents Are Delivering; Billy Smith, Fuentes, McCovey Doing WellGarland (03) Is Exception
description: When the Yankees and the California Angels meet for the first time in the season at Yankee Stadium tonight, the fans might not be able to see the players for the dollar signs.

title: Masterwork or Nightmare?
description: This is a place of refuge, a sanctuary, said John Hejduk, dean of the school of architecture at Cooper Union, of the new Bronx Developmental Center designed by Richard Meier. To Mr. Hejduk, the centera long, low building sheathed in aluminum panelsis a masterwork, a place where architecture can lift up the spirit and make life a little better. To Anthony Pitta, a parent active in the parents organization of the Willowbrook State School for the retarded, the new building is an architect's nightmare of a submarine.

title: Waldheim Sees Long Road Ahead Before Cyprus Accord Is Achieved
description: UNITED NATIONS, May 2 (Reuters)The Greek and Turkish Cypriot communities have a long way to go before they start making the concessions needed for a solution of the island's problems. Secretary General Kurt Waldheim of the United Nations said today.

title: Auburn: Pot of Steelat Rainbow's End
description: AUBURN, N. Y.For Tim Prosser, tending the electric arc furnace at the small steel plant here is hot, backbreaking work. The fumes escaping from the furnace where scrap steel is melted at 2,950 degrees have made him sick several times.

title: Klein Urges Consideration of Expanding the Sewer System in Suffolk
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., May 2Suffolk County Executive John V. N. Klein recommended today that the county study the possibility of enlarging the controversial Southwest Sewer District to include hookups to houses north of the project's current boundary.

title: Memphis Cottons to a Week of Parties
description: MEMPHISYou. all come and visit us. We want to see you so bad, said Ann Boyd, the wife of the Memphis Cotton Carnival King.

title: Chile's Army Rulers Buoyed by Economic Gains and Flagging Criticism
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, April 29After three and a half years of political represdon and economic austerity, the rightwing military Government, led by President Augusto Pinochet, appears confident that the Chilean economy is slowly recovering and that political opposition at home and abroad has been neutralized.

title: QUEENS URGES COURT TO TRY HEART PATIENT
description: The Queens District Attorney, John J. Santucci, called upon a Supreme Court justice yesterday to put on trial a 64yearold man charged with murder and arson, who had obtained more than 50 postponements because of a serious heart condition.

title: The Economic Scene
description: Thomas E. Mullaney reports that the Carter Administration faces a huge public education effort in changing the nation's attitudes on the energy crisis. Page 63.

title: FEDERAL SUIT BY OWNERS CHALLENGES RENT CONTROL
description: A group of real estate owners filed a Federal suit in Manhattan yesterday that challenged rent control and rent stabilization in New York City.

title: Steel Production Shows Rise Of 0.3% From WeekAgo Level
description: The nation's steel production for the week ended April 30 rose to 2.62 million net tons, from 2.61 million tons the week beforea 0.3 percent increase, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. The rate of capacity utilization rose last week to 83.9 percent, from 83.6 percent in the previous week.

title: WHITE & CASE AGREES TO SETTLE S.E.C. SUIT IN ANTIFRAUD ACTION
description: WASHINGTON, May 2White & Case, one of Wall Street's largest and most prestigious law firms, today agreed to settle a civil complaint by the Securities and Exchange Commission that it had violated antifraud provisions of Federal securities law in its work for the National Student Marketing Corporation, the onetime Wall Street favorite that became the locus of an extensive stock fraud.

title: U.S. and Vietnam to Open Talks in Paris Today
description: PARIS, May 2 (Reuters)The United States and Vietnam will open talks tomorrow in a fresh effort to heal the scars of the Vietnam war.

title: Court Rebuffs Watergate Group's Bid to File Memo
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The Supreme Court refused without comment today to let the defense lawyers In the Watergate coverup case file a memorandum with the Court commenting on the recent disclosure of the Justices secret and notyetfinal vote not to hear the case.

title: Oil Tank on Fire in Qatar
description: DOHA, Qatar, May 2 (AP)Fire broke out today in a storage tank at the Qatar General Petroleum Company's oil refinery, witnesses reported. The refinery produces about 6,200 barrels of gasoline and other products a day. It was the fifth petroleum industry fire in less than three weeks in Qatar.

title: Soviet Breakthrough Is Reported in Research on an Antimissile Beam
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The magazine Aviation Week and Space Technology said today that the Soviet Union had achieved a breakthrough in highenergy physics that may soon provide a directedenergy beam weapon capable of neutralizing the entire United States ballistic missile force.

title: Apples Win As Ruffels Upsets Borg
description: Ray Ruffels, the newest member of the New York Apples, thought he would scurry after every point against Bjorn Borg at Madison Square Garden last night and see what developed. What developed was a 64 upset of the Swedish star and a convincing 2818 victory for the Apples over the Cleveland Nets in their World Team Tennis match.

title: Beame Roams the Range To Bring Oilmen Home
description: HOUSTON, May 2Mayor Beame to oil companies: Please come home, Oil companies to Mayor Beame: Drop dead.

title: Prof. Sam Granick, Chlorophyll Expert, Found New Protein
description: Prof. Sam Granick, a Rockefeller University expert on chlorophyll and iron metabolism, died after a heart attack Friday at New York Hospital. He was 68 years old and lived at 500 East 63d Street.

title: One Very Smart Tomato
description: I had coffee with Dr. Irving Slezak, the brilliant genetic researcher. He brought some genes and a chopping knife. Working with the skill of a master salad chef, he chopped one of the genes into dozens of tiny parts, threw half of them away and tossed the rest into a salad bowl.

title: Explain Yourself
description: Doyle Dane Bernbach has a big explanation to go along with its first quarter statement, which shows that revenues were up 15.6 percent to $15.2 million from the first quarter of 1976, while net income from advertising was up 50.7 percent to $856,000, or 46 cents a share compared with 31 cents. Explanation: Last year's $568,000 net income was before nonrecurring gains of $243,000 from sale of marketable securities portfolio. $138.000 from sale of Dynaric Inc. and a lower tax rate schedule which increased net income to $949,000 or 52 cents a share.

title: E.P.A.'s Authority Over States Is Left In Doubt by Court
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The Supreme Court left unresolved today the issue of whether the Federal Government can force the states to crack down on air pollution by automobiles.

title: Two Dodger Runs in Eighth Send Mets to a 34 Defeat
description: LOS ANGELES, May 2Jerry Koosman lost a fine pitching duel to Doug Rau tonight as the Los Angeles Dodgers scored twice in the eighth inning for a 31 victory over the New York Mets. A crowd of 28,017 at Dodger Stadium watched Los Angeles end a losing streak at one game mid post its 18th victory in 22 games this season, snapping a threegame winning streak the Mets had acquired in San Diego.

title: The Administration's Task.. Educating Public on Energy
description: Strong reliance on conservation was the principal plink in the energy policy proposed by the Carter Administration two weeks ago. It appeared to be a popular position that offers a sensible and quick answer for part of the problem. But some analysts are questioning whether the nation will cooperate sufficiently to achieve the President's ambitious goal s. Although there may be considerable differences of opinion in business, economic and scientific circles over the degree of energy wastefullness in the United States, there is a high level of agreement that opportunities do exist for considerable conservation with existing, though costly technologies, and that such programs are essential.

title: SEOUL'S RULE BACKED BY ARMY OF AGENTS
description: SEOUL, South KoreaGood morning, said the agent from the Korean Central Intelligence Agency.

title: Breitel Tells Lawyers That Greed Is Undermining Their Profession
description: ALBANY, May 2Chief Judge Charles D. Breitel of the State Court of Appeals warned today that the practice of law has become so profitable that the profession tends to attract in certain sectors persons motivated by greed.

title: Fibak Pulls Out of Cup, Angering Poland, France
description: LONDON, May 2 (AP)The Davis Cup tennis tournament ran into further international political problems today.

title: Texas Instruments Enters CB Radio Field
description: the Instruments is jumping into the volatile and troubled citizens band radio market. At a news conference yesterday in Las Vegas, the semiconductor giant introduced a 40channel, single side band/AM mobile CB radio containing semiconductor technology. The radio's overall capacity will be 120 channels.

title: 2 Women Slain in 95th St. Home; Police Suspect Narcotics Motive
description: A 27yearold mother and a young woman companion were found shot to death in an apartment on the Upper East Side yesterday afternoon, the apparent victims of a dispute over drugs.

title: Yonkers Gets 10,046 At Opening
description: YONKERS, May 24Yonkers Raceway opened its spring meeting tonight with one hopeful eye on the gate and another on Albany as the harness racing scene shifted from Roosevelt.

title: Tuna Protest in San Diego
description: SAN DIEGO, May2 (AP)From 2,000 to 3,000 tuna industry workers, many of them jobless because of Government attempts to save a porpoise that is often accidentally drowned in tuna nets, staged a protest march today along San Diego's Embarcadero.

title: Cable Cars to Shut Down
description: SAN FRANCISCO. May 2 (AP)Cable cars from downtown hotels to Fisherman's Wharf will be closed for two weeks. A spokesman for the transit company said yesterday that the cars on the PowellHyde line would be shut down while repairs are made.

title: Arledge Will Head ABC News; Disclaims Theatrical Flourishes
description: Roone Arledge, one of television's leading showmen, who as head of ABC Sports since 1964 created the popular Wide World of Sports and introduced the slowmotion and stopaction camera techniques, yesterday was named president of ABC News and ABC Sports.

title: Dollar Climbs Against Yen in Tokyo
description: TOKYO, May 2 (AP)The dollar climbed against the Japanese yen today, starting a week in which the dollar is expected to be in demand to pay fof accumulating import settlements.

title: Voters Pick School Boards Today In New York Community Elections
description: Vote for ChildrenTuesday, May 3. It has rumbled along in subway cars and bounced in buses for weeks now, in stark black letters on a gold backgroundthe slogan personified by a photograph of five schoolchildren, roundeyed, looking a little forlorn.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: convict on Pass Abducts Woman, 19, and Takes Her On a Spree of Robberies
description: A convict who allegedly kidnapped and raped a 19yearold college student while he was on a twoday furlough from a state studyrelease program was arrested at gunpoint in a Brooklyn motel room yesterday afternoon. The police said he had forced his terrified victim to accompany him on a 20hour crime spree in Brooklyn and Queens.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: Israeli Report on Military Shortcomings Is Rebutted by Peres in Parliament Debate
description: JERUSALEM, May 2A state comptroller's report that is sharply critical of the Israeli military because of documented instances of waste and ineptitude was the subject today of partisan preelection debate in Parliament.

title: Market Place
description: Investors are continuing their search for companies that could benefit from the Carter energy program, a quest that has brought to the fore some stocks that have not had much attention in years.

title: Chicago Computer Failure Cancels All Trading in Soybeans and Grains
description: Trading was canceled In soybeans and grains on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday because of a breakdown in the computerized pricereporting system, according to exchange officials.

title: Going Fishing in Havana
description: Washington and Havana have not resumed diplomatic relations, but contacts between the two countries have suddenly flourished on a scale not seen for 15 years. After engaging in formal negotiations with the Cubans, Assistant Secretary of State Todman returned from Havana with an agreement on fishing rights in the Straits of Florida. The Carter Administration has lifted all legal restrictions on travel to Cuba and the spending of dollars there. The general embargo on trade remains, but even that iceberg may melt as relations continue to warm.

title: Beame in Houston to Try to Get Oilmen Home From the Range
description: HOUSTON, May 2Mayor Beame to oil companies: Please come home. Oil companies to Mayor Beame: Droo dead.

title: Advertising
description: I came here to have people tell me how they can use us, said Frank Levi, one of the 1,104 exhibitors at the 1977 Premium Show.

title: New Hospitals Agency Chief
description: A yellow and brown poster hanging above Joseph Thomas Lynaugh's desk contains a quotation from the late Malcolm X that is appropriate to Mr. Lynaugh's life. It is: Only those who have already experienced a revolution within themselves can reach out effectively to help others. Mr. Lynaugh, 37 years old, experienced that personal revolution in 1973 when he decided to leave the priesthood to begin a new career in public health. He rose rapidly, and yesterday was named the interim choice to be the daytoday head of the $1 billion municipal hospital system, replacing the controversial Dr. John L. S. Holloman Jr., who had been Ousted by Mayor Beanie.

title: Freight Worker Indicted
description: A Conrail freight yard worker was arraigned in Newark on charges that he tried to steal a shipment of handguns from Conrail's truck depot in Kearney.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: DR. REGINALD F. SEIDEL
description: Dr. Reginald F. Seidel, a urologist, died Sunday at Nantucket (Mass.) Cottage Hospital. He was 83 years old and had homes in Nantucket and in Englewood, N.J.

title: Message by DelBello
description: Alfred B. DelBello, the Westchester County Executive, conceded in his annual state of the county message that Westchester faced some major economic problems, but he noted that his government had managed to retain the highest credit ratingall AAA.

title: Feminism, Then and NOW
description: The quiet passage of the tenth anniversary of the National Organization for Women belies the profound change in America's consciousness generated by the women's movement. Initially, feminist claims were jarring, even enraging. Though the demands were not, in retrospect, so exceptionalmainly those of collegetrained women to be integrated equally into the work forcethey posed startling challenges to conventional attitudes.

title: GOODMAN MIGHT IN WITHOUT LIBERAL LINE
