description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 6If tomorrow's 103d Kentucky Derby were play instead of a horse race, one name would fill the marquee: Seattle Slew.

title: Mets Drop Fifth in Row As Giants Triumph, 53
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 6The New York Met losing streak reached five games and became the longest of the year for them tonight as Lynn McGlothen pitched the San Francisco Giants to a 53 victory.

title: TIMES'S PUBLISHER GETS SPECIAL SILURIAN AWARD
description: The Society of the Silurians yesterday named Arthur Ochs Sulzberger, publisher of The New York Times, as the recipient of a Special Publisher's Award for Innovative Journalism for founding the paper's Weekend and Living sections last year.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Moon Is Arrested With 10 Followers For Trespassing
description: WHITE PLAINS, May 6The Rev. Sun Myung Moon termed it sightseeing, but Bard College in Dutchess County said was trespassing and called in the state police to arrest the leader of the Unification Church and 10 of his followers.

title: Dolphins
description: MIAMI, May 6 (AP)Don Reese and Randy Crowder, defensive linemen, arrested Wednesday on a charge of selling cocaine worth $233,000, were suspended today by Joe Robbie, the Miami Dolphins managing general partner.

title: Kahane Is Arrested By Israeli Soldiers For Disobeying Ban
description: TEL AVIV, May 6Rabbi Meir Kahane was arrested today and charged with inciting soldiers to disobey orders after he had attempted to persuade troops at checkpoint to disregard their commander and let him go to the West Bank of the Jordan River to break ground for a Jewish city.

title: Ehrlichman Says Nixon's Version Of Watergate Will Be Found False
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif, May 6 (UPI)John D. Ehrlichman, once secondincommand in former President Nixon's White House, said that he declined a huge sum of money offered by Mr. Nixon when he was told on April 30, 1973, that he was being fired.

title: Earl Latham, Retired Professor Of Political Science at Amherst
description: AMHERST, Mass., May 6 (AP)Dr. Earl Latham, a political science professor at Amherst College for 28 years until his retirement three years ago, died today after a brief illness, the college an nounced.

title: TWO STEEL COMPANIES LIFT PRICES SHARPLY. U.S. AGENCY CRITICAL
description: The Republic Steel Corporation, the nation's fourth largest steelmaker, announced yesterday price increases of 6.8 percent to 8.8 percent on basic steel products. The move is expected to be followed shortly by the rest of the industry.

title: High and. Dry, Wine Is on the Block
description: PARIS, May 6More than 26,000 of the choicest bottles of wine originally stocked for the passengers of the liner France will instead be auctioned off shortly.

title: But Don't Jump to Conclusions
description: WASHINGTON. May 6 (AP)When is living together not really living together?

title: Clamma Dale at Best in Falla
description: Clamma Dale is a singer of such talents and graces it is no wonder that her oareer has blossomed so unusually in the last two years. The soprano made a successful debut with the New York City Opera; she earned great praise for her performance as Bess In the Broadway revival of Porgy and Bess, and she won the Naumburg Award, entitling her to two recitals In Alice Tully Hail. The first, well received, was given last season. The second was sung on Thursday night, with Neil Stannard again, her excellent pianist.

title: Leon Lapidus, 52, Professor Of Engineering at Princeton
description: Prof. Leon Lapidus, chairman of the department of chemical engineering at Princeton University, died of a heart attack in his office Thursday afternoon. He was 52 years old.

title: Reshaping World Economics
description: The progress of humanity, the advance of civilization, is basically the achievement of a successive series of reforms, of new orders.

title: UNEMPLOYMENT AT 7%, LOWEST IN 29 MONTHS; 90 MILLION HOLD JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, May 6The national unemployment rate fell in April from 7.3 percent to 7 percent, its lowest level in 29 months, and the number of people with jobs scored a strong gain of more than 500,000 for the second consecutive month, the Labor Department reported today.

title: ...and in Vienna, a Plaque and Memories
description: VIENNA, May 6Nearly 77 years ago an assistant professor of neurology with only handful of students and followers wrote to a friend he doubted that one day a marble tablet would be put up at a building on the edge of the Vienna woods proclaiming: In this house, on July 24, 1895, the secret of dreams was revealed to Dr. Siam. Freud.

title: Political Candidates Set Back by F. C. C. On Broadcast Time
description: WASHINGTON, May 6 (AP)  The Federal Communications Commission, reversing itself, ruled today, 4 to 3, that a broadcast station was not required to sell a political candidate the specific amount of air time he wanted.

title: Product Competition Planned
description: A spokesman for Volvo of America said the boards of the two companies in Sweden had decided that stockholders of Volvo and Saab would be offered the opportunity to transfer their shares to a new joint company.

title: U.S. Consumers of Canadian Gas May Find Fuel Bills Increased 16%
description: OTTAWA, May 6American consumers of Canadian natural gas next winter would pay an average of 16 percent more, for a total increase in their fuel bill of about $300 million a year, if the Government gives the expected approval to a recommendation by the National Energy Board.

title: Miss Longet Is Denied Plea for Early Release
description: DENVER, May 6 (UPI)The Colorado Supreme Court deliberated less than 15,minutes today before denying Claudine': Longet's appeal for an early release from jail so she con'd spend Mother's Day with her three children.

title: Columbia U. Is Planning to Sell The Delafield Estate in the Bronx
description: A spectacular 19thcentury mansion On the Bronx that once housed one of the city's most prominent families and is now the home of a talking chimpanzee may soon become a country club surrounded by 75 lowrise condominiums.

title: Cut in Shellfishing Ordered in Suffolk
description: STONY BROOK, L.I., May 6The State Department of Environmental Conservation, bowing to Federal pressure, today announced the closing, because of pollution, of 2,600 additional acres of clan% beds in Suffolk County, including virtual ly all of the most productive waters In the Great South Bay off Babylon Town.

title: Personal Investing
description: Taxexempt hospital bonds are going as fast on Wall Street these days as free beer at a firemen's picnic. In this year's first quarter, according to a compilation by The Daily Bond Buyer, financing on medicalcare facilities totaled, a record $981.4 million, up more than 150 percent from a year earlier.

title: A Year After Italian Quake, Reconstruction Is Impressive
description: GEMONA, Italy, May 6When the earth shook for 56 seconds a year ago today, Antoinette Prigente tumbled from a window in her old stone house on Via del Teatro, suffered a broken arm and spent the next three months in a hospital. Then she lived in a tent, in a hotel at the seaside and finally moved into her new home just outside of what is left of this town, one of the worst

title: Election Unit Says Fund Is in Peril If Congress Races Are Subsidized
description: WASHINGTON. May 6If Congress approves pending proposals to provide campaign subsidies for candidates for the Senate and House, the election campaign fund will run out of money in 1980, the Federal Election Commission predicted today.

title: ENGINE TROUBLE FORCES CONCORDE TO FLY BACK
description: WASHINGTON, May 6 (AP)A British Airways Concorde supersonic jet developed engine trouble over the Atlantic Ocean today and was forced to return to Dulles International Airport near here, an airline spokesman said.

title: JUDGE OFFERS TO END BOSTON SCHOOL RULE
description: BOSTON, May 6 (UPI)The third phase of Boston's school desegregation plan, aimed at disengaging the Federal court from the program, was made public today.

title: U.S. Assails G. M. Bid to Bar Inquiry
description: DETROIT, May 6The Government argued today in a brief filed in a Federal court here that a grand jury investigation into possible tax fraud by the General Motors Corporation should not be quashed as the company requested week ago.

title: About New York
description: Sounds like walltowall white people to me. Marki Marcus, young, black and handsome, and with his cynicism coming into its own In the halfcourt world of Columbus Avenue, was offering his impression of the city's summer job picture for teenagers.

title: London Gold Price Up $2 As Zurich's Rises $1.50; Dollar Gains in Europe
description: LONDON, May 6 (AP)The price of gold shot up by as much as $2 an ounce today. The dollar closed mostly up in light trading.

title: An ExPatient of Freud Recalls: He Talked to Me
description: Abram Kardiner has had accomplishments of great note since then. He has made a name for himself as a psychiatrist, a writer, a teacher and a researcher. But perhaps never again will he enjoy the sort of goldenboy glow he picked up in 1921 when it became known how he passed his time on the couch at Berggasse 19 in Vienna.

title: The Night Seattle Slew Was Born
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., May 6Light snow was falling on the blue grass country and the temperature had slid below freezing in the early dusk of Feb. 24, 1974, when a 5yearold mare named My Charmer was led into the foaling stall on Ben S. Castleman's White Horse Acres beside the Newton Pike. The foaling stall was twice the size of My Charmer's regular place in the barn, carpeted with clean straw, with small screened window in one wall. In the tiny room beyond the window, Paul Mallory, the farm manager, settled into an easy chair, switched on a portable telesports vision set and sat back to await developments. He knew it could be a long wait, of for the foal My Charmer was carrying The Times would be her first. Two days less than 11 months earlier she had been over in Paris, Ky., for a date with Bold Reasoning, who was just starting out as a syndicated stallion under the management of Claiborne Farm. Seth Hancock, the young master of Claiborne, had been the matchmaker, recommending the young, unproven sire as a suitable mate for the young, unproven brood mare, and Bold Reasoning's alliance with My Charmer was only his third with a thoroughbred.

title: Revamped Sleeping Beauty
description: Some ballets take time to settle down in the repertory. They are like new shoes that pinch a little at first, or a wine Whose sediment has to be decanted. When the American Ballet Theater first staged the complete version of The Sleeping Beauty last year, it took the very bold step of returning, so far as was possible, to the original St. Petersburg version.

title: Conviction Reversed For Antiwar Activist In Power Line Blast
description: DENVER, April 6 (AP)The United States Court of Appeals for the Tenth Circuit overturned yesterday the conviction of Cameron David Bishop. an antiwar activist, on three counts of sabotage in the bombing of four power line towers in 1969.

title: Patents
description: WASHINGTONA method has been devised for conserving energy in hotels and other buildings. Patent 4,021,615 was granted this week to Gerald H. Fairfax and Emrys C. James, engineers who invented the apparatus for the RCA Corporation.

title: Youth Stabbed at Brooklyn School
description: A 16yearold student at Erasmus Hall High School was stabbed yesterday opposite the school, on Bedford Avenue in the Flatbush section of Brooklyn. The youth, Kevin Dow of 80 East 93d Street, was stabbed by the friend of a youth he fought with the day before, the police said. He was reported as in critical condition at Kings County Hospital.

title: GunSupplier, a Suspect in Murder of Joey Gallo, Found Dead in the Pool at His Home in Caribbean
description: The missing link in the murder of Joey Gallothe man the police say provided the guns for the 1972 assassination of Mr. Gallo in the Little Italy section of New York Citywas found dead Thursday in three feet of water in his swimming pool on the Caribbean island of Grenada.

title: W.H.A. Playoff Unsettled
description: TORONTO, May 6 (AP)The dates of the World Hockey Association's championship series between the Winnipeg Jets and Quebec Nordiques have not been determined because of schedule conflict at the Winnipeg Arena. The problem in scheduling the fourofsevengame series is a circus booked through May 15.

title: Tories Make Big Gains in British Municipal Vote
description: LONDON, May 6The Conservatives made big gains in municipal elections throughout England and Wales yesterday, topping their advance with the capture of the Greater London Council, the capital's local government.

title: Rosa Vicien Is Bride Of Frank H. Milburn
description: Rosa Maria Vicien of New York, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Pedro Vicien of Buenos Aires, was married yesterday afternoon to Frank Hinckley Milburn, son of Mr. and Mrs. Devereux Milburn of Old Westbury, L.I. State. Supreme Court Justice Arnold Guy Fraiman performed the ceremony in his chambers.

title: Woman Gets Key V.A. Post
description: WASHINGTON, May 6 (AP)Dorothy L. Starbuck, who joined the Veterans Administration as a clerk in Chicago 31 years ago, became the agency's top woman employee today as she was appointed chief benefits director. She will direct an annual budget of more than $12 billion, which is about 70 percent of the V. A.'s annual appropriaton.

title: Secretary of Defense Brown Sees Chance of a Modest Arms Agreement
description: WASHINGTON, May 6Secretary of Defense Harold Brown said today that there was a pretty good chance, of modest strategic arms agreement between the United States and the Soviet Union by October, but that the prospect was slim for a rarreaching pact by then.

title: Yanks and Figueroa Stop New
description: The Oakland A's whom the Yankees defeated, 41, last night behind Ed Figueroa's fivehit pitching and Roy White's threerun homer were not the Oakland A's of their championship seasons. They weren't even the Oakland A's of last season.

title: Consumer Notes
description: A major manufacturer of birthcontrol devices announced yesterday the recall of 86,000 diaphragms manufactured under the brand name KoroFlex during a fourmonth period in 1976. Some of the devices are defective.

title: British Football
description: By Reuters ENGLISH LEAGUE Third Division

title: Sara P. Ridgway Is Bride of Locke McLean
description: In St. James Episcopal Church in Manhattan yesterday evening, Sara Parsons Ridgway, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William C. Ridgway Jr. of Short Hills, N. J., Fishers Island, L. I., and Hobe Sound, Fla., became the bride of Locke McLean, son of Mr. and Mrs. Gale McLean of Potomac, Md., York Harbor, Me., and Boca Grande, Fla.

title: GEORGIAN CAPTIVATES NORTHEAST ENGLAND
description: NEWCASTLE  UPON  TYNE, England, May 6No one, perhaps, would have been much surprised had he said, Ili, I'm Jimmy Carter and I'm running for President. For President Carter, with relish and nostalgia, turned today's goodwill visit to this green but grimy corner of industrial Britain into something closely resembling the thousands of campaign stops he made in a long American political contest.

title: ...and in Vienna, a Plaque and Memories
description: VIENNA, May 6Nearly 77 years ago an assistant professor of neurology with only handful of students and followers wrote to a friend he doubted that one day a marble tablet would be put up at a building on the edge of the Vienna woods proclaiming: In this house, on July 24, 1895, the secret of dreams was revealed to Dr. Sigm. Freud.

title: CARTER APOLOGY EXPECTED FOR DEATH IN ARMY TESTS
description: Elizabeth Barrett, daughter of Harold Blaucr, who died in an Armysponsored drug experiment in 1953, said early today that she expected a personal apology from President Carter.

title: Carter Allows Uranium Shipments
description: LONDON, May 6President Carter has rushed through his personal approval for several large shipments of highly enriched uranium to West Germany, France, Canada and Japan, among other countries, breaking a logjam that has caused tensions between Washington and several of its allies.

title: Television
description: 1:30 P.M. Anyone for Tennyson? (13)

title: An ExPatient of Freud Recalls: He Talked to Me'...
description: Abram Kardiner has had accomplishments of great note since then. He has made a name for himself as a psychiatrist, a writer, a teacher and a researcher. But perhaps never again will he enjoy the sort of goldenboy glow he picked up in 1921 when became known how he passed his time on the couch at Berzgasse 19 in Vienna.

title: Corporation Affaiis
description: WASHINGTON, May 6A detailed investigation by the Del Monte Corporation has found that the large food company made questionable or illegal foreign payments totaling about $2 million, far above the $250,000 initially disclosed last summer.

title: Dispute Intensifies Over Nixon Role on Hush Money
description: WASHINGTON, May 6An attorney for former President Richard M. Nixon today cited statements by a former Watergate trial attorney, James F. Neal, as a basis for a third request that The Washington Post retract a report suggesting that Mr. Nixon might have known about hush money payments to Watergate defendants as early as January 1973.

title: 2 New Works Played in a Concert
description: The Composers Ensemble ended its 197677 season on Thursday night with a concert in Carnegie Recital Hall that offered premieres of two works and the first New York performance of another during an evening that had few bright moments.

title: Canadian Bank Rate Cut to 7% From 8% to Spur Money Growth
description: OTTAWA, May 6 (Reuters)The Bank of Canada announced today a reduction in its bank rate to 7 percent from percent, effective Monday. Gerald Bouey, the bank's governor, said the reduction was being made because the rate of growth in the money supply had fallen below the central bank's target range.

title: Carter Meets With 5 of 6 Leaders In a Prelude to Economic Parley
description: LONDON, May 6President Carter met tonight with five of the six leaders of America's major allies in a prelude to their economic conference over the weekend, which is expected to set the tone of relations for years ahead.

title: PLANS FOR MERGER OF VOLVO AND SAAB BEING NEGOTIATED
description: STOCKHOLM, May 6 (UPI)Volvo and Saab, two of Sweden's largest private companies, announced merger plans today.

title: Youth Escapes East Berlin
description: BERLIN, May 6 (AP)An East Berlin youth pulled the emergency brake on train as it passed near the Berlin Wall crossing point at Bornholmer Strasse, jumped to the wall and scrambled over it into West Berlin, police reported today.

title: The Standings
description: Saturday, May 7, 1977

title: CORRECTIONS
description: The telephone number for the Caramoor music festival near Katonah, N.Y., was incorrectly listed in The Times yesterday. It should be (914) 232.4206,

title: Governor Appoints Claims Judges
description: ALBANY, May 6  Governor Carey nominated five new judges to the Court of Claims today, including the Democratic county leader in Syracuse, a Brooklyn Assemblyman and the former Brooklyn Liberal Party chairman.

title: Assad Ready to Discuss Mideast Buffer Zones
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, May 6 (UPI)A few days before meeting President Carter, President Hafez alAssad of Syria says he is willing to discuss demilitarized zones between Israel and her neighbors. This was considered an important Arab concession.

title: REE MORTON, A SCULPTOR, 40, KILLED IN CAR CRASH;
description: Ree Morton, a sculptor, died last Saturday at Mercy Hospital in Chicago, from injuries sufferea In an automobile accident. Miss Morton, who was 40 years old, lived at 12 Waverly Place.

title: Meadowlands
description: ENTRIES

title: Census Shows Changing Way of Life
description: WASHINGTON, May 6 (UPI)Americans in the 1970's changed their views on marriage, divorce, childbearing and other social institutions to the point where their ways of living are vastly different from those of earlier generations, a Census Bureau report indicates.

title: Mary Ann Malloy Is Married To Elliott Meyer, Executive
description: Mary Ann Malloy and Elliott Meyer were married yesterday in New York by Supreme Court Justice George Postal in his chambers.

title: The Threat to the Wiretap Bill
description: Few aspects of American law are as murky as the Government's authority to wiretap and conduct electronic surveillance in the interests of national security. Abuses such as the protracted eavesdropping on Martin Luther King Jr. have exposed the need for corrective legislation. Crafting such legislation means balancing individual rights of privacy against the best interests the nation. The Justice Department and a powerful group of Democratic Senators seem to be driving successfully toward a bill that achieves this delicate balance. But their achievement may now be threatened. The Administration's foreign policy, defense and intelligence agencies insist on retaining unwarranted latitude to keep tabs on transient aliens, denying them the Fourth Amendment protection against unreasonable search and seizure.

title: Election Set in Sri Lanka
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka, May 6 (Reuters) prime Minister Sirimavo Bandaranaike or Sri Lanka said last night that general &actions would be held on August 15.

title: Neighborhoods: Douglaston, on the Sound, A Real Suburban Community in the City
description: Like many residents of New York City, the people of Douglaston, Queens, are embroiled from time to time in heated battles with city government.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: STROLLFEST The 19th semiannual Brooklyn Heights Promenade Art Show opens todaya popular occasion for an outing in the borough, a largescale sampling of creativity and one of the most impressive panoramic views in all of New York. From 11 A.M. to 6 P.M. today and tomorrow and on the following two weekends, crowds are expected to throng the esplanade from Remsen to Orange Streets, inspecting the colorful, competitive lineup of oils, watercolors, graphics, sculpture, crafts and photography.

title: Bridge Tolls: More Than Equity and Better Air
description: Each weekday, 600,000 people drive into Manhattan over the free East River and Harlem River bridges. They inflict their autos and pollution on themselves, Manhattan's 1.5 million residents, and 2.5 million other commuters who pay a transit toll of at least dollar a day,

title: Canadiens Get No Rest, Open Cup Final Tonight
description: The Montreal Canadiens would have preferred more than one day's respite after closing their pounding semifinal series with the New York Islanders on Thursday night. But tonight in Montreal, the defenders of the National Hockey League's Stanley Cup must open a fourofsevengame final series against another eager team of industrious bruisers, the Boston Bruins.

title: How Side by Side
description: In Side by Side by Sondheim, a pastiche of theater songs by Stehen Sondheim at the Music Box Theater, Millicent Martin gives virtuoso musical performance. She sings a constellation of Sondheim songs, easily adapting herself to the fluctuating moods of the saucy I Never Do Anything Twice, the assertive I'm Still Here, the tonguetickling The Boy From ... and the wistful Send in the Clowns.

title: France Takes Lead In Davis Cup by 20
description: WARSAW, May 6 (UPI)France took a 2.0 lead over Poland today in their Davis Cup European Zone A ten nis series.

title: WinnerTakeAll Tennis Match on TV Called a Ruse
description: Although television viewers were told they were watching a $250,000 winnertakeall tennis match on March 5, Jimmy Connors was guaranteed $500,000, win or lose, and llie Nastase received $150,000, the promoter of the event acknowledged yesterday.

title: Yugoslavia Sentences Djilas Cousin, To 2 Years for Hostile Propaganda
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, May 6 (AP)Vitomir Djilas, a cousin of Milovan Djilas, the dissident former vice president, was sentenced today in Titograd to two and a half years in jail on conviction of hostile propaganda, sources here reported.

title: OZONE IRRITATIONS ON PLANES ARE CUT
description: An ozoneirritation problem that fected hundreds of airline passengers and crew members in winter has been virtually eliminated for now by operationa tchniques and seasonal changes, airline spokesman said yesterday.

title: News Summary
description: SATURDAY, MAY 7, 1977

title: Profiles of Horses in 103d Kentucky Derby
description: Undefeated, untied and unscored upon in six career starts totaling five and threequarters miles. The horse the others Must beat to win. Record shows nothing but I's at every fractional call. Has not been touched with whip since last October in Champagne Stakes at Belmont Park, where heran fastest mile (1:34 25) ever run by 2yearold. Broke 52yearold track record for seven furlongs at Hialeah earlier this year with 1:20 35 clocking. Comes to Derby off victory in Wood Memorial at Aqueduct. A Kentuckybred son of Bold Reasoning, dark brown colt was bought for bargain price of $17,500 as yearling. Did not make first start until last Sept. 20 at Belmont but roared to Eclipse Award as 2yearold champion with three runaway victories in span of a month. Has never gone to post without being a betting favorite, highest odds being 52, in his debut. A greatgrandson of Bold Ruler, whose grandsons have dominated Derby in recent years. Fairly docile around barn but a tiger on track. Bankroll stands at $255,340 but could climb dramatically. Insured for $3.5 million, a figure that could also climb in a hurry. Major uncertainty: Does lightly trained colt have a foundation to withstand

title: Carter's Welfare Statement
description: WASHINGTON, May 6President Carter's statement this week on welfare changes answered some important questions about his Administration's policy, but it left many more unresolved. The statement prodded a better idea of the nature, the timing and, to some extent, the cost of the News changes that the President Analysis wants to make. On the other hand, little more is known than before about how the President's plans would affect individuals and communities.

title: Camien Takes Stormy 2Mile Duel
description: With lightning dancing around and rain coming down almost as fast as the runners were moving, Torn Camien of Sewanhaka High and John Gregorek of St. Anthony's staged a dramatic battle in the twomile run yesterday at the New York Relays on the St. John's University track in Jamaica, Queens.

title: New Hampshire's Governor Asks Public for Funds to Help Pay Cost of Jailing Protesters
description: SEABROOK, N.H., May 6Gov. Meldrim Thomson Jr. tonight issued a nationwide appeal for contributions from corporations, labor unions and rankandfile citizens throughout America to help to pay the cost of jailing more than a thousand antinuclear demonstrators.

title: No Confrontation Foreseen
description: WASHINGTON, May 6A State Department spokesman said today he was certain that Andrew Young was not seeking a confrontation with the South African Government with his plan for private visit to that country.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: The telephone number for the Caramoor music festival rear Katonah, N.Y., was incorrectly listed in The Times yesterday. It should be (914) 232.4206.

title: Books of The Times
description: If truth is sometimes stranger than fiction, this profile of a modernday political terrorist is proof that it can also be more compelling. All the ingredients of a fictional espionage novel are heresharply drawn characters, a fastpaced plot, violence, terror, intrigue and even the obligatory sex, although the last by suggestion, rather than in explicit detail. What makes the account different and doubly riveting is that it is fact rather than fiction, the true story of the most celebrated and soughtafter terrorist abroad today.

title: DELAY ON CAR BUMPERS BY GOVERNMENT SCORED
description: WASHINGTON, May 6 (AP)Delays in putting Federal standards for automobile bumpers into effect are causing needless damage and financial loss to car owners, an insurance industry group said today.

title: Militant Ulster Protestants Vow to Continue Strike
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 6 (AP) Militant Protestants vowed today to continue their fourdayold strike in Ulster despite apparently dwindling support.

title: Frost Denies TimeOut Report
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., May 6 (UPI)David Frost denies that Richard Nixon's aide asked for a time cut from the television cameras to compose himself during a grilling about Watergate. Mr. Frost says there was a short break, but that he, himself, ordered it.

title: White House Eases Stand on Energy Chief's Powers
description: WASHINGTON, May 6In a concession to a bipartisan group of senators, the White House dropped today its insistence that the secretary of the proposed department of energy be given the sole power to set prices paid to producers of natural gas and crude oil.

title: Carey Reportedly to Back Cuomo Even if He Loses in the Primary
description: Governor Carey has told top Democrats and Liberals that he will support Mario M. Cuomo's mayoral candidacy through the November election even if Mr. Cuomo is defeated in the Democratic primary in September, according to both Democratic and Liberal officials supporting the Cuomo candidacy.

title: With Some Slips, Jim Wright Takes Hold Of His Pivotal Place in House Leadership
description: WASHINGTON, May 2My dear friend Otis Pike is piqued at Congress, Representative Jim Wright, the majority leader, told the House in a recent debate on Mr. Pike's purely symbolic amendment to reduce the budget by $7 million, the cost of the Congressional pay increase.

title: News Summary
description: SATURDAY, MAY 7, 1977

title: 67 Spanish Political Parties Excluded From Election
description: MADRID, May 6 (Reuters)More than 60 political parties appeared today to have been excluded from Spain's June 15 general elections, raising the prospect of violent protests during the campaign.

title: Meany Pledges Support For Striking Teachers
description: KANSAS CITY, May 6 (AP)George Meany told striking schoolteachers today that they had a duty to their families as well as to their pupils and pledged: that the A.F.L.C.I.O. would support them until they reach agreement on a contract:

title: Senators Back Peace Corps Funds After a Revitalization Is Urged
description: WASHINGTON, May 6 (UPI)A Senate subcommittee today recommended authorization of $81 million for continued Peace Corps operations in 1978 after hearing suggestions on how to revitalize the corps and possibly make it independent or a public corporation.

title: Mrs. Gandhi's Candidate Elected by Congress Party
description: NEW DELHI, May 6The defeated Congress Party today overwhelmingly elected Indira Gandhi's candidate as its new president, demonstrating the former prime minister's continued influence in party affairs.

title: No Evidence Found That Hunts Sought Corner in Soybeans
description: CHICAGO, May 6 (UPI)A Federal Judge said today that there was no evidence heirs of the Texas oil millionaire, H. L. Hunt, were trying to corner the soybean market In their purchases on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Fears of Tightened Credit Send Stocks Into a Tumble
description: The latest weekly jump in the nation's basic money supply, announced after the close of trading Thursday, renewed Wall Street fears of tighter credit yesterday and pushed stock prices lower.

title: Kean Discloses Worth
description: Thomas H. Kean of Livingston, Republican gubernatorial candidate, disclosed that his total assets amount to $1.8 million and that he has liabilities of $67,780. He also said he had $1.2 million in investments, including $163,4. 000 worth of stock in the Livingston National Bank and $147,000 in the National State Bank of Elizabeth. Mr. Kean, former Assembly speaker anck minority leader, said he paid $79,373 in Federal income taxes last year and $2,739 in state income taxes. His prop erty taxes for 1976 were $15,129.

title: Iowa Bankers Enter the Electronic Age, But Will Their Customers Go Along?
description: DES MOINESThe most ambitious test of the banking industry's march into the electronic age is having startup troubles.

title: Notes On People
description: After a brief stay in St. Luke's Hospital in Houston for a complete physical examination, King Hussein flew home to Jordan, leaving in his wake royal gift watches for the hospital staff and flowers for his fellow patients. No one could say just how many watches the King's men distributed, but they were said to be made of yellow gold, with sapphirestudded stems, for the women staff members who attended Hussein, and white gold watches with leather bands for the men. The dozens of bouquets of flowers he received were distributed to other patients. It was announced, meanwhile, that the King was found to be in excellent health.

title: Ruth Sutton Reynolds, 87; Family Developed Sutton Place;
description: Ruth Sutton Reynolds, author and lifer: long resident of New Rochelle, N. Y., died.; yesterday in the Briar Crest Nursing: Home in Ossining, N. Y. She was 87 years old.

title: Soviet Six Beats Canada; Czechs Retain First Place
description: VIENNA, May 6 (AP)The Soviet Union overcame an aggressive Canadian team, 81, in a penaltyfilled game in the world ice hockey championship at the Stadthalle tonight.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: A Power Problem in New Hampshire
description: The State of New Hampshire is turning a fairly peaceful protest against the development of a nuclear power plant into a major legal and fiscal crisis that will not help its reputation or treasury.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: CBS TO MOVE WHO'S WHO TO SUNDAYS IN RATING BID
description: While technically canceled for next fall, Who's Who, the CBS News magazine show devoted to people topics, will be given another chance by CBSTV to prove that it can compete for primetime audiences.

title: Bren a Contributor To Ads Against Mobil
description: Donald L. Brent the biggest single participant in an investing group bidding against the Mobil Corporation for the valuable Irvine land holdings in California, acknowledged yesterday that he had contributed to recent ads against Mobil that had been run in several major newspapers by a newly formed Committee for Energy Resources. The ads, mentioning Irvine, questioned Mobil's investments in nonenergy businesses.

title: No Reprisal by Byrne
description: The state will take no action against the municipalities that removed from rebatecheck envelopes a message from

title: Dance: Rudy Perez Coverage II
description: Choreographer's Powerful Solo Is Performed by Clive Thompson of Alvin Ailey Dance Theater

title: Letters: On Medical Care Costs
description: To the Editor:

title: Giscard Avoids London Dinner
description: LONDON, May 6It was reportedly a very congenial dinner party that the President of France missed tonight by not turning up for the welcoming affair that Britain gave at 10 Downing Street for participants in the weekend economic summit conference.

title: IMPORT CURB ESTABLISHED ON RHODESIAN CHROME
description: WASHINGTON, May 6 (AP)The Treasury Department set up a temporary system today to prevent Rhodesian chrome from entering the United States.

title: Zoeller Earns Respect, Now He Wants Victory
description: DALLAS, May 6Fuzzy Zoeller, 25yearold extrovert who took a share of the lead today in the second round of the Byron Nelson Golf Classic, is one of those golf professionals who earns a good livelihood without winning any tournaments.

title: Ethiopia and Soviet Sign Agreements on Closer Tie
description: MOSCOW, May 6The revolutionary military Government in Ethiopia today moved toward closer ties with the Soviet Union by signing a series of documents promoting cooperation between the two countries.

title: 65.3% Rise. Is Reported In Incidence of Measles
description: ATLANTA, May 6 (AP)Reported cases of measles were up 65.3 percent in the first four months of the year, as against the same months in 1976, the Federal Center for Disease Control said today. It called for an improved immunization program.

title: Patents: Hotel Energy Saver
description: A newly patented device conserves energy by turning off airconditioning or heating in hotel rooms while they are empty. Page 12.

title: Radical Economic Policy Proposed by Chirac
description: PARIS, May 6Jacques Chirac, the leader of a party purporting to carry on the Gaullist tradition, upstaged the Government of President Valry Giscard d'Estaing again today when he proposed new economic policy radically opposed to that of the Government.

title: Marine Drill Instructor Guilty
description: SAN DIEGO, May 6 (AP)A drill instructor pleaded guilty at the MarineCorps Recruit Depot today to seven counts of assault, one of hazing and eight counts of financial dealings with recruits. The plea was entered by Sgt. Albert J. Fragua, 27 years old, of Albuquerque, N.M., in a special courtmartial.

title: Swiss Credit Bank Says Chairman Was Blameless In $880 Million Scandal
description: GENEVA, May 6The chairman of the Swiss Credit Bank, Oswald Aeppli, has been cleared by a special committee of five board members of all responsibility for the $880 million scandal that has enveloped this major commercial bank. The board named the committee, composed of five of its outside directors, last Monday, and commissioned them to establish responsibility for the scandal at all levels of the bank's Zurich headquarters and at its branch in Chiasso, on the Italian order. It was that branch whose officers are believed to have placed investors unds in a financially troubled Liechtentein holding company.

title: Nixon Election Funds Are Seized by I.R.S.
description: WASHINGTON, May 6 (AP)The Internal Revenue Service has seized more than onethird of the $1.3 million in surplus funds left over from former President Richard M. Nixon's 1972 reelection campaign, records on file with the Federal Election Commission show.

title: Hijacked Loot Found
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation said that it had recovered $2 million worth of prescription drugs, clothing, jewelry and appliances stolen in a series of truck hijackings in the last few weeks.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: White House Eases Stand on Energy Chief's Powers
description: WASHINGTON, May 6In a concession to a bipartisan group of senators, the White House dropped today its insistence that the secretary of the proposed department of energy be given the sole power to set prices paid to producers of natural gas and crude oil.

title: Gold
description: Selected world gold prices Friday. London: morning fixing $147.75, up

title: A.T.&T. Joins Plan for Free Stock to Employees
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company, the nation's largest corporation, in terms of stockholders and profits, has joined a growing last of large companies adopting an ESOPan Employee Stock Ownership Plan that provides free stock to all employees.

title: Marie E. Kamen, Publicist, Is Bride of William G. Allen
description: Marie E. Kamen, widow of Dr. Robert E. Kamen, was married in New York yesterday to William G. Allen. Justice Maxine K. Duberstein of the Supreme Court of the State of New York, performed the ceremony in her chambers.

title: Bombing Suspect Pleads
description: MADISON, Wis., May 6Dwight Alan Armstrong, 25 years old, pleaded no contest today to a charge of second degree murder and was remanded to jail without bail pending a presentence report.

title: A City Shopping Spree To South of the Border
description: Drop in at La Tienda, a spacious shop on the ground floor of a nondescript white brick apartment building at 210 East 58th Street, and you'll imagine yourself in some Latin American country, exploring a narrow winding street lined with little stalls overflowing with colorful merchandise. There's even a sidewalk cafe where customers can relax over a 30cent cup of Colombian coffee and listen to the haunting flute music of the Peruvian Andes.

title: At Least Two Killed as Pakistani Soldiers Fire on Protesters in Lahore
description: LAHORE, Pakistan, May 6At least two men were killed and 11 wounded by Pakistani soldiers here today during an unruly antiGovernment demonstration, while across this nation of 75 million a day of martyrs called by the opposition. Pakistan Alliance appeared to fall short of undermining the position of Prime Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto.

title: Byrne Signs a Guarantee of Rights Of Those Developmentally Disabled
description: TRENTON, May 6Governor Byrne signed into law today a measure that has been called a bill of rights for New Jersey citizens suffering from developmental disabilities.

title: Toward a New Kind of School Board
description: Mayor Beame, like most of his predecessors, wants abolish the Board of Education and run the New York City schools himself, through a commissioner, as he runs the Police and Fire Departments. Almost anything might be better than the present system, but Mr. Beame seems to be driving reform too fast and too far. In his understandable desire to manage every dollar spent in the city's name, he would strip away the very useful insulation that separates educators and politicians in almost every jurisdiction.

title: LEGRANDS SENTENCED IN KILLING OF 2 GIRLS
description: Devernon LeGrand, the selfstyled bishop of a Brooklyn church, and a stepson, Steven Straun LeGrand, were sentenced yesterday to the maximum of 25 years to life in prison for the murder of two teenaged sisters on Oct. 3. 1975.

title: To the Geordies, Carter Is an O.K. Bloke
description: WASHINGTON, England, May 6All across northeastern England today the word was the same: Jimmy Carter is an O.K. bloke.

title: Housen Conquers a Problem, Gains Richardson Semifinal
description: HEWLETT HARBOR, LI., May 6Bob Housen, a strong 38yearold golfer who has four New Jersey State titles to his credit, said: Match play does make you play different golf. As much as you want to play the way you do in medal play, match play makes you gamble too much.

title: U.S. AND BRITAIN AGREE ON RHODESIA TACTICS
description: LONDON, May 6Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance and Dr. David Owen, the British Foreign Secretary, reached full agreement today on revised tactics that they hope will lead to a black majority government in Rhodesia before the end of next year.

title: Polaroid Says Film Cassette Is Key to Its Instant Movies
description: LOS ANGELES, May 6The technical innovations of Polaroid's new instant color motionpicture system are concentrated in a selfcontained film cassette rather than in the lightweight camera that exposes the film or the tabletop player that rewinds the film for processing and automatic display.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Japanese Police Remove Towers Built as Protest Against Airport
description: TOKYO, May 6Working under the cover of darkness with the aid of a surprise court order, Japanese police toppled today two tall steel protest towers that for nearly half a decade have blocked use of the runways at Tokyo's new international airport.

title: Money
description: Friday, May 6, 1977

title: Australian Air Controllers Strike
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Saturday, May 7 (Reuters)Australian air traffic controllers went on strike for higher wages at midnight, halting all international and domestic flights, It was the second walkout in a week, of the 900 controllers after the Australian Public Service Board reJected their demand for a 38 percent salary increase,

title: Susan Turberg Goodfriend Wed to Harold Resnik
description: Susan Turberg Goodfriend, a member of the City Health Commissioner's expert committee op health education, was married yesterday afternoon to Harold Resnik, a senior partner in M. R. Weiser & Company, accountants.

title: Penny Earned
description: To the Editor:

title: Concert: StarChild
description: George Crumb, who in recent years has become one of the most admired of American composers, had a world premiere with the New York Philharmonic on Thursday night in Carnegie Hall. Pierre Boulez conducted his StarChild, a work that is by far the most ambitious thing that this composer has attempted.

title: Paine Webber Announces Accord] To Merge with Mitchell, Hutchins
description: In a further sign of the growing concentration on Wall Street, Paine Webber Inc., parent company of Paine, Webber, Jackson & Curtis, the big retail brokerage firm, yesterday announced with Mitchell, Hutchins Inc., a researchoriented brokerage firm, that the two brokerage houses would merge.

title: COWLES COMMUNICATIONS ELEVATES THREE OFFICERS
description: John M. Haberlan, a vice president of Cowles Communications Inc. and president of its wholly owned subsidiary, Cowles Broadcasting Inc., yesterday was elected president and chief operating officer of the parent company.

title: Young Planning to Go Ahead
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 6Andrew Young said today that his visit to South Africa was not intended to interfere in the Government's affairs or stir up any trouble. Mr. Young said he would go ahead with his planned speaking engagements unless the invitations were canceled or the Government told him not to come.

title: Curbs on Shipments Weighed
description: LONDON, May 6 (Reuters)Secretary of State Vance and External Affairs Secretary Donald Jamieson of Canada agreed today to study the adequacy of controls on nuclear shipments, a Canadian spokesman said.

title: FRENCH BUSINESSMEN ARE GUESTS OF BEAME
description: With croissants on the breadandbutter plates, flowers representing the tricolor of France on the tables and a few French words on their lips, Mayor Beanie and his top aides gave breakfast to a group of 20 French businessmen at Gracie Mansion yesterday and used the occasion to try to lure them to New York.

title: Marshall Signs L.I. Player
description: HUNTINGTON, W. Va., May 6 (AP) Marshall University signed yesterday Ken Labanowski, a highscoring high school basketball player from Oyster Bay (L.I.) High School. Labanowski is a 6.foot7 Inch forward,

title: South Africa May Bar Young; Lack of Formal Request Is Cited
description: JOHANNESBURG, May 6The South African Government threatened today to bar a oneday visit here later this month by Andrew Young, the American representative at the United Nations, giving as its reasons Mr. Young's failure to seek formal approval and his plan to talk to black leaders but not to Government representatives.

title: Former Patient of Freud Recalls Time on Couch: He Talkedto Me
description: Continued From Page 27 guy. He was a rather short man, you know, only about 5feet6.

title: Revolutionary Irish Armored Car Wins a Test for Belgian Order
description: DUBLINThe Belgian Government has purchased 124 armored cars of revolutionary design. What has astonished rival arms makers is the fact that the: car was designed and made in the Republic of Ireland, which has no history of arms production.

title: The Day Was . . . Well ...Up in the Air
description: A medley of spring weatherearlymorning fog, dazzling midday sunshine and howling late  afternoon thunderstormscrossed the New York metropolitan area yesterday, generating headaches for travelers and a kaleidoscope for sky watchers.

title: 5 MAJOR POTASH PRODUCERS ACQUITTED ON PRICE FIXING
description: CHICAGO, May 6 (Reuters)Five major potash producers today were acquitted of Federal charges of conspiring to fix prices and production levels of the mineral, a prime component of fertilizer.

title: Bridge:
description: For one of the competitors, the Cavendish Club's invitation pair championship starting here today is the first stage of an international tour.

title: 10to1 Shot, Wins Oaks For Fillies
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 6While the big boys were back in the barn resting for the Kentucky Derby, a dozen of the fanciest fillies in the land competed today in the 103d Kentucky Oaksthe sister race to the classicand they were led home by a 10to1 outsider named Sweet Alliance.

title: Playing Nuclear Games At the Summit
description: LONDONPresident Carter rightly recognizes both the dangers and benefits of nuclear energy as far as potential wartime and peacetime usage is concerned, but he will have to prove himself more peacemaker than pacemaker if he is to gain any substantial harmony at this weekend's London summit.

title: IncomeTax Phone Aid
description: A tollfree home service offering information on the state's new income tax has received more than 125,000 calls since it went into operation Feh. H. It will he discontinued on Tuew day. The State Tax Director, SidneyGlaser, said the most calls were received during the week of April 10 just before the original April 15 filing deadline for the 2 to 2.5 percent tax.

title: U.S. IS SUING DETROIT OVER SEWAGE PLANT
description: DETROIT, May 6The Federal Government sued the City of Detroit today in an effort to stop the city's sewagetreatment plant from polluting the Detroit River and Lake Erie.

title: RISE IN U.S. AID TO SPUR NEV YORK AREA JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, May 6New York State, New Jersey and Connecticut will be able to hire approximately 76,000 more lowincome longunemployed workers under an expansion of a Federal program disclosed today.

title: Gains Are Seen in Efforts to Preserve the Pine Barrens
description: BATSTO, May 5Federal and state and conservation officials, gathered here for a tour of the Pine Barrens, reported gains today in efforts to prevent overdevelopment o fthe unusual wilderness.

title: UNEMPLOYMENT AT 7%, LOWEST IN 29 MONTHS; 90 MILLION HOLD JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, May 6The national unemployment rate fell in April from 7.3 percent to 7 percent, its lowest level in 29 months, and the number of people with jobs scored a strong gain of more than 500,000 for the second consecutive month, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Weekly Quiz
description: Questions are based on news reported in The Times during the last week.

title: BankRobbery Suspect Killed by Police in Wayne
description: The police pursued three bankrobbery suspects and killed one and wounded the other two during an exchange of gunfire in Wayne, the authorities said. Charles Voelker, the chief of police of nearby Fairfield, said an alarm had been sounded shortly after three men walked into the Midlantic Bank there and announced that they would rop it.

title: Pride of Carlisle Wins Trot at Meadowlands
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., May 6Keystone Pioneer, last year's trotter of the year, was made the 3to5 choice by a crowd of 19,825 tonight in the $25,000 Sirloin Trot at the Meadowlands but never became a contender in the sevenhorse field.

title: 71st Plane Crash Victim Dies
description: MARIETTA, Ga., May 6 (AP)Ernest Prewett, 66 years old, died today of burns suffered when a Southern Airways plane crashed into the general store where he was shopping in New Hope, Ga., on April 4, He was the seventyfirst victim of the accident.

title: Beame Orders Parks Department To Revise Summer Youth Hiring
description: Mayor Beame ordered yesterday that applications for 1,100 summer Parks Department jobs for youths be handled through the city's employment department.

title: For Magruder, Now in a New Life, Nixon Interview Held No Interest
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, May 6Conforming with his assertion that he does not think about Watergate these days, Jeb Stuart Magruder, a convicted Watergate conspirator, did not watch the first televised David Frost interview with tormer President Richard M. Nixon on Wednesday.

title: Cut in Shellfishing Ordered in Suffolk
description: STONY BROOK, L.I., May 6The State Department of Environmental Conservation, bowing to Federal pressure, today announced the closing, because of pollution, of 2,600 additional acres of clam beds in Suffolk County, including virtual. ly all of the most productive waters in the Great South Bay off Babylon Town.

title: The Day in Jersey Area Was, Well, Up in the Air
description: A medley of spring weatherearlymorning fog, dazzling midday sunshine and howling late  afternoon thunder. stormscrossed the New York metropolitan area yesterday, generatin headaches fo travelers and a kaleidoscope for sky watchers,

title: Bonaparte Speaks
description: At the end of their first televised interview, David Frost had Napoleon Bonaparte perspiring heavily under his pressing interrogation about the Waterloo affair, and small wonder.

title: Anker Eases Martin Luther King High PhaseOut
description: Protesting parents and students from Martin Luther King Jr. High School won a slight concession from the New York City School Chancellor yesterday nn plan to phase out the high school on Manhattan's West Side. The chancellor prom. sed that the plan would not begin during he next academic year.

title: New Panmunjom Session
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Saturday, May 7 (AP)The United Nations command agreed with North Korea today to convene the Military Armistice Commission Monday morning at Panmunjom to discuss the killing of a South Korean soldier in the demilitarized zone.

title: TWO STEEL COMPANIES LIFT PRICES SHARPLY; U.S. AGENCY CRITICAL
description: The Republic Steel Corporation, the nations fourth largest steelmaker, announced yesterday price increases of 6.8 percent to 8.8 percent on basic steel products. The move is expected to be followed shortly by the rest of the industry.

title: American Mother of 77 Gives Her Regrets to Broadway
description: A 49yearold working mother from Oklahoma who once had dreams of being a musical comedy star on Broadway was named the National American Mother of 1977 yesterday.

title: U.S. Food Service Head Named
description: WASHINGTON, May 6 (AP)Lewis S. Straus today was named administrator of the Agriculture Department's food and nutrition service. The 43yearold resident of Somerset, N.J., has been working in the agency as an expert consultant at $168.96 a day for about two months, .a spokesman said. His new job pays $47,500 a year. The agency handles such programs as food stamps and school lunches.

title: Zaire Orders Expulsion Of Arrested Newsmen
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, May 6 (AP)The Zairian Government ordered the expulsion today of seven Western newsmen arrested in Shaba Province and accused of trying to spy for the rebel army there.

title: Dancer, a Beauty Sleeping Little, Does 2 Performances Toe to Toe
description: The show must go on, even if that show is a grueling threehour ballet and you are a ballerina who suddenly must dance two successive performances of The Sleeping Beauty instead of one.

title: NoFault Divorce Law in Australia Reducing Trauma and Cutting Costs
description: CANBERRA, AustraliaWhen Torn Steele and his wife decided after five years of unsuccessful marriage to finally get a divorce, all he did was fill out a simple Government form attesting that their marriage had irretrievably broken down. Within days he got a 10minute hearing before the local office of Australia's new Family Court. That was it.

title: Soybean Futures Decline By Limit in 3 Deliveries; Oats, Wheat, Corn Gain
description: CHICAGO, May 6 (AP)Soybean futures fell the limit of 30 cents a bushel in two of the three old crop deliveries on the Chicago Board of Trade today.

title: Home, Souring Home
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.Home ownership for the average family has been the cornerstone of the country's housing policy from the time the Government first undertook to have a housing policy. In 1931, President Herbert Hoover told a national housing conference: Those immortal ballads, Home Sweet Home, My Old Kentucky Home, and The Little Gray Home in the West, were not written about tenements or apartments . . they never sing songs about a pile of rent receipts.

title: In Memoriam
description: BRUNOHenry and Annie. Lost in the sinking of the LusltaniaBeloved parents of Harry.

title: Rhodesian Industry Gets Some Pointers On Beating Boycotts
description: BULAWAYO, Rhodesia, May 3 (AP)The Rhodesian Trade Fair, shop window for this beleaguered country's industry, has opened with a startling array of products and hints of how businessmen beat boycotts.

title: The Region
description: The desire of communities in the metropolitan region to protect the environment by prohibiting oil drilling off their shores increasingly is coming in conflict with a desire among some of the same communities to benefit from any jobs created if the drilling does start. Last week New York City made it clear that it considers the job potential to have the greater weight.

title: Is a Fourth Network About to Hatch?
description: Tired of living in the shadow of the networks and of drawing paltry ratings in prime time against the powerhouse network schedules, a number of independent (unaffiliated) television stations decided last fall to see what would happen if they pooled their resources to do something big.

title: Carol Henze Has Bridal
description: Carol Maria Henze, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Raymond F. Henze Jr. of Scarsdale, N. Y., was married there at noon yesterday to John Bannister, son of Mr. and Mrs. Gerald H. Bannister of Rugby, England. The Rev. Paul Surlis performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in the Immaculate Heart of Mary Roman Catholic Church.

title: Hope F. Jones Becomes Bride
description: Hope Florence Jones. daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edwin Scoville Jones of St. Louise was married there yesterday afternoon to David Keith Welles Jr.. son of Mr. and Mrs. Welles of Perryburn. Ohio.

title: Annie to Aid Project HOPE
description: Project HOPE will benefit from the evening performance of the musical Annie at the Alvin Theater on June 1. Tickets, at $35 and $50, can be obtained from the beneficiary at 1271 Avenue of the Americas, Suite 3551.

title: Miss Lynch Bride Of Robert Brennan
description: Teresa Mary Lynch, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Thomas J. Lynch of East Hills, LI., was married yesterday to Robert Owen Brennan in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church in Roslyn Harbor, L.I. The Rev. Vincent Sullivan performed the ceremony. The bridegroom is a son of Mr. and Mrs. B. Elliott Brennan of East Williston, L.I.

title: 6 Homers Hit as Reds Lose to Pirates, 1210
description: Some baseball fans, notably the purists, like tight pitching battles highlighted by great defensive plays. Other fans would rather see hits rattling all over the diamond and a steady parade of runners.

title: IN AMERICA
description: AMARILLO, Tex. He's Stanley Marsh 3pronounced three, not the thirdand he lives in a sprawling ranch house on a sprawling ranch in the Panhandle. Even if there were no peacocks strutting across his roof and no ostriches in his backyard, it would be a surprising place. It would still he surprising if there were not a Volkswagen Beetle plantedliterally planted ??osedown near his driveway, for that would leave the yak, the zebra, the several llamas and the 20foot neon sculpture that changes its redwhileandblue color scheme with every shift in the High Prairie wilds. Stanley Marsh 3, who decreed this pleasure dome, calls it Toad Hall.

title: LETTERS TO THE CONNECTICUT EDITOR
description: Hoping to Keep It The Haven It Is

title: FISHING
description: MACKEREL should remain the best offshore bet around the Island thisweek. Meanwhile, the alternatives are increasing inshore as the waters warm. Blackfish are late, but there are scattered reports that they have arrived on some of the inshore structures and rock piles. Flounder fishing is fair to good in the bays and on the flats.

title: Baranello to the Aid of the Party
description: THREE months after his selection as Democratic state chairman, Dominic J. Baranello, who is also the Suffolk County Democratic leader, is still trying to pick up the pieces or, as he described it, playing catchup.

title: Fertility Was the Problem
description: FRESH from the success of The Emergence of Man, the seventh in a series of popular science books, John Pfeiffer has now turned to The Emergence of Society. And, I had better say at once, I have rarely encountered a more difficult book to write about: chaotic, selfcontradictory, anecdotal and at the same time breathtaking in the bold simplicity of its global generalizations.

title: The Music Festivals Of Europe 1977
description: Wherever the Europeanbound traveler ventures this spring and summer he is apt to find a music festival in progress or about to begin. In addition to regularly recurring events, a number of special programs are scheduled. Britain is celebrating the Silver Anniversary of Queen Elizabeth II's accession to the throne with commemorative events throughout the country. Belgium is celebrating the 400th anniversary of the birth in Antwerp of Peter Paul Rubens along with the biennial Europalia Festival, dedicated to the art of a particular European country, this year Germany. Switzerland's Fte des Vignerons, in Vevey, honors the grape harvest; it will be held from July 30 to Aug. 14 for the first time since 1955. Italy's Spoleto Festival of Two Worlds branches out to become truly a twoworld event when founder GianCarlo Menotti opens the Spoleto Festival U.S.A. in Charleston, S.C., on May 25. Austria, with longestablished festivals in Vienna and Salzburg, adds a festival within a festival at its Carinthian Summer event, which inaugurates composer/conductor participating. And in West Germany, Bonn's biennial Beethoven Festival recognizes the 150th anniversary of the composer's death. (However, renovation of the opera house in Wiesbaden has forced another traditional German event, the Wiesbaden May Festival, to skip year.)

title: Editors' Choice
description: A FEAST OF WORDS, by Cynthia Griffin Wolff. (Oxford University Press, $15.95.) Psychologicalcritical study of Edith Wharton's life and art.

title: BOOK EXCHANGE9700
description: BOOK EXCHANGE9700

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: Is It Necessarily Bad to Defer Action?

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: TodaySt. Clement's. Saratoga Race Track, Saratoga Springs, N. Y. Regular, green, amateurowner, junior and children's working hunters; open, intermediate, preliminary and junior jumpers; ponies, equitation. 8:30 A.M.

title: Steel, Sax and Sauce
description: LOU DILISIO can be found weekdays banging out fenders at his auto body repair shop in Mount Kisco. Monday nights, he's playing clarinet with the Westchester Concert Band. Tuesdays, it's saxophone with the Yonkers Philharmonic. There's tennis on Wednesdays and, on weekends, wine castings and gigs with his dance band.

title: When the Bund Strutted in Yaphank
description: YAPHANK ON balmy spring days, a breeze from the Carmans River still winds up the bluff past the gingerbreadfringed cottages of Siegfried Park, crosses its empty athletic field and ripples the pine trees next to the Edelweiss Hauss Community Hall.

title: Carter's First Summit
description: LONDONThe current London summit offers President Carter a useful chance to become acquainted at first hand with some of the free world's main problems and some of the leaders who must deal with them. Yet this is about the only persuasive argument for its value.

title: SHOP TALK
description: PUT a shell to your ear and you can hear the sea. Step inside the Chambered Nautilus, an oceanic boutique at 499 Central Avenue in Cedarhurst, and you can feel the sea around you.

title: States' Rights vs. Victims' Rights
description: Imagine (and these are reallife cases, typifying conditions in several states) having a relative in a public mental hospital and learning he had been subjected to electric shock treatment 800 times. Or imagine being held with others for two weeks in a cell without windows, bed or toilet and trying to sleep on that floor. If you were lucky, you might find a lawyer or public interest group to bring suit. If society was lucky, that suit would not only address the individual case but also be broad enough to force the cleansing of the whole snakepit. But why should minimal decency depend on luck at all?

title: Sketches of Government Leaders Meeting Carter at Economic Conference in London
description: James Callaghan

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: GARDENING
description: BEANS have been grown for food in the Americas since prehistoric times, but it seems likely that beanplanting in New Jersey will reach a record high this year Everyone with even a small plot of ground seems to be turning it into a vegetable garden, and beans are the most popular of all vegetables.

title: Heavy Action Last Week
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  The struggle for control of tho former Spanish Sahara, a 109,000squaremile sandbox in northwest Africa, is an inconclusive, bitter affair, one of the continent's obscurer conflicts. On one side are the forces of Morocco and Mauritania, who partitioned the territory in an agreement concluded with Spain in November, 1975. On the other is the Polisario Front, indigenous, composed mostly of tribesmen, who are fighting for Saharan independence with the logistical, material and diplomatic support of neighboring Algeria.

title: Kentucky Derby Chart
description: EIGHTHThe Kentucky Derby, $267,200 added, 3YO, 1M. Start good, ?? ?? Oil, 5.40 P.M. Winner, ?? b. or br. ?? by Bold ReasoningMy Charmer, by Poker. ?? W. H. Turner, Jr. Value to winner, $214,700; second, $30,000; third, $15,000; fourth, $7,500. Times23; 45 4/5; 1:10 3/5; 1:36; 2:02 1/5.

title: Skinner Wins 2 Sprints, Leads Jackson to Title
233 SENTENCED TO DEATH IN '76, U.S. STUDY REPORTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 7 (AP)A Government census shows that 233 Americans were sentenced to death in 1976.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ST. LOUIS, May 7 (AP)Leon Spinks battered Pedro Agosto with a series of punches in the opening round and scored a knockout after 1 minute 55 seconds of their scheduled eightround heavyweight bout today.

title: The Room Count
description: SEATTLEHotel companies are measured by the number of rooms they own or manage, and Western International's 25,580 rooms rank it as a major competitor in the field. The company's 40 percent growth in rooms since 1975 also makes it the fastestgrowing member of the industry.

title: A Step Forward for A Woman Conductor
description: Three years ago, Judith Somogi made history by becoming the first woman to conduct the New York City Opera. In a few weeks, she will add to her laurels as the third woman to conduct the New York Philharmonic, following in the footsteps of Nadia Boulanger and Sarah Caldwell. She will be in charge of one of the Promenade programs at Avery Fisher Hall, that being given on May 31 and June 1 and 2.

title: BRIDGE
description: All players have occasion at some time to echo Hamlet's sardonic question: Use every man according to his deserts and who should scape whipping? They do something that mature judgment suggests is unwise, but the fates are kind and they escape unscathedperhaps even with a profit. And some players, like North in the diagramed deal played at New York's famed Cavendish Club, do not even realize that they merited a whipping.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: THE greatest enemy of brick walls, chimneys and other structures made of brick is waterthat is, water that penetrates the surface through crumbling mortar joints, cracked or missing bricks and similar defects.

title: Famous Bulldog's Puppies Are Apples of Many Eyes
description: Prospective buyers, even from as far away as Anchorage, Alaska, keep calling, but Charles A. Westfield Jr. will not sell his two male puppies. Only 13 days old, the sourmugs are as precious ??s platinum to him. They were produced by Ch. Westfield Cunomorus Stone, the most famous bitch and the topwinning one in the history of bulldogs. Called Puzzle, she was retired earlier this year with 38 bestinshows, 23 specialties and 140 nonsporting groups.

title: SHOP TALK
description: AT 1999 Palmer Avenue in Larchmont, just a few doors from the Larchmont Playhouse, there is a red door and sign that reads Red Door Bakery. But this is not the entrance; in fact, it is not even a real door. Go around the corner, in back of the buildings alongside the railroad tracks, and there is another red door, no mirage, but the entrance to an unusual experience: a bakery unlike any a customer is likely to see in Westchester.

title: Salvation Army Ends Association With U.S.O. Over Serving of Drinks
description: The Salvation Army has withdrawn from participation in the U.S.O. (United Service Organizations) because the 36yearold home away from home for men and women in the armed forces has changed its policy and now permits the serving of alcohol in its centers.

title: Crenshaw Birdies 18th For 207, Tie With Floyd
description: DALLAS, May 7Ben Crenshaw topped Ray Floyd's two birdies on the last four holes today with three birdies of his own in the same stretch. With that streak Gentle Ben shot his way into a tie with Floyd for first place after the third round of the Byron Nelson Golf Classic.

title: DINING OUT
description: SAN FRANCISCO. The name fairly quivers with appetizing vibrations. Can anyone east of the Rockies resist a restaurant that advertises San Francisco cuisine? Well, almost. Especially if you know that most of the recipes have grown just a bit tired after 20 years of toofaithful service.

title: Apples Trounce Strings For 4th Victory, 2914
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., May 7The New York Apples routed the Los Angeles Strings, 2914, tonight for their third consecutive World Team Tennis victory. The Apples won four of the five sets.

title: Radio
description: 89 A.M., WKTU: Mellow Child. Children's songs and stories.

title: Seattle Slew Captures Kentucky Derby by 1 Lengths
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 7America loves a story with a happy ending, and it got one today at Churchill Downs in the 103d running of the Kentucky Derby.

title: THE PRICE OF FAME
description: For almost a halfcentury. Anne Morrow Lindbergh has been the intimate companion of famefirst as the wife of the aviator who was canonized a hero after he was the first to fly nonstop and solo from New York to Paris, and now as his widow, who is the living symbol of that epic flight. She is the guardian of the Lindbergh legend, and the inevitable center of attention for elaborate celebration ceremonies in the United States and France on May 20 and 21.

title: High Court Didn't Help
description: Mass transportation in the metropolitan region, already short on money and long on obsolescence, suffered another setback last month when the United States. Supreme Court decided that the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey should not be in the railroad construction business.

title: Suzanne V. Stallings Is Bride of James Magee
description: Suzanne Virginia Stallings, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Elias Stallings of Rumson, N. J., was married yesterday afternoon to James Wa??er Magee., son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Ulmer Magee of Media, Pa., and Vero Beach, Fla.

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox: Fierce Horses
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Paperback Best Sellers
description: Massmarket paperbacks are softcover books sold at newsstands, variety stores, supermarkets; as well as in bookstores. This analysis is based on reports from representative wholesalers and chains with more than 10,000 outlets in the United States.

title: Primroses Can Be Started From Seed
description: Primroses or primulas are among the best loved of spring's flowers. Blooming along with such early companions as golden alyssum, the snowy hardy candytuft, blue wood phlox, tulips and narcissus, they are a visual assurance of winter's end. In their native habitats, they grow with gay abandon in fields, high in the mountains or at the edge of most woods in Asia and Europe. The English primrose is ever dear to our hearts.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: The stock market's strong recent advance ran out of steam last Friday when one of Wall Street's chief bugaboos  a jump in the basic money supply  reared its head anew.

title: Englewood: A Medieval Festival
description: COME Wednesday, and madrigalists will sing, strolling musicians will strum lutes and play recorders and costumed students will serve tarts and mulled cider in a specially constructed village square on the grounds of DwightEnglewood School in Englewood.

title: Wall Street Merger Trend Accelerates
description: Wall Street draw its belt a notch tighter last week as the dearth of profits in the brokerage community resulted in plans for two more big mergers.

title: Getting Congress To Hear Business
description: WESTCHESTER'S top business leaders, concerned about economic trends in the county, have opeded a direct line of communications to the three Congressmen who represent the county in Washington. The instrument is a 15member Congressional liaison committee established under the auspices of the Westchester County Association, which has 800 members from corporate, professional and civic communities.

title: A Shiver for Lawyers at the Securities Bar
description: It took five years to resolve a Securities and Exchange Commission suit against White & Case, the venerable Wall Street law firm. When outofcourt settlement finally came last week, many observers were disappointed over the lack of a judicial statement on lawyers' responsibilities under the securities laws. The case, nevertheless, has become a landmark.

title: Rereforming Schools
description: WHEN the history of the 1960's is written, the nature and impact of the school reform movement will become far clearer than it is now. It is too soon to know, for instance, whether it was essentially a literary movement, led by such celebrated authors as A.S. Neill, John Holt, Jonathan Kozol and Charles Silberman, or whether it was a social move ment sufficiently broad to cause lasting change in the nation's schools.

title: Catherine Bennett James Wed to R. E. Thornburgh
description: Catherine Bennett James was married yesterday afternoon to Richard Edward Thornburgh in the Mount Kisco (N. Y.) Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Jack S. Miller.

title: Disposal of Dead Pets Becomes an Official Concern
description: WITH MUNICIPAL incinerators being shut down one by one as the various towns in Farifield County phase into solidwaste recycling through the Connecticut Resource Recovery Authority, local health officials are becoming increasingly concerned with the problem of disposing of various types of special waste.

title: Deaths
description: APPELBAUMLouts, beloved husband of Mary, loving father of Billie Siegel and Rachmael BenAvram, adored grandfather of Matthew and Donna, Services Sunday, 11:15 A.M. at Gutterman's Nassau Memorial Chapel, Lone Beach Road at Greystone, Rockville Lentil, L.I.

title: New York State's Ghetto Medicine Program Is Being Replaced
description: New York State's Ghetto Medicine Program, which was started under a 1968 state law to provide public funds to help pay for voluntary hospitals' deficits in clinics serving outpatients, is being replaced.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Only two Americans in the last threequarters of a century achieved overnight fame and became instant heroes. One was Adm. George Dewey, victor in the Battle of Manila Bay (May 1, 1898). When he returned to the United States in 1899, the admiral. resplendent in Navy whites, was hysterically feted in New York, Washington and elsewhere. Yet the hurrahs for the man who had said, You may fire when ready. Gridley. subsided within a year.

title: At Indy, There's a 200 M.P.H. Question
description: Will the 200mileperhour barrier officially fall next weekend during the first round of qualifying for the Indianapolis 500? That's like asking whether Tom Seaver of the Mets will ever pitch a nohitter. The answer to both questions is, yes, if the conditions are right, Certainly. Seaver is capable of pitching a nohitter, and certainly this year's cars are capable of exceeding 200 m.p.h. at Indy.

title: Letters: People Who Play Radios on Buses
description: To the Editor:

title: Melinda Smith, Steven Porter Are Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. George Douglas Lawrence of Bronxville, N. Y., and Mill Reef, Antigua, have announced the engagement of Mrs. Lawrence's daughter, Melinda Kemp Smith, to Steven Kenneth Porter, son of Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth Porter of Old Westbury. L.I.

title: TOP LAW FIRM BANS SEX DISCRIMINATION
description: An agreement to recruit, hire and pay women lawyers on the same basis as men has been accepted by Sullivan & Cromwell, one of the nation's most prominent Iaw firms.

title: Strike Halts Australian Air Traffic
description: SYDNEY, Australia, May 7 (Reuters)Air traffic came to a virtual standstill in Australia today during a 48hour strike by air traffic controllers that closed all airports. The stoppage effectively cut off the continent from the rest of the world, with the exception of military flights. The 900 controllers have demanded a 36 percent pay raise. Over the weekend they will vote on whether to prolong the strike.

title: On Watch for the Unknown
description: IT IS MOSQUITO time and medical detectives at the Yale University School of Medicine are again on the lookout for encephalitis, the mosquitotransmitted disease that has never been recorded in humans in Connecticut, but that has been reported in neighboring states.

title: Rubie Mages to Marry
description: Ruble Mages, an assistant district attorney of New York County, and Lawrence D. Fruchtman, an assistant counsel with the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, plan to be married July 31. Miss Mages is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Mages of Harrisburg, Pa. Her fianc is the son of Rae Fruchtman of the Bronx and the late Moe Fruchtman.

title: A Freshman Tries to Meet His Classmates
description: LAST summer, before he arrived on the Yale campus for his first term, David Lempert conceived the idea of trying to meet all 1,300 members of the freshman class. He calculates that he succeeded in greeting about 700 before he quit.

title: Living Alone in the HighRises
description: BACHELORS and their female counterparts are increasingly seeking refuge in the plethora of luxury highrise apartment houses that dot the Palisades. And just as the living habits of these people have changed, so has the profile of a number of businesses upon whom they depend.

title: Dolly Flopped, but Her Street's a Hit
description: LOS ANGELES Rain seeps into the Bowerie National Bank and Harmonia Gardens, drips down the steel underbelly of the Sixth Avenue El. Exactly $1,920,000 worth of plaster, plastic, plexiglass and illusion is getting drenched.

title: Debate on Profits: A Clash of Titans
description: A new and potentially important debate that may influence Government economic policy has erupted in academic circles over the profitability of American enterprise.

title: NONFICTION IN BRIEF
description: One of the frustrations about making sense out of public policy is that so much depends on the frame of reference. We can look at abstract concepts of the public good. We can look at polls and votes to determine what citizens want, and why. We can read the literature of the day and infer political attitudes from literary insights.
