title: Syrian, Awaiting Carter, Is Adamant on Territory
description: GENEVA, May 8President Hafez alAssad of Syria said on his arrival today from Damascus that he hoped that his meeting here tomorrow with President Carter would be fruitful for the cause of peace in the Middle East, but he also said that he did not have in mind giving up an inch of our territory in a peace settlement.

title: Floyd's Late Surge Wins Nelson Golf by 2 Shots
description: DALLAS. May 8Ray Floyd and Ben Crenshaw matched birdie for birdie and eagle for eagle today in the final round of the Byron Nelson Golf Classic, and the outcome was settled on the last two holes as Floyd birdied the 17th and Crenshaw bogeyed 17 and 18.

title: Nixon Tells Frost Kissinger Differed on Cambodia
description: Former President Richard M. Nixon says that Henry A. Kissinger, then his adviser on national security, developed misgivings over the American invasion of Cambodia in 1970 once it had gotten under way, Newsweek magazine says in a report on the second Nixon interview with David Frost, to be broadcast Thursday night.

title: 15 Typhoid Cases in Australia
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, May 8 (UPI) Health authorities today reported 15 confirmed cases of typhoid in Victoria state. Health Department authorities said that an employe in a coffee shop was suspected as the source of the disease.

title: Braves Drop 14th in Row as '76 Nightmare Returns
description: Manager Dave Bristol of the Atlanta Braves thought the first month of the 1976 National League season was onceinalifetime nightmare. His Braves won eight of their first 13 games, then dropped 13 in a row.

title: Satellite Launching Is Postponed
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., May 8 (AP)The scheduled launching of twin military communications satellites on Tuesday has been postponed indefinitely because of a problem in the Titan 3C rocket. Air Force officials said today that a defective component had been discovered in the ignition circuit of the first stage of the rocket during a countdown check.

title: Coffee Airlifted From Uganda
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, May 8 (AP)An American DC8 transport plane has begun an airlift of 1,000 tons of coffee from Uganda, the Uganda radio reported yesterday in a broadcast monitored here. The broadcast said the airlift by Seaboard World Airlines was promoted by European coffee buyers to overcome transport handicaps involved in shipping the coffee overland through Kenya. Some trucks carrying coffee through Kenya have been hijacked.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Hundreds of Kite Owners Battle Wind at Princeton
description: PRINCETON, May 8Hundreds of youngathearts of all ages descended on the Battlefield here yesterday to duel with undulating winds as participants in this town's first Great KiteFlying Day.

title: Caution Is the Key to 2State DredgeDisposal Plan for L.I. Sound
description: WHITE PLAINS, May 8New York State and Connecticut environmental authorities have finished presenting to the public a plan that would guide the disposal of dredged materials in Long Island Sound.

title: Rita Moreno Excels in Rose Tattoo
description: NEW HAVENThe Rose Tattoo is Tennessee Williams's warmest, most ingratiating play, a romantic comedy with the zestiness and boisterous humor of a folk tale. In revival at the Long Wharf Theater, starring Rita Moreno, The Rose Tattoo seems to have ripened into a popular classic. It is filled with sunshine and optimism.

title: Andretti Takes Formula I Race in Spain
description: MADRID, May 8 (AP)Mario Andretti scored his second straight Formula I victory today, leading the Spanish Grand Prix from start to finish in his JPSLotus. The victory moved Andretti into second place in the competition for the 1977 World Drivers Championship.

title: Purser Subdues Hijacker On TokyoHawaii Flight
description: TOKYO, May 8 (AP)A crew member swinging a fire ax subdued a wouldbe hijacker today who had tried to force a Northwest Orient Airlines jumbo jet with 261 persons aboard to Moscow, authorities reported.

title: City Wants Presidential Yacht
description: MARQUETTE, Mich., May 8 (AP)The City of Marquette wants the Defense Department to lend it the Presidential yacht Sequoia, which has been used by Presidents since Herbert Hoover, for a tourist attraction. President Carter recently ordered the yacht sold in an economy move. Mayor Holly Greer has asked the Government not to sell the 104foot yacht but lend her to the city as a focal point for development of the lower harbor.

title: SUMMIT PARLEY ENDS
description: LONDON, May 8The leaders of seven industrial nations concluded their economic summit meeting tonight with a strong pledge to cooperate on a series of measures to combat unemployment and the economic crisis caused by their collective trade deficit to the major oilproducing nations.

title: Runners Narrowly Miss Explosion
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 8 (UPI)An oil tankertruck overturned and exploded yesterday at a normally busy intersection that had been cleared for a foot race. The driver was killed in the accident that occurred just after the last of 300 runners cleared the Kendall Square section.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: Dr. Leonard Rubin wrote recently about the spoilage of tomato paste once the tin was opened and only a spoonful or so was dished out. He also noted that in Europe tomato paste was packaged in tubes much like toothpaste, a much more efficient and less bothersome method for using small quantities.

title: Jackson Seeks Education Discipline
description: CHICAGO, May 8 (UPI)Parents must become involved in their children's education if they hope to persuade innercity youths to exchange sex, drugs and alcohol for education and careers, the Rev. Jesse L. Jackson said yesterday. Mr. Jackson, the president of Operation PUSH, opened a drive to obtain the signatures of 100,000 parents in a campaign to get them to instill discipline in the education of ghetto youths.

title: Pentagon Wants to Buy Over 200 Mobile Missiles
description: The Defense Department's planning for the MX mobile missile program includes a development cost of $5.5 billion and the purchase of 200 to 250 missiles at a cost of $100 million each, according to testimony made public by the Senate Armed Services Committee.

title: Norton Wants a Workout And Spars Five Rounds
description: Ken Norton, who is scheduled to face Duane Bobick in a 12round heavyweight bout Wednesday night at Madison Square Garden, held a secret workout yesterday at the Solar Sporting Club.

title: FactoryWage Gap Between City and Nation Widens
description: The gap between wages of New York City factory workers, who are traditionally lower paid, and those of factory workers throughout the country has widened substantially in the last year.

title: Coffee Futures Prices Level After Long Rise
description: The heat was finally gone out of the coffee market. For the last four weeks, prices of green (unroasted) beans deliverable this month have dropped by 64 cents a pound. Last week alone the drop was 22 cents.

title: New York's County Clerk, a Regular Democrat Who Likes His Job, Says He Has Many Friends
description: Norman Goodman is a satisfied man.

title: Advertising
description: U.S. Pioneer Electronics, a leader in hifi, is taking its audio message to video this month.

title: Soviet Press Depicts Meeting as IllFated
description: MOSCOW, May 8 (Reuters)The Soviet press has depicted the London economic summit conference as an illstarred attempt by the capitalist powers to extricate themselves from a deepening crisis.

title: 500 New York Welfare Recipients Found on Rolls in North Jersey
description: Nearly 500 New York City welfare recipients and families may also be collecting welfare grants in North Jersey, according to Richard V. Horan, New York State's Welfare Inspector General.

title: Foreman Says He's Quitting
description: HOUSTON, May 8 (AP)George Foreman says he has decided to quit boxing because of religious beliefs. He said the love of his mother also played a part in his decision.

title: Turning Off Filibusters
description: For nearly a century after the Civil War, the Senate was the South's chosen battleground for repelling civil rights legislation, and the filibuster was its preferred weapon. But since Lyndon Johnson demonstrated that civil rights bills could be enacted into law, the filibuster has lost its regional and racist overtones. It survives as a weapon that any determined minority can use either to frustrate the majority completely or to extract concessions.

title: Big Board Sends Out Merger Questionnaire
description: In preparation for the proposed merger of the New York Stock Exchange and the American Stock Exchange, questionaires went out Friday to the chief executives of all companies listed on the Big Board, it said yesterday.

title: 76ers' Reserves Pace 2d Victory Over Rockets
description: PHILADELPHIA, May SSteve Mix, Lloyd Free and Darryl Dawkins are the Philadelphia 76ers' trouble shooters. They are specialists in defense, instant offense, rebounding and muscle. The 76ers needed all those talents in the second and fourth quarters today and they used them well in a 10697 victory over the Houston Rockets at the Spectrum.

title: Meadowlands
description: Horses listed in order of post positions

title: Reality in Romance
description: BOSTON, May 8Sunday night without Upstairs, Downstairs: Thousands of Americans must be having withdrawal symptoms. Or so it seems from the way the audience responded a week ago to the last scene at 165 Eaton Place. During a twohour fundraising show afterward, people across the country telephoned their local stations to pledge the astonishing total of $1,735,000 to public television.

title: 44DAY TRANSIT STRIKE IS ENDED IN PHILADELPHIA
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 8 (AP)Public transportation in the nation's fourth largest city began returning to normal today after transit workers ratified a contract to end a 44dayold strike.

title: Backers of the Death Penalty Are Making Scant Progress
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 8Legislacion to restore the death penalty, despite its current popularity in American public opinion polls, has not been sweeping to victories in all the state legislatures debating the issue.

title: O'NEILL DEFENDS CARTER FROM M'GOVERN CRITICISM
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP)Defending President Carter from criticism within his own party, House Speaker Thomas P. O'Neill Jr. said today that it was unfair to judge the President's performance on the basis of his first 100 days in office.

title: Carpenters to Return to Work
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 8 (UPI)About 4,000 carpenters are to return to their jobs tomorrow after a oneweek strike while retification of a new tentative agreement goes on. Ratification of the new pact, reached after nine hours of bargaining Friday, will be conducted by mail. William Cherry, a Federal mediator, said that terms of the agreement would not be released until after ratification.

title: Paul Van Ness Makes Local Piano Debut
description: Paul Van Ness's piano recital late Saturday afternoon at Carnegie Recital Hallhis New York debutwas one of those occasions in which a lot was all right but not much was really wonderful.

title: Lawyer Held in Attempt On Life of Rep. Rogers
description: WEST PALM BEACH. Fla., May 8 (AP) An unemployed lawyer, already being held in $100,000 bond on state charges of attempting to kill United States Representative Paul G. Rogers, was ordered held today under $250,000 bond on Federal charges filed in the case.

title: EAST AFRICAN COLONY VOTES INDEPENDENCE
description: PARIS, May 8The people of the Territory of Afars and Issas voted for independence today after 115 years of French rule over their barren but strategically placed East African country.

title: Tax Process Altered
description: New York City's Acting Finance Commissioner, Harry S. Tishelman, said he expected to save $600,000 during the next fiscal year by using only one bank to process realestate tax returns.

title: Miss Stacy Victor by Stroke
description: ROSWELL, Ga., May 8 (AP)Hollis Stacy carded birdies on three of the last four holes today and overcame JoAnne Carner to capture the $50,000 Lady Tara golf tournament with a finalround, threeunderpar 70. It was the first victory for the 23yearold in her four years on the Ladies Professional Golf Association tour.

title: Giscard Decries Ban On Concorde Flights
description: LONDON, May 8 (UPI)President Valry Giscard d'Estaing of France said today that unless the BritishFrench Concorde airliner was permitted to land in New York, France would draw some conclusions about the real will of the United States to remove barriers to world trade.

title: CHRISTOPHER HOLLIS, 75; BRITISH WRITER AND M.P.
description: LONDON, May 8 (Reuters)Christopher Hollis. a British writer and politician, has died at the age of 75,friends said today.

title: Racing Driver Is Killed
description: ROSSBURG, Ohio. May 8 (AP)A 28yearold driver was killed in a sevencar crash on the first lap of a race at Eldora Speedway today. He was David West of Custar.

title: SUMMIT PARLEY ENDS
description: LONDON, May 8The leaders of seven industrial nations concluded their economic summit meeting tonight with a strong pledge to cooperate on a series of measures to combat unemployment and the economic crisis caused by their collective trade deficit to the major oilproducing nations.

title: Roy Jenkins, Snubbed at Conference, May Still Have Gained Stature
description: LONDON, May 8Roy Jenkins, the man who personifies Europe's hopes of unity and independence from the United States, was for a time treated as a secondclass citizen by the Europeans during the economic conference here.

title: Lucille Field, Soprano, Offers Pleasant Program
description: Lucille Field's program of songs in Carnegie Recital Hall Saturday afternoon was a pleasant, friendly affair even if the soprano was unnecessarily limiting in her choice of material. Slow, reflective German lieder predominated, although Miss Field, a professor of music at Brooklyn College, proved herself capable of more vocal flamboyance on the few occasions when that was demanded.

title: Dichter Plays 4 Big Works
description: Misha Dichter played an important program Saturday night at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. and one that was in several respects well calculated to draw out many of his best qualities as a pianist. There were four big works in all, two by Schumann (the C major Fantasy and Faschingsschwank aus Wien), the Beethoven Moonlight Sonata and Prokofiev's Sonata No. 7.

title: Palestinian Accuses U.S.
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 8On the eve of the talks between President Hafez alAssad and President Carter, a Palestinian guerrilla leader connected with Damascus has accused the United States of seeking to overthrow King Hussein and set up a Palestinian state in Jordan.

title: New Corporate Bonds
description: (For week ended May 6, 1977)

title: Canadiens' Stars Upstaged. In 73 Drubbing of Bruins
description: MONTREAL, May 8Everything was back to normal today in the National Hockey League. The Montreal Canadiens, the defending champions, who may have lost a measure of greatness in losing twice in six games against the New York Islanders last week, regained some of their superlatives last night by trouncing the Boston Bruins, 73, in the first game of the Stanley Cup championship.

title: U.S. Is Studying Possible Frauds In Drought Funds for Livestock
description: WASHINGTON, May 8  Government agents are investigating possible fraud and abuses that may have cost up to $20 million of the funds spent in the past year for emergency aid to livestock producers in droughtstricken states, according to sources familiar with the inquiry.

title: 10,000 at Festival Brighten the Day for 4,000 Retarded
description: EDISON, May 8  More than 10,000 volunteers, many from high schools and colleges throughout the state, gave up their free time yesterday to create an experience for 4,000 retarded children and adults  one they will long remember.

title: Stanley Cup Final
description: Boston vs. Montreal

title: Barnum Announces A Deal With J.W.T.
description: Dr. H. James Barnum Jr.who was sued by the J. Walter Thompson Company, sued the J. Walter Thompson Company and settled out of court with the J. Walter Thompson Companyhas now, on an altogether different matter, come to an agreement in principal to acquire a subsidiary of the J. Walter Thompson Company, Synapse.

title: Doing Business With China
description: The resumption of ChineseAmerican negotiations to settle financial claims is a vital step toward normal trade relations and part of a broader effort by the new Peking leadership to revive exchanges with the outside world. The talks provide a chance to advance the relationship despite the differences over Taiwan that block political normalization a euphemism for the exchange of embassies and full diplomatic recognition.

title: BOLDER SOVIET STYLE IS NOTED IN A REPORT
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (UPI)A report prepared for Congress says the Soviet Union and its allies have extended their influence through Angolan societyfrom the military to fishing fleetsand that Russian aggressiveness there may indicate a new, more belligerent Soviet approach to the third world.

title: Bus Stops Limited
description: The New York City Transit Authority will start a limited stop bus service today on the M10 route in Manhattan, which begins at Eighth Avenue and 159th Street and follows Eighth Avenue, Central Park West and Seventh Avenue to Park Place. It will operate southbound between 6:40 A.M. and 8:30 A.M. and, northbound, 4 P.M. to 5:20 P.M., Monday through Friday. Fliers listing the stops are to be distributed to passengers.

title: Carter's Act Plays Well in London
description: LONDON, May 8President Carter, the newest and apparently the hottest political talent attending the London economic summit talks, had several vivid reminders today of the transitory nature of power, if not of fame, and of the mortality of rulers.

title: Katharine Works Johnson, 86; Headed Miss Porter's School
description: Katharine Works Johnson, who with her husband, Ward L. Johnson, was coprincipal of Miss Porter's School in Farmington, Conn., from 1943 to 1954, died last Monday at a nursing home in Rockledge, Fla. She was 86 years old and lived in Cocoa Beach, Fla.

title: MICHIGANDERS WARY OF NAVY RADIO CENTER
description: MARQUETTE, Mich., May 8A White House aide has reaffirmed President Carter's campaign promise not to impose a Navy communications center on Michigan's Upper Peninsula against the will of the people.

title: Boxing Booms in the Gyms, While Outside, a Scandal Threatens Knockout Blow
description: Outside they're talking about the scandal, about kickbacks and falsified records and the possibility of fixed fights. Names like King and Flood and Braverman are coming up in conversations, unpleasant conversations. Outside they're talking as if this could be a big one, maybe the big one.

title: Laderman Works Initiate Series By Long Island Chamber Group
description: The Long Island Chamber Ensemble Initiated its new series at Storyville yesterday afternoon with a concert featuring Ezra Laderman as composer, conductor and commentator. Storyville, of course, has long been a noted gathering place for jazz aficionados, but the club's woodpaneled decor and friendly intimacy create an ideal atmosphere for classical chamber music as well.

title: TV: Shaky Testimony of 2 Men
description: Testimony of Two Men arrived draped in that most admirable intention of providing a quality alternative to the embarrassment of mediocrities being churned out by the commercial networks. The sixhour miniseries. produced by M.C.A. Universal and the various stations involved in the project, represents the first effort of Operation Prime Time.

title: Lynn Rubenstein, Librarian, Married to Seth G. Abraham
description: Lynn Caren Rubenstein, associate librarian at the New York law firm of Simpson, Thacher & Bartlett, was married yesterday afternoon to Seth G. Abraham, assistant to the president of the Major League Baseball Promotion Corporation. Rabbi Jehiel Orenstein performed the ceremony in South Orange, N.J., at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Mayer A. Rubenstein, parents of the bride.

title: Why Limes Are a Bit Dear
description: Forty cents apiece for limes in New York? That doesn't sound at high to me, said Charles Walker, the executive vice president of the Florida Lime and Avocado Administrative Committees, when he was asked about the current high price of this emerald green citrus fruit.

title: Jackson State '70 Class Finally Has Graduation
description: JACKSON, Miss., May 8 (AP)Jackson State University's class of 1970 finally got to don graduation caps and gowns today, seven years after a volley of gunfire from law enforcement officers killed two young men and forced cancellation of the commencement.

title: DEFENSE CHIEF TELLS INTELLIGENCE GROUPS TO STAY WITHIN LAW
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Secretary of Defense Harold Brown has told the members of the various military intelligence agencies that their operations should be conducted strictly within the law and that he expects them to report without hesitation any abuses, improprieties or illegalities that occur.

title: On Cartesian Ethics
description: WASHINGTONWith great fanfare, President Carter has announced his proposal for The Ethics in Government Act of 1977, its purpose to remove any possibility of hidden conflict of interest.

title: Tornado Hits California Coast
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., May 8 (UPI)A tornado swirling out of a Pacific storm roared inland near the Sports Arena today and tore up trees, downed power lines and damaged building, including a convalescent hospital, along a path of more than three miles. On person reported minor injuries. More than 50 patients at the Crestwood Convalescent Hospital were evacuated when part of the roof was ripped off, but none were hurt.

title: Aid for Battered Children Is Inadequate, Doctors Say
description: CHICAGO, May 8 (UPI)  Concern over child abuse has increased greatly in the last decade, but services to help battered children have not kept pace with legislation designed to protect them, two doctors reported today.

title: T. BROOKE PRICE, 86; HELD A.T.& T. EXECUTIVE POST
description: T. Brooke Price, vice president and general counsel for the American Telephone and Telegraph Company from 1951 until his retirement in 1955, died Saturday at a Morristown, N. J., hospital after a long illness. He was 86 years old and lived at 33 Ogden Place in Morristown.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article in The Times on April 29, reference was made to a foundation established by John M. Olin. That organization has no connection with the Olin Foundation Inc. of New York, which makes grants to private colleges and universities for the construction of academic buildings.

title: Store Owner's Son Shot in Inwood; Marine Held After 60Block Chase
description: The 24yearold son of a supermarket owner was shot and critically wounded last night by one of two gunmen who threatened his father while attempting to hold up their store in the Inwood section of Manhattan.

title: 400 Injured in Clash At New Tokyo Airport
description: NARITA, Japan. May 8 (Reuters)At least 400 people were reported injured today when thousands of demonstrators trying to prevent the opening of the new Tokyo airport here fought with an equal number of riot policemen.

title: Nieminski Wins 3 Events, Leads Met. Decathlon
description: Mike Nieminski of St. John's, a sophomore from Hicksville, L. I., won three of the first five events yesterday in the decathlon competition of the Metropolitan Intercollegiate track and field championships at St. John's University in Jamaica, Queens.

title: A. Sidney DeW. Herreshoff Dies;Naval Architect in Rhode Island
description: A. Sidney DeW. Herreshoff, chief naval architect at the Herreshoff Manufacturing Company, designers and builders of America's Cup defenders and many other yachts, died Saturday at his winter home in Coconut Grove, Fla. He lived there and in Bristol, R.I., where the concern, founded by an uncle, was situated.

title: Supplementary OverCounter Listings
description: Week ended May 6, 1977

title: N. B. A. Playoffs
description: SEMIFINAL ROUND

title: Unsinkable Village Preserver Is Honored
description: I'm a kind of landmark myself, Ruth Wittenberg commented last week, in a spirit of candor oddly incongruous with the Dutchbob style in which she wears her jetblack hair at the age of 79.

title: Nearby Dog Show
description: TOY (E. W. Tip??, Jr., judge)??, Marie E. O'Nell's and Florence T. Sgrigruali's Toy Manchester terrier, Ch., Charmaren's Ched?? of To?? 2. Mr. and Mrs. William Kier??manns mi?? pinscher, Ch., Ariston's Royal Renue; 3, Morris E. Howare's and ?? ?? Robinson Jr.?? Yorkshare terrier, Ch. Trivar's Suds Sipper; 4, ?? W?? Bruss is griffon, Ch., Bartestree Quicksand Pony.

title: Newark Project Seeks to Smooth the Road to Reading
description: NEWARKProject ReadWrite, an unusual pilot program for children with severe reading difficulties is under way at, the Hawkins Street Elementary School.

title: Backers of the Death Penalty Are Making Scant Progress
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 8Legislacion to restore the death penalty, despite its current popularity in American public opinion polls, has not been sweeping to victories in all the state legislatures debating the issue.

title: Neil Simon's New Play Is Sold As Film Even Before It Opens
description: HOLLYWOOD, May 8Chapter Two, Neil Simon's 17th play, will not reach Broadway until Dec. 1, but it has already been purchased by Columbia Pictures in association with Rastar Productions, it was announced by Daniel Melnick, in charge of worldwide production for Columbia.

title: Liquori Takes 1,500 Race
description: TOKYO, May 8 (Reuters)  Marty Liquori of the United States won the 1,500meter race at an international track and field meet today with a time of 3 minutes 40.7 seconds.

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, MAY 9, 1977

title: Seattle Slew Hasn't Convinced 'Em All
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 8Unbeaten Seattle Slew went home to New York with the roses from the Kentucky Derby today, possibly wondering what he has to do to impress his critics.

title: Armed Mohawks in Upstate Camp Asking Suitable Land of Their Own
description: EAGLE BAY, N.Y.Two miles up Big Moose Road from this central Adirondack Mountain resort community, a wooden sign among the tall pine trees proclaims Ganienkeh, a Mohawk Indian word for Land of the Flint.

title: Preventing Economic Chaos
description: LONDON, May 8The summit meeting of the world's major nonCommunist industrial nations has brought another step in what all have come to recognize as the necessary reorganization of the world's economic system. Slowly, painfully, the leading economic powers have begun a stagebystage effort to reconstruct what they concede is the shattered format of a generation of prosperity that had no precedent in history. Again and again, the government leaders recalled the 1930's and the economic warfare provoked by the Depression, conflict that not only worsened that Depression's effect for all countries but also brought the social and political upheavals that led to World War II.

title: Muriel B. Rush Is Bride of Douglas B. Gillespie
description: Muriel Bishop Rush, daughter of Col. Benjamin Rush 3d, U.S.A., retired, of Alexandria. Va., and the late Louise Cassard Rush, was married yesterday to Douglas Brown Gillespie, son of Mr. and Mrs. Gardner F. Gillespie Jr. of Rye, N.Y.

title: Hemphill Audiodrama Digs Into Minstrelsy
description: Julius Hemphill, the saxophonist and Composer, performed Roi Boy and the Gotham Minstrels, an original, oneman audiodrama at the Tin Palace on Sunday. He was costumed in a bright silver minstrel's suit and he improvised on saxophones and flute accompanied by a prerecorded tape.

title: Deaths
description: AUSKERNSimon, beloved husband of Ethel, devoted father of Mimi and Jerry Ross and Sylvia Auskern, dear brother of Minnie Koszyn, LII Kalmer, Samuel and Ted Auskern, adored grandfather. Services Monday, 1:45 P.M. at Gutterman's Parkside Building, 2576 Flatbush Ave., nr. Ave. V, Brooklyn.

title: Ambushed Argentine Aide Is Partly Paralyzed
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 8 (Reuters)Argentina's Foreign Minister, Adm. Csar Guzzetti, today ??ay partly paralyzed in a hospital after being bludgeoned and shot in the head by guerrillas who lay in ambush for him at a private clinic.

title: LEGISLATURE SEEKING CHANGE IN INSURANCE
description: ALBANY, May 8The New York State Legislature is intent on changing the state's nofault automobile insurance system this sessionbut so far has found itself unable to figure out just how.

title: Volleyball Title to U.S.C.
description: LOS ANGELES, May 8 (UPI)Southern California beat Ohio State, 157, 915, 1510, 1512, last night and captured the National Collegiate volleyball championship at Pauley Pavilion. Pepperdine defeated Rutgers, 158, 156, for third place,

title: Inquiries Center on Tournament
description: The current boxing scandal centers on the United States Boxing Championships, a tournament promoted by Don King, the flamboyant exconvict and exnumbers racketeer who had become the sports biggest promoter. His tournament, financed by ABCTV, was suspended by the network after it found that boxers' records had been falsified.

title: ABC Had Best Gain In Network Profit, Rising 186% in 1976
description: Although the ABC television network dominated the primetime ratings consistently during 1976, the network that reaped the greatest revenues and profits for the year was CBSTV.

title: Concert: Rock
description: Little Feat, a sixman band from Los Angeles, has built up a loyal cult following over the last few years, primarily on the strength of a series of original, conceise, wellcrafted albums. Several of the musicians in the groupLowell George, the guitarist, and Bill Payne, the pianist, in particularoften contribute songs and performances to the albums of their friends, and as a whole Little Feat enjoys an exalted reputation among professional rock musicians.

title: Vote Called Nearly Unanimous
description: DJIBOUTI, Territory of Afars and Issas, May 8 (Reuters)  More than 99.5 percent of the voters who took part in yesterday's referendum on the issue supported independence, according to partia official results. The full results were expected to be announced later today. The new nation will be known as the Republic of Djibouti.

title: U.S. OFFICIAL SCORES BEAME'S '78 BUDGET
description: LANCASTER, Pa., May 8The Carter Administration's chief representative to New York City said yesterday that Mayor Beame's budget for the next fiscal year was not balanced in a true accounting or financial sense and that the city would probably have to show how it would handle its projected future deficits before it could receive an extension of Federal loan assistance after 1978.

title: Ivan Nunez, Pianist, In Thoughtful Recital
description: Ivan Nunez may be something less than a virtuoso pianist, but at its best his poised, thoughtful playing Saturday night at Alice Tully Hall brought richer rewards than many a flashier recital.

title: NO SMOKING GUN YET IN TRIAL OF 2 NURSES
description: DETROIT, May 8The prosecution said in opening arguments that there would be no smoking gun put in the defendants' hands and no witnesses saying, I saw them do it

title: Squash Tennis to Bacallao
description: Pedro Bacallao of the Princeton Club won the national squash tennis championship for the ninth consecutive year yesterday, defeating Dave Stafford of the Yale Club, 159, 1510, 1512, in the final at the Yale Club.

title: WILLIAM S. NOEL
description: William S. Noel, vice president for industrial relations of the Rheem Manufacturing Company, makers of airconditioning equipment, water heaters and shipping containers, died Friday at Overlook Hospital in Summit, N. J., after a long illness. He was 56 years old and lived at 11 Rotary Lane in Summit.

title: Music: Stylish Miss Riperton
description: George Benson's fourconcert series that ends tonight has offered something different every time, and on Saturday night at the Palladium the novelty was Minnie Riperton.

title: Racing Car Kills Fan
description: ZAGREB, Yugoslavia, May 8 (UPI)One person was killed and four were injured when an auto competing in the Formula SuperVW auto race today left the track and crashed into a group of spectators. After the accident, the organizers suspended the race, the first of the Formula SuperVW events to be held in Yugoslavia.

title: Tea Dance Welcomed Back by Californians
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Calif., May 8As a 16piece band played a nostalgic ballad, hundreds of welldressed couples danced as smoothly as stylish skaters over the whitetiled lobby floor of the Hyatt Regency Hotel here Friday evening.

title: Four Peregrines to Be Freed
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (UPI)Four young peregrine falcons born in captivity will be freed in a wilderness area near Idaho's Snake River this week in an effort to reestablish the species there, the Interior Department said today. Their numbers were reduced by DDT and there are now only 53 known pair of wild peregrines in this country.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BIENVENU French  speaking New Yorkers are invited tonight to hear some words of wisdom from one of the most illustrious names in the French theater. At 8 o'clock Silvia Monfort will discuss her career and the artistic and practical state of French drama. An informal questioning session and reception will follow, at New York University's La Maison Francaise, 16 Washington Mews.

title: Ulster Protestant Strike Appears Near Collapse
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 8 (AP)A sixdayold general strike by Protestant militants appeared on the verge of collapse today despite terror tactics aimed at bus drivers and power plant workers.

title: Indictments Decided by Bell
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP)Attorney General Bell says he will personally decide whether to seek indictments against more bureau agents for allegedly unauthorized spying on domestic political groups. Mr. Bell made the statement in an interview in U.S. News & World Report, released today.

title: Dance: The Harmony of Contrast
description: Sweet harmony of contrast, as Cavaradossi sings in Tosca. at least when he is using an English translation, and one was reminded of the phrase at the Metropolitan Opera House on Saturday. Not, of course, by the opera, because ballet has taken over the opera house for the summer, but by the two performances of The Sleeping Beauty offered, afternoon and evening, by American Ballet Theater. And the contrast was not so much between the performances themselves as between the reigning ballerinas in each.

title: Club's Tension Builds as Giants Sweep
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 8In China the populace is organized to note preearthquake warnings. Scientists can spot a volcano about to erupt. And even a time bomb ticks.

title: A.D.A. Would Abolish Corporate Income Tax
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (UPI)Americans for Democratic Action called today for abolition of the corporate income tax. A resolution said that all corporate income, whether paid in dividends or not, should be allocated to individual shareholders and these shareholders should pay tax on this income at their own personal income tax rates.

title: YONKERS' FISCAL GOAL THREATENED BY A SUIT
description: YONKERS, May 8The City of Yonkers, which was pulled from the brink of default last year with the help of state supervision of its finances, faces a court test this month on whether the strict supervision will continue for another year or will end on June 30.

title: From the Police Blotter:
description: An apparent dispute over a dice game in front of 66 Rivington Street on the Lower East Side ended in the fatal shooting of a player and the wounding of a passerby. The dead man was identified as Sacarias Rivera, 30 years old, of 230 East 4th Street. Bernaber Adames, 30, of 109 East 105th Street, was admitted to Beth Israel Hospital with an arm wound. The gunman, who was not identified, fled.. After a Brooklyn youth was stabbed to death during a dispute at Prospect Place and Ralph Avenue in the Ocean Hill section, a crowd chased the alleged assailant and beat him into unconsciousness with clubs. When the suspect. Lionel Bennerson, 26, of 180 Troy Avenue in Brooklyn, revived, he went to St. John's Episcopal Hospital for treatment, where he was arrested. The dead youth was identified as Ronald. Odwin, 16, of 18 Avenue V.... A 2l year old prisoner suffered a punctured lung when he was stabbed in the back by an unidentified inmate at the Queensboro Correctional Facility .. at 4704 Van Dam Street in Long Island City. The prisoner, Luis Hernandez; who was awaiting parole after serving a robbery sentence, was admitted 40 City Hospital at Elmhurst in fair condition. The stabbing may have been racially connected.

title: Preventing Economic Chaos
description: LONDON, May 8The summit meeting of the world's major nonCommunist industrial nations has brought another step in what all have come to recognize as the necessary reorganization of the world's economic system. Slowly, painfully, the leading economic powers have begun a stagebystage effort to reconstruct what they concede is the shattered format of a generation of prosperity that had no precedent in history. Again and again, the government leaders recalled the 1930's and the economic warfare provoked by the Depression, conflict that not only worsened that Depression's effect for all countries but also brought the social and political upheavals that led to World War II.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Fair to Help Fix Up Bryant Park Dampened by Rain
description: The City Parks Commissioner, Martin Lang, planted a myrtle bush in Bryant Park yesterday morning, and volunteers from the City University and Daytop Village, a treatment center for narcotics addicts, planted ivy in the park before the rain drove everyone indoors.

title: Putting Our Heads to the Problem of Old Age
description: WAYLAND, Mass.As a roundtable discussion on aging is held at the White House today, under Rosalynn Carter's sponsorship, we might remember that the problem of old age is not new in our society. It has a long history, full of irony and sadness, and also a practical lesson or two. What we do about the problem in the present depends on how we think about its past.

title: Israeli Is Linked to Uranium Ship
description: OSLO, Norway, May 9 (UPI)An Israeli agent told Norwegian officials four years ago that he was involved in selling a West German freighter, carrying enough uranium to build 42 nuclear weapons, to Israel, Norway's former chief prosecutor said today.

title: Slain Widow May Have Been Robbed of $3 Million
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 9The police said today that burglars believed to have killed a wealthy widow who distrusted banks might have escaped with up to $3 million to $4 million in cash.

title: U.S. Warns Of Big Rise In Measles
description: ATLANTA, May 9 (AP)An alarming increase in the incidence of measles nationwide may make it nececeary for school officials to keep children at home unless they get Immunized, the National Center for Disease Control said today.

title: Miami Debate Over Rights of Homosexuals Directs Wide Attention to a National Issue
description: MIAMI, May 9A dispute over rights for homosexuals, building locally for the last several months, is focusing attention on a national issue.

title: Judge Orders F.D.A. To Drop Laetrile Rules
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, May 9 (AP)A Federal district judge ordered today that the Food and Drug Administration retract requirements for importing laetrile, a substance used to treat cancer, which the Government says is worthless.

title: Affiliation Is Unsettled
description: DENVER, May 9 (AP)It is too soon to tell what effect action taken by the National Collegiate Athletic Association will have on plans for two schools to join the Western Athletic Conference, according to Stan Bates, the W.A.C. commissioner.

title: Weekend Boxing
description: Ant verp, Belgium Lucien Rodriguez, France, ?? JeanPierre Coopman, Belgium, 15 rounds, winning the European heavyweight litle; Richard Rodriguez, France, ?? Y??maz Re??, Turkey, weiterweights, 6; Fernand DetRuyter, Belgium, outpointed Horst Leng, West Germany, light heavyweights, 8.

title: New Head of Agency Says It Failed to Fulfill Law
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP)The head of a Federal agency that was supposed to tell consumers which automobiles were most crashworthy said today that the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration had not carried out the assignment with sufficient diligence or enthusiasm.

title: Advertising
description: R. J. Reynolds, the nation's largest cigarette company, yesterday announced its newest brand, Real, which has been the subject of rumor and speculation in the industry for months.

title: About New York
description: The Chinese friends and relatives of Mr. Yee paid their last respects at the moneyburning ceremony and they followed his coffin from Bacigalupo's funeral home onto Mulberry Street where Carmine, the band leader, gave a signal with his trombone and concluded a dirge version of Nearer My God to Thee.

title: People in Sports
description: Muhammad Ali, the world heavyweight champion, and Alfredo Evangelista, his challenger, both passed physical examinations in Landover, Md., yesterday for next Monday night's title fight in Landover. The 35yearold Ali, showing that he was taking his 22yearold opponent seriously, was at 224 pounds for the preliminary weighin, down quite a hit from the 290 he weighed several weeks ago and five and a half pounds lighter than when he fought Jimmy Young a year ago.

title: Ugandan, 14, Is From Honduras
description: A 14yearold boy who spoke broken English and what seemed to he an African dialect, and who had confused immigration authorities and brought Ugandan partisans into the picture by claiming to be a refugee from Uganda, confessed yesterday that he really was a runaway from Honduras. The boy had been found wandering the streets of Manhattan on Friday night, and he convinced the police that he had fled Uganda and reached here as a stowaway.

title: Stock Tables Explained
description: Unless otherwise noted, rates of dividends In the foregoing table are annual disbursements based on the last Quarterly or semiannual declaration. Special or extra dividends or payments not designated as regular are identified in the following footnotes:

title: Masked Men Halt Truck, Steal $225,000 in Silver
description: NEWBURYPORT, Mass., May 9 (AP)Four armed men wearing Halloween masks stole $225,000 worth of silver sheets from a truck that was on its way to a flatware factory, the police said.

title: Miners' Union Moves To Renegotiate Contract
description: MORGANTOWN, W.Va., May 9 (AP)The international executive board of the United Mine Workers of America declared today that the controversial issue of coal company absentee policies had become national in scope and must be renegotiated immediately.

title: Prosecution Witness in southern Firebomb Case Says He Lied at Trial
description: BURGAW, N.C. May 9A key prosecution witness who helped to send the socalled Wilmington 10 civil rights activists to prison for the 1971 firebombing of a Wilmington, N.C., grocery store testified under oath at a postconviction hearing today that his original testimony had been false and derived from extensive coaching by the prosecuting attorney.

title: James Jones, Novelist, 55, Dies; Best Known for Here to Eternity
description: James Jones, the writer whose first novel, From Here to Eternity, made him world famous, died of heart failure last evening in Southampton, L.I., Hospital. He was 55 years old and resided at Sagaponack, L.I.

title: Patricia Hearst, Called No Threat, Given 5 Years' Probation by Judge
description: LOS ANGELES, May 9  A Superior Court judge, disregarding a Probation Department report that Patricia Hearst should be imprisoned, ruled today that she would not have to go to jail for her part in a 1974 robbery and shooting incident here.

title: West Pacific Is a Hunting Ground for Air Force's Typhoon Chasers
description: ANDERSEN AIR FORCE BASE, Guam It begins as a suspicious speck on a photo radioed from a satellite hovering in space.

title: Top Spot In Lacrosse To Hobart
description: Hobart has been seeded No. 1 in Division II of the National Collegiate Athletic Association postseason lacrosse tournament.

title: Warnke Now Says U.S. Also Wants OnSite Inspection in an Arms Pact
description: WASHINGTON, May 9  Paul C. Warnke, director of the Arms Control and Disarmament Agency, disclosed today that the United States' comprehensive strategic arms proposal would require some onsite inspection, a verification measure that has generally been resisted by the Soviet Union.

title: Senate Committee Backs New Department of Energy
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (UPI)The Senate Governmental Affairs Committee approved President Carter's proposed department of energy today but voted to modify the oil and gas pricing powers of the department secretary.

title: Peer Sentencing Found To Reduce Juvenile Crime
description: DEERFIELD, Ill., May 9 (AP)High school juries that sentence juvenile offenders to such punishments as six hours of windowwashing are credited by the police with helping to reduce the incidence of minor thefts and vandalism.

title: AW Shucks Mannerisms of White House Aides Delight Europeans
description: LONDON, May 9The White House press secretary, Jody Powell, who hails from Vienna, Ga., urged journalists the other day to be crisp and succint, for a change, in questioning W. Michael Blumenthal, the Secretary of the Treasury.

title: Notes on People
description: After a dispute 14 years ago, Herbert von Karajan is back conducting the Vienna State Opera for a twoandahalfweek series of performances. The conductor quit the Governmentsubsidized company in 1963, vowing never to return, after stage personnel threatened to strike if he hired an Italian prompter. Over the years, officials worked to patch things up and recently Chancellor Bruno Kreisky and Fred Sinowatz, the Education Minister, coaxed the con ductor into returning to the Opera House. Then, after all was arranged, a former aide to Mr. Sinowatz published an antivon Karajan poem. Mr. von Karajan threatened to cancel, his return to the Vienna house, but Mr. Sinowatz publicly apologized for the poem. And so, on Sunday, some 1,400 people applauded Mr. von Karajan's return.

title: Defiance of Lisbon Bullfight Law Is Hailed
description: LISBON, May 9Three bullfighters who had defied an old Portuguese ban against killing bulls were freed today pending trial, and were hailed by bullfighting fans as national heroes.

title: One Week Before Israel's Election A Central Issue Has Yet to Arise
description: JERUSALEM, May 9With only a week to go before Parliamentary elections are held, the campaign has yet to produce an overriding central issue. However, there has been a fierce drive for votes by a total of 22 political groups.

title: ARMY IN BELFAST FOILS ATTEMPT TO BLOCK ROADS
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 9 (Reuters)  Cavalcades of tractors blocked the centers of rural towns in Northern Ireland today and tried to do the same in Belfast in fresh attempts to enforce demands for a general strike, demands that most workers have ignored.

title: FERDINAND E. RULE
description: WASHINGTON, May 9Ferdinand E. Ruge, a teacher of English at St. Albans school for boys here since 1933, died yesterday of a heart attack at Doctors Hospital. He was 76 years old.

title: Reds 11 Games Back After 10thInning Loss
description: A week ago Manager Sparky Anderson of the Cincinnati Reds noted that his twotime World Series champions trailed the sizzling Los Angeles Dodgers by seven and a half games in the National League's Western Division race.

title: Proposals to Strengthen NATO Focus of Meeting
description: LONDON, May 9President Carter and the foreign ministers of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, meeting here tomorrow, will discuss the serious military problems that, combined with longstanding internal political disputes, present a picture of an alliance in disarray.

title: Bell Urged to Move Against F.B.I. Aide
description: Attorney General Griffin B. Bell has been advised by key aides to have the Justice Department seek a criminal indictment for perjury against J. Wallace LaPrade, head of the Federal Bureau of Investigation's New York regional office, according to department sources.

title: N.A.S.L. Standing
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME San Jose 2, Vancouver 1.

title: Hong Kong Begins Commodity Trading In Cotton Futures
description: HONG KONG, May 9With more than 100 visitors looking on, a trader for Shearson Hayden Stone Far East Investment Ltd. made the first trade today on the Hong Kong Commodity Exchange, the world's newest commodity market.The trader purchased 10 lots (25,000 pounds per lot) of raw cotton for October delivery from Jardine, Gill & Duffus H.K. Ltd. at 7,600a price equivalent to 76 American cents a pound.

title: Summit Parley: Limited Accord
description: LONDON, May 9President Carter and the leaders of the six other major industrialized democracies wound up their weekend economic conference here agreeing on one basic point: to keep talking about the problems that still divide them. They noted that the economic ills their countries were facing were more difficult to deal with than they once had imagined and acknowledged that their ability to cope with them cooperatively was starting to fray.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Books of The Times
description: I'll have to begin by admitting that the only stockmarket guides I ever read before picking up these two books was Nicholas Darvas's How I Made $2,000,000 in the Stock Market. This you may recall, was a best seller in the early 1960's by a professional dancer who said he had invested his way to riches in the 1950's, although on the subject of taxes he never said a mumbling word. His simple technique had been to watch the actively traded stocks until he spotted one breaking upward out of its previous pattern, and then to buy into it and trail it up with an automatic sell order, called a stoploss. in case it should turn down again.

title: Market Off by 3.65 Over Worries Interest Rates Will Continue Rise
description: The stock market ap??rently c?? that interest rates would continue to rise, fell moder??tely yesterday in the ?? trading in almost six months.

title: RARE STAMPS STOLEN FROM PUBLIC LIBRARY
description: Rare United States stamps with an estimated value of $150,000 to $200,000 were stolen from the Public Library on Fifth Avenue at 42d Street over the weekend. One of the stolen stamps was an inverted Jenny, a 1918 24cent airmail valued at $45,000.

title: Calliope Singers Try the Unusual
description: There were two unusual cantatas in Sunday night's concert by the New Calliope Singers at Carnegie Recital Hallone by Schubert about the Israelites crossing the Red Sea and one by Maurice Wright about a fat man who falls in love.

title: JEWELER WHO SLEW BANDIT IN 1973 KILLED IN HOLDUP
description: A 67yearold Queens jeweler who shot and killed a gunman who tried to rob him in 1973, died in a gun battle with three holdup men yesterday.

title: Who's No 1? Canadiens And Bruins Have Answer
description: MONTREAL, May 9There must be some misunderstanding. Nearly everybody at the National Hockey League championship series here was talking about Czechoslovakia winning the world championship in hockey.

title: City's Retail Sales Showing Strength Against the Area
description: Although this year's earlier Easter kept New York City retail sales in April barely ahead of last year, the average sales gain among six of the city's biggest department stores for the third consecutive month exceded that of stores in the metropolitan area.

title: Queens School Panel Bars Test, Citing Availability
description: A Queens school board last night ordered that the citywide reading test not be given to its 20,000 elementary and junior high school students today because it is readily available to the public.

title: Thomas E. Mullaney
description: The specter of highlevel inflation, which has haunted the American economy almost continuously for more than a decade, has grown so ominous in recent months that some analysts are wondering whether the horrendous conditions of the 197273 pcriod, and their consequences, are about to return.

title: Huge Lobbying and Legal Drive Being Pressed for the Concorde
description: A massive lobbying, legal and public relations effort by French and British interests, costing an estimated $4 million and aimed at winning approval of landings by the supersonic Concorde aircraft in the United States, is entering its climactic stage.

title: French Hospital Closing on Friday After 96 Years
description: Confronted with $20 million in debts and mired in bankruptcy proceedings the French and Polyclinic Medical School and Health Center plans to close on Friday after nearly a century on Manhattan's West Side.

title: Theater: Cacciatore Is Spiced by Human Drama
description: Joseph Pintauro, whose three oneact plays under the collective title Cacciatore are being presented Friday. Saturday and Sunday evenings at the Actors Repertory Theater through May 22, has two considerable strengths: an ability to write pungent, idiomatic, urban speech, and a willingness to let human passions overflow on the stage.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: Horses listed in order of post positionas Letter cesigrates OTB ??ist??ng

title: Bell Urged to Move Against F.B.I. Aide
description: Attorney General Griffin B. Bell has been advised by key aides to have the Justice Department seek a criminal indictment for perjury against J. Wallace LaPrade, head of the Federal Bureau of Investigation's New York regional office, according to department sources.

title: Lindsay Against Beame Running
description: Former Mayor John V. Lindsay said yesterday that he does not believe Mayor Beame is qualified to be Mayor and should not run again.

title: Rumanian Dissident Free Under Amnesty Decree
description: BUCHAREST, Rumania, May 9 (UPI)Rumania celebrated the 100th anniversary of its independence today with an amnesty decree affecting thousands of convicts, including Paul Goma, a dissident writer.

title: Summit Parley: Limited Accord
description: LONDON, May 9President Carter and the leaders of the six other major industrialized democracies wound up their weekend economic conference here agreeing on one basic point: to keep talking about the problems that still divide them. They noted that the economic ills their countries were facing were more difficult to deal with than they once had imagined and acknowledged that their ability to cope with them cooperatively was starting to fray.

title: Cast of Happy End Seeks One With Aid Of a Shot in the Arm
description: Today at 1 P.M., the 40member cast and crew of Happy End. the Chelsea Theater Center's production of the BrechtWeill musical, which moved to Broadway's Martin Beck Theater from Brooklyn last Saturday afternoon, will get preventive gamma globulin injections before resuming performances tonight. And thereby hangs a tale of measles, rocky bumps and of hopes for a happy ending.

title: Carter InflationTied Price Guides Called Factor in U.S. Steel's Move
description: WASHINGTON, May 9The Carter Administration strongly urged the United States Steel Corporation last week not to let any new price increases exceed the 6 percent basic rate of inflation, Administration sources said today.

title: Bridge:
description: Peter Weichsel and Alan Sontag of New York City won the third annual Cavendish Club Invitational Tournament, which concluded here early yesterday morning. The pair, generally ranked as one of the world's best, won for the second year in a row, holding the lead from the second of the four sessions.

title: Yields on Treasury Bills Rise
description: Yields rose on Treasury bills in the weekly auction yesterday in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: Canada Urged to Bar Gas Pipeline From Alaska Across North Yukon
description: OTTAWA, May 9A report commissioned by the Canadian Government recommended today a ban on any gas pipeline from Alaska across the northern Yukon and urged that no natural gas pipeline be built through the Mackenzie Valley of the Northwest Territories for at least 10 years.

title: Leaders in Albany Supporting Bill To Tighten Controls on Lobbyists
description: ALBANY, May 9A bill that would tighten state control over political lobbyists and allow greater public scrutiny of their activities has been agreed to by the staffs of the leadership of the Legislature. Passage of the measure, the first revision of New York State's lobbying law since it was adopted 71 years ago, is considered likely.

title: CARTER ASKS TAX RISES, FUNDING SHIFT TO EASE SOCIAL SECURITY DRAIN
description: WASHINGTON. May 9  President Carter proposed to Congress today that it eliminate the growing deficits in the Social Security System by enacting a big payroll tax increase for employers, a small rise for workers and an experimental diversion of general tax revenues to the Social Security System.

title: Boston Ballet Promenades de Mille
description: BOSTONThe Boston Ballet has just ended its year's season at the Music Hall with what it has called an Agnes de Mille Festival. In fact, only four works were given; on the other hand, this brief season did indeed celebrate and demonstrate the long and happy relationship between the choreographer and the artistic director of the Boston Ballet, E. Virginia Williams. The program also served to show the fine performing fettle that the company is In at present.

title: LI. DOCTOR ACCUSES 2 IN MALPRACTICE SUIT
description: PORT JEFFERSON, L.I., May 9A loca gynecologist here has shocked member of his profession in this North Shore vi lage by bringing a $2.75 million medica malpractice suit against two hospital co leagues who delivered his wife eigh years ago and treated his braindamage daughter.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, MAY 10, 1977

title: Major League Scores
description: EStein, Meyer. DPSeattle 2, Toronto 1. LOBSeattle 8, Toronto 7 28GWoods. HRBernhardt (5), Aust (6). SM??bourne, PGarcla. SFBailor.

title: OnceSecret F.B.I. Manual Tells Agents How to Handle Offenses
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP)  The Federal Bureau of Investigation does not want its agents to be prudish on pornography investigations.

title: The Casts
description: CACCIATORE, torce o?? plays by Joseph Pintauro Directed of Warren Ro??tson Barnet Kailman and Peter Ficoo; settings by Robert Franklin; lighting by Marcia Madeira: production stage manager, Paul Sarnoff. Presented by the Actors Repertory Theater Inc., Warren Robertson artistic director; Earl Fries producer. At 1220 Broadway.

title: Carter, at Meeting With Syrian, Calls for Palestinian Homeland
description: GENEVA, May 9President Carter met here today with President Hafez alAssad of Syria to discuss the Middle East conflict, and said at a meeting with reporters that there must be a resolution of the Palestine problem and a homeland for the Palestinians.

title: LangfordRice Team Wins
description: OCEANSIDE, L. I., May 9John Langford and Jack Rice of Inwood shot a best ball 35. 3267 and won the proassistant championship of the Metropolitan Professional Golfers' Association today at the Middle Bay Country Club. Three pairs tied for second with 68's: Bill Greenleaf and Todd Heyda of Briar Hall. Craig Shankland and Brian Bowne of Fairview, and Mike Ballo and Nick Manolios of Woodway.

title: New Pilot at the Controls
description: President Carter has pledged to do away with regulation that inhibits competition among airlines and is supporting legislation to that end. But the proposed changes in the legal mandate of the Civil Aeronautics Board, the independent Federal agency that controls fares and assigns air routes, will not assure success. Equally important will be the commitment to reform of board members and their skill at smoothing the transition to airline competition.

title: Carey Vows to Fight Party Chiefs But Not the People Over Cuomo
description: ALBANY, May 9Governor Carey today declared that he would fight. his own party leadership if it tried to block Mario M. Cuomo from becoming the next Mayor of New York.

title: People and Business; ExSenator Buckley Joins Firm Of Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette
description: James L. Buckley, former RepublicanConservative Senator from New York, has joined the Wall Street brokerage firm of Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette Inc., becoming a member of the executive committee and of its board of directors. Before his election to the Senate in 1970, Mr. Buckley was for 17 years vice president and director of the Catawba Corporation, which provided administrative and financial services to a group of companies exploring for and producing gas and oil, primarily outside the United States.

title: Assembly Votes $4 Billion Budget As G.O.P. Attempt to Cut It Fails
description: TRENTON, May 9The Assembly gave final legislative approval today to a record New Jersey budget of $4 billion for fiscal 1978, which begins July 1.

title: Deaths
description: BALSAMDod, of Miami Beach, on May 2, 1977. Loving mother of Ruby Rothenberg; motherinlaw, granomother and greatgrandmother. Interment took place on 5/4/77 at Mt. Ararat Cemetery.

title: Iowans Fear Big Corn Crop Will Cut Price
description: SLIFER, Iowa, May 8The rain was light and scattered by a chilly south wind last week as Garland Hanson stood at the corner of a field, watching his son, David, hurry a huge diesel tractor over the ground as he tried to finish planting soybeans before the soil got too wet.

title: Giscard, After Private Meeting, Praises Carter in TV Interview
description: PARIS, May 9President Valry Giscard d'Estaing of France, who had his first private meeting with President Carter over breakfast this morning in London, praised Mr. Carter tonight in a television interview here.

title: Olivia NewtonJohn Conveys Her Niceness
description: All performers are fantasy objects for their fans, but why America's apparent need for a female pop singer who blends images of the crinolined, antebellum South with the buoyancy of a modernday Texas cheerleader should be fulfilled by somebody from England by way of Australia remains one of life's minor mysteries.

title: Dollar Mostly Up; Gold Price Is Down
description: LONDON, May 9 (AP)The United States dollar was generally firmer against West European currencies and the price of gold declind by over a dollar an ounce on European markets today.

title: PEAT, MARWICK'S RECORD CLEARED BY AUDIT UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, May 9A special re view committee appointed to investigate the auditing practices of Peat, Marwick, Mitchell & Company has uncovered a significant number of instances of noncompliance with the firm's policies and procedures but has nevertheless concluded that its overall performance was satisfactory.

title: Events Today
description: Film

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Except for particularly sensitive cases where there is a need for secrecy, New Jersey would abandon the traditional requirement for grand jury indictments in criminal cases under recommendations announced yesterday by a committee of the State Bar Association. Protection of the rights of defendants from unwarranted prosecutionthe basic function of the grand jury derived from English common lawwould be taken over by judges holding hearings in open court. The change would require an amendment to the State Constitution.

title: On Watch in the White House Basement for Armageddon
description: WASHINGTON, May 9The scream knifed through the perpetual murmur of the White House basement. Thinking back Dennis L. Chapman remembers it as blood curdling.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Eastman Kodak Company, which has reported a 20 percent drop in firstquarter earnings this year, yesterday announced that it would begin offering customers and dealers rebates on its instant cameras and film.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: THE WOMEN The founding mothers of the formative, colonial years are saluted in a new exhibition, running today through June 15, titled Remember the Ladies . . . Women in America, 17501815, at the NewYork Historical Society, 170 Central Park West. The display is completing a nationwide tour begun last June as part of the Bicentennial celebration.

title: JUDGE IN C.I.A. TRIAL USING ADVISORY JURY
description: The first trial charging the Central Intelligence Agency with invading the privacy of citizens by secretly opening their mail began yesterday in Federal District Court in Brooklyn with Judge Jack B. Weinstein adopting a rare procedure of using an advisory jury.

title: Philomusica Shows Brilliance
description: The peripatetic Philomusica chamber ensemble, which has been giving a series of concerts in the city's five boroughs this spring, settled into the Mitzi E. Newhouse Theater in Lincoln Center Sunday night for its final Manhattan program of the season.

title: The Standings
description: Tuesday, May 10, 1977

title: BEN F. MILLER SR.
description: Ben F. Miller Sr., a retired manufacturer's representative, died suddenly last Thursday in Waterbury (Conn.) Hospital. Mr. Miller who lived in New Canaan, Conn., 20 years, moved six weeks ago to 479A North Spring Street, Naugatuck, Conn. His age was 71. He is survived by his wife, the former Martha Calkins; a son, Ben F., Jr.; a daughter, Mrs. Thomas Hunt; one brother, two sisters and three grandchildren.

title: Minister Hailed for Effort To Improve Life in Harlem
description: When the Rev. Dr. M. Moran Weston first went to St. Philip's Church in Harlemone of the oldest and largest black Episcopal churches in the countrythe streets were always heavily strewn with unsightly litter that built up between sanitation pickups.

title: Goodman, Hopeful on 4Way Race, To Run Without Liberal Party Line
description: State Senator Roy M. Goodman has decided to run for Mayor of New York City without the Liberal Party line that he had hoped for, on the theory that there will be a fourway election and that a Republican can win it.

title: Session Backs Tutoring in New York Schools
description: He was 13 years old and could barely see over the lectern. But Jeffrey Young, a fifthgrader from Public School 154 in the Bronx, was a star speaker yesterday at a conference looking for successful, lowcost action programs for Children of the Cities.

title: ALLIES WARN SOVIET AGAINST IMPERILING SECURITY OF BERLIN
description: LONDON, May 9The leaders of Britain, the United States, France and West Germany warned the Soviet Union in firm language today not to endanger the status quo in Berlin.

title: Taxes & Accounting
description: Corporations are continually looking for new types of stockcompensation plans to attract and keep key executives.

title: The Program
description: CHICAGO SYMPHONY ORCHESTRA. S??r Georg S??lcon??u??or. At Carnegie Hall.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY TransAtlantic

title: Music: Chicagoans Start Lushly
description: The Chicago Symphony, conducted of course by Sir Georg Solti, gave the first of a series of concerts last night in Carnegie Hall. Later this week more ambitious things will be done, culminating in a performance of Beethoven's Missy Solemnis. But at this concert Mr. Solti put together an orthodox program or Haydn. Wagner and Brahms.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Yonkers Racing
description: Hoses isted in order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: Fire Damages Woods in Maine
description: STETSONTOWN, Me., May 9 (AP)Fourteen buildings and three acres of wooded area on Kenebago Lake were destroyed by a fire in a wooded area known as Grants Camp. Officials estimated damages at from $200,000 to $300,000.

title: Tuna Fleet, Hopeful of Accord, Will Resume Fishing
description: SAN DIEGO, May 9The American tuna fleet will return to its eastern Pacific fishing grounds starting tomorrow after being tied up at dockside here for two and a half months in a dispute over Government restrictions on the accidental killing of porpoises in tuna nets.

title: Soybean Prices Advance on Late Buying
description: A late wave of buying lifted prices of soybeans by 16 to 26 cents a bushel yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. The best gains were in the oldcrop deliveries.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Monday.

title: Regents Chancellor Denies Move to Halt School's Integration
description: Theodore M. Black, chancellor of the New York State Board of Regents, denied emphatically yesterday that the board had exerted any pressure on the State Education Commissioner. Ewald B. Nyquist, to rescind his December 1975 order that Andrew Jackson High School in Cambria Heights, Queens, be desegregated.

title: London Drops Gas Tax Increase
description: LONDON, May 9 (APThe Government agreed tonight to drop its recently imposed 10centagallon increase in the gasoline tax. That tax, which sent the average price of an imperial gallonslightly more than an American gallonto $1.41. will end at the beginning of August. The Liberal Party demanded that the increase be eliminated.

title: A Paris Question: How to Retaliate If the No Stands
description: PARIS, May 9A question widely discussed here recently was how France could retaliate if New York continued to bar landings by the supersonic Concorde.

title: Mondale Chairs Cabinet Session
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP)Vice President Mondale chaired his first Cabinet meeting today while President Carter was flying to Geneva from London after an economic summit meeting with United States allies. A White House spokesman briefed reporters on the closed session, which he said was largely devoted to an explanation by Joseph A. Califano Jr., Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, of the Administration's proposals for bailing out the financially ailing Social Security System. Those proposals were made public after the meeting.

title: Dutch Art Collector Denies Accusations of War Crimes
description: AMSTERDAM, May 9 (Reuters)A wealthy Dutch art collector, Pieter Menten, today denied accusations that he had killed scores of Polish Jews during World War If. He denounced the charges as a Soviet stunt as his trial opened here.

title: Atlantic City Priest Disputes Total Displaced in a Likely Casino Area
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 9A Roman Catholic priest said today that the number of people who had been forced from their homes in the Inlet section of this resort citya slum area being considered for casinogambling hotel siteshad been greatly understated.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: T. BROOKE PRICE, 86
description: T. Brooke Price, vice president and general counsel for the American Telephone and Telegraph Company from 1951 until his retirement in 1955, died Saturday at a Morristown, N. J., hospital after a long illness. He was 66 years old and lived at 33 Ogden Place in Morristown.

title: Atom Protesters Tell U.S. Judge That Armory Jails Are Unhealthy
description: CONCORD, N.H., May 9Attorneys for antinuclear demonstrators who have been jailed in five National Guard armories for more than a week moved today to force their release in Federal District Court here.

title: Music: Chamber Society Outshines Its Own Genius
description: Because of the high talent it can command and the high standards it insists upon, the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center consistently puts on concerts of quality,. marked by technical polish and musical integrity. Occasionally, however, the society surpasses itself, and that is what happened on Sunday evening at Alice Tully Hall.

title: ELIZABETH FREEMAN
description: Elizabeth Wolfson Freeman, wife of William M. Freeman who retired last June as a member of the news staff of The New York Times, died Sunday evening in the Albany Medical Center of complications following surgery. She was 48 years old and lived in Cambridge, N.Y.

title: New Bond Issues
description: Monday, May 9, 1977

title: C.I.A.LINKED PROFESSOR LOSES A VOTE ON TENURE
description: Brooklyn College's political science department voted last night to deny tenure to Prof. Michael I. Selzer, a political scientist who said last January he was connected to the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: Young, Off on His African Tour, May Seek Closer Nigerian Ties
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 9Andrew Young, the United States delegate, left today on an African tour that may aim in part, at improving relations with Nigeria.

title: PETER J. SALA
description: Peter J. Sala, an insurance man, died Sunday at Mountainside Hospital, Glen Ridge, N.J. He was 52 years old and a resident of Essex Fells, N.J.

title: Rockefeller Given Peace Award At Dinner of Synagogue Council
description: Former Vice President Nelson A. Rockefeller last night called for a just and lasting peace in the Middle East that would assure the existence of Israel.

title: CINCINNATI TEACHERS VOTE TO END STRIKE
description: CINCINNATI, May 9By a vote of 774 to 197. the Cincinnati Federation ?? Teachers voted tonight to end their 19day strike and return to classes tomorrow. The new contract provides for a wage increase of 6 percent retroactive to Jan. 1.

title: TV: Moving Study of the Elderly
description: A few months ago this writer joined Judith Crist, film critic, and Peggy Cooper, television producer, at the Washington offices of the Corporation for Public Broadcasting to watch several finalist programs and, if possible, choose the best local publictelevision documentary of the year. For the most part, the levels of ambition and achievement were dreadfully uninspired, prompting ominous grumbling about giving an award at all. Then a halfhour entitled Number Our Days was slipped into the cassette deck, and it became immediately apparent that the proceedings had reached the point of nocontest. The program will be on Channel 13 at 9 o'clock tonight.

title: Energy Waste Is Found In Bad Cooking Habits
description: GAITHERSBURG, Md., May 9 (AP)Cooks who keep opening the oven door to check on dinner are among the biggest energy wasters in the kitchen, a Federal study concludes.

title: Penn's Crew Gets Top Seeding
description: Penn's varsity crew was seeded first, Harvard second and Cornell third yesterday in a coaches' poll for the Eastern sprint championships to be held at Princeton on Sunday.

title: DEATH PENALTY BILL FACES CAREY'S VETO
description: ALBANY, May 9Governor Carey said today that he would veto any death penalty bill that reached his desk, and that as long as he is Governor, I will not send any person in this state to the death chamber.

title: Seriously Now
description: In pursuit of selfimprovement I joined an overflow audience at the College of Higher Understanding to learn how to be serious. The occasion was a panel discussion by six of the most serious men In the country.

title: Driving Taxis Proves Too Dangerous, So Cabby Sets Out to Drive Pacers and Trotters
description: YONKERS, May 9John J. MacDowell, a 30yearold groom from Flushing, Queens, who gave up taxi driving last year after having been held up three times has decided that life along the race track's backstretch is the life for him.

title: Policeman Near Retirement Slain
description: ROANOKE RAPIDS, N.C., May 9 (AP)A police lieutenant three months from retirement was shot to death today shortly after three armed men robbed a convenience store here, the police said. Three Emporia, Va., men were arrested in the death of Lieut. Sonny E. Vaughan, 64 years old, who was shot four times.

title: W.H.A. Playoff
description: CHAMPIONSHIP

title: Hooked on Charts
description: Where did I end up after reading Mr. Metz and the Mamises? Well, I'm grateful to Mr. Metz for telling me any number of things I didn't know before about investingthings such as how to shop around for the smallest brokerage commission, or how to determine the price at which to unload a stock whether it is a winner or a loser, or how to choose among the many different kinds of municipal bonds that are available despite the Municipal Assistance Corporation debacle

title: More in U.S. Keep Deposits Abroad, House Unit Finds
description: WASHINGTON, May 9A House committee has concluded that, partly because of a failure by the Internal Revenue Service to enforce the Bank Secrecy Act of 1970, the use of foreign bank accounts by Americans to defeat criminal and tax laws is more prevalent today than when the act was first passed.

title: 6 Top Cyclists Censured For Use of Banned Drug
description: BRUSSELS, May 9 (AP)Six top international cyclists, including the world champion, Freddy Maertens, and Eddy Merckx of Belgium used a drug prohibited by regulations during major races, a Belgian Cycling League spokesman said today. The spokesman said the six, who included tour Belgians besides Merckx, had been suspended for month and fined $300.

title: RundgrenLed Utopia Quartet Rolls in Rock
description: A rock quartet is performing under a pyramidal structure, in front of a huge sphinx with a laser beam in its forehead and strobe lights for eyes. They are surrounded now by jets of flame, now by flash bombs, smoke machines, walls of water and lifesize paper dragons. The music alternates between howling white noise and melodic. Beatlesinfluenced pop, with time out for a lunging hard rock arrangement of Something's Coming, from West Side Story.

title: Dave Anderson
description: Perhaps the New York Mets belong in Family Court instead of in last place. In the quiet years, M. Donald Grant always spoke of the Mets as a family and now its members are bickering loudly among themselves. Not that the Mets ever really resembled a family. The imagery was figment of M. Donald Grant's imagination, as was the belief that the Mets would be a contender in the National League East this season. In reality, the Mets, like most teams sports, resembled a plantation and still do. That's M. Donald Grant in the plumed hat, riding in the carriage. And there's an uprising out in the cotton fields. The workers are grumbling about the foreman, about shirkers and about the available workers who were not hired. As the Mets returned to Shea Stadium tonight against the San Diego Padres, these nasty words were still echoing from seven losses in the last eight games:

title: Medical Schools Urged to Intensify Recruitment of Minority Students
description: A fivefold increase in the enrollment of medical students from minority groups in the United States over the last decade has not produced enrollments matching the percentage of these minority groups in the present population, according to a report released yesterday.

title: Stanley Cup Final
description: Boston vs. Montreal

title: A Designer's Struggle Ends in Triumph
description: Five and a half years ago, her life in disarray, Harriet Selwyn quit her job as a saleswoman in a garment center company. With her teenaged daughter, she went to California.

title: Brawl Injury Sidelines Brett
