title: The Policy Of Confusion
description: WASHINGTON, May 12In his classic study of Diplomacy, Harold Nicolson warned of the dangers of imprecision, of confusion of thought leading to anxious bewilderment, of the narcotic force of illconsidered. slogans, and of the more guileful aspects of tact.

title: Excerpts From Second Segment of Frost's Television Interview With Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, May 12Foltowing, as made public by David Frost, are excerpts from the transcript of the televised portions of his interview with former President Richard M. Nixon. This segment, the second, dealing with United States foreign policy, was broadcast tonight.

title: 6 TO 18 YEARS TO CROATIAN IN JET HIJACKING CASE
description: Marc Vlasic, the Croatian nationalist who pleaded guilty two months ago to attempted kidnapping in last September's hijacking of a Trans Word Airlines jetliner, was sentenced yesterday to serve six to 18 years in prison by Justice James J. Leff in State Supreme Court in Manhattan.

title: Couple Testify Defendant Was With Them on Night Wilmington Store Burned
description: BURGAW. N.C., May 12A New Jersey couple testified today at a postconviction hearing in the Wilmington 10 case that the Rev. Ben Chavis, the chief defendant in the case, was with them in a church parsonage at the time the young black minister was accused of burning a nearby grocery store.

title: Rhodesian Information
description: STANFORD, Calif.If there are as yet no victors in the Rhodesian conflict, Ian D. Smith's whiteminority regime is winning the propaganda war as a result of a slick publicrelations campaign directed at the outside world

title: 3 Steel Makers Join Price Rise
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corporation, Jones & Laughlin Steel Corporation and Kaiser Steel Corporation, following others in the industry, have raised prices by 6 percent, effective June 19, on steel used in automobiles and other consumer goods. Only the Armco Steel Corporation has not yet acted. Page D5.

title: A Savory Melting Pot Simmers on 9th Ave.
description: THE NINTH AVENUE International Festival will spread itself from soup to nuts tomorrow and Sunday along one mile of that busy thoroughfare between 37th and 57th Streets. This is the fourth year that the caloric festival will fill the avenue, and the first that motor traffic will be entirely banned from the street both days during festival hours, from 11 A.M. to 7 P.M. While the event is weighted toward foodedibles of just about every nation that has ever heated a pot in New Yorkthere will be countless entertainments that will also reflect a city of immigrants. And for those who want to work it off, there will he trampolines, volleyball and roller skating, but no weightwatching demonstrations.

title: Swiss Bank Blamed for Not Halting Irregularities
description: GENEVA, May 12The Swiss Credit Bank failed to deal promptly and effectively with irregularities in the handling of $400 million at one of its branches, the director of the Government agency that supervises banking said today.

title: Music: Solti Triumphs
description: MORE THAN MOST of his other scores, the Fifth Symphony of Mahler requires of the listener an act of faith, a predisposition to be persuaded and even overpowered. In inferior performances, the work can seem a series of tenuously connected outbursts of joy and pain, flecked with enigmatic allusions to Wagner, Bruckner and Beethoven, and barely, if at all, held together by the flimsy string of distorted or aborted tunes.

title: Newark Begins 911 Service
description: NEWARK, May 12Newark has initiated use of the 911 telephone number for all emergency calls for police, fire or ambulance service. Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson said connecting the 911 service to the city's new $3 million police communications center was designed to speed response to crimes, fires and accidents, which prompt a daily average of 1,000 phone calls.

title: Nixon Broke the Law, Carter Says
description: WASHINGTON, May 12President Carter said today that, in his opinion, Richard Nixon violated the law and was guilty of impeachable offenses during his tenure in the White House.

title: Dick Shawn Goes It Alone, But Takes 2d Billing
description: Even in repose, relaxing in his pleasantly cluttered East Side apartment, Dick Shawn seems poised to leap into one of the manic routines that have established him as a supercharged and highly original comic entertainer. At 48, he is a bit heavier than he was when he first cut a swath of laughter through the cabaret circuit in the 1950s, and his hair, though thick, is entirely gray.

title: ATale of Two Governors
description: Even those who don't agree with his positions will have to admit that Gov. Hugh Carey of New York has not been acting much in the manner commonly attributed to politicians seeking reelection. He has been standing up, speaking out and welcoming the heat.

title: FIRE HALTS OIL FLOW IN MAJOR SAUDI LINE
description: DHAHRAN, Saudi Arabia, May 12Oilfield operators sought today to divert the flow of oil around a section of pipeline damaged by a rupture and fire that temporarily cut off more than half of the nation's petroleum production.

title: American Express on Big Board
description: The New York Stock Exchange yesterday assigned market making responsibilities for the American Express Company's stockto he newly listed on the Big Board next Wednesday under the symbol AXPto the specialist firm of Honderson Brothers. The firm, which is assigned a virtual monopoly in the stock in exchange for a commitment to maintain a fair and orderly market, also handles such stocks as Ford, Bendix, Honeywell and H. & R. Block.

title: Music: Vive Berlioz, Adieu Boulez
description: PIERRE BOULEZ started his last weekend as music director of the New York Philharmonic last night in Avery Fisher Hall. He went out on the shoulders of one of the biggest works in the repertory, The Damnation of Faust by Hector Berlioz. In a way Mr. Boulez, in this summing up of his six years with the orchestra, was still involved with the avantgarde. Berlioz, after all, was the most advanced composer of his time.

title: Homers and Errors Spark Mariners
description: SEATTLE, May 12The New York Yankees made five errors, had Catfish Hunter suffer his earliest knockout in six years and more than 200 games, yielded six unearned runs, allowed three stolen bases and hit into three double plays tonightbut still had the tying runs on base in the ninth inning when Roy White's line drive to shortstop finally gave the Seattle Mariners an 86 victory.

title: Opera: Cosi, Concert Style
description: MOZART'S Cosi fan tutte is normally thought of as a full evening's entertainment. In some ways the most interesting thing about Opera Gyarto's concert version Wednesday night at Carnegie Recital Hall was that the opera clocked in at exactly two hours worth of music, and was substantially complete.

title: Supreme Court Releases Addonizio Pending Plea On Shortening His Term
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (AP)The Supreme Court voted 7 to 2 today to give temporary freedom to Hugh J. Addonizio, former Mayor of Newark, who has been a Federal prisoner for more than five years.

title: La Pasionaria Is Given Passport And Prepares to Return to Spain
description: MOSCOW, May 12Dolores Ibarruri, the Spanish Communist leader whose eloquence earned her the nickname La Pasionaria, today prepared to return to Spain after 38 years of exile in the Soviet Union.

title: PRESIDENT INDICATES A STRATEGY SWITCH IN TAXREFORM PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, May 12  President Carter, apparently contradicting what his top economic spokesmen have been saying far months, voiced the hope today that his tax reform program would involve no change in revenues for the Federal Government.

title: S.E.C. Sets Jan. 1 Target For Freer Stock Trading
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The Securities and Exchange Commission decided today to set Jan. 1, 1978 as the target for lifting the last big obstacle to free competition in securities trading.

title: People in Sports
description: Evonne Goolagong Cawley, the secondranked woman tennis player in the world last year, gave birth yesterday to a 7pound5ounce daughter in Beaufort, S. C. The child was named Kelly Inalla Cawley.

title: Delay on Bail Is Called Reason Nuclear Protesters Were Jailed
description: CONCORD, N. H., May 12A bail commissioner testified today that she had been prepared to release the arrested Seabrook antinuclear demonstrators on their own recognizance, but that the protesters finally wound up being carted off to makeshift armory jails because they could not reach a consensus on what to do.

title: Columbia Plans a $20 Million Dorm Project
description: Columbia University announced plans yesterday to build a residence hall for 670 students and to refurbish four old dormitories at a total cost of about $20 million in the most ambitious construction program on the Morningside Heights campus in more than a decade.

title: Art People
description: AS OF THIS EVENING, Kenneth Clark will be back in New York City. For the first time in many years, the author of Civilization and so much else will be free to be what he most likes to be: the passionate sightseer after whom one of Bernard Berenson's books was named. Lord Clark has no formal engagements, there isn't a television program in sight and very few people even know where he is.

title: Broadway
description: TRY TO IMAGINE a musical about a black Congressmangifted, flamboyant, frequently at odds with other people and finally at odds with most of Congress itself. The musical is Adam, and the Congressman is the late Rev. Adam Clayton Powell Jr.. and Ashton Springer wants to produce it on Broadway early next year. Mr. Springer says he had been thinking for several years about doing something about Mr. Powell, and then Audrey Wood, the agent, had called and told him about Adam. Mr. Springer says he read the script immediately, but did not like it. Then, he says, he heard the score and loved it. He asked for a rewritten script, got it and bought it. The plan now is have Billy Wilson, who directed and choreographed the current Guys and Dolls and choreographed Bubbling Brown Sugar, to direct and choreograph Adam.

title: New Standards Urged to Help Public Schools,
description: Assemblyman Thomas H. Kean of Livingston called yesterday for minimum graduation standards for high schools and stricter requirements for teachers. In a position paper on education, the candidate for the Republi

title: OffDuty Policeman Is Stabbed to Death In Ft. Greene Flat
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., May 12 (AP)  Two New Brunswick policemen have been acquitted of charges they broke into the Sears, Roebuck store here in September 1975 and stole nearly $5,000 worth of merchandise. They are Ronald Speights, 37 years old, and Eude Moya, 29.

title: BUS LINES CONCERNED ABOUT TRANSIT BILL
description: TRENTON, May 12Spokesmen for both unsubsidized and subsidized New Jersey bus companiesthe profitable and the unprofitablevoiced their concern today over public takeover provisions of the state's proposed Transportation Improvement Act of 1977.

title: Outwitting Aerosol Ban: New System Ready
description: A proposed ban on spraycan gases dangerous to the earth's ozone was greeted yesterday with relative equanimity by major suppliers and users, despite Government estimates that the phaseout would cost industry several hundred million dollars.

title: FORMER REP. TONRY INDICTED FOR FRAUD
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 12Richard A. Tonry, who resigned last week from the House of Representatives after allegations that he won a primary election last year through vote fraud, was indicted by a Federal grand jury here today for soliciting and concealing illegal campaign contributions, among other charges.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Folger Coffee Company, the second largest United States roaster after the General Foods Corporation, announced yesterday that it was reducing the wholesale price of its ground coffee by 25 cents a pound to $4.18, effectively immediately.

title: Liberals Policy Group Chooses Cuomo for Party's Endorsement
description: The Liberal Party policy committee last night recommended that the party endorse Mario M. Cuomo for the mayoral nomination.

title: Clayton Suspended And Fined for Role In Potato Default
description: The New York Mercantile Exchange yesterday fined and suspended the Clay. ton Brokerage Company of St. Louis for its part in the default on Maine potato futures contracts on the exchange last May.

title: ROBERT BELL, EXTEACHER AT DRAMATICS ACADEMY
description: Robert Bell, a member of the faculty of the American Academy of Dramatic Arts in New York in the 1940's and 50's and of the Ram's Head Players, died Wednesday in Good Samaritan Hospital in Palm Beach, Fla. He was 82 years old and lived in Palm Beach and had a summer home in Baddeck. Nova Scotia.

title: For Children
description: Farm Day

title: Deaths
description: BELLRobert, 2165 Ibis Island, Palm Beacn, Flo., formerly of Washington, D.C. and New York City, died on May 11 in Good Samari?an Hospital, Palm Beach, Ha., at the age of 82. Funeral services will be held in St. Paul's Church parish, Washington. D.C., on May 16, at 11 A.M. inter ment Will be in the Rock creek parish, Washington, D.C. on May Id at 11 A.M. He is survived by his wife Irma Theobald Bell.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1

title: Around the Nation
description: BOSTON, May 12 (AP)Seven persons were injured and seven others were arrested when fighting erupted at racially tense South Boston High School today after a stick of dynamite was found near the front steps.

title: Senate Panel Backs Bill for Registering On Day of Elections
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (AP)Outnumbered Republicans on the Senate Rules Committee gave up their fight today against the Carter Administration's Election Day voter registration bill, but vowed to renew the battle on the Senate floor.

title: Threat of Dock Strike Ended by Agreement on ContainerShip Payments
description: The longshoremen's union and shipping industry employers in major North Atlantic ports reached an agreement yesterday that averted a threatened waterfront strike and extended the old contract to Sept. 30.

title: Jews of Jerusalem Mark Anniversary Of Victory in'67
description: JERUSALEM, May 12The Jews of Jerusalem today celebrated the 10th anniversary of the day when the walls and barbed wire that had divided this historic city for 19 years were torn down and Jerusalem was physically reunified.

title: Turkish Leader Says U.S. Aid Ban May Mean Smaller Role in NATO
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, May 12 (Reuter)Prime Minister Suleyman Demirel said today that Turkey would be forced to limit its contribution to NATO unless the United States lifted its curb on military aid to Ankara.

title: IMMIGRATION AGENCY ENGULFED IN TROUBLE
description: WASHINGTON, May 12A recent visitor to the Immigration and Naturalization Service headquarters here was confronted by three uniformed security guards requesting proper identification, signature and destination. Statistics suggest that at that same moment, a dozen or so Mexicans, Haitians or other foreigners were entering the United States without detection by I.N.S. guards to become part of a growing population of illegal aliens.

title: Cheap Mexican Labor Attracts U.S. Companies to the Border
description: BROWNSVILLE, Tex., May 9The 35 women who sort and box shrimp at TexMex Cold Storage Inc, are quick with their hands. With the help of machines, they can grade and package for freezing about 6,000 pounds of shrimp an hour. Their base pay is $2.30 an hour; their takehome pay: $2.12 an hour.

title: Australian Leader Threatens to Seek An AntiStrike Bill
description: PERTH, Australia, May 12Prime Minister Malcolm Fraser warned today that if the country's air traffic controllers did not vote to return to work tomorrow, he would introduce emergency legislation to end their work stoppage, which has closed Australia's airports for a week.

title: Head of I.M.F. Urges Major Revaluations
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (Reuters)West Germany and Japan should allow their currencies to appreciate in value to help correct imbalances in world payments, the International Monetary Fund's managing director said today.

title: Books of The Times
description: I HOPE THAT Kate Millett feels better now, that the author of Sexual Politics is happily at work on her sculpture, or agitating for a cause or writing a real book. While it is impossible not to respect the pain, love, anger and confusion here, the embarrassment and, I suppose, the bravery, Sita is less a book than tickertape pouring out of a wound.

title: A NEW INTERNATIONAL ECONOMIC ORDERII
description: Before America can play any durable and credible role in shaping a New International Economic Order, I believe we must meet headon our popular indifference to aid to the underdeveloped world. This can be accomplished only if we move toward an approach that encompasses, among others, some of the following concepts:

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: Work, Welfare and the Sugar Coating
description: It has been obvious for a decade that the only way to get the country to swallow the bitter pill of welfare reform , is to sugarcoat it with work. Increasingly, it appears that President Carter is willing to accept the sugar coating but not the pill.

title: Trips to Ellis I. Slated to Start
description: The 500passenger Miss Freedom, her bow wet with champagne and filled of the gunwales with politicians, businessmen and their guests, went on a short cruise of New York Harbor yesterday before starting service to Ellis Island tomorrow.

title: Mitchell Ginsberg Elected
description: Mitchell I. Ginsberg, dean of the Columbia University School of Social Welfare and former New York City Commissioner of Social Services, was named yesterday as presidentelect of the National Conference of Social Welfare at the group's annual forum at the Conrad Hilton Hotel in Chicago. He will become president in 1979.

title: The Pop Life
description: DOILY PARTON, who's in the midst of a run at the Bottom Line, has had throat trouble for years. She's been forced to cancel concerts, undergo twoweek stints, of total silence and may one day have to face that bane of all singers, throat surgery.

title: Gerulaitis Reaches W.C.T. Semifinals
description: DALLAS, May 12 (UPI)  Vitas Gerulaitis rallied from two sets down tonight and defeated Wojtek Fibak of Poland. 16, 36, 60, 62, to advance to the semifinals of the World Tennis Championship tournament.

title: MURDOCH VOICES ANXIETY OVER DIVIDED NEW YORK
description: Describing himself as the city's newest publisher, Rupert Murdoch said yesterday that he was concerned about the barriers that are dividing New York City,

title: Namath Reaches Agreement With Rams
description: Joe Namath and the Los Angeles Rams reached an agreement yesterday for Namath to play with the West Coast team next season. At the start, at least, he will be the secondstring quarterback behind Pat Haden.

title: Padres 52 Victors Koosman Bows
description: For a change, the New York Mets didn't exchange any barbs last night in Shea Stadium, nobody demanded to be traded and nobody ripped the front office. But nobody also scored enough runs, so the Mets more or less serenely marched to their fifth straight defeat and the 10th in their last 11 games.

title: Transcript of the President's News Conference on Foreign and Domestic Matters
description: Following is a transcript of President Carter's news conference yesterday afternoon, as recorded by The New York Times through the facilities of ABC News:

title: House Division Is Sharp in Debate On Special Aid Plan for Northeast
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The House divided sharply in floor debate today on the Administration plan to enlarge and extend the special aid program to areas of high unemployment under a formula favorable to New York City and other hardhit urban centers of the Northeast.

title: Barry Ashbee Dies
description: Barry Ashbee the former allstar hockey defenseman for the Philadelphia Flyers, died yesterday of leukemia at the age of 37. Page B3.

title: Nixon Rates Kissinger Plusand Minus
description: WASHINGTON, May 12Richard M. Nixon said in a television interview broadcast tonight that Henry A. Kissinger was an intellectual giant, but he described the former Secretary of State as moody, secretive, capable of outrageous private remarks and intensely protective of official prerogatives.

title: Bruno Wins Dodge Golf on Final 69
description: DENVILLE, N.J., May 12Bob Bruno drove up to the Rockaway River Country Club in a 3yearold Buick at about 8 o'clock this morning and drove away 11 hours later in a brand new 57,800 black, gray and maroon Dodge Charger Daytona. The getaway car was the first I prize in the 72hole threeday Dodge open golf tournament, which Bruno won by three shots at 282, six under Dar.

title: CARTER BRUSHES OFF LIBERALS CRITICISM; DEFENDS HIS POLICIES
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 President Carter brushed aside today recent criti cism of his domestic policies by liberal Democrats, describing them as people who are always hard to please and defending his programs and his goal of a balanced budget as consistent with the Democratic Party's traditions.

title: Advertising
description: At heart, John McKinney is a writer, one of those searchers after the great American novel. There have been short stories and books. He wrote The Gold Cup of Paradise during a stay in Mexico. Nothing has ever been published, up to now, that is.

title: Licensing of Physicians Reviewed By 2 Legislative Panels in Albany
description: ALBANY, March 12If Dr. Carl A. Coppolinowho murdered his wife with a lethal drugwere released from prison tomorrow, there would be nothing to stop him from setting up a practice in New York State, a state deputy attorney general testified here today.

title: Manikin Helping Students In Heart Disease Diagnosis
description: WASHINTON, May 12The patient was normal at the outset but within 20 minutes had developed clear signs of five serious types of heart disease.

title: Nixon Rates Kissinger Plus and Minus
description: WASHINGTON, May 12Richard M. Nixon said in a television interview broadcast tonight that Henry A. Kissinger was an intellectual giant, but he described the former Secretary of State as moody, secretive, capable of outrageous private remarks and intensely protective of official prerogatives.

title: Art Donovan Injured
description: BALTIMORE, May 12 (UPI)Art Donovan. a 300pound former Baltimore Colt defensive tackle and a member of the pro football hall of fame, was resting uncomfortably today after breaking his elbow and kneecap during a tumble into an empty swimming pool. Donovan 52 years old, fell 16 feet into the concrete pool yesterday at the Valley Country Club while perched on a ladder painting the diving well.

title: Role for Wind Energy Seen Far Off
description: BOULDER, Colo, May 12Does wind energy have a future? Or are its supporters, such as the New York tenement dwellers who won a battle with Consolidated Edison last week, merely tilting at windmills?

title: TV WEEKEND
description: THIS FILM is not an argument for or against capital punishment, but I think you cannot see it without examining your own convictions very deeply. This is WNET/13's Robert MacNeil introducing a strangely disturbing documentary called Murder One, produced and directed by Tex Fuller, with the assistance of public television networks in Georgia and North Carolina. Murder One, referring to firstdegree murder, looks at six separate convictions, three in North Carolina, where a key 1976 Supreme Court ruling caused death sentences to be commuted to life, and three in Georgia, where the same ruling served to uphold death penalties.

title: News Summary
description: Attempts were being made in Saudi Arabia to divert the flow of oil around an area damaged by a pipeline rupture and fire that temporarily cut off more than half of the nation's petroleum production. The fire at the Abaqaiq field, 35 miles southwest of Dhahran. killed one man and injured 13. Oil shipments were not expected to be affected. [page Al, Column 4.]

title: Crenshaw, Geiberger Card 65's and Share Shot Lead
description: FORT WORTH, May 12 (AP)Ben Crenshaw, a disappointed twoshot loser last week, oneputted 11 times today on his way to a fiveunderpar 65 that tied Al Geiberger for a oneshot lead in the $200.000 Colonial National invitation golfurnament.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2

title: MOYNIHAN CRITICIZES CARTER ON WELFARE
description: WASHINGTON, May 12Senator Daniel Patrick Moynihan accused the Carter Administration today of being unrealistic in its assumption that large numbers of people can be taken off welfare and put to work.

title: Bridge:
description: ARUBA, Netherlands Antilles, May 12With one day of qualifying play remaining in the Central American and Caribbean championship, the four favored teams headed confidently for places in the semifinal stage.

title: Glamour Issues and Prime Rate Are Factors as Dow Slips by 1.36
description: Continued weakness in key glamour issues and fears of a primerate increase caused the stock market to retreat slightly yesterday.

title: YOUNG IS UNCONCERNED BY ETHIOPIA'S SWITCH
description: ABIDJAN, Ivory Coast, May 12 (UPI)Andrew Young said today that Ethiopia's abrupt switch of allegiance from the United States to the Soviet camp had given the Kremlin more trouble than it can handle.

title: Books: Dipping Into The Atlantic
description: Between November 1857, when The Atlantic was founded, and October 1976, the Bostonpublished monthly magazine appeared 1,429 times in its 119 years. From this mass of verbiage, which spans the years of Boston's greatness as the hub of the universe and the Athens of America to the city's more dowdy intellectual reputation, Louise Desaulniers, the magazine's managing editor, has had the unenviable task of choosing one article for each year of the magazine's life. It is almost a fate worse than death, for a book composed of such selections is bound to contain a number of dogs.

title: Senate Passes Earthquake Bill
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (UPI)The Senate passed a bill today aimed at developing the capability to predict the time and place of earthquakes. The bill, approved by voice vote and sent to the House, would authorize $205 million over three years for the program.

title: 6 Plane Builders Seek Big Canadian Contract
description: Four American and two European aircraft manufacturers are angling for a contract estimated at $2.3 billion to 32.5 billion to build 130 to 150 highperformance fighters for Canada.

title: Commodities Register Wide Gain, Ending a 2Day Slump in Chicago
description: Ending a twoday slide, commodity futures prices rose yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade as local buying was supported by commissionhouse support.

title: Antiques
description: ARE THE CARVED sunflowers on early New England chests actually variations of the Tudor rose? Indeed, how British are the American chairs, chests, tablewares, gravestones and stitchery that survive from the Colonial period? These are some of the questions that prodded Phillip Johnston, curator of decorative arts at the Wadsworth Atheneum in Hartford to take a long look at the museum's Wallace Nutting furniture collection, the finest in existence of early New England designs. The result is an impressive exhibition called Art in 17th Century New England, which opened at the Atheneum this week and remains through November.

title: Diary of a Discerning Macy Shopper: the kindest cut
description: The other day. I said to Jack I wished I had a home of my own. What's the matter with this one? he asked. I told him that for years, I had been living with towels and pillowcases bearing the initials of his first wife, with silver spoons once owned by his mother and with wine glasses belonging to mine. Even our cutlery was once imported from his former bachelor pad. Everything. I said. seemed old and rusty. It happens to the best of us, replied my husband. Let's not get personal. If you want new cutlery, go out and buy new cutlery. So I did, and while making my choice, I learned so much about it that by now. I feel like a chef. And I certainly know what makes for a quality knife!

title: Commodity Price Index Declines 2.2 From the WeekEarlier Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials fell to 219.5 from 221.7 last week.

title: At the Movies
description: DO YOU WANT TO KNOW my fantasy? whispered Tony Curtis, his blue eyesgleaming boyishly. I dreamed I would get the book published, it would make the bestseller list, and a producer would buy it and ask me to write and direct the movie.

title: Consumer Official Says Agency's Foes Engage in Lying
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (UPI)Esther Peterson, consumer adviser to President Carter, accused the United States Chamber of Commerce and several big companies today of outright lies in the fight against the consumer protection agency bill.

title: GOVERNORS OF AMEX ENDORSE PROPOSAL FOR N.Y.S.E. MERGER
description: Governors of the American Stock Exchange voted yesterday to endorse a proposed merger with, the New York Stock Exchange, but sources familiar with Amex thinking said that the chances of the merger might be impaired if the Big Board went ahead with plans to enter the options business. The Amex already trades in options.

title: Management
description: Four top managers of a large industrial corporation trooped into Standard and Poor's main office recently, sat down, and like automatons began to take turns reading from the company's annual report.

title: The Diplomacy of Sympathy
description: President Carter inherited a strong hand in the Middle East and he keeps playing it out with extraordinary skill. As he and his aides emphasize, there has been no diplomatic breakthrough, not even much measurable progress toward a settlement. But the Arabs and Israelis are being deftly led toward a test of their readiness to compromise.

title: Retail Store Sales Climb 12%
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The Department of Commerce reported today that retail store sales last week were about $13.96 billion, up 12 percent from last year's $12.45 billion. Department store sales were an estimated $1.46 billion, up 16 percent from the yearearlier $1.25 billion.

title: Ali Suggests Norton Beat Young First
description: Ken Norton's flush of victory didn't last much longer than his 58second fight with Duane Bobick.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The New York Times yesterday incorrectly reported that the Federal Home Loan Bank Board had been without a chairman since June 1975. On Dec. 9, 1976, former President Gerald R. Ford named Garth Marston, a Republican who was then serving as awing chairman, to the chairmanship.

title: Army Chief Urges a New G.I. Bill With Education Benefits Restored
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The Secretary of the Army, Clifford M. Alexander Jr.. said today that he hoped to restore G.I. Bill education benefits as a recruiting incentive for the voluntary military system

title: Bad Bills for Man and Beast
description: Quietly, almost by stealth, a bill called the Interstate Horse Racing Act of 1977 will find its way onto the Senate calendar on Monday. Its object is to prohibit horseplayers from betting at legal staterun facilities in one state on races run at tracks in other states. That would mean no OTB bets in New York on the next Derby or any race run at Meadowlands. Why? Because a number of Senators are out to protect their turf.

title: CAPE CANAVERAL LAUNCHES TWO MILITARY SATELLITES
description: CAPE CANAVERAL. Fla., May 12 (UPI) Two Triple7 satellites equipped with sophisticated antijamming equipment were launched today as part of a program to rebuild the United States military's global communications network.

title: An Old Navy Man Tries to Find Stern
description: I'm an old Navy man, Richard M. Nixon said in the installment of his interview with David Frost that was telecast last night. The bow is the rear end, isn't it? Mr. Frost hesitated, then said, Probably.

title: Publishing: A Visit From 4 Writers
description: FOUR NOVELISTSMario Soldati from Italy, Nathalie Sarraute from France, Hans Hellmut Kirst from Germany and Robert Penn Warren of the United Statescame by, at various times, to say hello in recent days. We had a chance to talk about the novel and the profession of writing. All are storytellers, in their own ways, but it would be stretching a point to say that they are linked by anyhing but their dedication.

title: Carter Pledges Special Treatment for Israel on Advanced Weapons
description: WASHINGTON. May 12  President Carter avoided a confrontation with Israel and its supporters today by pledging that the United States had special security responsibilities to Israel and that special treatment would be given to Israel with regard to its right to buy and coproduce advanced weaponry.

title: Extending the Fashion Picture Way Out
description: Harriet Winter's drawstrings and knots. Cathy Hardwicks enormously full smockdresses. Scott Barrie's halfmoon tops. Eleanor Brenner's tuniclength dresses.

title: Shapp Told to Return Vote Funds
description: WASHINGTON, May 12Gov. Milton J. Shapp of Pennsylvania was ordered by the Federal Election Commission today to return nearly $300,000 in public subsidies given to his brief 1976 Presidential campaign on the ground that his claim of eligibility fur the money was partly false.

title: Goodman Opens Race; Expects 4 In Fall Election
description: Insisting that he could unequivocally, positively and absolutely be elected Mayor of New York without the Liberal Party's support that he once called crucial. State Senator Roy M. Goodman announced his candidacy for the Republican nomination yesterday.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Rome Says Italy Lives High on Imports, Urges Buy Italian
description: ROME, May 12The Government has come to the conclusion that Italians are importing too much meat, whisky and champagne, too many RollsRoyces and other foreign cars and too many furs and yachts.

title: Nureyev Appeals to Moscow to Let Mother and Sister Leave
description: After years of frustrating silence by the Soviet authorities, Rudolf Nureyev made an anguished public appeal yesterday for visas that would allow his 73yearold mother and sister to leave the Soviet Union and visit him for the first time since he defected 16 years ago.

title: People in Sports
description: Bob Hopkins, who served as assistant coach of the Seattle Supersonics for three years under his cousin. Bill Russell, was named to replace Russell as head coach yesterday. The National Basketball Association club bought out the final year of Russell's fiveyear contract as coach and general manager.

title: British Ambassador Defended
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (Reuters)Diplomats at the British Embassy here rallied today to the defense of the British Ambassador, Sir Peter Ramsbotham, who has been portrayed in some London press reports as too stuffy and snobbish to get along with the Carter Administration.

title: Smith Refuses to Answer Court Questions On His Debts and a Jail Term Is Ordered
description: SAN DIEGO, May 13 (UPI)The financier C. Arnholt Smith, 78yearold friend and backer of former President Richard M. Nixon, refused to answer questions today in a Federal court debtor's examination and was ordered to jail on contempt charges until he answered the questions. The citation, for an indefinite term was immediately stayed for 21 days to allow Mr. Smith a chance to appeal.

title: Greek Festival Proves a Culinary Success
description: TENAFLY, May 13The fragance of roasting lamb shish kebab filled Fellowship Hall in the Greek Orthodox church today. Buffet tables around, the room were crowded with such traditional rich Greek pastries as baklava, kataifi and ravani, and such thinly crusted vegetable and cheese pies as spanakopita and tiropita.

title: N. B. A. Playoffs
description: SEMIFINAL ROUND

title: Alaska's Inquiry Into Rising Costs Stalled by Oil Pipeline Consortium
description: ANCHORAGE, May13 The State of Alaska hired a former Watergate investigator more than five months ago in an effort to determine the reason for the climbing cost of the Alaska oil pipeline, which has risen from an estimated $900 million to $7.7 billion.

title: Books of The Times
description: The mystique of the world of medicine  related, no doubt, to anxiety about our own mortality  has made dramatizations about hospitals and doctors extremely popular. And B. P. Reiter and Robin Cook, both physicians, make unusual and entertaining use of this entrallment by focusing on the macabre side of medicine; in these two novels there is not a trace of the altruistic Dr. KildareMarcus Welby fantasy syndrome.

title: 70 Hurt in Chicago Bus Crash
description: CHICAGO, May 13(AP)Two buses filled to capacity with rushhour commuters collided at a South Side intersection today, injuring more than 70 persons, the authorities said.

title: Redlining Study Scored By Banks in New York. As Lacking All the Facts
description: The Savings Banks Association of New York State yesterday criticized a state study detailing the extent to which mortgage lenders deliberately withheld. funds from deteriorating neighborhoods in a practice known as redlining.

title: ...While Schoolchildren Learn At the Metropolitan Museum
description: We learn here not only to write but also to listen, Sandra Hochman, poet and teacher, said to the group of youngsters gathered around her In the library of the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Junior Museum. Everything I learned about poetry I've learned by listening, she added.

title: Atlantic City Mayor Warns State Not to Block Casinos on Wetlands
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 13Mayor Joseph Lazarow said today at a news conference that Atlantic City will not tolerate hacheting of hotelcasino projects by the State Department of Environmental Protection.

title: La Pasionaria Returns Home to Spain After 38 Years
description: MADRID, May 13Dolores Ibarruri, a living Communist legend from the Spanish Civil War, today slipped hack into her homeland after 38 years in exile.

title: SHAPP DENIES BLAME BUT WILL REPAY FUND
description: HARRISBURG, May 13Gov. Milton J. Shapp said today that he had no knowledge of improper fundraising in his 1976 Presidential campaign, but said he would repay the $299,066.21 in Federal subsidies received by his campaign organization.

title: Appeals Court Affirms Curb on Lake Michigan Pollution by U.S. Steel
description: CHICAGO, May 13An appeals court up held late today orders by the Environmental Protection Agency that the United States Steel Corporation sharply reduce the discharge of pollutants from its Gary. Ind., plant into Lake Michigan.

title: Burden Joins Race For the Presidency Of the City Council
description: City Councilman Carter Burden of Manhattan announced his candidacy yesterday for the Democratic nomination for City Council President, pledging to serve as a kind of official devil's advocate, rather than a blindly loyal, unquestioning team player.

title: Miss Blalock Shares Lead
description: TOWSON, Md., May 13 (UPI)Jane Blalock and Argentina's Sylvia Bertolaccini carded fourunderpar 69's today to share the firstround lead of the $55,000 Greater Baltimore Classic.

title: BHUTTO ANNOUNCES A VOTE ON HIS RULE
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, May 13Prime Minister Zulkifar Ali Bhutto announced today a referendum to decide whether he should retain power in the aftermath of two months of rioting against his rule in which some 260 persons have been killed.

title: Prime Rate Lifted to 6% From 6% by Big Banks
description: Major banks across the countryled by Citibank, New York's largest and No. 2 in the nationincreased yesterday the basic interest rate they charge on loans to corporations in a move that reflected recent rapid growth in the demand for credit as well as higher rates that banks pay on large deposits.

title: Greek Nomads Roam No More, Except in Cars or on Bikes
description: PHERRAI, GreeceSeveral years ago Nicolas Nakos, who was approaching 60 and struggling with a shepherd's life here in Thrace, hoped his son would soon take over his flock, but when the lad returned from the army he wanted to open a furniture store, so the flock was sold. Mr. Nakos's daughter went to work in West Germany, met a Greek theremany southern Europeans labor in German industryand decided to marry. Her mother, Lambrini, had spent years spinning and weaving and stitching a dowry, but the bride wanted to buy her own things abroad and left half her mother's work behind.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, May 13The National Council on the Arts announced today the establishment of a livable cities program, designed to encourage groups to develop ideas for revitalizing American cities.

title: Gold Prices Gain Abroad, But Dollar Moves Lower On Witteveen Statement
description: LONDON, May 13 (AP)Gold prices rose today while the dollar declined for a second consecutive day following yesterday's statement that the West German and Japanese currencies should be allowed to rise in value.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Xerox Corporation yesterday disclosed to the Securities and Exchange Commission that it had made improper payments of about $375,000 in seven foreign countries in the last six years.

title: Nuclear Protesters Are Released Pending Trials by a Higher Court
description: HAMPTON, N. H., May 13  The demonstrators against the Seabrook, N.H., nuclear power plant were released from their armory prisons today.

title: Judge Orders Carey to Designate  Who Will Build Bridge Toll Booths
description: Governor Carey was ordered by a Federal judge yesterday to designate the officials or agencies that would carry out the building of toll booths for bridges over the East River and Harlem River as part of a cleanair plan for New York City.

title: Poetry Writing: The Elderly. Learn in a Nursing Home...
description: The 35 men and women, a good many of them past 90 and at least a third of them in wheelchairs, looked obediently at the objects on tables in front of them.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, May 13The State Appellate Division today ordered Angelo Bruno, the reputed head of organized crime in the PhiladelphiaSouth Jersey area, back to prison.

title: Detroit Murder Trial Delayed
description: DETROIT, May 13Judge Patricia J. Boyle has adjourned until June 9 the start of the first degree murder trial of Al Junior Lewis, accused of fatally shooting his estranged wife, Bettye McCaster, while she was teaching a class at an elementary school here last November. The delay will allow time for the defendant to undergo psychiatric tests.

title: RESULTS
description: (OTB payoffs subject to 5% Muncipa?, tax)

title: Mets Homers, Matlack Beat Dodgers
description: They may he torn by dissension, trapped in the cellar and burdened by family troubles, all right. But the New York Mets managed to subdue their miseries last night in Shea Stadium when Jon Matlack pitched them to a 30 victory over the Los Angeles Dodgers, the hottest team in the business.

title: $460.9 BILLION BUDGET IS ADOPTED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (AP)The Senate approved today a tentative budget of $460.9 billion with a $64.6 billion deficit, figures close to President Carter's proposals but allocating less for defense than he requested.

title: The Dance: Ancestral Voices
description: Alvin Ailey has been giving young ?horeographers a chance to work with his company lately. On Thursday night, at the City Center, the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater presented Ancestral Voices, a premiere by Dianne McIntyre.

title: General Foods Follows Folger And Cuts Ground Coffee Prices
description: The General Foods Corporation, the nation's largest coffee roaster, has followed the lead of the Folger Coffee Company, the second largest, and reduced its wholesale prices on ground coffee by 25 cents a pound.

title: Finances in Governor's Race Listed
description: TRENTON, May 13  Gubernatorial candidates indicated today that they were using different approaches to financing their campaigns for their parties' nominations June 7 as they filed their first financial reports with the State Election Law Enforcement Commission.

title: Bars Offering Nudity and More Survive Despite the Authorities
description: Bars where customers can watch nude women dancers and, sometimes, buy their sexual services have been able to flourish openly in New York City through a variety of tactics ranging from arcane legal debates about art to overnight moves to new locations.

title: Mondale Will Warn South Africa
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (AP)Vice President Mondale will tell South African leaders next week that friendship between the two nations is impossible without a major transformation of South Africa's racial policies, Administration officials said today.

title: Funeral Set for Ashbee
description: PHILADELPHIA,May 13 (UPI)  Funeral services for Barry Ashbee, the Philadelphia Flyers assistant hockey coach who died of leukemia yesterday, will be held Monday at 1 P.M. at the St. Andrews Presbyterian Church in Huber Heights, Ontario. Burial will follow at the Glendale Memorial Gardens. There also will be a memorial service at the Spectrum here at 2 P.M. Monday.

title: How Jimmy Made It At the Top
description: LONDONPresident Carter's first climb to the summit was a notable success and he is now accepted as the outstanding leader of the free world by a number of government heads who came here somewhat skeptical and returned home impressed.

title: Rolling Back Steel
description: Who says jawboning doesn't work? The Carter Administration's recent success in talking down posted steel price increases is evidence that inflation can be retarded without formal price controls. One battle does not win a war, but the steel price rollback does suggest that jawboningtough talk, perhaps some threatscan make a difference,

title: Carter Signs Bills for Public Works And the Creation of a Million Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, May 13  President Carter signed today a pair of bills that Administration officials said would create more than a million jobs. primarily for construction workers and young people.

title: News Summary
description: SATURDAY, MAY 14, 1977

title: Dolly Parton In Top Form At Showcase
description: Dolly Parton has been about the most admired and popular composer and singer in country music for several years. Now she's making a determined effort to appeal to the poprock market, and Thursday she opened a threenight run at the Bottom Line at Mercer and West Fourth Streets.

title: BEAME SEEKS TO EASE STOCKTRANSFER TAX
description: In a dramatic move to keep the securities industry from drifting away from New York City, Mayor Beanie yesterday proposed phasing out the effects of the stocktransfer tax over four years beginning in the 197879 fiscal year.

title: Williams Upstages Olympians in 100
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, May 13 it didn't feel good, and the time could have been faster, but Steve Williams could not have cared less.

title: Kuhn Decides Against Turner
description: commissioner Bowie Kuhn advised Ted Turner yesterday that he could not serve as a coach or as acting manager of the Atlanta Braves, the team he owns.

title: Schroeder 4 Shots Ahead After Scoring a 65 for 131
description: FORT WORTH, May 13 (AP)John Schroeder, who had been playing so poorly he'd entertained thoughts of quitting the tour, turned a deadly putter and what he called a bunch of lucky breaks into a fiveunderpar 65 today that staked him to a fourstroke lead in the second round of the $200,000 Colonial National invitation golf tournament. His 131 led Ben Crenshaw, the firstround coleader.

title: Film: 'The Car':Science-Fiction Horror Story Backfires All the Way
description: "The Car," which opened at three theaters yesterday, has all the ingredients of a parody, although someone has made the mistake of doing it straight. It's a cross between a science-fiction and a horror film about an angry, driverless automobile that terrorizes a small Utah town for several days, squashing one hitchhiker, two bicyclists, one sheriff, one school teacher and assorted policemen.The people who made the film (see box, if you really care) clearly didn't have enough interest in the project to provide it with any kind of mythological substructure. This car is simply meanperhaps its spark plugs hurt. I think we are supposed to believe the car is demonically possessed because it won't go into cemeteries, but I know people who won't go into cemeteries and have never suspected they were more than superstitious or lazy. The performances are terriblethin and overwrought in the manner of actors trying to improvise without an idea in their heads."The Car," which has been rated PG ("Parental Guidance Suggested"), is such an inept movie that even its vulgar language is unbelievableit sounds worse than it really is. The actual gore is minimal.

title: The Reds Have Just Played Bad
description: In the Cincinnati Reds dugout. Sparky Anderson watched what appeared to be an inningending grounder bounce toward Joe Morgan at second base. Ending the sixth inning Thursday in St. Louis was very important to Sparky Anderson because the Cardinals were leading, 21, and they had the bases loaded when Don Kessinger hit this grounder that was bouncing harmlessly toward Joe Morgan at second base. But suddenly the ball took a kangaroo hop over Joe Morgan's head. The ball had deflected off the thin ridge where the AstroTurf joins the infield dirt. And now, instead of the Reds having escaped from the inning, the Cardinals were ahead, 41. When the inning finally ended, the Cardinals had an 81 lead and the Reds would lose another game, Before last night's opener of the weekend series with the San Francisco Giants in Cincinnati, the Reds had lost 17 games and won only 12 games this season, hardly a record for the twotime World Series champions to cherish. And they were floundering 11 games behind the Los Angeles Dodgers in the National League West.

title: Nuclear Protesters Are Released Pending Trials by a Higher Court
description: HAMPTON, N.H., May 13  The demonstrators against the Seabrook, N.H., nuclear power plant were released from their armory prisons today.

title: Audience for Nixon Is Reduced by Half For the 2d Interview
description: David Frost's second primetime interview with former President Richard M. Nixon on Thursday night. on the subject of the Nixon Administration's foreign policy, attracted about half the audience of last week's interview dealing with Watergate.

title: Russell N. Levin, 70, a Consultant To the Retail Clothing Industry
description: Russell N. Levin, a consultant in the retail clothing industry who had retired in 1956 as executive vice president of Lerner Stores Corporation in New York City, died Thursday in Montefiore Hospital and Medical Center after a long illness. He was 70 years old and lived at 6 Old Lyme Road, Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: A Seattle Slew Victim Scores at Aqueduct
description: White Rammer, a powerfully built chestnut colt, won again yesterday to maintain his almostperfect record. it never will be 100 percent, because the only horse ever to beat the sprinter is Seattle Slew.

title: LIVER PASTE IS RECALLED OVER FEAR OF BOTULISM
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (AP)  A canned liver paste imported from France is considered dangerous to eat and is being recalled from retail stores, the Agriculture Department said yesterday.

title: Wissel Named Head Coach
description: LAKELAND, Fla., May 13 (AP)Hal Wissel, an assistant coach and scout for the Atlanta Hawks and former head coach at Fordham, was named today as basketball coach at Florida Southern University.

title: Fictitious Breeder Swindled the State
description: New York's horse breeders have complained for years about not getting the kind of financial support their counterparts in other states receive. Now, it appears, the New York State Thoroughbred Breeding and Development Fund has done too much.

title: BEAME SEEKS TO EASE STOCKTRANSFER TAX;
description: In a dramatic move to keep the securities industry from drifting away from New York City, Mayor Beame yesterday proposed phasing out the effects of the stocktransfer tax over four years beginning in the 197879 fiscal year.

description: WASHINGTON, May 13 aGiving a major lift to New York State and other economically hardhit regions, the House v???? 243 to 94 today for the Administration plan to enlarge and extend the special aid program to areas of high unemployment.

title: ANDREW YOUNG PAYS VISIT, BUSY BUT BRIEF, TO GHANA
description: ACCRA, Ghana, May 13During a brief visit here today Andrew Young, the United States representative to the United Nations, offered to mediate a student protest against the government, met with one of the rival Rhodesian nationalist leaders and tacitly affirmed the improvement of American relations with Ghana.

title: CAREER DIPLOMATS NAMED TO AMBASSADORIAL POSTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (Reuters)President Carter named today two career diplomats, Arthur A. Hartman and Lawrence S. Eagleburger, to be the United States Ambassadors to France and Yugoslavia.

description: Music

title: Martin Faces Fine As Yanks Win, 30
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., May 13With some acerbic statements. the addition of a rookie outfielder from Yonkers and what might amount to a S2.500 fine of Manager Billy Martin, the Yankees engaged in another round in their continuing saga of intrateam squabbling today.

title: Falcons Taken fora Jet Ride in Survival Bid
description: BOISE. Idaho, May 13Prof. Tom Cade looked like a proud mother as he sat aboard a commercial jetliner cradling a pasteboard box with three fuzzy peregrine falcon chicks nestled inside.

title: Accord in OPEC Reported to Drop Planned July Oil Price Rise of 5%
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 13 (UPI)Eleven members of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries have agreed to drop their planned 5 percent price increase in July as part of an apparent compromise to end their price war with Saudi Arabia, the Middle East Economic Survey said today.

title: Election Campaign Gets Under Way in France as Leaders Clash on TV
description: PARIS, May 13In what was taken as the formal opening of an election campaign that may last 10 months, Prime Minister Raymond Barre and the opposition Socialist leader, Francois Mitterrand, clashed last night in a television debate on how to revive the economy.

title: Petty Earns Pole Position
description: DOVER, Del., May 13 (UPI)Richard Petty won the pole position today for Sunday's MasonDixon 500 stockcar race at the Dover Downs International speedway. Petty toured the mile track at 136.033 miles an hour in his Dodge. Benny Parsons won the No. 2 spot in a Chevrolet.

title: CONSERVATIVES PERIL ALBANY BILL TO EASE LAWS ON MARIJUANA
description: ALBANY, May 13A vigorous lobbying effort by the Conservative Party, including the threat of political reprisals against individual legislators, has jeopardized a compromise bill to remove criminal penalties for possession of small amounts of marijuana.

title: Bridge:
description: ARUBA, Netherlands Antilles, May 13Panama, the defending champions, met Mexico in one semifinal of the Central American and Caribbean championships here this afternoon, while Venezuela clashed with neighboring Colombia in the other.

title: A CITIZENS ALLIANCE ON ENERGY IS FORMED
description: Senator Jacob K. Javits yesterday announced the formation of a New York State citizens group to educate the public on the need for energy conservation.

title: HOUSE APPROVES BILL TO ENLARGE AID GIVEN HIGH JOBLESS AREAS
description: WASHINGTON, May 13Giving a major lift to New York State and other economically hardhit regions, the House voted 243 to 94 today for the Administration plan to enlarge and extend the special aid program to areas of high unemployment.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article in The Times yesterday on a trial involving mail openings by the Central Intelligence Agency, two attorneys for the American Civil Liberties Union, Melvin L. Wulf and Burt Neuborne, were erroneously identified as representing two of the defendants. They represented two of the plaintiffs, those whose mail had been opened.

title: A Court Order Puts Schoolgirl In Track Meet
description: WHITE PLAINS, May 13An unusual court order by a New York State Supreme Court Justice yesterday placed a 17yearold Rockland County high school girl into the ninth annual Loucks Games track meet today although her school had never submitted an entry application for her as required by the meet's rules.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BOHEMIA BOUNTY Ye Olde Village Fair is a big neighborhood event today in downtown Manhattan, spilling into streets and yards of the area around the famous Cherry Lane Theater and moving north toward Bleecker Street, off Seventh Avenue. This is the annual street celebration of the BedfordBarrowCommerce Block Association, a festive outdoor spread of fleamarket stalls, pavement musical entertainment, antiques and white elephant items and food. Many longtime Greenwich Village residents, and annual visitors from other parts of the city, consider this street fair the best in the Village; some call it the most bountiful in town. (Another good one, the nearby Charles Street fair, is coming up soon.)

title: World News Briefs
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Saturday, May 14 (AP)  Protestant extremists called off their attempt at a general strike in Northern Ireland early today after 11 days in which the effort encountered wide opposition.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article in The Times yesterday on a trial involving mail openings by the Central Intelligence Agency, two attorneys for the American Civil Liberties Union, Melvin L. Wulf and Burt Neuborne, were erroneously identified as representing two of the defendants. They represented two of the plaintiffs, those whose mail had been opened.

title: Mae West Keeps Up Hoopla
description: LOS ANGELES, May 13Surrounded by an honor guard of seven marinesseveral of whom were young enough to be her greatgrandson  83yearold Mae West marched into the Ballroom of the Beverly Wilshire Hotel here last night to receive After Dark magazine's 1977 Ruby Award. It is given annually  for distinguished work in the entertainment field.

title: Personal Investing
description: Though stocks generally have been moving in no particular direction at no great velocity so far this year, flickers of speculative lightning are beginning to show in the overthecounter market.

title: Eagles in Financial Bind; Bank May Add to Control
description: PHILADELPHIA,May 13 (AP)The Philadelphia Eagles, who have hurt their future on the playing field by trading away future draft choices, are corning up short financially because of interest owed on a $10.5 million loan. First Pennsylvania Bank. which financed two loans that enabled Leonard Tose to buy the majority share of the team in 1969, plans to increase its control over the club's finances.

title: Carter Energy Goal Not Possible, Analysis by Continental Oil Finds
description: The Carter Administration energy plan cannot attain its goal of reducing United States oil imports in 1985 from 9 million to 6 million barrels a day, according to an analysis completed this week by the Continental Oil Corporation.

title: Eriksson Excels Abroad
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., May 13 (UPI)Roland Eriksson, a center with the Minnesota North Stars, was named the most valuable forward for Sweden's team in the recent world hockey championship in Vienna. Eriksson, the leading scorer last season among National Hockey League rookies, led Sweden in scoring and finished with two threegoal games.

title: Macy Seeks to Sell Its Homestock Unit To Levitz Furniture
description: R. H. Macy & Company, which made its first diversification move in 1971 when it purchased an interest in a furniture chain, is preparing to divest itself of it.

title: FlipTop Collector Has 21,000
description: Tony Green, a seventhgrader from the Upper East Side, is a versatile young man with two major hobbies, stringing together the fliptops from beverage cans and making his own movies.

title: MOHAWK INDIAN BAND AGREES TO RELOCATE
description: The armed band of Mohawk Indians that moved into an Adirondack campsite three years ago in an attempt to return to ancestral ways, agreed in a settlement with the state yesterday to leave the area and move to a site In nearby Clinton County.

title: British Official Lauds Envoy to U.S.
description: LONDON, May 13Britain's Foreign Secretary, Dr. David Owen, sent a message from Saudi Arabia today stressing that he had high regard for Sir Peter Ramsbotham, the British Ambassador in Washington, who is about to be replaced by Peter Jay, the soninlaw of Prime Minister James Callaghan.

title: Shift In Priorities Seen
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (UPI)The Rev. Jesse L. Jackson said today that President Carter had shifted his priorities away from helping blacks and the poor and thus created the need for widespread protest marches.

title: Speech for Computers
description: A computer that synthesizes speech with natural inflection and rhythm has been patented by two Bell Telephone Laboratory researchers. Page 27.

title: Blazers Eliminate Lakers in 4
description: PORTLAND, Ore., May 13 Taking full advantage of a fifth personal foul called on Kareem AbdulJabbar late in the third quarter, the Portland Trail Blazers turned a 3point deficit into a 10point lead and fought off a fourthquarter counterattack tonight to beat the Los Angeles Lakers, 105101, and advance to the final round in the National Basketball Association playoffs.

title: About New York
description: To live comfortably in his tenement at 323 West 43d Street, Michael Roselli carries a knife and sometimes a baseball bat to supply reveille for the nasty sleep of the sickened winos on the doorstep.

title: Gulf stream, Hialeah Plan To Alternate Top Dates
description: MIAMI, May 12 (UPI)  Gulfstream and Hialeah, the Miami area's two major thoroughbred race tracks, agreed today on a formula under which they will alternate the lucrative midwinter dates.

title: Carter's Nuclear Energy Policies Prompt Complex Lobby Efforts
description: WASHINGTON, May 13  President Carter's proposals to alter the direction of nuclear technology in the United States and impose tighter restrictions on the international exchange of some nuclear equipment have prompted complex waves of lobbying aimed at Congress and executive branch policy makers.

title: Saudi Oil Flow Being Restored After Big Fire
description: DHAHRAN, Saudi Arabia, May 13Virtually all of Saudi Arabia's oil production is expected to be restored within three days following a major fire, officials of the Arabian American Oil Company said today.

title: Keep Easy Ride Riding
description: For months now, a fleet of small tan buses labeled Easy Ride has been circulating out of the Lower East Side. The immediate destinations are hospitals, settlement houses and other locations around the city. But the fleet has more permanent goals: to save substantial amounts of Medicare funds; to help keep older and handicapped people out of institutions, and to create jobs for former addicts and criminal offenders. It would all sound utopian except that the Easy Ride experiment appears to be working. Nevertheless, the experiment is now financial jeopardy. To survive, it requires a decision by Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare Califano that would allow the use of some Medicare dollars in the interest of saving a lot more of them.

title: Most Grain Futures Ebb But Soybean Prices Gain; Cattle Contracts Climb
description: With wheat futures failing to maintain Thursday's rising momentum, prices of most grains futures declined yesterday on the Chicago Baord of Trade. However, soybean futures prices rose for the second day with the oldcrop beans futures closing up the 30 cent limit.

title: EFTA FOR COOPERATION WITH COMMON MARKET
description: VIENNA, May 13Leaders of the European outer seven free trade group, meeting here, stressed today their countries desire for closer cooperation with the Common Market and their determination to step up measures against unemployment.

title: CITIES HELD LAGGING ON SEWAGE PROJECTS
description: LOS ANGELES, May 13Contrary to the hopes of Congress, and despite the expenditure of billions of dollars, twothirds of the nation's cities have not improved their sewage plants sufficiently to meet Federal specifications by a statutory deadline of July 1, according to a new expert analysis.

title: Most Nations Plan Atomic Power Despite Advice at Nuclear Meeting
description: SALZBURG, Austria, May 13Despite widespread opposition to nuclear power and last month's call by President Carter for the deferral of plutonium exploitation, most of the more than 60 nations participating in the nuclear energy conference that ended here today have shown little or no sign of pulling back.

title: Sports Today
description: AUTO RACING

title: New York Muting image of Its Mt. Everest
description: LAKE PLACID, N. Y.This region's renowned Mount Marcy, long used by state officials as an advertising symbol to lure more tourists to remote hiking trails, is losing its cachet as the premier attraction of the Adirondack wilderness.

title: Washington Star Reports Profit
description: WASHINGTON,May 13 (APThe Washington Star announced today that it had made an operating profit of $60,00O in April, its first profitable month since November 1970.

title: Judge Rao Sues for $25 Million Over Perjury Charge Against Him
description: Judge Paul P. Rao Sr. of the United States Customs Court filed a suit in Manhattan yesterday seeking $25 million in damages for a perjury indictment that was brought against him when Maurice H. Nadjari was the special state anticorruption prosecutor.

title: Gregg Smith Singers Enthrall Monteverdian
description: The rediscovery of Monteverdi, that Bach, Mozart and Beethoven rolled into one Renaissance man, has been one of the more significant and exciting musical developments of recent decades. Only now, however, are we coming into a time when his works can he heard in anything approaching the way they sounded in his day, the late Renaissance. The performance of Monteverdi's Vespro della Beata Vergine by the Gregg Smith Singers at Alice Tully Hall on Thursday night turned out to be a tremendous leap forward in this rearward direction.

title: BERNARD E. WOHL
description: Bernard E. Wohl, a retired high school teacher, died Thursday at the Florida Medical Center, Fort Lauderdale, Fla. He was 69 years old and a resident of Margate, Fla.

title: An Elephantine Case of Unnecessary Jitters
description: Republicans are becoming very rare. A used Republican with 24 years of wear on the treads of his fiscal integrity recently went for a record price at auction in Manhattan. Brandnew Republicans are harder to find than truffles and are instantly snapped up by Greek shipping magnates to decorate their private Aegean islands.

title: Notes on People
description: James Cagney is very good, ambulatory, and in good spirits,said Jack Thomas, his soninlaw. Mr. Cagney has been undergoing treatment for the past nine days for what was described as a circulatory ailment. The 77yearold retired actor is in Good Samaritan Hospital in Los Angeles and was expected to remain there for several days. He was stricken with dizzy spells shortly before he had planned to leave on his annual trip to spend the summer on his farm in upstate New York.

title: Gail Wynters Is a Zesty, HighSpirited Singer
description: The fact that Gail Wynters, a white singer. made her New York debut at Small's Paradise in Harlem provides a clue to the effectiveness of her performance this week at the Rainbow Grill. Miss Wynters has a strong voice. which she uses with the flair and sweep of Gospeltrained black singers. But she adds a personal qualitya loose, bouncingly rhythmic projection that stirs some light, casual elements into a mix that might otherwise become oppressively heavy.

title: 76ers Top Rockets, 10795, For 31 Lead in Playoffs
description: HOUSTON, May 13Doug Collins scored 36 points and Julius Erving 29 tonight as the Philadelphia 76ers defeated the Houston Rockets, 10795, and moved within one victory of winning this semifinal playoff series in the National Basketball Association.

title: Concert: Tashi's Webern Elates
description: Tashi is a Tibetan word meaning good fortune, and it must have been something of the sort that brought the four members of the Tashi ensemble together four years ago. Peter Serkin is a pianist whose perceptions of problematic works can be uncommonly acute. Ida Kavafian is a violinist who can move easily from traditional to avantgarde styles. Fred Sherry is a cellist of versatility equal to hers, and Richard Stoltzman is a clarinetist whose mastery of the technical and expressive possibilities of the instrument is extraordinary.

title: Taubman Group Adds $800,000 in Irvine Bid
description: LOS ANGELES, May 13 (AP)TaubmanAllenIrvine Inc. added another $800,000 to the pot today in its continuing battle with the Mobil Corporation for control of the Irvine Company.

title: Securities Chiefs Meet And Work Is Stressed
description: WHITE SULPHUR SPRINGS, W. Va., May 13The spring meeting of the Securities Industry Association at the Greenbrier Hotel ended today with David W. Hunter, its chairman, telling those of the 300odd directors, governors and committee chairman remaining for the final session that We don't know much about anything because we're generalists.

title: 911 Emergency System Is Set Up in Newark
description: NEWARK May 13 (UPI)The city of Newark has adopted the computerized 911 telephone system for emergenay calls to police, fire and ambulance services.

title: Companies Issue Earning Reports
description: For periods ended March 31 unless other wise indivated. (N) indicales stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange. (A) American Stock Exchange and (0) OvertheCounter.

title: Dollar Falls In Tokyo
description: TOKYO, May 13 (AP)The dollar declined in moderate trading on the Tokyo foreign exchange market today after a rise yesterday promoted by concern over a Saudi Arabian oilfield fire. The fire proved to be less serious than at first feared.

title: CONSERVATIVES PERIL ALBANY BILL TO EASE LAWS ON MARIJUANA
description: ALBANY, May 13A vigorous lobbying effort by the Conservative Party, including the threat of political reprisals against individual legislators, has jeopardized compromise bill to remove criminal penalties for possession of small amounts of marijuana.

title: Case Tendered for 'Tender Land'
description: Aaron Copland's The Tender Land has never succeeded in the larger opera houses for the good reason that it is not conventionally operatic. It has been described, rightly, as a large genre scene, a portrait of a Midwestern farm family in the 1930's. It is simplistic, filled with stereotypes. There is hardly any plot to speak of. The elder daughter. on the eve of her graduation, meets n drifter, who crystalizes her desire to leave home. The music is typical of the composer's Americana stylespare. lyrical, quietly atmospheric. for the most part. The work takes its time getting started: neither action nor score grips the viewer until the firstact finale. a fine quintet called The Promise of Living.

title: Patricia Grant Becomes Bride
description: Patricia Anne Grant, daughter of Michael Donald Grant. chairman of the board of the New York Wets Baseball Club, and Mrs. Grant of Cedarhurst, L.I., and Hobe Sound. Fla., was married in Cedarhurst yesterday to Douglas Alexander Warner 3d, son of the late Mr. Warner Jr. and the late Eleanor Warner of Cincinnati. The Rev. Dr. Earl W. Pratt Jr., rector of TrinitySt. John's Episcopal Church in Hewlett, LI., performed the ceremony at the Grant home.

title: Big OTC Movers*
description: *All figures except recent bid price taken from top 50 NASDAQ upsiders and downsiders for January, February and March as compiled by the OvertheCounter Securities Review.

title: CLARA PILATES, TEACHER OF CONTROLOGY EXERCISE
description: Clara Pilates, who taught an exercise system popular with leading film stars, dancers and musicians, died yesterday in St. Clare's Hospital. She was 95 years old.

title: Twyla Tharp Gives a Premiere of Clear Mud
description: In recent years Twyla harp has become an institution with the Brooklyn Academy of Music, although quite possibly the least institutional institution one could imagine. At the Academy on Thursday Miss Tharp and her dancers came up with a gala performance, including the world premiere of a work called Mud. It should also have included Hermione Gingold, who for some incomprehensible reason was to have narrated The Bix Pieces. and for some other reason, probably far more comprehensible, called off.

title: Albany Is Called Lax in Supervision of Insurance Data
description: The financial difficulties of the Empire Mutual Insurance Company, which is on the verge of bankruptcy, did not become apparent to the New York State Insurance Department until last February because the department's requirements for statistical reporting by insurance companies are inadequate, according to the Acting Federal Insurance Administrator, J. Robert Hunter.

title: Braves Return Home and Lose Again
description: The Atlanta Braves, who ended a losing streak at 17 games by beating the Pirates in Pittsburgh on Thursday, returned to Atlanta last night and reverted to form.

title: Swiss Credit Defends Delay on Data
description: GENEVA, May 13The Swiss Credit Bank admitted today that it already knew of the multimillion dollar scandal at one of its branches before the last annual shareholders meeting although it said nothing about it at the time.

title: McGovern Calls Democratic Foes Of Carter Mainstream of Party
description: WASHINGTON, May 13  Senator George McGovern said today that Democrats who, like himself, were critical of President Carter were not a handful of liberal malcontents but the mainstream of the Democratic Party.

title: Radio
description: 69 A.M., WQXR.,Oboe Concerto, Haydn; Excerpts ; from Suite No. 4, Francoeur; Overture to L'Inganno Felice, Rossini; Chant d'Hiver, Ysaye; Salome, Hadley; Overture to Le Jugement de Midas, Gretry; En Bateau from Petite Suite. Debussy; Flamenco Concerto for Guitar and Orchestra, Torroba and Sabicas; Marche Solennelle, Tchaikovsky.

title: Consumer Notes
description: Home insulation loans of up to $500 from the state's gas and electric utilities to their customers will be available in about a month, spokesmen for the State Board of Public Utility Commissioners and the major utilities said yesterday.

title: Open Interest
description: Friday, May 13, 1977

title: Cyclone Hits Bangladesh
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, May 13 (UPI)A cyclone with 100mileanhour winds swept inland today from the Bay of Bengal, leaving one person dead, several injured and a trail of destruction in two coastal districts. Earth tremors also shook the country.

title: QUEBEC JEWS GIVEN LEVESQUE ASSURANCE
description: MONTREAL, May 13Premier Rene Levesque sought today to dispel growing fears in the Jewish community in Quebec by inviting it to help build an independent nation in the province in which all minorities would be welcome.

title: WKCR Will Start 90 Straight Hours of Jazz Tonight
description: WKCRFM, the radio station of Columbia University (89.9 on the dial), begins an adventurous experiment in jazz programming at 6 P.M. today. For 90 continuous hours, through Wednesday WKCR will broadcast the complete recorded works of the jazz musicians who make up Chicago's Association for the Advancement of Creative Musicians. On Thursday evening at 8 P.M., the first of four live concerts by the association's musicians and groups will take place at Columbia's Wollman Auditorium.

title: ALIEN AMNESTY PLAN OUTLINED BY U.S.AIDE
description: Secretary of Labor Ray Marshall said yesterday that the Carter Administration's immigration program would involve amnesty for a large number of illegal aliens now in the United States and a system of identification cards for all Americans seeking jobs.

title: Opposition Rejects Referendum
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan May 13 (AP)The Pakistani opposition condemned Prime Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto's referendum proposal as a vehicle to make him a oneparty ruler.

title: Deaths
description: BACHSara Loth on Thursday May 12, Dear mother of Richard and Alice Marcus, loving grandmother of Edward, James, Betty, David, and John. Cherished sister of Eleanor Livingston. Memorial service to be held at the Benne?t Funeral Home 824 Scarsdale Ave., Scarsdale, N.Y. Sunday May 15 at 2:30 P.M. In lieu of ?owers contributions may be made to The Audubon Society.

title: E.P.A. Proposes Auto Makers Pay for Fixing InUse Cars Violating Pollution Rules
description: WASHINGTON, May 13The Environmental Protection Agency proposed today new rules that would require automobile manufacturers to pay for fixing cars that were not meeting Federal air pollution standards while they were in use.

title: SOUND GROWTH SEEN BY BUSINESS COUNCIL
description: HOT SPRINGS. Va., May 13At the halfway point of this year's second quarter, the nation's top business executives made their semiannual pilgrimage to this mountain resort to consider the state of the economy, and concluded that it was on a sound growth path that would extend well into 1978.

title: FlipTop Collector Has 21,000
description: Tony Green, a seventhgrader from the Upper East Side, is a versatile young man with two major hobbies, stringing together the fliptops from beverage cans and making his own movies.

title: Reliance Group Head Loses Appeal On Withholding $200,000 Pledge
description: Saul P. Steinberg, chairman and president of the Reliance Group Inc., has lost an appeal before the State Court of Appeals to withhold payment of $200,000 to the Woodmere Academy, a nonprofit school on Long Island.
