title: Beyond San Juan: An Island Without Crowds
description: I had dieted myself from the middle of the middle floor at Lane Bryant to the bikini department at Lord and Taylor, and my ego demanded a maximum reward: a long weekend and my first meals in over three months. But the trip had to be really inexpensive. My husband, Dan, finally agreed to Puerto Rico and a midweek San Juan night flight, $155.20 round trip.

title: Roosevelt I. Coop Buyers Eager for Utopia to Begin
description: Rivercross, Roosevelt Island's only cooperative apartment house, is not quite a coop yetit's about 15 percent short of the 70 percent needed for closing but it is already beginning to act like one.

title: He Almost Didn't Make It
description: WRITING about a political campaign, any campaign, is not one of journalism's simpler tasks. Not only does the subject matter exist at various levels of reality and fantasy, but the people involved generally find some reason, strategic or personal, to conceal what is happening from anyone who happens to inquire, especially a reporter.

title: A SMALLER NEW YORK FORECAST FOR 1980'S
description: New York almost surely will ne a smaller city in the 1980's, but it has a good chance of being a more prosperous city as well, according to a study published last week by the Temporary Commission on City Finances.

title: Women Have Message for the Mail's Males
description: WASHINGTON  Mary Valentino works for the United States Postal Service. She is, in fact, one of its three topranking women.

title: Victoriana
description: Nothing looks better with today's romantic clothes than real Victorian jewelry a cameo brooch on a highnecked blouse. a stickpin on a lapel, a locket on a lace dress The best fun is to poke around antique shops looking for treasures. but it's also possible to find oneofakind Victonaria in the finejewelry sections of some department stores Prices range from moderate to very high, depending of course on age, workmanship and materials (a gold cross set with diamonds. pearls and tourmalines comes a lot dearer than a pendant made from an old button) But whatever the cost a good piece of Victorian jewelry is a wise investment.

title: The Long Island Weekly asked the two Democratic candidates why they wanted to be Nassau County Executive. Here are the replies from their offices:
description: T HE power to tax is the power to destroy. Chief Justice John Marshall said it in 1819, and Nassau County's present Republican administration seems determined to prove it.

title: Laetrile's Legalization in Indiana A Coup for Small Rightist Group
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 14  Indiana's Republican and Democratic leaders are expressing amazement and embarrassment that a small rightwing group has succeeded in pushing through the Legislature a law legalizing the sale of laetrile, the disputed cancer drug.

title: Notes: CorroboreesA New Rite of Spring
description: Corroboree is the Australian aborigine word for a gathering or fiesta; a boomerang, according to its boosters, is the thinking man's Frisbee. This year, as never before, boomerang corroborees are blossoming all over the country and beginning to take their place beside kiteflying contests as rites of spring.

title: A Veteran Sorter For Nature's Air Force
description: THE poet gives birds a lyrical spirit. The businessman gives them barely a glance. Grace C. Meleney gives birds a name, rank and serial number.

title: A Tokyo Airport Still Embattled After 7 Years
description: NARITA, Japan, May 12The battle lines are tightly drawn around Tokyo's new international airport, whose newness has faded before a single airliner has used its superb facilities.

title: EZRA Z. SHAPIRO, 74, U.S. ZIONIST FIGURE
description: Ezra Z. Shapiro, a lawyer who was active in the Zionist movement for more than half a century, died in Jerusalem Friday night. He was 74 years old.

title: Thais Ban Film on Entebbe Raid
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 14 (AP)An Americanmade movie dramatizing the Iaraeli rescue of hostages from Uganda's Entebbe airport has been banned in Thailand, the national police announced today. Officials said that the film, Raid on Entebbe, might endanger relations between Thailand and Arab countries and was unfair in its treatment of the Middle East issue.

title: Ann Brewster, Lawyer, Bride Of W. L. Irwin
description: Ann Blair Brewster, a lawyer with Simpson Thacher & Bartlett, was married yesterday in Ro?hester ?? William Langer Irwin, a certified public accountant. The Rev. Robert Wainwright performed the ceremony in St. Paul's Episcopal Church.

title: A Motocross Glossary
description: Berm: Rutlike banked curve in twist of the track. When it is taken at the proper angle, a rider can perform berm shot and increase his speed.

title: A Boom Grows in the Dust
description: Acouple of hundred people from all over the Island, New Jersey, Connecticut and Pennsylvania gathered at Bridgehampton one recent Saturday to shoot the berms, rollercoaster over the whoopdedos and perform wheelies,'hole shots and daring crossups in midair.

title: Hnueilings
description: KALTMANFannie. A monument to the memory of the late Fannie Kaltman will be unvelled at Beth David Cemetery, Elmont, L.I., on Sunday, May 22, at 10:33 A.M.

title: It's Academic Robes Today for Marymount's Hank
description: THE story is told at Marymount College of the day a noted personality arrived for commencement, to be met at the Tarry town station by the then president, Dr. John J. Meng. The celebrity walked right past him, however, extending his hand to the tall, silverhaired distinguishedlooking groundskeeper and driver, Clarence Speight.

title: The Golf Clinic
description: Jack Nicklaus isn't the longest driver on the tour but he's probably the smartestand that's more telling.

title: FollowUp on the News
description: From 1970 to 1972, Baby Lenore was in headline after headline. Born out of wedlock in New York in May 1970, she was surrendered for adoption by her mother and ended up in the home of Nicholas and Jean DeMartino in Brooklyn. Then the natural mother, Olga Scarpetta, a 32yearold Colombian, welleducated and of a wealthy background, changed her mind and sued to regain the child.

title: Mexican Oil Refinery Explodes
description: REYNOSA, Mexico, May 14 (AP)At least two explosions rocked the Petroleos Mexicanos refinery in this Mexican border city late Friday. No serious injuries were reported. Firemen from five American cities were called across the Rio Grande to assist Mexican firemen in battling the blaze.

title: 3 NATIONS RESUMING MEKONG RIVER PLAN
description: BANGKOK, Thailand. May 14Vietnam, Laos and Thailand have agreed to resume the development of the water resources of the Mekong River and its sprawling basin.

title: Harness Racing
description: The New York Sires Stakes continues at Yonkers on Friday night with a $25,000 pace. On Saturday, Jazy Spark and Mannart Stone are two of the eligibles in the $25,000 Canadian American Series at Yonkers.

title: Vanishing Shoreline Erodes Contentment
description: TWENTY years ago, few beachfront property owners living along the shores and cliffs facing the Sound thought about erosion. Now, however, they see more water and less beach each year, and erosionthe loss of sand along the shore and soil along the tops and bases of cliffs is an urgent, perplexing and expensive problem that they cannot afford to ignore.

title: A Jury With a Grand Tradition
description: TWENTYTHREE swornin per sons file into the Grand Jury Room upstairs in Westchester County's Courthouse. Their day will be with 20 cases. They will decide, by majority vote, whether a crime has been committed and whether an accused, arrested, arraigned person will be indicted for it.

title: NONFICTION IN BRIEF
description: Dutch politics is not exactly the stuff of dreams, and even the brilliant and tireless young author of this 300,000word woolly mammoth apologizes for its presumptuous bulk. Simon Schama should, however, feel proud of what his 10 years in the archives of the Netherlands have wrought. Anyone aroused by the idea of history or by the spectacle of human complication will by no means be wasting the time it takes to read through this intelligent. analytical narrative of

title: Staff of the Public Service Agency Opposes Telephone Rate Increase
description: The New York Telephone Company's request for a rate increase of $393 million should be denied completely, the staff of the New York State Public Service Commission says.

title: CAMERA VIEW
description: Most people agree that there are an increasing number of revealing and expressive photographs appearing in books, periodicals and exhibitsand one reason for this is that in many cases grants have played an important role in making these photographs possible.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: The existence of two separate Federal antitrust enforcement agencies with mostly overlapping powers puzzles people who have not followed the historical development of American antitrust enforcement.

title: Canadiens Win Stanley Cup
description: The Montreal Canadiens defeated the Boston Bruins, 21, in overtime and captured the Stanley Cup with a fourgame sweep of the National Hockey League playoff finals. Section 5.

title: Miss Emerson Bride in Jersey
description: Christ Episcopal Church in Short Hills, N.J., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Sandra Leigh Emerson, daughter of Fred R. Emerson of Short Hills and the late Suzanne Gould Emerson, to Peter Hoguet Helmer, son of Mr. and Mrs. George A. Helmer of San Francisco.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTONWhen A.A. Sommer Jr. left the Securities and Exchange Commission last spring with a sharp blast at the agency, there was no reason to think it would be hard to find a successor.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: EVERYONE I KNEW in Connecticut had already been there except me. I don't enjoy betting, never having won anything, not a horse race or even a raffle. So to the fronton to watch jai alai in Bridgeport was not a very attactive idea, especially on a wild sleeting night. I'm not a bettor, I said. But my friend insisted that I see it at least once.

title: Cecilia A. Hellmann Is Wed to Donald Fraser
description: In St. Gertrude's Roman Catholic Church in Bayville, L. I., yesterday afternoon, Cecilia Ann Hellmann, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Charles Hellmann of Locust Valley, L. I., became the bride of Donald William Fraser, son of Mr. and Mrs. A. Wallace Fraser of Manhasset, L. I. The Rev. William Jablonski performed the ceremony.

title: For Some, the Vietnam War Goes On
description: FOR George and Helen Shine of Pleasantville, the Vietnam War was both a time of pride and nightmare. And it's not over yet. Their oldest son, Alexander, suffered shrapnel wounds over much of his body when a grenade exploded near him in 1969. In 1970, their youngest son, Jonathan, was killed. Since Dec. 2, 1972, their third son, Anthony, has been missing in action.

title: HARSH SOVIET ATTACK SAYS CHINA PREPARES FOR FULLSCALE WAR
description: MOSCOW, May 14The Soviet Union published a harsh and significant attack on China today that seemed to move relations between the two former Communist allies back to their low point before the death of Mao Tsetung eight months ago.

title: Arts and Leisure Guide
description: In between Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man and Ulysses, James Joyce wrote his only play, called Exiles, which grapples with the risks taken in breaking the bonds of conventional morality and, in ways, parallels Joyce's own artistic struggles. The play was first produced in Munich in 1919, had its first New York performance in 1925 and its first London performance the following year. Exiles turned up again in New York in 1957 and 1971, in productions Off Off Broadway, and in London in 1970, when Harold Pinter staged it with John Wood and Vivian Merchant. Now Circle Repertory Company has decided to have a crack at it. Exiles opens Thursday at the company's theater in the Village. (See Theater)

title: Marathon Runners Head for Yonkers
description: MARATHON fever is running very high for next Sunday's Yonkers Marathon. Although not quite so exalted as the Boston Marathon, run a month ago, the Yonkers race is one of the most renowned marathons in the country and the second oldest, next to Boston's. Marking its 41st birthday this year, the 26mile, 385yard race will attract marathoners from all over the country.

title: Long Island, This Week
description: AMAGANSETTSensitive Approach to Nature, watercolors by Rose E. Millevolte; Thursday through Sunday, 11 A.M. to 5 P.M. Gallery East, Main St. Reception today 2 to P.M.

title: Sneva Officially Surpasses 200 M.P.H. In Gaining Pole for Indianapolis 500
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 14The Indianapolis 500 motor race at last achieved a 200milesanhour lap speed today. Equally momentous, A.J. Foyt, ol Super Tex himself, was booed by an Indy crowd.

title: SATURDAY NIGHT LIVE!
description: Whether he was a victim of a voluntary impeachment or of his own Watergate crimes, Richard Nixon's fate was almost certainly sealed during the tumultuous hours that have come to be called the Saturday Night Massacre. The timing of that historic event was ordained, more or less, by the Federal courts. In August,1973 Judge John Sirica ruled, at the request of Special Prosecutor Archibald Cox, that Nixon must hand over his taperecorded conversations with the White House Watergate conspirators. In September the U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia heard the case, ordered the parties to seek an outofcourt solution, then began considering its own decision when the compromise failed.

title: Soccer
description: Pal, Chinaglia and the Cosmos have 2:05 games in Giants Stadium in the Meadowlands today against the Fort Lauderdale Strikers and next Sunday against the Chicago Sting. The New York Apollo of the American Soccer League have a 3:30 P.M. game next Sunday against the Cleveland Cobras at Hofstra in Hempstead, L.I.

title: Miss Staats Is Wed To R. W. Simmons
description: Margaret Ann Staats, director of studies at Grace Church School, and Robert Wagner Simmons of New York, a principal with the First American Securities Corporation, were married yesterday in the chantry of Grace Episcopal Church by the Rev. FitzSimons Allison.

title: Nehemiah Wins 4 Events
description: ELIZABETH, N.J., May 14Renaldo Nehemiah of Scotch PlainsFanwood showed a new facet of his amazing talents as he tied the New Jersey scholastic record of 20.9 seconds for the 220yard dash at the Watchung Conference meet today at Williams Field.

title: EnglishtownDawn Lights the Way To Bargains at the Flea Market
description: IT IS 4 A.M. on a spring Saturday. The back roads of Manalapan Township are damp with morning fog, and the only sound is the occasional squish of a tire through a puddle as a convoy of cars moves inexorably on, at a constant pace, headlights piercina the darkness.

title: THE NOTSOCOOL JODY POWELL
description: One morning in 1975, Joseph Lester Powell Jr. (better known as Jody) awoke in a now forgotten motel room to find a small mound of pillows and garments scattered over and around him. Sleeping in the other bed was James Earl Carter Jr. (better known as Jimmy). I thought, says Powell: My God, did I steal Jimmy's pillows? That's weird.

title: Trying to Keep G.O.P. on Top
description: RUNNING the Republican Party in Westchester these days is not an easy task. Steadily and remorselessly,. Democrats, emocrats, once a fragile political minority, have been closing the numbers gapthey are now only 15,500 behind in enrollmentand are gobbling up public offices once safely Republican.

title: Tufariello Captures 2 Races in Hartford
description: HARTFORD, May 14Tony Tufariello of Hewlett, I.I., ran a meetrecord 47.3 seconds for the 440yard run after winning the 220 yard dash in 21.3 seconds today in the windswept Hartford Public Schools invitation track meet.

title: Felicia Eth, Literary Agent, Is Married to Kenneth Aron
description: Felicia Eth, a literary agent with Writers House Inc., was married last night to Kenneth Paul Aron, a doctoral candidate in chemistry at the State University at Stony Brook, L.I. Rabbi Stanley Gerstein performed the ceremony at Temple Beth Am. in Teaneck, N.J.

title: PAPERBACK TALK
description: Pioneer's tale. As a girl she horrifies her parents by bearing a child out of wedlock. As a young student she develops a crush on her professor, a ruggedly, handsome, tyrannical scholargenius, who lets her perform the drudgework of his research. For a time, even after she's borne his child, he delays marriage, on the ground that she may be partJewish. Later, as the professor's wife, she meets an American Indian, a gentle, goodhumored man, whom she ultimately marries and with whom she lives happily ever after.

title: For Maximum Efficiency
description: Whether for patriotic reasons or purely personal economic reasons, most people nowadays are interested in taking steps to lower energy consumption in their home and thus keep electric bills from climbing any higher than absolutely necessary. With warm weather almost upon us (or already here in some places), one way to do this is to make certain that room air conditioners are properly maintained and sensibly operated so that the homeowner or apartment dweller gets maximum cooling efficiency out of each watt consumed.

title: Tennis
description: The only world Team Tennis home game for the Apples tans weeK is at 7:30 Tuesday night in the Felt Forum against Rod Laver and the San Diego Friars.

title: In Summary
description: Three Federal agenciesthe Food and Drug Administration, the Environmental Protection Agency and the Consumer Product Safety Commission have announced a proposed timetable for the banning of fluorocarbon gases used as propellants in aerosol cans. The gases, which are thought to deplete the stratospheric ozone layer that protects the earth against ultraviolet radiation from the sun, would be phased out over the next two years, with manufacture ending in October 1978 and interstate transport prohibited in April 1979.

title: In Love With the Game
description: A Baseball Companion.

title: EARTHLY POSSESSIONS
description: And her wonderful new book comes in the wake of six lovingly acclaimed novels:

title: Striking Up The Band
description: THREE weeks after this advertisement appeared in local newspapers, Staff Sgt. Perry Lipkin had 55 bona fide responses. Said Sergeant Lipkin, who is the recruiting and retention officer for the 199th Army Band: There's an incredible amount of talent in Westchester. We've signed up a new generation of band fans in march time.

title: DINING OUT
description: THE temptation to award three stars'to Mayfair Farms is great. Several of the selections at a recent dinner were outstanding arid a couple of them were superb. However, a few careless and inexcusable lapses dictate otherwise.

title: Something to Fight About
description: Something to Fight About

title: Who's Who Who's Black
description: WHEN I was a child in Harlem, we often repeated some doggerel that summed up a lot of black sociology:

title: Votes in Congress
description: Last Week's Tally for the Metropolitan Area Senate No Votes.

title: Costikyan Pulls Out Of Mayoral Contest And Supports Koch
description: Short of money and persuaded that he and Representative Edward I. Koch were splitting the same potential constituency, Edward N. Costikyan pulled out of the race for the Democratic nomination for Mayor yesterday and became Mr. Koch's campaign cochairman.

title: Randi Burke Bride Of Thomas Opladen
description: St Teresa's Roman Catholic Church in Summit, N.J., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Randi Joan Burke, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Terence George Burke of Summit, to Thomas John Opladen, son of Mrs. John Opladen of Candlewood Isle, Conn., and the late Mr. Opladen.

title: Events Today
description: United Cerebral Palsy BlkeAThon: Celebrities, news and sports figures and the Public ride bicycles to raise money for Cerebral Palsy; 10 A.M.; Central Park at 72d Street and Fifth Avenue.

title: Falling Bricks Hit Restaurant on Central Park South
description: A 40foot section of brickwork broke away from the 25thfloor east facade of the Park Lane Hotel on Central Park South yesterday afternoon, raining thousands of bricks onto parked cars, sidewalks and the root of an adjacent 15thfloor penthouse restaurant crowded with diners.

title: New jersey/This Week
description: ACTOR'S CAFETHEATER, 263 Central Avenue, East OrangeEndgame. Thursday through Saturday, 8:30 P.M. Opens Friday (through June 18). $3.90$5.50; students and the elderly, $2.50$3.90; group rates. (201) 6751881.

title: The Product Is the Hero
description: The ads for Real are pure chocolate cake in the words of the advertising agencydark, rich and basic in their appeal. The Real message, conveyed by tobacco leaves and roughgrained wood, focuses on one Ideaa natural cigarette with nothing artificial added. There will be no cowboys, no skindivers, no New York models swinging in the woods, in fact, no people at all In the ads.

title: Vance, in Iran, Asserts Stability Depends on Rights:
description: TEHERAN, Iran, May 14Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance said today that the stability of a nation ultimately depended upon it granting human rights to its citizens rather than denying those rights to suppress dissent.

title: CHESS
description: Oleg Romanishin, the young Russian grandmaster who won the 52d Hastings International Tournament this year, has an aggressive style epitomized by great enthusiasm for speculative pawn sacrifices.

title: Stockton, After Downing Gerulaitis, Plays Connors in W.C.T. Final Today
description: DALLAS, May 14There's nothing like a touch of adversity and a few defeats to inspire Jimmy Connors.

title: Pregnancies Rising
description: THERE are approximately 332,000 girls in grades seven through 12 in New Jersey's public schools, and medical experts familiar with the situation expect more than 60,000 of them to get pregnant this year.

title: FISHING
description: THIS is the week that the devoted saltwater fisherman looks forward to all winter. Big striped bass should be arriving along the New Jersey coast, and this week also should mark the arrival of bluefish off Atlantic City and the end of the mackerel run along the northern sections of the state's coastline.

title: SHOP TALK
description: WHEN friends challenged Harriet Durkin to make use of her early retailing experience and open a shop of her own, she decided to return to her heritage.

title: The Education of the Blind and Deaf Children
description: Only a few years ago the diagnosis that a child was blind was followed by a recommendation that he be sent to a residential school for the blind. At that time, more than 80 percent of all visually impaired children were enrolled in such institutions; by 1973 the figure had dropped to 35 percent. The other 65 percent were attending regular classes in local schools.

title: Amy Handler Engaged To Michael Caldarola
description: A?my, Handler, who expects to be graduated May 28 from San Francisco State University, and Michael Caldarola, an instructor in English there, will be married in August in San Franoisco.

title: L'Aventura
description: 135Central Park Road, Plainview. 6810977. Atmosphere: Fairly small, somewhat formal restaurant with considerable but not expensive decoration. Recommended dishes: lnsalata di mare, mussels marinara, baked clams, cannelloni emiliana, stuffed veal chop, cannoli, Italian cheesecake, zuppa inglese.

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: May 20  Night stock car racing opens at Riverhead (L.I.) Raceway, Route 58, starting at 7:30.

title: Poll Shows Inflation, Rather Than Unemployment, Is Top Concern
description: In the last year, inflation has passed unemployment as the dominant economic concern of Americans, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll, even among some social and economic groups that have traditionally harbored the greatest fear of unemployment.

title: HUMOR
description: My grandfather used to say that squash is delicious if you like squash; and this gastric profundity also applies to kinds of humor; one man's chateaubriand is another man's Spam. When radio's Molly said,

title: Rockland High School Finds Antidote for Senioritis
description: SPRING VALLEY, N. Y.  The East Ramapo School District in Rockland County believes it has found a cure for for senioritis, the disease that invariably strikes seniors once they have been accepted at colloge.

title: What They Are Saying
description: Duane Bohick, to TV interviewer in the dressing room after his 58second knockout by Ken Norton: I guess you have a lot of [air] lime to kill, huh?

title: The Moped Revolution
description: The moped is the readymade answer to President Carter's energy program.

title: Tuttle Scores Double in Loucks Track
description: WHITE PLAINS, May 14John Tuttle likes to use the woods and hills around his home in rural upstate New York to train for his races. Today at the 10th annual Loucks Games he used the handsome track at White Plains High School as a demonstration ground to show how such training pays off.

title: Local Radio: A Growing Voice
description: THE pay is low and there is no overtime. The hours are long and one day often melts into the next. The dinner party that was planned at home months ago is canceled because of local fire or murder that has to be covered at cocktail time. There is no union to negotiate fringe benefits, such as sleep, because the company is too small bother withusually only 15 to 25 people. There is no other job to go to in a tight economy, and the waiting list for what jobs there are is growing. Smile, you're on local radio.

title: BOOK ENDS
description: IT'S always pleasant to see a novelist make an auspicious debut, which is what John Casey did with his first novel, An American Romance. John Leonard, among other celebrants, said the book made him feel better about the future of the novel, and since good first novelists are the future of the novel, I decided to intercept Mr. Casey at his publication party.

title: Murky Outlook on Water Zoning
description: HOLD everything. In an effort to help clean up Connecticut's waters, the state's Department of Environmental Protection has few new regulations. But opponents say such good intentions could well be the shoals on which recreational boating in the state founders.

title: Albany Officials Debate Extension Of Law on Apartment Conversions
description: ALBANY, May 14Democrats and Republicans in the State Senate have drafted separate proposals to change the laws governing the conversion of rental apartments to cooperatives or condominiums. Their action makes it unlikely that regulations will be allowed to expire completely and makes it equally unlikely that they will continue in their present form.

title: COTTON MILLS RESIST COST OF CURBING DUST
description: COLUMBIA, S.C., May 14I just started to smother after I had been working in the spinning room for a few years. Flossie Strickland said.

title: Mary McCarty The Quintessential Character Actress?
description: Imagine Chicago, opening night, without the adrenalin of Mary McCarty, as the venal prison matron, belting When You're Good to Mama, Mama's Good to You! Or Follies, without Mary McCarty lining out Who's That Woman? Her name's not brightly lighted on marquees, but when electricity's needed, they call McCarty. In fact, Moss Hart, rehearsing Miss Liberty in 1949, told her. Go out on stage and make lightning. So, in a sense, did Jos Quintero, director of the current Anna Christie. He needed, for the role of Marthy Owen, the play's aged, goodhumored souse, an actress who could help resuscitate O'Neill's sluggish first act ; who could make lightning even opposite the voltaic Liv Ullmann. Though the role would be a total departure for a musicalcomedy performer, Quintero called anyway. And of course, auditions are unthinkable for a woman on whom directors traditionally depend for strong starsupport.

title: New Toronto Building Halves Use of Energy
description: TORONTOExecutives of Ontario Hydro, the Governmentowned corporation that supplies electricity to Canada's most populous province, believe they have achieved a breakthrough in energy conservation with the radical design of their new headquarters, a crescentshaped, partly glassenclosed office tower in downtown Toronto called Hydro Place.

title: Quarter Horses Go to Post In Yaphank on Thursday
description: YAPHANK, L.I., May 14Parr Meadows held its first race yesterday, but it was an unofficial one in which six horses competed out of the regulation starting gate. The winner of the 350yard exhibition chase down the backstretch was Smooth Eugene, owned and trained by Kevin Chumney of Mineral City. Ohio.

title: Shore Birds: A Fight for Life
description: IN A FEW WEEKS the Connecticut shores of Long Island Sound will be invaded by thousands of people bent on simple pleasuresa suntan, a salty swim, a frozen custard cone. But right now, another invasion is taking there, that has been annually almost since the beginning of the world. The invaders are birds and they are bent on businessserious, lifeanddeath business.

title: Future Events
description: Tickets to the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: 16 Cases of Plague in U.S. in 1976
description: ATLANTA ,May 14 (AP)Sixteen cases of human plague, including nine in New Mexico, occurred in the United States last year, according to the national Center for Disease Control. The center reported yesterday that this compared with 20 cases nationwide in 1975. Four cases were reported in Arizona, two in California and one in Colorado, the center said. Three of the victims died. Plague is primarily a disease of rodents and is transmitted to humans by fleas, but it also can be transmitted from one person to another.

title: An Unlikely Budget Alliance
description: TWO neglected minorities in the General Assembly have discovered each other, or think they have, to the consternation of Governor Grasso, her budgetmakers and the Democratic leaders of the legislature.

title: Signal From the Left
description: PARIS, May 14You have arrived, a French official told a visiting American the other day, at what may have been the turning point. No doubt this was an optimistic view, but things did look a little better this week for French Government that must face parliamentary elections early next year and that has been trailing badly in the polls.

title: Generic Drugs: An Aye Vote
description: DRUG TOPICS of last Feb. 15 had a fullpage advertisement on its inside cover offering the medication Chlordiazepoxide under another brand name at 40% less than it cost under its original brand name.

title: DEMOCRATIC GROUP BACKS CARTER ON HUMAN RIGHTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (AP)  The Coalition for a Democratic Majority praised President Carter today for his tough stand on human rights and his approach to disarmament and urged him to hang tough.

title: Article 8  No Title
description: James Doyle, formerly assistant for public affairs to Archibald Cox, is currently in the Washington bureau of Newsweek. This excerpt is taken from his forthcoming book, Not Above the Law, which will be published in June.

title: POLITICS
description: THERE is an old story in Essex County to the effect that, when Nicholas Caputo became County Clerk, his predecessor passed on to him two thingsthe key to the office and the secret for conducting successful ballot drawings.

title: The Dream of the Good Society
description: Of all the revisions and revaluations taking place during the past quartercentury in the history of Western thought, none has been more illuminating than the continuing exploration of the sources of modern revolutionary radicalism: the radicalism that became visible in the French Revolution, gained momentum in the 19th century, and has so much affected the political topography of the 20th. Once, we limited these sources almost automatically to the Enlightenment ideals of Reason and Progress. We didn't often think of religion as significantly involved. After all, wasn't religionespecially Christianityone of the prime targets of this radicalism? That this new radicalism might itself be a form of religion, one dependent upon essentially religious drives and cravings, did not often enter our commentaries on the subject down through the 1930's.

title: Rx on Malpractice
description: ANY discussion of the complex medical malpractice situation in Connecticut must commence with two relatively simple Is there there is a problem, is there a solution? The answer to both questions is a definite and emphatic, yes.

title: Wheat on Credit
description: These are not the best or worst of times for the nation's grain farmers as they head toward another binbusting season of wheat, corn and the lesser grains.

title: World News Briefs
description: CAIRO, May 14 (UPI)Foreign Minister Ismail Fahmy said today that he would meet the Soviet Foreign Minister, Andrei A. Gromyko, somewhere in Europe June 910 in a new attempt to repair the severely damaged relations between Cairo and Moscow.

title: In Smmary
description: If Watergate was the shame of Richard Nixon's Administration, foreign affairs was its pride, and the contrast was reflected in Mr. Nixon's second television interview with David Frost. Speaking effusively last week, as he did not in the Watergate interview, Mr. Nixon claimed for himself the credit for United States diplomatic initiatives from 1968 to 1974 and depreciated the influence of his foreign policy adviser throughout that period, Henry Kissinger.

title: Is This Shepard Or Saroyan?
description: LONDON Curse of the Starving Class is the kind of title one might expect to find on the marquees around the turn of the century, alongside Dion Boucicault's The Streets of New York or Edward Sheldon's Salvation Nell. Nor is the ring of melodrama restricted to the title for, in Sam Shepard's newest and least characteristic play, although mortgages are not foreclosed nor distressed damsels threatened by overbearing landlords, there is an impoverished suburban family, an intrigue concerning the sale of property, an alcoholic paterfamilias, a scheming mother, a wayward daughter and a denouement in which miraculous conversions take place and a wretched retribution falls upon the head of a tragic son.

title: Children Good and Bad
description: THOMAS WILLIAMS is the author of six novels Ceremony of Love, Town Burning, Tne Night of Trees, A High New House, Whippie's Castle, The Hair of Harold Roux (winner a National Book Award in ]975)and now a seventh, Tsuga's Children. Williams has always been more a preacher and entertainer than a serious novelist.

title: Gateway Agency Wins Key Victory
description: THE FIRST major test of the Connecticut River Gateway, landmark agreement that is designed to preserve the lower Connecticut River Valley below Middle town, has been won by the unit. Future challenges to that result may include legal test of the agreement itself.

title: Quarter Horse Racing
description: The longdelayed $30 million Parr Meadows course in Yaphank, L.I., (Exit 68, Long Island Expressway) is scheduled to open Thursday night at 8 o'clock. The 180day, sixnightaweek stand, which runs through Dec. 3, continues on Friday and Saturday nights. The track is dark Sundays. The parimutuel betting includes exacta, quinella and daily double betting. Local OTB and Nassau Downs betting parlors also take wagers.

title: A Field Ripe for Nondevelopment
description: THINK of suburban America, and pictures of split ruches, shopping centers, acres of parking fields, gasoline stations and a few strategically placed parks come into view. Nassau County is no exception.

title: 29,528 of the 433,000 Eligible Apply for Upgrading Military Discharges
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (UPI)A relatively small number of Vietnam war veterans eligible to have their general or undesirable discharges upgraded under Carter Administration program have applied for the upgrading, the Defense De partment said today.

title: The Secret of Achieving a Champion's Sparkling Coat
description: When Glorvina Schwartz enters the show ring with her shimmering silver and gold coated Ch. Sandina Sparkling Champagne, spectators assume it has taken endless hours to achieve the Afghan's splendrous coat. Surprisingly, this is not the case. Grooming on him is much less work than most people would imagine, said Mrs. Schwartz, who is his breeder, coowner and handler. I never touch Pinky with a brush during the week. He's bathed about every five or six days. I use hair conditioner on his coat and, at times, I like to experiment with people's shampoos.

title: From China to Wallingford
description: IT'S BEEN more than 25 years since John T. Downey, a young Yale graduate with an attitude he recalls as a mixture of idealism and selfinterest, joined an obscure Government organization called the Central Intelligence Agency. A little more than year later, on a flying mission during the Korean war, he parachuted into China and was captured.

title: Survivors of Jewish Resistance Recall Their Struggle at Reunion
description: In July 1942, a young Jewish Resistance fighter smuggled a letter penned in her own blood out of a Gestapo compound near the Polish town of Vilna.

title: INTERVIEW
description: AFTER nearly a lifetime devoted to medicine and publichealth service, Dr. James R. Cowan was expected to corn plete his professional career as a senior vice president of Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Greater New York. He was highly paid there, and highly insulated from the pressures and controversy that mark hospital administration and public health.

title: State Hunting Welfare Cheats
description: IN March, Atlantic County put four mothers in jail as welfare cheats. The month before that, seven mothers were jailed in the same county for the same reason.

title: A Bonanza of Haydn Piano Sonatas on Record
description: In the world of live music, Joseph Haydn has long occupied the rather unglamorous position of warmup composer. His symphonies, string quartets, piano sonatas, et al., are frequently found on concert programs (although usually the same handful of staples), but they generally serve as throatclearing introductions to the main item of businessa Mahler symphony, a Beethoven quartet or a largescale piano work of Schumann. The image of good old Papa Haydn, harmless, genial but a bit of a bore, dies hard.

title: In Dance, Something for Everyone
description: A mixed bill bringing together Jerome Robbins's Les Noces and Alvin Ailey's The River for the first time this season was seen Friday night at the Metropolitan Opera House. For the evening American Ballet Theater also included Glen Tetley's Voluntaries and the grand pas de deux from Don Quixote.

title: Colborn of Royals Pitches NoHitter
description: KANSAS CITY, May 14Jim Colborn pitched the first nohitter of the baseball season tonight, leading the Kansas City Royals to a 60 victory over the Texas Rangers at Royals Stadium.

title: LETTER FROM WASHINGTON
description: FRAUD. That's the key word used by opponents of the Carter Administration bill that would require states to permit potential voters to register for Federal elections at polling places on Election Day.

title: THEATER
description: IT'S only been around for a fraction over a year, but it seems time to add the Downtown Cabaret Theater of Bridgeport to the glories of Connecticut theater. But the D.C.T. different from the other theaters in Connecticut; only the proscenium stage is common factor.

title: Dollie Shen Planning Nuptials on June 25
description: Dollie MeiNing Shen, an investment trust officer at the Chemical Bank, and William H. Harris, an assistant vice president with the Irving Trust Company's Personnal Banking Division, will be married June 25 in New York.

title: How Long Can the Ozone Take the Fluorocarbons?
description: At a critical point in the earth's historyno one is sure just when and whythe earth's atmosphere accumulated enough oxygen to begin forming an ozone layer from a few to 30 miles high. This oxygen revolution made possible the evolution of the higher forms of life, while its byproduct, ozone, protected that life from the most searing forms of ultraviolet sunlight.

title: The Fire Next Time
description: On Monday morning, June 13, 1977, the first effects of the Saudi Arabian pipeline fire began be felt at the Exxon refinery at Baytown,N.J., and elsewhere in the United States. The summer driving season had, of course, already begun; the July 4 weekend was coming up fast. Without the fire, American refineries would have been turning out vast amounts of gasoline. The tankers that should

title: O.A.S. DISTURBED AS U.S. PROPOSES CUT IN SUPPORT
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (UPI)Officials of the Organization of American States have been disturbed by a proposal of the Carter Administration for a 25 percent cut In the $40 million annual United States contribution to the body.

title: It Was Less Complicated to Take One Bill at a Time
description: WASHINGTONIn a city where form has traditionally mattered a great deal, a new structure is struggling to attain the status now accorded to the clearing of judicial appointments with Senators, the waiting by bureaucrats secretaries to see whose boss gets on the phone first and the leaving oftough constitutional questions to the deliberations of the United States Supreme Court.

title: Marijuana Penalties: No Changes Likely
description: UNLIKE New York, where the Legislature is moving to ease criminal penalties for marijuana use, legislators in New Jersey say there is little likelihood of similar action in Trenton this year.

title: GARDENING
description: FLOWER gardens were bright and cheerful from early spring to late fall in grandmother's day. It is doubtful that she spent much time planting her garden. More than likely it just happened.

title: Florence Juliet Married
description: Florence Elizabeth Juliet, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Eduardo Juliet of Scarsdale, N. Y., and Robert Francis Mackey, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Mackey of Salem, Mass., were married yesterday in Our Lady of Fatima Roman Catholic Church in Scarsdale. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Virgilio Ranco.

title: Carey's Ties With Party Leaders Deteriorate in Mayoral Campaign
description: Governor Carey's break with New York City Democratic leaders over Mayor Beame's expected candidacy for reelection and his threat to bolt the Democratic party if necessary to support Secertary of State Mario M. Cuomo is only the latest  although clearly the most stunning  development in a steadily deteriorating relationship with the Democratic party leadership.

title: Yankees Beat Angels, 41, as Nettles Clouts Two
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., May 14Two home runs by Graig Nettles and fourhit pitching by Don Gullett were enough for the Yankees to overcome Nolan Ryan and the California Angels tonight, 41. Gullett walked four and struck out nine. Ryan fanned eight.

title: Dingle Drenched And Dingle Dry
description: We were two Minnesotans circling Ireland by rented carI at the wheel and Joe yelling Left! whenever showed signs of veering over to the American side of the road. We had seen cousins in Kilkenny, monastic ruins in Cashel, the glass factory in Waterford and nothing worth remembering (despite its memorable name) in Tipperary. Now we were making our way through the narrow streets of Dingle.

title: DINING OUT
description: THE Traveler's Rest reflects an era when eating out was a planahead family treat. The building that now houses the restaurant in Millwood, N.Y., is new, only about six years old, but it adjoins the original inn, which goes back fleast to the turn of the century and perhaps many years before that. It has two rooms on the main floor and two on a lower level. All four look out on a garden 'at the rear where ducks stroll through a manicured garden with a manmade stream meandering through it. In the middle distance is a waterfall surrounded by evergreens aglow with twinkling lights. It's all of piece, right down to the golden oldies from the 1930's and 90's wafting gently through the sound system.

title: Lea Fitzhugh Wed To Elvin C. Welch
description: Lea Armistead Fitzhugh and Elvin Carl Welch were married yesterday in the Village Church in Rancho Santa Fe, Calif. The Rev. Donald Caughey performed the Presbyterian ceremony.

title: Sunday Observer
description: The latest aberration in the American pursuit of happiness is the feelgood movement. The country is swarming with swamis from Asia, quacks from California and evangelists of sexual joy, narcotic paradise, communal contentment and dining ecstasy. Psychologists who can whip off a quick volume of tips on how to feel good 24 hours a day adorn the bestseller lists. In the warm baths surrounding Disneyland West, gurus of feelgood preside over group gropes aimed at squeezing the nasty wrinkles out of psyches yearning for a peace ineffable.

title: New York City's Factory Wages Went Up by 80%, but Bought Less
description: Now, here, you see, it takes all the running you can do, to keep in the same place. If you want to get somewhere else, you must run at least twice as fast as that.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: PERSONAL INCOME ROSE 9.1 percent, the Commerce Department reported, with average per capita income climbing from $5,903 in 1975 to $6,441 In 1976. . . . Citibank led a rise In the prime rate from 6 percent to 6 percent. . . . The nation's basic money supply [cash plus checking account balances] declined by $16 billion in the latest statement week to $321.2 billion, according to the Federal Reserve Board....Gold closed in London at $148.15 an ounce on Friday, down from $148.75 an ounce a week earlier. . . .April retail sales totaled $59.4 billion. 11 nercent ahead of April 1976.

title: Coppola's Vietnam Movie Is a Battle Royal
description: LOS ANGELES Coppola went wild, recalled one participant in the arduous shooting in the Philippines of Apocalypse Now, Francis Ford Coppola's epic about the Vietnam War. He had temper tantrums. There was a scene in which I am screaming that the napalm has ruined the surf. I was supposed to yell something and then walk away. By this time, I was so sick and frustrated with the picture that when I did the scene, I did something which wasn't in the script. I threw a prop 20 feet in the air. Coppola screamed, Cut! That was terrific! He came over to me and said, How did you have such an inspiration? I said, I did it because I couldn't take your goddam tantrums any longer!

title: Monaco, but Not Las Vegas
description: LONG BEACH

title: ART VIEW
description: There is probably more modern sculpture now being produced in a single year in this country than some of the key figures in the creation of modern sculptureBrancusi, say, or Gonzalezmanaged to produce in an entire lifetime. Sculpture abounds as never before. Some 25 years ago Andr Malraux correctly observed that sculpture was an art the modern age had rediscovered, but today it occupies a central and unquestioned place in our artistic culture.

title: Hunt for Welfare Cheats
description: Earlier this month, the Legislature approved a proposed law that would allow the state to take part in a new Federal program designed to keep unemployed husbands at home.

title: There Is Controversy Over Best Methods for the Deaf
description: It took several years for the Wrights to accept that their child was profoundly deaf. They said: At first we were plunged into blackness. We didn't know what to do. There is no book that tells you how to raise a deaf child. In fact, the Wrights discovered, there has long been a divisive controversy among experts over the best way to educate a deaf child.

title: Paperbacks:
description: THE CARTER FAMILY SCRAPBOOK, by James Neyland. (Grosset & Dunlap/Today Press, $3.95.) Late last year writerphotographer Jim Neyland, on assignment in Plains, Ga., was befriended by Lillian Carter: he used his entree to her family's inner circles and their picture collections to compile this candid, disarmingly homey album about the world of Jimmy and Rosalynn Carter, their lives and kinfolk.

title: 351 Shot Is Victor In Withers
description: Even the winning jockey couldn't believe it.

title: Schroeder Falters but Holds Lead By Shot Over Crenshaw With a 202
description: FORT WORTH, May 14 (UPI)John Schroeder slumped on the back nine today, bogeyed two of the last three holes, lost almost all of a fiveshot advantage but still clung to a oneshot lead over Ben Crenshaw alter three rounds of the $200,000 Colonial National invitation golf tournament. He had a 71 for a threeround total of 202.

title: DialaRide: AT; NonworkingNumber?; I told him I'd fight to the bitter end for doortodoor service. For the handicapped, there can be nothing else.
description: For the last 14 months, a schoolbus operator in New Rochelle has been operating a transportation system that is unique in the countya dialaride service that brings a small van or bus to a resident's door in response to a telephone call and takes him or her anywhere in town for 70 or 80 cents, depending on the distance. But now that system is in jeopardy.

title: BRIDGE
description: In the Age of Chivalry, when the ambition of every hotblooded young squire was to find a damsel in mortal peril, surrounded by enemies, and ride furiously to the rescue, it must sometimes have happened that the victim did not appreciate that a rescue was in progress and failed to cooperate with her true knight.

title: Powder Spots Petty Cash Thieves
description: AUSTIN, Tex., May 14 (AP)The Texas Capitol police have caught four dishonest Statehouse employees by dusting coins in the petty cash drawer with a coloring that sticks for 36 hours. The powder does not show until it is placed under an ultraviolet light and will not disappear, even with washing, for 36 hours. If a theft is reported, employees with access to the cash drawer are asked to submit to the test. The police said that the employees had been informed of the program.

title: U.S. Communists Say Yiddish Paper Serves Imperialism
description: The Communist Party U. S. A., published a 2,000word attack yesterday on the leftwing New York Yiddish daily, Morning Freiheit, and its editor, Paul Novick, as having slid in the last decade into open service in the interests of United States imperialism.

title: Suffolk Guards Summer Gold
description: SUFFOLK County's economic indicators start heating up along with the weather about this time of year as summerseason businesses take down the shutters, slap on a new coat of paint, order new supplies, air out the extra rooms and generally get ready for the summer money to start rolling in from the west.

title: Hugh Roome 3d Becomes Fiance Of Miss Davis
description: Mr. and Mrs. Jerome Davis of Bedford, N.Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Katherine Ann Davis, to Hugh Reinagle Roome 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Roome of Menlo Park, Calif. The wedding is planned for August.

title: For Many Reasons, Leaders Have Lost Their Power
description: Governor Carey has carefully set up some straw bosses to explain why he is intervening in the New York City Democratic mayoral primary to support his friend and Secretary of State, Mario M. Cuomo.

title: 76ers Box Score
description: FRIDAY NIGHT

title: In Summary
description: Since taking office in January, President Carter and his aides have been striving to establish a new United States policy toward the Middle East; last week, during his trip to Europe, Mr. Carter flew to Geneva for an afternoon's talk with the President of Syria, Hafez alAssad.

title: Tax Reform Drive Slowed By Flurry of Challenges
description: When the Town of Ramapo, in Rockland County, became the first municipality in New York State to adopt computerized, 100 percent assessment in 1973, officials were celebrating.

title: Susan B. Goldman Is Planning to Wed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Albert S. Goldman of Rye, N.Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Susan Beth Goldman, to Dr. Gene David Resnick, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jack Resnick of Oceanside, L.I. The wedding will take place in September.

title: Solti Conducts the Missa Solemnis
description: No one can accuse Georg Solti of being a sobersides when he brings the Chicago Symphony to town, but the three programs he conducted in Carnegie Hall last week were unusually austere in tone and primarily oriented toward the classic symphonic repertory rather than the splashier Romantic literature. Perhaps Mr. Solti was trying to show New Yorkers that he and his virtuoso orchestra do not always require neonlit scores to prove their excellence.

title: `Bermuda of the North
description: GEORGE WASHINGTON didn't sleep here. But Ulysses S. Grant paid a visit. So did Giovanni da Verrazano, who compared the place to the Isle of Rhodes, and Captain Kidd, who may have left something behind. French privateers sacked the place. And people say a flaming ghost ship, immortalized by John Greenleaf Whittier, still looms offshore.

title: Dominion Takes Calder Feature
description: MIAMI, May 14 (AP)Dominion, the oddson favorite, romped to a 4length victory today in the $28,500 Palmetto Handicap at Calder, Lightning Thrust, the 21 second choice with the crowd of 13,086, finished second four lengths in front of Kay Baby. Sergio was fourth in the sevenhorse field.

title: A Tortilla Glossary
description: Tortilla: Flat, round, pancakelike Mexican bread, made from ground corn and water or flour and water. Consider a pita without the pocket.

title: U.S. Debates Soviet Beam Weapon
description: A debate is under way within United States Government scientific and intelligence circles over whether the Soviet Union is developing and testing a directed energy beam weapon that could destroy United States nuclear ballistic missiles in flight.

title: Legislative Hearings Planned This Week
description: The following public hearings will be held in the New York metropolitan area by state legislative committees this week:

title: MAESTRO OF THE MEDIA
description: Norman Lear, the man who made Archie Bunker and Mary Hartman, Mary Hartman, telephoned the White House one day late last month, saying that he just wanted to talk about Jimmy Carter and television. I want to do anything I can to help, Lear told Barry Jagoda, the President's television adviser.

description: How to Get There

description: IF the moon is made of green cheese, it's one of the few varieties that you might not find in Westchester despite the efforts of people like George and Elaine Behling, who operate a cheese boutique in Ossining.

description: Route 100, Millwood, N.Y. (914) 9417744.

title: LETTERS TO THE LONG ISLAND EDITOR
description: Frank Lynn's analysis of the tole Played by Nassau Republican Chairman Joseph Margiotta in his party's race for the County Executive nomination [Opinion Page, April 24], contains a basic misconception that tends to place the entire campaign in an incorrect perspective.

title: BATTLE STILL RAGES OVER CONSUMER UNIT
description: Representative Paul N. McCloskey Jr., a California Republican who is in his fourth term in Congress, classes the struggle over the bill to create a consumer protection agency with the Watergate and Vietnam crises.

title: Pimlico Stakes On Grass Won By Improviser
description: BALTIMORE, May 14, (AP)  Improviser picked his way througuh horses along the rail before finding an opening near the threesixteenth pole then drew away to win the $87,500 Dixie Handicap today at Pimlico Race Course by half a length.

title: AMERICAN JEWS ARE URGED NOT TO ABANDON THE U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 14American Jews have been urged to work for improvement of the United Nations in a report that says disapproval of antiIsraeli or antiAmerican decisions should not lead them to abandon the United Nations.

title: In Summary
description: New York State now has the figures to demonstrate what has generally been suspected: Many banks practice redlining, the policy of refusing mortgages in deteriorating neighborhoods. Whether the state will be able to end, or even control, the practice, however, is still not sure, although political factorsspecifically a New York City mayoral election this year and gubernatorial election next yearprobably improve the chances for remedial legislation.

title: At 25, a Noticeable Change: Stronger, But Perhaps a Step Slower
description: As a fan and playground ballplayer, I have thought of sports as a means to recapture or prolong youth. Now it occurs that there is a pyramidlike slope in the graph of the athlete and fan's ability and interest. At 25, I have already passed the apex, and in a society that sees 25 as young, sports are telling me in many little ways that I am growing old.

title: Radio
description: 8.9 A.M., WKTU: Mellow Magazine. Children's songs and stories.

title: The news service that nourishes the intellect...and the inner man.
description: An increasing number of newspapers and other journals in this country and abroad now utilize The New York Times News Service as a basic news source. For these publications, the News Service is not just a supplementary or extra wire. It's a fundamental resource for major national and international news; for background coverage, analysis, columns, consumeroriented featuresand much, much more.

title: At 83, Mr. Good Deeds Is Ready To Go to Washington for Aged
description: KENILWORTH, May 15  When groups of the elderly in Union County voted recently for a representative at a new intern program in Washington, Jacob N. Landau, 83 years old, was the overwhelming choice.

title: Gathering Clans Find the Scots Aflame Over a Bitter Past
description: TONGUE, ScotlandSeveral thousand descendants of Scottish emigrants have just spent two weeks searching the home country for their roots. Some found a briar patch, instead.
