title: The Cast
description: LOOKING UP; screenplay by Jonathan Platnick; produed and directed by Linda Yellen; coproduced by Karen Rosenberg; edited by John Carter; photography by Arpad Makay and Lloyd Friedas; music by Brad Fiedel; a First American Films release; distributed by the LevittPickman Film Corporation. At the Fine Arts Theater, 59th Street, west of Lexington Avenue. Running time: 94 minutes. This film has been rated PG.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: More than half of New Jersey residents want the possession of small quantities of marijuana decriminalized, according to a Rutgers University poll.

title: Bishop of London Assists as Two Churches Celebrate Their 275th Anniversaries
description: MIDDLETOWN, May 15Dressed in a flowing white robe and miter hat, Bishop Gerald Ellison of London conducted services at the Christ Episcopal Churches here and in Shrewsbury today to mark the 275th anniversary of the founding of the two churches.

title: Parades Honor Greeks and Norwegians
description: Drawn to the streets by loyalty to their heritages and nearly perfect parade weather, thousands of GreekAmericans flocked to Fifth Avenue in Manhattan and thousands of NorwegianAmericans to Fifth Avenue in Brooklyn yesterday to commemorate milestones in their countries' histories.

title: Spectator Killed in Sicily
description: PALERMO, Sicily, May 15 (AP)One spectator was killed and three were seriously injured today when two cars taking part in the Targa Florio auto race plunged into a crowd. The drivers were also injured. The crash occurred in a curve of the Madonie Mountains.

title: EUROPEAN CONCERNS EXPANDING ABROAD TO CUT LABOR COSTS
description: In spite of a declaration at the economic summit meeting last weekend in London that unemployment is the most serious economic problem confronting the leading industrialized economies, the policies of many European companies, including some with government ties, are reducing the jobs available in their countries.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Church Buys Coast Town for Rural Haven
description: BRIDGEVILLE, Calif., May 15This tiny town southeast of Eureka in northern California will, in the future, observe no difference between church and state. The church has bought the town.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 78yearold woman was shot to death while standing in front of an upper Manhattan apartment building early Saturday nightthe apparent victim of a group of amid men chasing a holdup man from a corner grocery store.

title: Carter to Study Drought Tomorrow Amid Green of Farms in California
description: FRESNO, Calif., May 14President Carter is coming to California's bountiful Central Valley on Tuesday to look at the effects of the drought that has stubbornly embraced much of the nation's richest farming state for two years.

title: Five Perish in Mississippi Fire
description: PRENTISS, Miss., May 15 (AP)A family of five perished this morning in a fire that destroyed their frame home in Jefferson Davis County. The police said that firemen arrived on the scene too late to rescue the occupants. The victims were identified as Glen Davis. 41 years old, Peggy Sue Hooker Davis, 34, Charlie Ray Hooker, 9, Virgina Ann Davis, 3, and Laura Ann Davis. 5. The cause of the fire was not known.

title: Jersey Towns to Get $4.6 Million From U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (UPI)New Jersey communities are receiving $4.6 million in grants from the Federal Department of Housing and Urban Development, according to Senator Harrison A. Williams. Democrat of New Jersey.

title: Air Traffic Controllers Actions In Georgia Jet Crash Defended
description: ATLANTA, May 15 (AP)A spokesman for the Federal Aviation Administration today defended the actions of air traffic controllers involved in the handling of a Southern Airways DC9 that crashed last month near New Hope, Ga.

title: BLUMENTHAL EXPECTS LOANS TO NEW YORK
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Secretary of the Treasury W. Michael Blumenthal says that New York City will have to exhaust all efforts to borrow on its own in the fiscal year beginning July 1 before it can expect any shortterm loans from Washington.

title: The Cast
description: JAIL BAIT (Wildwechsel), directed by Rainer Werner Fassbinder; screenplay (German with English dialogue) by Mr. Fassbinder, based on a novel by Franz Xaver Kroetz; director of photography, Dietrich Lohmann; music, Ludwig van Beethoven; distributed by New Yorker Films. Running time: 99 minutes. At the New Yorker Theater, Broadway at 69th Street. This film has not been rated.

title: Plea on Boston School Disorder
description: BOSTON, May 15 (AP)South Boston High School's headmaster, Jerome Winegar, has issued an open letter to students and parents pleading for support to calm the tensions that erupted last week. If we can find a way to get back to even where things were a week ago, South Boston High could be an educationally exciting place to attend, he wrote.

title: Senate Intelligence Unit Weighs Single Director for All Agencies
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The Senate Intelligence Committee, after a year of activity that has been almost as secret as the agencies it monitors, is considering a plan to concentrate the authority over all the nation's intelligence agencies in a single office known as a director of national intelligence.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: CUBA HELD GOOD PROSPECT FOR THE SALE OF U.S. FOOD
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (UPI)United States farmers could capture at least onethird of Cuba's market for imported food if trade relations between the two countries were reestablished, an Agriculture Department publication estimated today.

title: Manhattan Opera Stages King David
description: There was a humaninterest angle to yesterday afternoon's performance of Honegger's King David at Alice Tully HallLois Albright, who conducted, is for all practical purposes blind. But that newsworthy angle shouldn't detract from the musical fact that this was, by and large, an honorable, effective statement of the score.

title: Pele (3 Goals) Is Whole Show as Cosmos Win by 30
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., May 15Pele shone almost as bright as the sun today, displaying the brilliance that has made him king of the soccer field.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: Carl Ajello, the Attorney General of Connecticut, announced yesterday that the state would take the General Motors Corporation to court over the company's practice of switching engines in its cars.

title: ISRAELIS WIND UP ELECTION CAMPAIGN
description: JERUSALEM, May 16Israel's election campaign came to an end today, with the last political volleys heard at a special session of Parliament less than 24 hours before voting was due to begin.

title: No Campus Charges for Protest
description: STANFORD, Calif., May 16 (AP)Stanford University officials said today that no campus charges would be brought against the nearly 300 students arrested a week ago in a protest against the school's financial ties with apartheid South Africa. They do face misdemeanor charges of trespassing and failure to disperse.

title: Don't Ask New York State Bar How Many Is Most
description: New York State has more lawyers than any other state, but how many is that?

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON. May 16 (AP)Recent rains had almost no effect on the drought, in the West and prospects remain bleak. for this summer, according to new Government reports.

title: The 4 Requirements For Forming a Group
description: To form a group, a collection of elements and an operation for combining them must satisfy four basic mathematical rules:

title: Expiring May Soybean Futures Swing Upward by 27.5c a Bushel
description: The expiring May soybean futures contract, which goes off the board in two days, was the object of wild price swings yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: U.S. and Russia Announce Talks On Operating Space Station in 80's
description: The United States and the Soviet Union announced yesterday an agreement to begin discussions that could lead to the operation of the first international space station sometime in the 1980's.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Article 5  No Title

title: Fiscal Malnutrition Kills Yale Faculty Club at 56
description: NEW HAVEN, May 16It was commencement time for 276yearold Yale University yesterday, and that was a joyful occasionbut while the graduates were commencing careers, a Yale institution was ending its, and that was a mournful occasion.

title: Sea Show by Youths With Visual Handicap
description: A special display on the theme Pinocchio and the Whale, designed and made by visually impaired children of the Lighthouse Child Development Center, opened yesterday at the Lehman Children's Zoo in Central Park.

title: 5 KILLED AS GOPTER ON PAN AM BUILDING THROWS ROTOR BLADE
description: A New York Airways helicopter idling on the heliport atop the Pan Am Building in midtown Manhattan keeled over on a broken landing gear yesterday afternoon and a huge rotor blade snapped off and slashed four people to death before coming to rest 59 stories below and a block away on Madison Avenue. A fifth victim died later at Bellevue Hospital.

title: Harlem Ministers Helping Sutton Get Out the Vote in Congregations
description: Reversing his lifelong political pattern and the tactical posture of his mayoral campaign, Percy E. Sutton met yesterday with a roomful of black ministers to map a drive to mobilize their congregations behind his candidacy.

title: Wiley Asks Action On Right to Resell PrivateLine Time
description: WASHINGTON,May 16(AP)Richard E. Wiley, chairman of the Federal Communication Commission, urged today that Congress permit those who lease private telephone lines more freedom to resell unused capacity to others.

title: West Side Funeral of Mob Figure Traces Divergent Paths in Area
description: Mickey Spillane, one of the last survivors of the West Side Irish mob, came home to 10th Avenue to be buried yesterday.

title: Dresser Posts 19.2% Profits Gain On a Sales Return Rise of 10.5%
description: Dresser Industries, a leader in oil and gas field equipment and a capital goods producer, reported yesterday a 19.2 percent increase in earnings for the second fiscal quarter ended April 30 on a sales and revenue gain of 10.5 percent. This brought the halfyear gain in earnings to 17.5 percent and in sales and revenues, 6.4 percent.

title: Panel in House Voices Concern On Energy Plan
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Carter Administration today took the tax elements of its energy program before the Congressmen who have to translate them into law and ran into one special concern after another, from propane to foreign trade to mass transit to the free market.

title: Yang Sen. Chinese Nationalist Aide
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan,May 16 (UPI)Gen. Yang Sen, a former military commander on the China mainland and a wellknown figure.in Taiwan, died of lung cancer yesterday at a military hospital here. He was in his nineties.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Article 3  No Title

title: SCHMIDT PARTY AGAIN SEEKS TO OUST YOUTH UNIT CHIEF
description: BONN, May 16The leadership of Chancellor Helmut Schmidt's Social Democratic Party moved once more today to expel the leftwing leader of its troublesome youth organization, the Young Socialists.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: CARTER AIDES REACH A TENTATIVE ACCORD ON A WELFARE PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, May 16High officials in the Carter Administration have reached tentative agreement on a national welfare plan that they believe would provide an adequate income to people unable to work and financial incentives to get those who can work to do so.

title: Steel Output for Week Reaches Highest Level Since March 8, 1975
description: Steel production for the week ended May 14 reached 2.76 million tons, highest since the week ended March 8, 1975, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: Open Interest
description: Monday, May 16, 1977

title: Yonkers Drivers
description: (Includes races of MAY 13)

title: Carter and Vance Impress Arabs As Solid, Serious and Reliable
description: CAIRO, May 16President Carter, venturing for the first time into the tangled web of Middle East diplomacy, has come across to Arab officials as a man who is genuinely trying to bring about a permanent overall settlement between Israel and the Arabs.

title: Theory of Groups: a Key To the Mysteries of Math
description: In 1832, the night before a brilliant 20  year  old French mathematician named Evariste Galois was killed in a duel, he feverishly filled 60 pages with notes and proofs that solved a longstanding mathematical problem. His calculations laid the groundwork for what has become the Theory of Groups, now considered the supreme example of mathematical abstraction.

title: P.L.O. Seeks Details of Carter's Plan for Homeland
description: BEIRUT Lebanon, May 16The Palestine Liberation Organization views President Carter's concept of a Palestinian homeland as an important contribution to a just and durable peace in the Middle East, but it would like some details.

title: NATO Is Training Troops to Survive A Soviet Gas Attack
description: BRUSSELS,MAY 16The North Atlantic Treaty Organization, worried about a buildup of chemical weapons in Eastern Europe, is training Western troops to survive gas attacks.

title: Job Prospects for Young Lawyers Dim as Field Grows Overcrowded
description: Two years ago, the American Bar Association introduced Juriscan, a computer service designed to mate employers with young lawyers seeking work. A few months ago, this computer service was scuttled. It had been swamped with eager thirdyear law students, but few employers had signed on.

title: Canadiens Receive Champion's Welcome
description: MONTREAL, May 16 (AP)A crowd estimated at 500,000 lined city streets today to welcome home the Montreal Canadiens, winners of the National Hockey League championship.

title: Medical Society Committee Asks Curb on CancerCausing Pollution
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 16A committee of the Medical Society of New Jersey urged action today to reduce air pollution in the state because of its potential for causing cancer.

title: Hundreds of Commuters Throng Barriers at Grim Accident Scene
description: Blood smeared the sidewalk on Madison Avenue north of 43d Street, helicopter wreckage protruded from the Pan Am Building's gray flank, 36 stories overhead, and hundreds of welldressed commuters, not seeking escape, thronged the police barriers around the scene.

title: Safety Agency Accused of Delay In Banning Treated Sleepwear
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP)Members of Congress accused the Consumer Product Safety Commission today of inordinate delays in reaching its decision to ban Tris, a flame retardant used in children's sleepwear.

title: Automatic Loss of Driver's License Is Supported by Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON. May 16The Supreme Court ruled unanimously today that states may revoke drivers licenses automatically, without prior hearings, in certain circumstances.

title: CARTER AIDES REACH A TENTATIVE ACCORD ON A WELFARE PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, May 16High officials in the Carter Administration have reached tentative agreement on a national welfare plan that they believe would provide an adequate income to people unable to work and financial incentives to get those who can work to do so.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The State Supreme Court has ruled that the judicial article in the New Jersey Constitution gave it powers over judicial employees that supersede specific state laws governing public employment.

title: A Sister Ship of the Lindbergh Plane Makes a Few Turns Over L.I.
description: BETHPAGE, L.I., May 16A sister ship of the Spirit of St. Louis took off from Long Island today, but not from Roosevelt Field and not for Paris.

title: Citizen Fund Established to Aid F.B.I. Agents Indicted by the U.S.
description: Former Senator James L.Buckley, Clare Boothe Luce, a former Ambassador, and William E. Simon, former Secretary of the Treasury, announced yesterday the formation of a Citizens Legal Defense Fund for the F.B.I., The Associated Press reported.

title: A Huge Ticket GiveAway, A Fight and an Ali Hustle
description: LANDOVER, Md., May 16It was obvious that Muhammad Ali was trying to give them their money's worth. But whose money?

title: Fiery Passion And Concern
description: Edward Norton remembers that the first time he met Eleanor Holmes he was so impressed by her extraordinary energy and intelligence that he began to refer to her as La Pasionaria, the fiery woman who galvanized the Spanish loyalists in their fight against Franco.

title: Loss to Thieves by King of Ming Put at $300,000
description: Oriental jades and bronzes were among the estimated $300,000 worth of art objects stolen last weekend from the Manhattan town house of Robert H. Ellsworth, an expert in Chinese Ming dynasty antiques, the police reported yesterday.

title: White Shoes, Bright Hopes
description: He came from Beaver Falls, Pa., via Tuscaloosa, Ala., but from the start, Joe Namath's audacity marked him as a New Yorker. When he led the vastly underrated New York Jets to their 16to7 victory over Baltimore in the 1969 Super Bowl, he gave all of us, not just sports fans, one of the pure moments of joy in the city's recent emotional history. (His performance, it was said at the time, proved that his talent was as big as his mouth.) But he was just as audacious off the field. When he signed with the Jets in 1965 for the then stunning salary of $387,000 a year, he broke ground for the present era of bigmoney celebrities. When he flaunted a moustache and long hair, he set the style for a generation of mod athletes. Who else would have dared wear white football shoes? Who else would have given television endorsements to pantyhose? Even in defeat, as the brilliant years faded and he suffered repeated injury, Joe Willie White Shoes was a center of interest; the condition of Namath's Knees joined the Groundhog's Shadow as a famous seasonal imponderable. But now, at 34, he has sensedand accepteda new opportunity. Next season, he will play for the Los Angeles Rams, one of the more highly regarded professional football teams. He is Namath, so he must now harbor some audacious ambition for the 1977 season. We are New Yorkers, so we share it with him.

title: WORLD OIL SHORTAGE IS CALLED INEVITABLE
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Energy company executives and analysts from 15 countries warned today that nonCommunist countries must make enormous investments in coal, nuclear power and energy conservation to offset an inevitable world oil shortage and a risk of war.

title: Yonkers Racing
description: Horses listed in order of Post Positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: Deaths
description: ALEXANDERBlanche, on May 13. Wife of the late Albert A., beloved mother of Kathryn Lewin and the late Albert, Jr., devioed grandmother and great. landmother. Private services have been held.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: JERUSALEM. May 16Israel's election campaign came to an end today, with the last political volleys heard at a special session of Parliament less than 24 hours before voting was due to begin.

title: GOLDIN SAYS BUDGET CONCEALS A DEFICIT
description: City Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin charged yesterday that Mayor Beame's proposed 1978 budget, which the Mayor said was balanced, actually had a deficit of at least $53.6 million concealed by accounting gimmicks.

title: Adelphi's Bluman on U.S. Five
description: Alan Bluman, a 6foot6inch, 210pound senior on Ade1phi University's basketball team, was chosen yesterday as a member of the United States team that will visit Israel in July for the Maccabiah Games. Dolph Schayes, former star in the National Basketball Association, is the head coach of the united States team.

title: The Last Battle?
description: PARIS, May 16The parliamentary elections to be held in France next Marchor perhaps earlierare being seen here as the most important in the history of the Fifth Republic, with possibly profound consequences for Europe as well as France.

title: Giants Size Up Jeter and Think He Fits Right In
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., May 16The muscles from Gary Jeter's neck to his calves, stretching his gray Tshirt and shorts, accentuated a remarkable physique as the Giants unveiled their No. 1 draft choice today.

title: Assembly Passes a Bill, Then Takes a Second Look
description: TRENTON, May 16This morning, the State Assembly voted, 55 to 0, to allow physicians to maintain a supply of marijuana to treat patients, but this afternoon, the action on the bill was rescinded.

title: Conferees Agree On Antiboycott Bill
description: WASHINGTON, May 16A SenateHouse conference committee today reached agreement on a bill aimed at prohibiting American citizens and corporations from complying with the Arab boycott against Israel.

title: Con Edison Is Entering Fuel Production
description: The Consolidated Edison Company is going into the fuel production business through a joint venture to explore for natural gas and the acquisition of a uranium mine in Colorado, Charles F. Luce, the chairman of the nation's largest utility, told stockholders yesterday.

title: Dressed Like an Egg, From Mabou Mines, Is Visual Counterpoint to Words of Colette
description: In its theatrical adventures, the Mabou Mines has specialized in compact performance piecesa few actors, a single setwith astonishingly complex results.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Mayor Beame warned that forged taxicab medallions were being sold to unsuspecting prospective cab owners for $15,000 each. A legitimate ownerdriven medallion is worth about $40,000 on the open market.

title: Pittsburgh Will Pick Candidates To Replace Flaherty as Mayor
description: PITTSBURGH, May 16The departure of Mayor Peter F. Flaherty from the local political scene to become Deputy United States Attorney General has thrown the race to succeed him wide open, but has hardly excited the municipal electorate.

title: Quebec Conciliatory on Threats Of Pullouts Over Language Curb
description: MONTREALThreats by large companies to leave Quebec rather than submit to coercive language measures are being taken seriously by the Quebec government, which is ready to negotiate agreements with them.

title: A Golf Contract Made to Be Broken
description: Adair Jones, who had never played golf before Jan. 31, 1976, when she married Kearney Hibbard, contends that she knew just what she was doing that dayshe signed a contract giving her husband the right to play golf whenever he is of a mind to do so. The contract also said, I further state that I will in no way restrict him by devious means from playing golf. In turn, Kearney Hibbard, a confirmed golf addict who averaged 72 holes a week, signed a contract that said: I give my newly ordained wife the same privileges of the Plainfield Country Club course that she bestowed on me. But it was clear Kearney did not look forward to golfing with Adair. His contract stated he did not have to have his wife for a golf partner until she had 10 consecutive good shots as judged by Frank Madden and Dick Meyers, two of Kearney's regular golfing partners

title: Rhodesia Warns Neighbors1 That It Might Launch Attacks Against Rebels
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, May 16 (Reuters)Rhodesia said tonight that it had advised Britain recently that it might be forced to carry out preemptive strikes at black guerrilla bases outside its border.

title: Social Security A Major Issue Troubling West
description: BONN, May 16One of the most critical political and economic issues of the next five yearsthe mounting deficits in many Western countries social security systemswas apparently not mentioned at all at the economic summit conference in London earlier this month.

title: Eurobonds Offering Is Set to Reach Italy
description: A $500 million loanthe largest Eurobond offering so far  was launched yesterday to raise funds that ultimately will be lent to Italy, New York investment banking sources confirmed yesterday afternoon.

title: Waldheim Sees African Disaster
description: MAPUTO, Mozambique, May 16 (UP1)Secretary General Kurt Waldheim of the United Nations said today that the world faced a disaster of grave dimensions unless peaceable change came quickly to whiteruled Rhodesia and SouthWest Africa.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: No Heroes No Villains, by Steven Phillips Random House, $8.95). Murder trials and courtroom's workings.

title: Recital: Perahia Tackles Big Ones
description: Every young pianist wants to test himself against the big pieces, and all young pianists should, though not necessarily in public. So it was not surprising that Murray Perahia chose to round off his recital at Alice Tully Hall on Sunday night with Schumann's Symphonic Etudes, one of the most technically and musically taxing pieces that the 19thcentury virtuoso tradition produced.

title: Power Failure Hits Wide Area in Southern Florida
description: MIAMI, May 16 (AP)A massive power failure cut off electricity to a 15,000squaremile area of south Florida today, shutting down air conditioning in homes and offices, stranding people in elevators and snarling traffic at busy intersections.

title: PHYLLIS J. RUBENSTEIN
description: Phyllis Jacobs Rubenstein, of 14 East 75th Street and Woodmere, L.I. an art collector and consultant, died Saturday after a long illness in the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. She was 46 years old.

title: J. W. T. to Handle Gallo Assignment
description: The E. & J. Gallo Winery, Modesto, Calif., has assigned a big piece of business to the J. Walter Thompson Company's eastern division. One trade source indicated that the billings could go as high as $10 million.

title: Amid Drought, Los Angeles Is Rich in Imported Water
description: LOS ANGELES, May 16A resident of Los Angeles can buy fruit, vegetables, meat, dairy products, fish, wine and even oil produced right here in Los Angeles County. But when an Angeleno turns on a faucet, the water may have come from as far away as Wyoming, 1,000 miles to the northeast.

title: Levins, 14, Advances At Eastern Men's Net
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., May 16Fourteen yearold Gary Levins of Massapequa advanced to the fourth round of the Prince Eastern men's hardcourt tennis championships today by beating Tom Porter of Scarsdale, 63, 67, 64, at the Rooseevelt Field Tennis Club.

title: Double Amputee, Missing 9 Days, Saved
description: OMAHA, Neb., May 16 (AP)Alerted by a teenager who found the man's wallet and led on by a trail that included an artificial leg, the police have rescued a helpless double amputee who was missing for nine days.

title: Crafts Come to Lunch at the White House
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Rosalynn Carter gave the traditional luncheon for Senate wives todaybut the official china and glassware were left in the cupboard.

title: Kissinger, in First NBC Program In December,Will Analyze Crises
description: NBC's first program under its exclusive television arrangement with Henry A. Kissinger, will be a December special in which the former Secretary of State will offer his observations on crucial situations in foreign affairs and their effects.

title: $2.25 Billion Approved to Aid In State and Local Employment
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP)A $2.25 billion fund to help state and local governments in periods of high unemployment was approved today by Congress. The House approved the measure, 252 to 134. The Senate agreed by voice vote without dissent.

title: Bargaining Edge for Moscow Seen In Active Civil Defense Program
description: BRUSSELS, May 14Some American and West European military leaders say they belieVe that the Soviet Union's civil defense program, unmatched in the United States, will give the Russians an advantage in the next round of arms talks.

title: Hedberg, Ftorek, Tardif Picked for AnStars
description: TORONTO, May 16 (UPI)The Winnipeg Jets Anders Hedberg, who scored 70 goals during the season, led the AllStar team announced by the World Hockey Association today.

title: Gallup Poll on Marijuana Shows 66% Would Vote Against Legalizing It
description: A recently completed opinion survey indicated that if a national referendum were held Americans would vote against legalizing the use of marijuana while favoring removal of criminal penalties for possession of small amounts of it, the Gallup Poll reported yesterday.

title: Ravishing New York's Heritage
description: Will New York never stop the relentless destruction of its great landmarks?

title: Child's World of Wonder in Brooklyn
description: As museums go, the new Brooklyn Children's Museum doesn't exactly conform to type. You go in through an oldfashioned trolley car kiosk, walk down a ramped culvert of corrugated steel called a people tube, and find yourself in a Rube Goldberg fantasyland of contraptions that seem designed to make busy, happy children even of grownups.

title: Copter Pad Born in Controversy
description: Helicopter service between the heliport atop the Pan Am Building and metropolitan airports was tried first in the mid1960's, ended for economic reasons and was resurrected only a few months agoall amid fierce arguments that one day one of the aircraft was bound to fall into the street below.

title: Michigan Judge Dismisses Suit Against Makers of the Drug DES
description: DETROIT, May 16 (UPI)A judge dismissed today a lawsuit filed by 144 women and 40 husbands who alleged that the women had contracted cancer because their mothers had taken the hormone DES during pregnancy to prevent miscarriages.

title: Job Prospects for Young Lawyers Dim as Field Grows Overcrowded
description: Two years ago, the American Bar Association introduced Juriscan, a computer service designed to mate employers with young lawyers seeking work. A few months ago, this computer service was scuttled. It had been swamped with eager thirdyear law students, but few employers had signed on.

title: S.E.C. Chairman Warns Disclosures May Hurt Business
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission expressed concern today that confidence in American business would be furtherand unjustifiabilyundermined as the agency begins to open its investigatory files on questionable corporatory payments.

title: Notes on People
description: For some time now, Gov. George C. Wallace has been hemming and hawing about running for the United States Senate, but yesterday he came right out and said it: I intend to run for the U. S. Senate from Alabama. The reaction of the man he hopes to replace, Senator John J. Sparkman, was on the serene side. The 77yearold Mr. Sparkman has been rumored ready to retire, but yesterday he said: If I decide to ran, it doesn't matter who else will be in there. If I decide not to run, that will not depend on who is running. I'm not concerned. Mr. Wallace's announcement, made a day after the fifth anniversary of the date he was shot and paralyzed while campaigning for the Democratic Presidential nomination, was made on the ABCTV Good Morning, America program.

title: About New york
description: Sea gulls do no picturesquelywheel all that much over the city's 300acre garbage dump that molders and mulls on the BrooklynQueens seacoast between Starrett City and Howard Beach. The gulls tend more toward a cafeteriastyle bumping and pushing and prancing among the pickings, hardly inhibited because the closest thing they have to a natural enemy there is Gus Fischetti, the city's chief landfill engineer.

title: Amex Approves Listing of Hess's
description: The American Stock Exchange has approved for original listing 1.4 million common shares of Hess's Inc., a department store chain. The company's stock is currently traded in the overthecounter market.

title: Panel in House Voices Concern On Energy Plan
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Carter Administration today took the tax elements of its energy program before the Congressmen who have to translate them into law and ran into one special concern after another, from propane to foreign trade to mass transit to the free market.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Jordan Cancels Gubernatorial Bid, Will Support Byrne for Reelection
description: TRENTON, May 16Mayor Paul T. Jordan of Jersey City withdrew today as a candidate for the Democratic gubernatorial nomination and announced he would support the reelection of Governor Byrne.

title: U.S. and Korea Agree On Shoe Export Quotas
description: SEOUL, Korea, May .16 (AP)After three rounds of bargaining, the United States and Korea agreed today on a fouryear quota on nonrubber shoe exports to the United States, effective June 28.

title: Books of The Times
description: A Visit to Haldeman and Other States of Mind  surely the worst title for a good book since Quarup by Antonio Callendo  was published a month ago and seems to have fallen down a mine shaft. Nobody is reviewing it, which is odd, since Mr. Mee's previous book, Meeting at Potsdam, was a best seller. Whereas Loose Change  pulpy, synecdochic, overweening will be published next week, has already been bought for a network television miniseries and is going to be reviewed by everybody who has a thesis to swot about the 1960's.

title: BOND PRICES SHOW MODERATE ADVANCE
description: Bond prices rose moderately yesterday as many traders became more convinced that the Federal Reserve was not going to push shortterm interest rates any higher for a while. Government securities, however, lost some of their gains, and trading activity was light. The Federal Reserve added some reserves to the banking system by negotiating some overnight repurchase agreements when the Federal funds rate was 5 percent. This indicated that the Federal Reserve did not intend to nudge this basic money market rate out of the 55 percent range soon.

title: Porn Is Here to Stay
description: Mayor Beame may well be sincerely disgusted with pornography; only he is much better at keeping his feelings about erotic material private when no election looms.

title: Rx by Ali's Doctor: Retirement
description: LANDOVER, Md., May 16When the 15 dreary rounds were over, when Muhammed Ali had successfully but mechanically defended the world heavyweight title against Alfredo Evangelista tonight, the doctor in his corner put the champion's performance in perspective. It was like a workout, Dr. Ferdie Pacheco explained. He tried to go the distance and dance. And the doctor prescribed retirement. Ali, he had said earlier, is now at the dangerous mental point where his heart and mind are no longer in it. Like this fight, it's just a payday. Ali to be Ali, has to have a super challenge. Hot even Ken Norton creates that kind of a challenge. Norton's style is such that Ali can't get up because he knows he can't look good. Not that the 49yearold Miami general practitioner, a familiar second in Ali's corner for 13 years, expects the 35yearold champion to take his advice. It's as if the doctor wrote a prescription that he knew the patient wouldn't get filled. Muhammad Ali already is talking of ?arry Holmes and Earnie Shavers as his next two opponents.

title: CORRECTION
description: In Saturday's editions of The Times, It was incorrectly stated that the proposed acquisition of the Gerber Products Company by Anderson, Clayton & Company was under investigation by the Securities and Exchange Commission. In fact, it is under investigation by the Federal Trade Commission. Also, a revision of the offer will, eliminate payment of certain fees only with respect to shares tendered by a soliciting dealer for its own account.

title: EXPLOSION IN MADRID DAMAGES U.S. CENTER
description: MADRID, Tuesday, May 17 (AP)The United States cultural center in Madrid was badly damaged by an explosion early today, a few hours before the arrival of Vice President Mondale, a spokesman for the American Embassy reported.

title: Dow, Continuing Rise, Adds 4.16; Active Franklin Mint Drops by 2
description: The stock market, continuing to shrug off the first primerate increase in nearly a year, pushed higher yesterday across a broad front.

title: Formulas by which pension systems are funded
description: The figures represent the annual payment, as a percentage of salary, made into each pension system by employee and employer. In Britain, for example, a payment is made in the employee's name of an amount equal to 14.5% of his salary. However, his personal indebtedness is only 5.75%. The employer pays the balance which is not, therefore, a deduction from the worker's pay.

title: Cancer Patient Cited In Carter CallIn Dies
description: HIGH POINT, N.C., May 16 (AP)When Opal DeHart got through to President Carter in his national telephone callin program March 5, she asked why her cancerstricken father could not obtain the controversial substance laetrile.

title: YALE SALUTES FORD WITH AN LL.D.DEGREE
description: NEW HAVEN, May 16A tear came to Gerald R. Ford's eye today as he stood before thousands of graduating Yale students, their families and citizens of this city to receive an honorary Doctor of Laws degree.

title: Philadelphia Fire Kills 2 Boys
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 16 (AP) Two young cousins were killed yesterday when fire swept a threestory brick house owned by their grandparents, the police said. The bodies of Willie Salley 3d 9 years old, and Dimitrius Salley, 4, were found on a stairway landing. The grandparents and two firemen were injured fighting the fire.

title: Time Holdings Will Sell Its Stock To N.V. Amev of the Netherlands
description: Time Holdings, Inc., a financial holding company that controls the Time Insurance Company of Milwaukee and the Bank of Commerce of Milwauke, has made an agreement to sell its shares to N.V. Amev of the Netherlands for about $60 million. Under the agreement, stockholders of Time Holdings will have an opportunity to sell their shares for cash. There are 1,491,096 shares outstanding in addition to options to purchase 74,727 shares, and notes convertible into 158,620 shares.

title: Companies Issue Earnings Reports
description: For Periods ended March 31 unless otherwise indicated. (N) Indicates stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange (A) American Stock Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: Social Security A Major Issue Troubling West
description: BONN, May 16One of the most critical political and economic issues of the next five yearsthe mounting deficits in many Western countries social security systemswas apparently not mentioned at all at the economic summit conference in London earlier this month.

title: Summary of Actions Taken by the Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, May 16  The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Weekend Boxing
description: Caracas, V/??zuela,  Luls Estaba, 107pounds, Venuzuela, outpointed Rafael Pedrozd, 107, Panama, 15 rounds, retaining the World Boxing Council junior flyweight title.

title: N.B.A. Begins an Inquiry Into Its ExA.B.A. Clubs
description: Larry O'Brien, commissioner of the National Basketball Association, began an investigation yesterday into the mounting financial problems of the Nets, Denver Nuggets, Indiana Pacers and San Antonio Spurs. He asked David Stern, the league counsel, to gather facts on the heavy debts of the former American Basketball Association teams for presentation to the owners at their annual league meeting June 14 through 17 at San Diego.

title: Taking the Waters
description: Tucked away in one paragraph of the 28page fact sheet issued last month by the White House on President Carter's national energy program is this intriguing statement:

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: DESIGN TIME A free new exhibition of graphics called Young American Printmakers, now on display in Avery Fisher Hall's Cork Room Gallery through May 30, should be of interest to visitors at Lincoln Center. This display of 50 works by 48 students from 16 universities, with examples ranging from figurative to abstract in 16 printmaking techniques, might also be an offbeat diversion for concertgoers who normally use intermissions for a cigarette and chitchat.

title: Spain's Mood Is Becoming Troubled as the Election Nears
description: MADRID, May 16A troubled mood is developing in Spain as the country prepares for its first real elections in four decades, to be held June 15.

title: 5 KILLED AS COPTER ON PAN AM BUILDING THROWS ROTOR BLADE
description: A New York Airways helicopter idling on the heliport atop the Pan Am Building in midtown Manhattan keeled over on a broken landing gear yesterday afternoon and a huge rotor blade snapped off and slashed four people to death before coming to rest 59 stories below and a block away on Madison Avenue, A fifth victim died later at Bellevue Hospital.

title: Oil Rig Fire Burns 6 Workers
description: SHOSHONI, Wyo., May 16 (AP)Six oilfield workers were burned today when a flash fire engulfed an oil rig 15 miles north of Shoshoni. The authorities slid that the six men were listed in stable condition at Memorial Hospital in Riverton. The victims suffered first,secondand thirddegree burns. The cause of the blaze was under investigation. The authorities said that the rig was owned by the Field Rocky Mountain Drilling Company.

title: The MermanMartin Magic Blazes In Benefit 2Alarm Fire of Genius
description: Ethel Merman is the bonfire and Mary Martin is the smoke. They go very nicely together, if you're in a mood to burn up the town.

title: 4 PUT ON PROBATION IN LAETRILE IMPORTS
description: SAN DIEGO, May 16Four Californians convicted of participating in an international smuggling conspiracy that supplied millions of dollars worth of the outlawed cancer drug laetrile to Americans were today placed on probation for three years and fined a total of $80,000.

title: Annenberg Asks U. of Pennsylvania To Develop Visual Education Plan
description: Walter H. Annenberg, who in March withdrew his proposed gift of $40 million to finance the Fine Arts Center of the Annenberg School of Communications at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, has now asked the University of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia to submit a plan for a similar, though broader, program for visual education.

title: Let the Public Decide on Court Reform
description: Court reform in New York was, it appeared, nearing the end of a long, tortuous path. But now it is jeopardized by new and shameful bickering in the State Legislature. The reform package considered in the past two years has three parts: the appointment of Court of Appeals judges by the Governor after screening of candidates by a nominating commission; strengthened court administration, and improved judicial disciplinary procedures. Achieving these goals requires a state constitutional amendment. That, in turn, requires approval of the reform package by the Legislature at two consecutive sessions and then by the voters at a general election.

title: Pharmacists Told to Collect 50c On Adult Medicaid Prescriptions
description: Pharmacists throughout New York State should have been collecting 50 cents starting yesterday morning for every Medicaid prescription they filled for a recipient over the age of 21, Hugh O'Neill, Deputy State Commissioner of Social Services for policy and program, said late yesterday.

title: Theory of Groups: a Key To the Mysteries of Math
description: In 1832, the night before a brilliant 20  year  old French mathematician named Evariste Galois was killed in a duel, he feverishly filled 60 pages with notes and proofs that solved a longstanding mathematical problem. His calculations laid the groundwork for what has become the Theory of Groups, now considered the supreme example of mathematical abstraction.

title: Christie's Opens New York Sales At Delmonico's
description: Christie's first New York sale last night a glittering affair inaugurating its $1.5 million redcarpeted quarters at the Delmonico Hotelraised many eyebrows but no world records.

title: Advertising
description: The supporters of Mario H. Cuomo, a Democrat who is in the race for Mayor of New York, signed up Norman, Craig & Kummel yesterday to handle advertising. Gerald M. Rafshoon, President Carter's adman, who has already said he would be in the Cuomo camp, will serve as a consultant to the agency.

title: Hurdler at St. John's Gets His Inspiration From Moses
description: They were always athletes in search of an identity, too slow for the quartermile, not strong enough for the halfmile. Their event traditionally led off most track and field meets and was forgotten lust as quickly.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: SEARS RAISED NET 81% IN 1ST QUARTER ON ALLSTATE GAIN
description: Sears, Roebuck & Company, the nation's largest retailer, had an 81 percent increase in net income in its first quarter, shareholders were told yesterday at the annual meeting in Chicago.

title: CORRECTION
description: In Saturday's editions of The Times, it was incorrectly stated that the proposed acquisition of the Gerber Products Company by Anderson, Clayton & Company was under investigation by the Securities and Exchange Commission. In fact, it is under investigation by the Federal Trade Commission. Also, a revision of the offer will eliminate payment of certain fees only with respect to shares tendered by a soliciting dealer for its own account.

title: Japanese Echoing Carter's Appeal for Nuclear Restraints
description: HIROSHIMA, JapanBecause the people are so nice to us here, said the muscular American marine, explaining why he and his buddies came to Hiroshima almost every Sunday. He spoke while taking off the headset connecting him to the rock music on his tape recorder. A Japanese acquaintance kept his earphones on and rocked with the beat.

title: C.I.A. Said to Report on Alien Aided by Gov. Brown
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 16Gov. Edmund G. Brown says that he had not been aware of an adverse report that the Central Intelligence Agency allegedly filed on a foreignborn friend and $24,000ayear adviser whom the Governor helped in gaining status as a permanent resident.

title: EXPROSECUTOR ADMITS TAPING DEFENSE WITNESS
description: BURGAW. N.C., May 16The prosecutor in the Wilmington 10 case, whose conduct in the 1972 trial is the subject of a Federal grand jury investigation, disclosed today at a postconviction hearing that he secretly taperecorded a conversation with a key defense witness last week.

title: Breakdown on Vote
description: ALBANY. May 16 (AP)Here is a breakdown of the 70to72 vote by which the Assembly rejected today a bill to repeal criminal penalties for possession of mall amounts of marijuana:

title: A's Shell Holtzman in 1st And Conquer Yankees, 84
description: OAKLAND, Calif.. May 16Try as they would to produce a pleasing birthday present for their manager, the Yankees could only come up with a distressing, 84 loss to the Oakland A's tonight.

title: Dance: Fine Graham Mysteries
description: The Martha Graham Dance Company, at once America's oldest and youngest dance institution, opened a month's Broadway season at the LuntFontanne Theater last night. During the first week Rudolf Nureyevsurely Miss Graham's most celebrated convertwill appear at all performances. The novelty of the openingif novelty be thought neededwas provided by the revival of Primitive Mysteries.

title: Yamani Denies Accord by OPEC on Oil Prices
description: ABU DHABI, May 16 (Reuters)Saudi Arabia's oil minister, Sheik Ahmed Zaki Yanani, said today there was no truth in reports that the 13 members of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries were about to reach a compromise solution on oil prices.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Article 6  No Title

title: Congressional Report Discounts Usefulness of Soviet Civil Defense
description: WASHINGTON, May 16  The Joint Congressional Committee on Defense Production concluded today that a largescale civil defense program, such as the Soviet Union's, could be readily overwhelmed by nuclear weapons.

title: Kummerfeld Named Deputy Mayor
description: Mayor Beame announced yesterday the appointments of Donald D. Kummerfeld, the city's Budget Director, as First Deputy Mayor and of Robert J. Bott, a deputy budget director, as Mr. Kummerfeld's successor.

title: A New Strategy for Southern Africa
description: The Carter Administration appears to have decided on a significant change in American policy toward southern Africa. The new approach receives its first formal display this week, when Ambassador Andrew Young leads the United States delegation to a United Nations Conference on Rhodesia and Namibia in Maputo, Mozambique. Ambassador Young's approach has been conspicuously coordinated with the State Department, our mission chiefs in Africa, and Vice President Mondale, so there should be little doubt that he will now be speaking with the full authority of the United States Government. Later in the week, the new initiative will be carried a step further, when Mr. Mondale meets in Vienna with Prime Minister John Vorster of South Africa.

title: Stanford Stars TopRated In N.C.A.A. Title Tennis
description: ATHENS, Ga., May 16 (AP)Matt Mitchell of Stanford was seeded No.1 in singles and Mitchell and his teammate, Perry Wright, gained the top doubles spot today for the National Collegiate tennis championships May 23 to 30.

description: Music

description: AT ROME

title: At OTB...
description: Paul Screvane, chairman, said yesterday that for the second straight year, OTB would not handle wagers on the Preakness.

title: Carter Gets Bill to Cut Taxes and Simplify Returns
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP)Congress gave final approval today to a bill cutting taxes for 46 million lowand middleincome couples or individuals and simplifying tax returns for 95 percent of Americans.

title: LULA A. FARMER
description: Lula A. Farmer, wife of James Farmer, founder in 1942 of the Congress of Racial Equality and its national director from 1960 to 1966, died Sunday in a Washington hospital after a long illness. She lived in Washington and was 55 years old.

title: Thomas E. Mullaney
description: Throughout most of his long career in top executive capacities at the United States Steel Corporation, R. Heath Larry has devoted much time and effort to labor negotiations, public affairs and communications. Now as he approaches retirement age in the corporate world, the U.S. Steel vice chairman is adapting those talents for a bigger stage as a leading representative and spokesman for a broad range of American industry.

title: Ali Toys With Evangelista and Scores a Unanimous Decision
description: LANDOVER, Md., May 16Alfredo Evangelista, like Rocky, went the distance.

description: SAILING TODAY

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: In my darker moments when I am momentarily persuaded that man will not succeessfully fulfill his stewardship of the natural world, I sometimes think that worrying about whales, wolves, rare species of freshwater fish and even the magnificent Atlantic salmon is a futile exercise.

title: Blues Deny Reports Of Imminent Bankruptcy
description: ST. LOUIS, May 16 (AP)Spokesmen for the financially troubled St. Louis Blues today denied reports that the National Hockey League franchise was on the verge of declaring bankruptcy.

title: Racing Scholarship Awarded
description: Edward Wilson of Greenwich, Conn., was named the winner of the Thoroughbred Racing Association's Grantland Rice Scholarship at Vanderbilt University. The scholarship is awarded to a high school senior planning a career in sports writing.

title: Cubs Win 6th inRow; Clines Star
description: CHICAGO, May 16 (AP)Gene Clines had four hits, including a tworun homer, and drove in five runs today as the hot Chicago Cubs defeated the San Diego Padres, 96. It was the Cubs fifth straight victory and 13th triumph in their last 15 games.

title: Bridge:
description: ARUBA, Netherlands Antilles, May 16An exciting exhibition match yesterday between a foursome of United States stars and the Venezuelan team that won the zonal team title here the day before conclued nine days of play in the Central American and Caribbean championships.

description: Article 2  No Title

title: People in Sports
description: Marvin Barnes the Detroit Pistons 6foot9inch forward, was scheduled to surrender at 9 A.M. yesterday to begin serving a oneyear prison sentence for parole violation. But he was late. Dressed in a neatly cut beige suit with a white shirt and no tie, he did not arrive at Superior Court in Providence, R.I., until 1:30 P.M. He was immediately turned over to three state marshals, handcuffed and put on a bus to the centuryold, overcrowded Adult Correctional Institution in nearby Cranston, where he will he in the maximumsecurity unit. With good behavior, he might he paroled in four months.

title: ISRAELIS WIND UP ELECTION CAMPAIGN
description: Today's Election for Parliament Is Seen as Close Fight Between Labor Party and Likud

title: CREIGHTON B. PEET
description: Creighton B. Peet, author of young people's books, died Sunday at a Manhattan hospital. He was 78 years old and lived at 300 East 34th Street.

title: The Standings
description: Tuesday, May 17, 1977

title: Bill on Marijuana Is Apparently Dead As Albany Bid Fails
description: ALBANY, May 16The bill to remove criminal penalties for the possession of small amounts of marijuana appeared dead tonight after unexpected bipartisan oppositionlargely under the impetus the Conservative Party  forced its Assembly sponsors to send it back to committee.

title: Mondale Praises Lisbon
description: LISBON, May 16Vice President Mondale expressed warm encouragement today for the return to Portugal of a democracy that some Portuguese fear may be fragile.

title: Drive Against Nuclear Spread Focuses on 12 Nations
description: LONDON, May 12President Carter is expected to focus his drive to stop the spread of nuclear weapons on 12 or more countries that are deemed to be on the nuclear threshold.

description: TUESDAY, MAY 17, 1977

title: It's Showdown Time for Collegiate Lacrosse Powers
description: For eight lacrosse teams, a second season will begin tomorrow.

description: (Including races of May 14)

title: CHARTER AIRLINES BACKED ON SCHEDULED FLIGHT ROLE
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP)The Supreme Court today let stand a lower court's decision allowing charter airlines to compete for passengers on regularly scheduled flights.

title: Kidnapped Briton Slain, I.R.A. Says
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 16 (Reuters)Irish guerrillas said today they had killed a British Army captain the kidnapped in south Armagh on the border with the Irish Republic.

title: WORLD OIL SHORTAGE IS CALLED INEVITABLE
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Energy company executives and analysts from 15 countries warned today that nonCommunist countries must make enormous investments in coal, nuclear power and energy conservation to offset an inevitable world oil shortage and a risk of war.

title: April Industrial Output Rose 0.8% For Third Solid Monthly Advance
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP)The nation's industrial output increased 0.8 percent in April, the third month of solid growth, the Government reported today.

title: Taxes & Accounting
description: Countries have widely varying policies on taxing married couples, in some cases rewarding and in others penalizing two  income families, a study by the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development has found. Page 47.

title: COURT PUTS OFF CASE ON CHILDREN'S RIGHTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Supreme Court refused today by vote of 7 to 2 to decide one of the most significant cases on its docket, one from Pennsylvania involving the rights of children whose parents seek to commit them to mental institutions.

title: Views on Energy Solutions Differ in Various Nations
description: Briefings around the world on the report by the Workshop on Alternative Energy Strategies indicated yesterday that, in different nations, solutions may be seen differently.

title: Liberian Ship Unit Is Urging Inspections
description: The Liberian Shipping council called yesterday for an inspection program to weed out aging and unsafe vessels that fly the Liberian flag.

title: Bill on Marijuana Is Apparently Dead As Albany Bid Fails
description: ALBANY, May 16The bill to remove criminal penalties for the possession of small amounts of marijuana appeared dead tonight after unexpected bipartisan oppositionlargely under the impetus of the Conservative Party forced its Assembly sponsors to send it back to committee.

title: Prolonged Drought in Haiti Brings Thousands to Brink of Starvation
description: ANSE ROUGE, Haiti  Severe drought this yearthe worst of three years of sparse rainfallhas brought hundreds of thousands of Haitians to the brink of starvation, relief officials say.

title: Columbia Nine in Playoff
description: CENTERVILLE, MASS., May 16Columbia and Cornell, having tied for first place in the Eastern Intercollegiate Baseball League, will meet in a playoff game tonight at Damaschke Field in Oneonta, N.Y., to determine the league title.

title: Upsets Mark Start Of NorthSouth Golf
description: PINEHURST, N.C., May 16(AP)Two former national champions, Bill Campbell and Vinny Giles, and three top contenders, Dale Morey, Mark Tinder and Greg Hays, went to the sidelines today as the 77th North and South amateur golf tournament opened with a series of surprises.

title: Mets and Yanks Show Serious Side, But Wind Up Offering Comic Relief
description: Assessing some of the recent devel opments in baseball, one of the sport's more astute executives observed yesterday that what we're seeing is one professional comedian and 15 or 16 wouldbe comedians.

title: Plan Offered in Albany for Bank Contributions to Aid Housing
description: ALBANY, May 16Banks in New York State would be required to contribute to funds for rehabilitation of housing and for loans to homebuyers in marginal neighborhoods under a program proposed today by state banking and housing authorities.

title: Nursing Homes, One Year Later
description: The course of public scandal is usually predictable: Noise and fury yield rapidly to apathy and unconcern. That is what happened after the nursing home scandal of 1960. Fifteen years later, Assemblyman Andrew Stein's Temporary State Commission on Living Costs and the Economy demonstrated that shameless profiteeringmagnified by the advent of Medicaidhad overwhelmed all reform. Once again the community became aroused, and once again, in due course, public interest faded. Fortunately, however, the year since last we heard much about our nursing homes seems to have been well used. Indeed, New York is developing what may be a model system for the discovery and control of Medicaid fraud.

title: Taxes & Accounting
description: PARISThe United States is one of six industrial countries where the tax system still appears to encourage sin: It charges married couples more income tax than couples living together would pay on the same income. According to a new study by the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development, Britain, Austria and Finland are the only industrial nations that actually reward virtue by taxing married couples less than those that are not married. In 8 of the 17 countries the O.E.C.D. surveyed, the tax man does not care whether a couple is living together with or without the benefit of matrimony.

title: Dividends
description: MONDAY, MAY 16, 1977

title: Cauthen Boots Home 4 Winners
description: In the first two races at Aqueduct yesterday Steve Cauthen was apparently just getting the feel of the track after the Sunday respite. His mounts ran only second. The first one trailed the winner by 6 lengths but the second, Wind in the Sails, was less than a length behind. And that appeared to put some wind in the 17yearold rider's sails, for he triumphed in the third raceand then guided three others to victory before heaving to for the day.

title: Dollar Gains in Europe;Gold Falls
description: LONDON, May 16 (AP)The dollar made slight gains around Europe today while the price of gold fell in the two main bullion centers, Zurich and London.

title: Carey Says State Subsidizes U.S., And Asks Reasonable Aid for City
description: WASHINGTON, May 16  Governor Carey; urging reasonable Federal assistance for New York City, told the Senate Banking Committee today that New York State can't afford to subsidize the country any longer.

title: ExSaints Linebacker Dies
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 16 (AP)Ray Hester, former linebacker for the New Orleans Saints, died today after a long bout with leukemia at the age of 28. Hester, a native of this area, started 32 straight games with Tulane, before he signed with the Saints as a free agent in 1971.

title: SAMUEL W. LAMBERT JR.
description: Dr. Samuel W. Lambert Jr., an internist and former associate clinical professor of medicine at Columbia University's College of Physicians and Surgeons, died at his Manhattan home last Wednesday. He was 79 years old.

title: Appeal on Gulf Payments Is Barred
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP)The Supreme Court today turned down an appeal by Claude C. Wild Jr., a former lobbyist for the Gulf Oil Corporation, stemming from alleged illegal corporate contributions to the 1972 campaign of Senator Sam Nunn of Georgia.

title: Final Shows Reaffirm Trend to Softness
description: Mohair coats as puffy as cumulus clouds. Sweaters as filmy as spider webs. Colors the rosy beige, pale blue and green of Lalique glass. That's part of the fall fashion program at Anne Klein, devised by Donna Karan and Louis Dell'Olio.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, MAY 17, 1977

title: World News Briefs
description: NEW DELHI, May 16 (Reuters)Prime Minister Morarji R. Desai said today that if India found it necessary to carry out nuclear explosions for peaceful purposes, the tests would be open for observation.

title: FLORENCE EXTON
description: Florence Nightingale Augusta Phillips Exton, widow of Dr. William Gustav Exton, a pathologist and urologist who had been director of the laboratory of the Prudential Life Insurance Company, Newark, died Saturday in her apartment here at 40 Central Park South. She was 96 years old.

title: Market Place
description: Shares of Franklin Mint, a company that has achieved spectacular sales, profits and stockmarket popularity through directmail sales of commemorative coins, stumbled badly yesterday after management said at the annual meeting that profits in the second quarter would trail those of the yearearlier period.

title: CASINO BILL IS READY FOR VOTE IN SENATE
description: TRENTON, May 16Under pressure from the Senate President, Matthew Feldman, Democrat of Teaneck, the Senate Judiciary Committee today completed action on a bill controlling casino gambling in Atlantic City. The committee approved the bill unanimously.

title: Not All Clocks for Human Rights Are the Same
description: President Carter's concern about human rights is genuine and stems from a sincere belief in human dignity. sympathize with this concern and believe that all members of the United Nations, by the very fact of their membership, have committed themselves to the ideals contained in the Charter and in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.

title: Around the Nation
description: ASPEN, Colo.,May 17  Claudine Longet, scheduled to be released from jail tomorrow, is faced with a $1.3 million damage suit filed by the parents of Vladimir Sabich, the companion she killed.

title: Beame Considers 52 Mies Plan for New City Center
description: In a daring architectural salvage operation, the Beame administration is seriously considering a spectacular 25yearold design by Ludwig Mies van der Rohe of an unbuilt convention center in Chicago for construction in New York City.

title: Lightor the Heart of Darkness?
description: VIENNAFew people are very optimistic about the outcome of Vice President Mondale's talks with South African Prime Minister Vorster. No doubt Mr. Vorster is moving gradually to help in creating a new, multiracial Rhodesian state (to be called Zimbabwe) and an independent SouthWest Africa (Namibia).

title: The Troubled Triangle
description: The cold war between the Soviet Union and China proceeds apace into its third decade and each of the giant Communist nations wants President Carter to join with it against the other. That in itself is an excellent reason for doing no such thing. Although no sane person wishes to exacerbate their rivalry toward military conflict, the contest presents both risks and opportunities for the United States that need to be weighed in our own diplomacy.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: COME ON DOWN In the weeks ahead, Union Square will be the place to be for free midday music, dance and theater, as a new entertainment series for workers, residents and visitors swings into motion today in the park bordering on 14th Street. The scheduled programs, with civic sanctioning, will reflect the ethnic and cultural diversity of the neighborhood in hourlong, Wednesday performances beginning at 12:30 P.M.
