description: For periods ended March 31 unless otherwise Indicated. (N) Indicates stock Is traded on the New York Stock Exchange (A) American Stock Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: Technology
description: The Continental Oil Company is building and plans to operate in West Virginia next year a commercialscale system for piping coal slurry directly from the mining face hundreds of feet below the surface.

title: DrugFunds Deadline For Elderly Is June 30
description: TRENTON May 17 (AP)The state announced today that June 30 is the deadline for eligible elderly people to apply for assistance covering pharmaceutical purchases made in 1976.

title: Soviet Poultry Increase Urged
description: MOSCOW, May 17 (AP)Soviet leaders, demanding that poultry production be doubled by 1980, issued a resolution yesterday calling for development of better chickens for the country's mechanized poultry farms.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An article in The Times on Monday incorrectly quoted a portion of the remarks by Willie Morris, the author, at a memorial service for James Jones. Mr. Morris said: One of the ir???? about this most unusual man is that he knew so much about human cruelty in all its manifestationsbut as a person was so lacking in cruelty himself.

title: House Approves A Budget Ceiling Of 460.9 Billion
description: WASHINGTON, May 17The House adopted today a tentative Federal spending ceiling of $460.9 billion for the next fiscal year, with significant support from Republicans, pleased by provisions for increased military spending, who had spurned past Congressional budget proposals as excessive.

title: Child's World
description: SOMETIMES you'll see young parents crawling about on the floor so earnestlyfirst on hands and knees, then worming themselves across the carpet on their stomachs. They'll lift their heads up abruptly, bump something and conclude: Yep, that does hurt; we'll have to move it.

title: Helicopter LandingGear Blamed; U.S. Inspection of All S61's Urged
description: Investigators for the National Transportation Safety Board found yesterday that failure of a landinggear fitting, possibly caused by metal fatigue, precipitated Monday's fatal helicopter accident atop the 59story Pan Am Building in New York City.

title: Francis Filbey, President Of Postal Workers Union, Dies in Washington at 69
description: WASHINGTON, May 17(AP)Francis S. Filbey, president of the American Postal Workers Union, died today at Georgetown University Hospital after a long illness. He was 69 years old.

title: Is Chef Pascal's Cheesecake Lindy's LongKept Secret?
description: WHEN Lindy's restaurant in Manhattan closed its doors and ovensin September, 1969, it was the end of a legend in more ways than one. It was fabled for its sturgeon, corned beef and blintzes. But most of all it was renowned for its cheesecakes, which were as integral a part of Gotham culture as Yankee Stadium, Coney Island, Grant's Tomb and the Staten Island Ferry.

title: The Standings
description: Wednesday, May 18, 1977

title: France's Leftist Opposition Opens Negotiations on a Revised Platform
description: PARIS, May 17France's CommunistSocialist opposition alliance today began an internal debate on which companies to nationalize and how to compensate shareholders if it wins power in elections next year, which is quite possible.

title: Dazzling, No More
description: PIANISTS of extraordinary talent, such as Christina Petrowska, spend a large part of their early lives perfecting technique, so that by the time they are ready to appear in public as adults many of them have thought of little else. The need to look up from the keyboard and communicate something to an audience, therefore, can come as a shock, and even an annoyance. But even the most accomplished pianist. needs to realize that possession of a brilliant technique is not all that rare nowadays, or more than a first step to making music.

title: A Dramatic Rise in Lawsuits and Costs Concerns Bar
description: There is a story lawyers like to tell about a mythical small town. There was not enough business there to support one lawyer. Then a second lawyer arrived, and there was plenty of business for both

title: ExtraCurricular Activity Banned at Twins Park
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., May 17 (UPI) From now on, the only enjoyment in going to Metropolitan Sports Stadium will be in watching the game. Rowdy tailgate parties, Frisbee tossing, volleyball and similar activities in the parking lot before the main events have been banned.

title: LIKUD ASKS FOR UNITY
description: TEL AVIV, Wednesday, May 18Israel's governing Labor Party was defeated today in Israel's national election, bringing to an end the party's 29year domination of the nation's political life.

title: A Proposal for Primary Day Registration Would Doom Voting Bill, Democrat Says
description: WASHINGTON, May 17The Democratic national chairman, Kenneth M. Curtis, predicted today that Congress would defeat President Carter's Election Day registration plan if it were expanded to covery primary as well as general elections.

title: Shultze, After Setbacks, Viewed As Gaining Power in Reshuffle
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 Charles L. Schultze is an economist, one of the best in Washington, virtually everyone agrees. He is uncomfortable running committees, uncomfortable as a political infighter, but he can be more convincing than most in getting economic ideas across to the President.

title: Mondale and Spanish Premier Meet
description: MADRID. May 17Vice President Mondale today told Prime Minister Adolpho Suarez of Spain. I think our people are as excited as yours oy the way democratic processes are inking hold here.

title: 76ers Top Rockets, 112109, Win Series
description: HOUSTON, May 17 (AP)Henry Bibby hit a basket with 37 seconds left and a free throw with 8 seconds to go to lead the Philadelphia 76ers to a 112109 victory over the Houston Rockets tonight. The victory gave the 76ers the National Basketball Associaton Eastern Conference championship.

title: Hnueilings
description: LIPPYBen. Wednesday, May 18, 11:30 A.M., Westchester Hills Cemetery, HastingsonHudson, N. Y.

title: A Dramatic Rise in Lawsuits and Costs Concerns Bar
description: There is a story lawyers like to tell about a mythical small town. There was not enough business there to support one lawyer. Then a second lawyer arrived, and there was plenty of business for both.

title: Audit for Treasury Finds a Deficit In Budget Beame Says Is Balanced
description: The accounting firm used by the United States Treasury Department to oversee New York City's finances has told city officials that Mayor Beame's proposed budget for the fiscal year starting July 1 probably contains a deficit of $53.6 million, sources in the City Comptroller's office said yesterday.

title: Books: A Jew's Life
description: THE Jewish Diaspora has scattered its people to the ends of the earth, but for those great numbers of us who live in New York, the others far off the beaten paths often seem to be an exotic breed. Isaac Goldemberg, a Jew and a poet, was born and raised in Peru. In this first novel, translated from the Spanish by Robert S. Picciotto, he has written, often poetically, about the Jews of his country.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: IT HAS COME to my attention that there are those who consider certain foods too conspicuously easy to prepare to serve to guests. This category would presumably encompass many quickly grilled foods such as lean and tender chopslamb chops, for example.

title: New Proposals on SouthWest Africa
description: VIENNA. May 17  South African sources indicated today that Prime Minister John Vorster may put forward new proposals for the future of SouthWest Africa when he meets with Vice President Mondale here on Thursday.

title: Cornell Beats Columbia, 40, ForIvyLeagueBaseballTitle
description: ONEONTA, N.Y., May 17Gary Gronowski scattered seven hits and struck out 11 to lead Cornell to a 40 victory over Columbia in the Eastern Intercollegiate Baseball League championship playoff tonight.

title: Democrats andG.O.P.OpenDrives To Obtain Political Contributions
description: WASHINGTON, May 17The Republican and Democratic National Committees have quietly hired new special representatives to compete for the millions of dollars in political contributions being raised, by groups representing corporations, business, professional associations and laborunions.

title: Burger Defends Supreme Court As Active in Wide Area of Rights
description: WASHINGTON, May 17Chief Justice Warren E. Burger portrayed the socalled Burger Court today as one that devoted much of its time to cases involving rights, ranging from the rights of racial minorities to rights of women, welfare recipients and the media.

title: Pop:Reich In Review
description: STEVE REICH is still thought of as one of the Young Turks of contemporary American music, so it was a little surprising to see that he was mounting a fourconcert retrospective of his work, which began Monday night at the Kitchen.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: After 19 hours of continuous negotiations, the city and the executive board of the Uniformed Fire Officers Association reached a tentative agreement on a new twoyear contract. Battalion Chief Edwin F. Jennings, president of the association, said that if the 2,500member union voted to accept the agreement, it would mark the first such contract reached by unions representing members of the Fire and Police Departments.

title: Suspect Accused in Drug Seizure
description: PORTLAND Me., May 17A complaint against a Michigan manresulting from the seizure last Saturday of $2 million worth of marijuana in a coastal resort cottage at Arrowsic was filed in United States Court here yesterday. The suspect, Jackie D. Miller, 25 years old, of Fenton, Mich., was accused of possession of marijuana. The 3,000 pounds of marijuana seized by officials was described as coming from the biggest drug bust in the state's history.

title: Deaths
description: ADELMANMurrey, of Ft. Leo, N.J. Beloved husband of Claudia (neo Fero). Dear son of Herman and Belly. Devoted and loving friend or Alyssa and Elizabeth Goliebler. Services will be held at GutlermanMusicantKreitzman corner Passaic and Park Sts., Hackensack, N.J. on Wednesday, May 18th, at 12 noon. Tho memorial period will be observed at the res. dunce. Should friends desire contributions may be made to the Heart Fund.

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, MAY 18, 1977

title: ANNIE L. WILLIAMS, AUTHORS AGENT, DIES
description: Annie Laurie Williams, the authors agent who sold Margaret Mitchell's Gone With the Wind to David O. Selznick for the movies, died yesterday at Mount Vernon (N.Y.) Hospital. She was in her 80's and lived in Mount Vernon. Miss Williams was the widow of Maurice Crane, also a literary agent.

title: Carter Asks End to White Rule in SouthWest Africa
description: LOS ANGELES,May 17 (Reuters)President Carter said today that unless South Africa acted to end white rule in SouthWest Africa, it would face strong action by the United States and four other Western powers in the United Nations.

title: BELL SYSTEM ISSUES PUSH BOND PRICES UP
description: The credit markets moved strongly toward higher prices and lower interest rates yesterday afternoon in response to the surprising rapid sale of a new issue of Bell System bonds yielding 8.15 percent, the lowest rate of return on such securities since the beginning of December. In addition, the credit markets reacted to news that housing starts had declined and that the Treasury had lowered its estimates of its borrowing needs in the months ahead.

title: Film: Fond Period Rite
description: ALTHOUGH the Whitney Museum's presentation of the 1939 Yiddish film. Mirele Efros, is billed as the first of a twopart series devoted to the Yiddish cinema in America, the film has much closer connections to theater than movies. The screenplay, an adaptation of the turnofthecentury Jacob Gordin play, fondly and solemnly preserves all of the gestures associated with the kind of performance that was as much ritual as theater.

title: About Education
description: Not long ago two boys got into a fight in the halls of Intermediate School 44 on West 77th Street in Manhattan. They could have been suspended; instead they were taken to the office of Steven Kaminsky, a teacher grade leader, and signed a behavior Contract

title: A Veritable Cooking School Between Covers
description: No matter how hard you try, there are really only seven basic methods by which you can cook foodboiling, roasting, broiling and grilling, braising, sauting, frying and baking. There may be variances in how you handle these methods for specific foods, but fundamentally, good broiling techniques are good broiling techniques whether you broil fish, beef, chicken or hot dogs. While all cookbooks offer recipes for specific dishes, few provide basic information for mastering these techniques so that the reader could go on to develop his or her own recipes.

title: CARTER RENEWS VOW FOR U. S. HEALTH PLAN
description: LOS ANGELES, May l7President Carter mounted a spirited defense of his domestic policies today, using an enthusiastic labor meeting as a backdrop for his response to recent liberal Democratic criticism that he was ignoring human needs.

title: La Mere Lea: In the Kitchen, Formidable
description: LYONS

title: Wage Negotiations for the Bell System
description: WASHINGTONAfter a 77day national strike by unionized telephone employees in 1955 had caused only minimal disruption of local and longdistance service, Joseph A. Beirne, founding president of the Communications Workers of America, glumly concluded that auto mation had made the Bell System impervious to seri ous hurt through exercise of labor's ultimate weapon, the strike.

title: Stockmann's Lifeline to Moscow
description: Moscow

title: Personal Health
description: The above are some typical questions and requests received and answered by a federally sponsored network of cancer information services established to help the public overcome its fear of cancer through knowledge and to help cancer patients and their families cope with the disease.

title: LIKUD ASKS FOR UNITY
description: TEL AVIV, Wednesday,May 18Israel's governing Labor Party was defeated today in national parlimentary elecdons, bringing to an end the party's 29year domination of the nation's political Life.

title: Market Place
description: The nation's investment companies reduced their holdings of common stocks by $1.5 billion in the three months ended March 31, including substantial blocks of International Business Machines, American Telephone and Telegraph and Exxon.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Meadowlands to Stage a $400,000 Pace, Richest Event for a Major Track in U.S.
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N. J.,May 17 (AP)The richest horse race in American harness and thoroughbred history, featuring a $400,000 purse, will be staged at the Meadowlands July 12, the New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority said today. The harness race, to be called the Meadowlands Pace, is a lateclosing event open to 3yearolds. A track spokesman said he expected about 40 to 50 horses would be nominated for the race. Nominations will be accepted up to June 15, he said, with each owner paying $1,500. About half the original field are expected to pay the additional 82,500 starting fee to run the race, he added.

title: About Real Estate
description: There was joy at Forward Industries five years ago when the company picked itself up from five old buildings on lower Broadway and moved to Brooklyn. As the president saw matters then, the newly built 75,000squarefoot plant in the Brooklyn Flatlands Industrial Park would give the growing company enough space for the next 10 years.

title: Travelers on Separate Paths Victims of Copter Accident
description: Clay S. Young, a freshman at New York University, was heading home to Seattle. Michael Findley was splurging on a trip to the Cannes film festival, where he hoped to promote a threedimensional movie Projector lens.

title: JAMES J. WICKEL, HEADED INTERPRETERS IN TOKYO
description: TOKYO, May 17 (AP)James J. Wickel, head interpreter for the United States Embassy in Tokyo for many years, died of a heart attack yesterday at his home. He was 51 years old.

title: The Liquid Protein Diet Controversy
description: SOME HAVE hailed it as a break through in the battle against obesity. Others say it is no more than a transient gimmick that will pass into obscurity before 1978.

title: Boom! Boom! Cubs Ring Up 23 Runs
description: Last Saturday the Chicago White Sox battered the Cleveland Indians, 182 with a 17hit assault in Comiskey Park. Yesterday the Chicago Cubs, amazingly, topped that feat. They beat the San Diego Padres, 236, at Wrigley Field, on 24 hits, including seven home runs. It was their sixth straight victory.

title: Best Buys
description: THE COOP runneth not over. Nor doth the corral. So, in the absence of widespread chicken or beef sales in the food markets this week, there is novelty, at least, in the form of lobsters.

title: Meadowlands
description: Horses listed in order of post positions

title: Carter Names Ambassador
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (AP)President Carter said yesterday he would nominate Richard K. Fox Jr. of Minneapolis, a career State Department official, to be ambassador to the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago.

title: Late Rally Ends Market's Slide; Some Steel Stocks Hit 77 Lows
description: A late afternoon rally sent the stock market higher yesterday, despite earlier weakness that saw some leading steel issues drop to new 1977 lows.

title: Car Mishap Injures Two
description: Car Mishap Injures Two

title: NASA Awards Contract
description: The Computer Sciences Corporation has received a contract in excess of $40 million from the National Aeronautics and Space Administration for communications and instrumentation support services at the Kennedy Space Center, Fla.

title: Tweed Weavers in Scottish Isles Resist Factories and Strict Hours
description: CARLOWAY, Scotland, May 16The Industrial Revolution has not reached Carloway and, with a little luck, it will not get here until after John MacGregor is dead.

title: ABRAMS BACKS CUOMO IN MAYORAL CONTEST
description: Denying that he was trying to curry favor with Governor Carey for support as the Democratic candidate for Attorney General next year, Robert Abrams yesterday announced his support of Mario M. Cuomo for Mayor.

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, MAY 18, 1977

title: The Greatest Is Now The Dullest
description: LANDOVER. Md.,May 17The morning after, Muhammad Ali is usually in full cry, gently patting the unmarked face known throughout the world, ridiculing his next opponent, praising his deflated foe from the night before. But today Muhammad Ali was in full flight. About 10 hours after his dreary 15round decision over Alfredo Evangelista of Spain, the world heavyweight champion moved quickly through the lobby of the Sheraton Inn, scribbled a few fast autographs, hurried into a big black limousine and departed for a jetliner to Los Angeles where the motion picture in which he plays the title role, The Greatest, will have its world premiere Thursday evening in a Hollywood dazzle of celebrities. But he is The Greatest now only on film. In the ring he is The Dullest, a sad reminder of what he once was. Both on and off the screen, the 35yearold champion is now more actor than athlete.

title: Roasters Nervous Over Reports Of Cold Injury to Coffee in Brazil
description: Nervous coffee roasters, a group that includes all major food companies, were trying to ascertain the extent of the damage caused by unseasonal cold and windy weather in the state of Parana, Brazil, late yesterday.

title: International Harvester
description: The International Harvester Company, a leading maker of farm equipment, motor truck and industrial products, reported yesterday net income of $57.6 million, or $1.97 a share for the quarter ended April 30. This was just under the $57.2 million, or $2 a share on fewer shares recorded in the corresponding period last year.

title: Where to Call To Seek Information
description: Following are the numbers of existing information services. All 800 numbers are tollfree within the areas listed. The other numbers can be reached from anywhere at regular longdistance rates.

title: Teacher Federation Says It Won Smashing Victory in School Vote
description: The United Federation of Teachers said yesterday that it had won a smashing victory by taking 172 of 288 vacant school board seats in 32 districts throughout the five boroughs in elections earier this month.

title: Emoting Strindberg
description: THERE ARE TIMES perhaps when we learn almost too much about the farfromprivate life of August Strindberg from attendance at his plays. How naked should a maneven an artistbe? Strindberg is a master at selfevisceration, wielding the knife with a masochistic glee and a butcher's skill.

title: Wine Talk
description: IT was the fall of 1945. The Germans had pulled out of Bordeaux long ago and it was time for the harvest. Almost as if in celebration of the end of the long dark night of war, nature provided one of the finest vintages of the century.

title: DEFECTOR FROM HANOI DEPICTS CONDITIONS
description: AWA KOMINATO, Japan, May 15A recently defected Vietnamese deputy who served on the culture and education committee of the Hanoi Parliament said in an interview today that the central thrust of Vietnamese cultural policy was to dam the northward spread of southern Vietnam's Westernized culture.

title: Rizzo's Candidates Lose in Primary
description: PHILADELPHIA,May 17The political prestige of Mayor Frank L. Rizzo was severely tarnished today by the defeat of the two principal candidates he supported in citywide primary elections.

title: West Point and Women: The Way It Was
description: Women: In my day they weren't just different, to most cadets at West Point, they were like another breed.... Soft where men weren't soft; angular where men were muscled; padded with extras where men were stripped down like a hot rod.

title: An Empty Plate On Every Table
description: WASHINGTON

title: Clothes for Fall: Let Freedom Ring
description: There has been, during the past few seasons, an enormous change in the spirit of the clothes in the women's fashion industry. The movement, since that is what it is now, is reaching its culmination in the fall clothes collection that will begin appearing in the stores next month.

description: Horses listed in order of post positions ????? ????? OTB ?????

title: Justice Dept. Is Checking Reports Its Officials Condoned Illegalities
description: WASHINGTON, May 17The Justice Department has begun trying to check out allegations by agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation that ranking department officials may have known about and condoned allegedly illegal investigative techniques that have already resulted in the indictment of one former agent.

title: FRESH AIR FUND TO MARK 100TH YEAR WITH BENEFIT
description: The Fresh Air Fund will hold a dinnerdance tomorrow at the Tavern on the Green in Central Park to benefit its Centennial Fund. Mary Martin is serving as honorary chairman and will speak briefly.

title: Card of Thanks
description: LEDERMANSolomon, M.D. Dr. Helene Aronson gratefully acknowledges and thanks all friends, patients and colleagues for their kind expressions of sympathy for the great loss of her beloved husband.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, May 17The state's Director of Consumer Health Services, Dr. Oscar B. Sussman, has asked Governor Byrne to investigate the practice of assigning two sets of license plates to the stateowned cars of top state officials.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: Coffee Futures Rise 6Cent Daily Limit
description: Reports of unusually cold weather and strong winds sweeping through the heart of Brazil's coffeegrowing region last Monday sent futures prices up the daily limit of 6 cents a pound yesterday.

title: Letter: On Prolonging Life
description: To the Editor:

title: Raiders Casper Hospitalized
description: LODI, Calif.,May 17 (AP)Oakland Raiders tight end, Dave Casper, was hospitalized yesterday following a traffic accident in which an Oakland restaurant owner was killed. The 26yearold Casper was listed in stable and satisfactory condition at Lodi Community Hospital after suffering a mild concussion and a wrist injury. Wayne Shiller of Alameda was dead on arrival after his car crashed off a river levee road. Shiller was driving with Casper his passenger.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: IT WON'T come as much of a surprise to learn that the hero of Jules Feiffer's first novel, Ackroyd, ends up in the kitchen of his apartment, staring at the white wall of the refrigerator hoping to come up with a clue to what I want to make myself. The pun is Feiffer. The identity crisisunresolved after 349 pages of searching for identityis the purest Feiffer. One would scarcely expect him to put pen to paper without creating a character who ends up staring at a blank surface wondering not only what he isthe implicit questionbut also what he ought to become, what he ought to make himself.

title: If You're 21, Tennis Tour Beckons
description: The best young tennis players in the country will be coming to New York this summer for the national 21yearsandunder championships. This is the circuit that was organized last year by Seena Hamilton for the United States Tennis Association, which every so often likes to remind people that the sport is not the exclusive domain of Jimmy Connors, Chris Evert and the other racquet millionaires.

title: ExAide in Carter Campaign Working for Cuomo
description: Can a littleknown ItalianAmerican lawyer from Queens be sold on radio and television like a wellknown peanut farmer from Georgia?

title: Buyers Slow to Act As Deadline Nears On G.M. Exchange
description: With the June 1. deadline approaching for buyers of Oldsmobiles. Buicks and Pontiacs with Chevrolet engines to exercise their option either to exchange their cars or receive free insurance policies, a great number of affected customers have yet to act on the offer made last month by the General Motors Corporation.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M. WNCN. Rhapsodle, Grandjany; Introduction and Rondo Capriccioso, SaintSaens; Danse Bohemienne, Debussy; Country Dances, Mozart; Prelude and Fugue in flat; BachSchoenberg; Fantasie No. 3, Byrd.

title: Letters
description: To THE LIVING SECTION:

title: Bridge:
description: In the long history of the national Intercollegiate championships, it is doubtful whether there has ever been a victory as decisive as was registered last month by Martin Fleisher and Alan Heubert of Teaneck, N.J., representing Swarthmore College.

title: Nastase, Vilas Score in Italy; Americans Bow
description: ROME, May 17 (AP)Guillermo Vilas crushed the British veteran Roger Taylor, 61, 62, in the first round of the $150,000 Italian tennis open championships today. After two days of rain, the big guns moved into action in the Foro Italico.

title: Amtrak Running Times Lengthened On Routes Plagued by Derailments
description: WASHINGTON,May 17Diesel locomotives that have a way of jumping the trackand had track itselfhave fo???? Amtrak to add from one to six hours to the running times of some of its longhaul trains for safety reasons.

title: Wife Is Not Liable for Charging Purchases on Husband's Account
description: A wife who charges a purchase to her husband's account cannot be held liable for the debt, Attorney General Louis Lefkowitz of New York said yesterday. The husband, he added, is responsible for the debt and can be sued by the merchant.

title: New Yorkers, etc.
description: ACCORDING to Dr. Richard Huber, Dean of General Studies at Hunter College, Mary Mead, a recent migr from Dallas, knows as much about style as the chairman of the board of General Motors knows about cars.

title: McGough, Hyndman Gain In North and South Golf
description: PINEHURST, N. C., May 17 (AP)John McGough, University of North Carolina junior from Greenville, Miss., shot the hottest golf of the North and South amateur tournament, five under par, and led the way through the second round today with a 2and1 victory over Jay Baumgardner of Bristol, Tenn.

title: Memorial Services
description: DUNLAPDr. Jack W. Memorial services for Dr. Jack W. Dunlap, the founder of Dunlap & Associates Inc., who died May 8, will be held at 8 P.M. Friday, May 20, at the First Presbyterian Church, 1101 Bedford Street, Stamford, Conn.

title: Plains, Ga., Farmer Puts His Feelings in Nutshell
description: WASHINGTON, May 17James M. Collins, a Texas millionaire, hailed him as a commonsense businessman. Representative Robert H. Michel of Illinois, the House minority whip, praised him for his gems of wisdom. And Senator Herman E. Talmadge of Georgia exulted over the man who does not pull any punches.

title: Micro(phone)nesia
description: This week the people of Micronesia, through their representatives, will meet with the United States Government in Honolulu for four days of negotiations. If these negotiations are successful, Micronesia may become a nation with limited sovereignty instead of remaining a United States dependency.

title: WNET on Offensive
description: THE 16 EPISODES that comprised the final season of Upstairs, Downstairs will be repeated by WNET this summer arter a reprise of all 26 episodes of The Forsyte Saga. Both British serials, which had played on a weekly basis in the past, will be presented nightly at 8 o'clock Mondays through Thursdays.

title: Navajo Leaders Free in Fraud Case
description: PHOENIX.May 17Fraud charges against the chairman of the Navajo tribe and his former aide were dismissed today by a Federal judge after a jury said that it could not reach a verdict.

title: House Passes $1.5 Billion Bill to Stimulate Youth Jobs
description: WASHINGTON,May 17 (AP)The House voted today to authorize a $1.5 billion program to put more than 200,000 young persons into jobs or training programs. The vote was 334 to 61.

title: Four Hospitals Urged to Phase Out Maternity Wards by End of Year
description: NEWARK, May 17Citing a 26 percent drop in the birth rate in a fivecounty region of North Jersey in the first half of this decade, an official health planning agency urged today that four hospitals in the region phase out their underutilized maternity wards by the end of the year.

title: KoosmanStars With Home Run and aFogrHitter
description: The Board of Directors stayed out of the New York Mets' locker room last night, and the players found the experience so uplifting that they went out and whacked the San Francisco Giants, 81.

title: Advertising
description: Among the recordsize crowd of advertisingrelated people who begin to gather today in the posh precincts of the stately old Greenbrier in White Sulphur Springs, W. Va., will be Rein Rijkens, a Dutchman, who is a director of SSC&BLintas International.

title: Carey Contends Carter Reneges On Relief Vow
description: ALBANY, May 17Governor Carey accused President Carter today of breaking a campaign promise to have the Federal Government take over the entire local share of welfare costs, and said he hoped to lead his fellow Governors in a fight to persuade the President to live up to his commitment.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The General Electric Company has developed a new technique, called Thermomigration, in the production of semiconductor components, which reduces the time required to fabricate a semiconductor device by as much as a thousandfold; that is, from more than a week to only a few minutes.

title: Building a Better Spray Can
description: The idea that little puffs from spray cans could endanger the great ozone belt that surrounds the earth was preposterous. The notion that a thriving business should be wrecked on the basis of such moonshine was monstrous. That was the reaction of many Americans, inside the industry and out, when scientists first advanced the theory that the fluorocarbons that propel deodorants and hair sprays could ultimately break down the planet's protective layer against excessive ultraviolet radiation.

title: JAPAN AGREES TO CUT COLOR TV SHIPMENTS TO U. S. BY OVER 40%
description: WASHINGTON, May 17To head off a sharp increase in American tariffs, Japan has agreed to severe limitations of its color television shipments in the United States over the next three years, American and Japanese sources reported today.

title: Events Today
description: AGAMEMNON, adaptation of the A?s?hyius tragedy; staged by Andrei Serban; music by Elizabeth Swados; presented by the New York Shakespeare festival, Joseph Papp, producer; at the Vivian Beaumont Theater, Lincoln Center, 8.

title: Two in House Seek To Bar Postal Cuts And Rate Increase
description: WASHINGTON,May 17Two House authorities on postal matters today promised legislation to head off the United States Postal Service's plan to increase postal rates and reduce mail deliveries to five days a week.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Alston Doubles in Debut To Start Deciding Rally
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 17Dell Alston, the newest Yankee, provided a satisfactory end to New York's soso road trip as he got the key hit in the 15inning 52 victory over the A's this afternoon.

title: Q&A
description: Q My collection of spices has been growing over the years. Many of them are seldom used and I keep them in glass jars or their original containers. How long do they keep?

title: House Approves A Budget Ceiling Of 460.9 Billion
description: WASHINGTON, May 17The House adopted today a tentative Federal spending ceiling of $460.9 billion for the next fiscal year, with significant support from Republicans, pleased by provisions for increased military spending, who had spurned past Congressional budget proposals as excessive.

title: NATO Sets a 3% Arms Budget Rise
description: BRUSSELS, May 17West European defense ministers today approved an increase in military spending by members of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization to meet the growing strength of the Soviet Union.

title: Sam Bernstein, Founder Of Murray's, the Store Specializing in Sturgeon
description: Sam Bernstein, cofounder of Murray's Sturgeon Shop, a highly regarded gourmet establishment on the West Side that specializes in smoked fish and exotic culinary items, died at his home yesterday.

title: JAPAN AGREES TO CUT COLOR TV SHIPMENTS TO U. S. BY OVER 40%
description: WASHINGTON, May 17To head off a sharp increase in American tariffs, Japan has agreed to severe limitations of its color television shipments in the United States over the next three years, American and Japanese sources reported today.

title: Brezhnev, Urging Arms Pact, Silent on Any Progress
description: MOSCOW, May 17Leonid I. Brezhnev said today that a new treaty limiting strategic arms would help improve the climate of SovietAmerican relations, but he gave no indication that the deadlock over such an accord had been broken.

title: MOBIL ABSOLVED BY U.S. OF VIOLATING EMBARGO
description: The Treasury Department said yesterday that it could find no evidence of violations of a United Nations trade embargo of Rhodesia by the Mobil Corporation. The charge was made by the United Church of Christ a year ago.

title: Sudanese Leader, in Paris, Says Soviet Threatens Peace in Africa
description: PARIS,May 17President Gaafar alNimeiry of the Sudan, here on a threeday state visit, charged today that peace in the Horn of Africa was threatened by the Soviet Union, embarked with Cuba on a new form of colonialism in Africa.

title: BEAME ASKS SENATE TO EXTEND U.S. LOANS
description: WASHINGTON,May 17Mayor Beame urged Congress today to act promptly to extend the program of Federal loans to New York City beyond 1978, emphasizing that the city can't afford to wait four years for Federal assumption of local welfare costs.

title: Secrecy in Shea Dispute
description: A solution may be near concerning the JetsMets controversy over the use of Shea Stadium. Judge Harold Baer of the State Supreme Court, who is to resolve the matter, called a meeting yesterday with lawyers for both sides, plus the city, which is the third party as the Shea landlord.

title: Major League Scores
description: Minnesota 4, 2BBBell, Hisle 2, Wyne ?ar, Cubbage, Greubab Terrell, Kusick.3BBlanks. HRCarew (3). SFosse, Chiles.

title: I'd Like to Do a Critique Of the Critics
description: TWO YEARS AGO, Martha Keller couldn't speak a word of English. The 31yearold Swissborn actress worked only in Europe, where she had appeared in 48 plays and 13 movies, and was inevitably cast as the Sunshine Girl, always healthy and romantic.

title: 9 Held in `Wall St. Club Sex Raid
description: A midtown massage parlor that the police said catered only to recommended people from Wall Street, was raided last night by police officers posing as customers. Nine persons were arrested on charges of promoting prostitution and the illegal sale of alcohol,

title: U.S. Questions the Prices of Bread
description: WASHINGTON, May 17The Government's price monitors questioned today whether there was enough competition in the baking industry to insure that bread products are produced and distributed at the lowest possible cost to consumers.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Article 5  No Title

title: Dr. Goldfield Supported in Vote At State Medical Society Meeting
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 17Dr. Martin Goldfield, who was recently demoted by tie State Health Commissioner, received a vote of confidence today from the Medical Society of New Jersey.

title: Commune Thrives on MillionDollar Income
description: TURNERS FALLS, MassOn Sunday morning the streets of Turners Falls are fairly quiet with most people in church or at home. At one church in the center of town, a longhaired minister, clad in kneehigh boots, jeans, a denim vest and a top hat, talks about love.

title: Glassboro Golf Champion
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., May 17 (AP)Glassboro State College won the N.C.A.A. District Two, Division Three golf qualifying tournament here today. The Profs trailed openinground leader Ramapo by 13 strokes after the first' day's play yesterday at Rutgers golf course, but raillied with a fourman total of 296 to finish at 615. Ramapo trailed at 623 and was followed by Upsala, 638; Trenton State, 640, and William Paterson, 644.

title: TV:To the Brink With The Atom
description: ALL'S NORMAL, more or less, in the televisionentertainment factory as still another tale raising the specter of nuclear annihilation rolls around on CBSTV tonight at 9 o'clock. This one is Red Alert, based on a Harold King novel originally published as Paradigm Red.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY TransAtlantic

title: Ronnie Eldridge Becomes Fourth To Enter Race to Succeed Sutton
description: In the sunny backyard of her West Side brownstone, surrounded by family and friends. Ronnie M. Eldridge yesterday became the fourthand probably the final Democrat to enter the race for Manhattan Borough President, a race that the candidates see emerging more as a question of style than of substance.

title: Young in Mozambique
description: MAPUTO, Mozambique,May 17An drew Young met today with African nationalists here outside a United Nations conference on southern Africa and stressed the Carter Administration's commitment to majority rule in the area.

title: Air Taxi Service Begun
description: HANOVER TOWNSHIP., N. J., May 17 (AP)Flights by an air taxi commuter service from Morristown Airport here to La Guardia and Kennedy and Newark International Airports began yesterday. Transcom Airways took seven passengers to and from Morristown as it inaugurated its service with a Piper Aztec. We don't really expect more passengers until people start hearing about us, said David Deutsch, TransCom's president.

title: Technicians Strike ABC
description: ENGINEERS and technicians for the American Broadcasting Company, determined to block management's attempts to change their work rules, walked off their jobs at midnight Monday. The strike, decided upon by the union after an impasse in contract negotiations reached earlier Monday, did not disrupt normal programming.

title: Film Folk at Cannes Talk Funds, Not Fun
description: CANNES, France, May 17More people and more movies than ever before have turned up for Cannes's 30th film festival, which the director Maurice Bessy called perhaps the festival of the last chance.

title: Prof. Erwin Mueller, 65; Physicist Was First Person to See an Atom
description: Prof. Erwin W. Mueller, a physicist and the first man to see an atomthrough a special miscroscope that he developeddied yesterday at George Washington University Hospital, Washington. He was 65 years old and a resident of State College, Pa.

title: KRESGE NET STABLE; IS RENAMED K MART
description: The S. S. Kresge Company, which renamed itself the K mart Corporation yesterday, showed virtually no change in its first fiscal quarter ended April 27, although sales were up 20 percent from a year ago.

title: Careers
description: Does the hotelrestaurant business offer opportunities to trained college graduates and master's degree holders?

title: Rep. Udall Startles Publishers
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, May 17Representative Morris K. Udall, Democrat of Arizona, first abused and then startled an audience of major book publishers by telling them that he is adding the book field and communications in general to a bill he has introduced in the House to study monopolistic concentration in critical American industries.

title: Notes on People
description: WHEN THE students at Lakefield College School, in Lakefield, Ont., cast their musical play Oliver! they did so in a most egalitarian way. The school's most famous student, Prince Andrew of Britain, the second son of Queen Elizabeth II, did not snag the Oliver Twist leading role, nor even that of the villainous Fagin.

title: Bell Praised by N.A.A.C.P. Chiefs For Action in 3 Integration Cases
description: Leaders of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People gave good marks yesterday to Attorney General Griffin B. Bell, whose confirmation they had opposed, for his intervention in three major school desegregation cases so far.

title: Officials and Nature Join to Hail Justice Douglas
description: WASHINGTON, May 17They honored a prophet today. With speeches and dignitariesand with birdsong and sunshine and the rustle of a light breeze in the treesthe 127yearold C.& O. canal and towpath were dedicated to William O. Douglas, the retired Supreme Court Justice.

title: Colborn Is Player of Week
description: KANSAS CITY, May 17 (AP)Jim Colborn, on the strength of his nohitter against the Texas Rangers, has become the second Kansas City Royal to be named this season as American League playeroftheweek. Colborn, a ??ghthander, permitted only two runners to reach base in beating the Rangers, 60, Saturday for the first nohitter of his major league career. The triumph

title: Files of S.E.C. Show Slush Funds In Use Decades Before Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, May 17  American companies began creating slush funds from which they made political contributions and other secret payments decades before the practice was exposed during the Watergate scandal, according to Securities and Exchange Commission files made public today.

title: ln Memoriam
description: Frank, Ned David. Today you would be 40.

title: World News Briefs
description: GENEVA,May 17The International Commission of Jurists, in a report published today, denounced the United Nations Commission on Human Rights for slowness in dealing with complaints about the situation in Uganda.

title: 2 Australian Youngsters Ousted in Eastern Tennis
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., May 17Phil Kadesch of Winchester, Mass., and Roger Wootton of Port Washington, L.I., defeated young Australians and led 10 qualifiers into the main draw of the $3,000 Prince Eastern hardcourt tennis championships tonight at the Roosevelt Field Tennis Club.

title: Doctor Tells Court That Laetrile Made Cancer Patient Feel Better
description: A 69year old man suffering from incurable cancer of the pancreas felt markedly better over a 30day period during which he was given the controversial drug laetrile, according to a report filed by his physician yesterday with a judge in Federal District Court in Brooglyn.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: EVEN THOUGH airlines have long since abandoned their trumpeting of the putative succulence of their food, the public still takes to the air with heightenedyes, that seems the wordexpectations about the food. Which makes the reality all the more difficult to stomach.

title: Dance: Calder Fete
description: MARTHA GRAHAM'S Gala Tribute to Alexander Calder began, appropriately enough, with Miss Graham herself talking briefly about the Calder she knewshe called him a divine clown and was followed, also appropriately, by that dance overture for her company and style, Adorations.

title: Navy Is Halting a Spy Operation That Used Businesses as Cover
description: WASHINGTON,May 17 (AP)The Navy is halting a spying operation that has kept track of port visits by Soviet naval ships and performed other intelligence tasks through business establishments and other covers in foreign nations, Pentagon sources said tonight.

title: Many in Boxing Say Ali Should Quit After Performance Against Spaniard
description: LANDOVER, Md., May 17Most boxing people, including some trying to promote his next fight, think that Muhammad Ali should retire.

title: Private Lives
description: IT was not, admittedly, adult behavior. In fact, he closed the door on the room full of modern novels, and, in the hall, turned Schopenhauer's face to the wall. There had been afternoons when he consoled himself by thinking about Schopenhauer's having consoled himself by thinking about the Upanishads, but this wasn't one of them. He climbed the stairs to the kitchen and fixed his first ginandtonic of the season. In the past, his first ginandtonic of the season had invariably caused snow to fall for another six weeks, but he thought that God was probably preoccupied these days with Jimmy Carter and wouldn't notice.

title: ANDRUS DEFERS SALE OF SOME OIL LEASES FOR ECOLOGY REASONS
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (UPI)Interior Secretary Cecil D. Andrus today postponed sales of oil leases in environmentally sensitive waters off Alaska, California and the southern Atlantic coast.

title: Dollar Eases in Europe; Gold Climbs in London, Marks Time in Zurich
description: LONDON, May 17 (AP) The dollar eased against European currencies today. The price of gold rose in London and marked time in Zurich, Europe's two main bullion centers.

title: Technology
description: The Continental Oil Company is building and plans to operate next year a system for piping coal slurry from the mining face to the surface hundreds of feet above. Page D5.

title: April Housing Starts Off 11% From Preceding Month
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (AP)Housing construction dropped sharply in April from its brisk activity in March but was still well ahead or the 1976 pace, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: 2 WATER PROJECTS CARTER OPPOSED VOTED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (UPI)The House voted today to authorize $1.2 billion to continue construction of 18 water projects, including two that President Carter tried to stop.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: Horses listed in order of postions Latter designates OTB Listing

title: Apples Beat Friars, 2928, In Tiebreaker
description: The New York Apples needed 3 hours 8 minutes of tennis, two tiebreakers and 11 match points last night to beat the San Diego Friars, 2928 in the Felt Forum. The prolonged World Team Tennis contest ended on an overhead shot by Billie Jean King that gave the Apples a 75 victory in the 13point supertiebreaker.

title: U.S. Cruise Ship Docks in Havana; CubanAmericans Stay Aboard
description: HAVANA,May l7 The first cruise ship to bring American tourists from the United States in 16 years arrived here today to a reception that was at once spontaneous and staged, happy and sad, and always under the tight control of the Cuban Government.

title: Chess:
description: To make use of the end game as a weapon, more is required than being able to prosecute winning pawnahead endings and to defend skillfully and stubbornly those in which the opponent has all the winning chancesone must develop the judgment for pushing various middlegame situations into favorable end games.

title: Jim Ulozas Takes Lead In L.I. Open
description: STONY BROOK, L.I.,May 17Jim Ulozas, a 5foot11inch professional golfr, did not look the part 13 months ago when he weighed 320 pounds. That was when he decided to try hypnosis in order to lose weight. It worked and he dropped to 200 pounds, discarding his size 48 jackets for a size 42.

title: School Board Fights Plan to End It
description: The Board of Education yesterday mounted a counteroffensive designed to stop Mayor Beame from replacing the salaried sevenmember board with a Commissioner of Education appointed by the Mayor.

title: Dividends
description: TUESDAY, MAY 17, 1977

title: Tokyo Aide Hints Bad Faith by U.S. in Nuclear Talks
description: TOKYO, May 17The chairman of Japan's Atomic Energy Commission suggested here today that American officials were dealing with Japan in bad faith in the dispute over nuclear reprocessing. The controversy, he said, threatens to disrupt JapaneseAmerican friendship.

title: People in Sports
description: Dorothy Hamill, the 20yearold Olympic gold medalist in figure skating, was in town yesterday to pick up the keys to a 1977 Ford Thunderbird. It was all part of being voted the 1977 athleteoftheyear by the readers of women Sports magazine. The magazine's publisher, Billie Jean King, also gave Miss Hamill a special crystal trophy, which Mrs. King called the symbol of the many faceted accomplishments of women in snorts today.

title: Close Watch Kept on Hawaii's Rumbling Volcano That Scientists Say Should Erupt by July of 1978
description: HAWAII VOLCANOES NATIONAL PARKThe summit and slopes of the mountain are swelling slightly but menacingly. Deep underfoot, unseen but not undetected, molten rock churns with heat and gathering pressure. It seeps through subterranean crevices, probing with all its pentup might for a way out.

title: Issue and Debate
description: WASHINGTON,May 16  President Carter has stressed what he calls an undeviating commitment to human rights everywhere. Yet at the same time, he and Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance have acknowledged that there are limits to how far the United States can go in promoting human rights without producing undesired results.

title: Reporters Rush for 28 Cartons of Political Payments Data
description: WASHINGTON, May 17The reporters; carrying cardboard containers of coffee and breakfast pastries, began lining up at 7 A.M. outside the locked door of the Securities and Exchange Commissions public reference room.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Article 4  No Title

title: Open Interest
description: Tuesday, May 17, 1977

title: Gen. Sir William Morgan, 85, Was Chief of Staff to Alexander
description: LONDON, May 17 (AP)Gen. Sir William Duthie Morgan, who accepted the surrender of the German forces in Italy on April 29, 1945, at Caserta, died last Friday at age 85, his family reported today.

title: Toward an Accord by OPEC
description: BAHRAIN,May 17In the five months since the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries split over how much to raise oil prices this year, reports of various compromises to erase the gap have reached the industrialized world a half dozen times. Now, oil experts are almost universally convinced that the prospects for settlement are better than at any time since last Dec. 17 when the dramatic announcement of the split was made.

title: Pope Names Auxiliary Bishop
description: VATICAN CITY, May 17 (AP)Pope Paul VI has named the Rev. John J. Paul as auxiliary to Bishop Frederick W. Freking of La Crosse, Wis., the Vatican announced today. Auxiliary Bishop Paul, 58 years old, was also made titular bishop of Lambesi.

title: Asarco Cuts Zinc 3c, 3 Others Trim Price
description: Asarco Inc. announced yesterday morning a cut of 3 cents a pound in its zinc prices and three other producers followed suit. However, the St. Joe Minerals Corporation, the nation's largest producer, said only that it would probably have an announcement to make today.

title: TRIS BAN VIOLATION LAID TO WOOLWORTH
description: The F.W. Woolworth Company was charged by the Federal Government yesterday with violating a ban on selling children's clothing treated with a flameretardant chemical called Tris. The company, denying the charge, agreed to a court order prohibiting any violation of the ban.

title: Commissioner Tells Prison Aides: Don't Apologize
description: TRENTON, May 17The State Corrections Commissioner, Robert E. Mulcahy 3d, told prison officials today that they should stop being apologetic and defensive about shortcomings not of their making in correctional systems. He said that they should mount a campaign to let everyone know what we can and cannot doand why.

title: Gromvko Arrives in Geneva
description: GENEVA, May 17Foreign Minister Gromyko arrived today for talks with Secretary of State Vance and reiterated the Soviet contention that progress toward a new arms agreement rested largely with the United States.

title: FLAHERTY CITES RECORD TO DENY PRIVILEGE USE
description: WASHINGTON,May 17 (UPI)Deputy Attorney General Peter F. Flaherty released yesterday a transcript of a Senate Rules Committee hearing to counter reports that he had invoked executive privilege to justify withholding from Congress an internal Justice Department memorandum warning that instant voter registration would yield a tremendous potential for fraud,

title: KenyaTanzania Frontier Remains Shut, and Some Say Nyerere Has Barricaded Road to Socialism
description: NAIROBI, KenyaThree months ago, when Tanzania closed its border with Kenya and seized Kenyan trucks, cars and private planes, it appeared to be simply a quarrel between sister states that would soon blow over. It has not worked out that way.

title: Shareholders Blur Bright Picture at ABC
description: With the American Broadcasting Companies Inc. reporting virtually nothing but cheer on the financial and rating fronts, Leonard H. Goldenson, its chairman, might have expected a short and congratulatory annual meeting yesterday.

title: Beame Considers 52 Mies Plan for New City Center
description: In a daring architectiral salvage operation, the Beame administration is seriously considering a spectacular 25yearold design by Ludwig Mies van der Rohe of an unbuilt convention center in Chicago for construction in New York City.

title: Carey Contends Carter Reneges On Relief Vow
description: ALBANY, May 17Governor Carey accused President Carter today of breaking a campaign promise to have the Federal Government take over the entire local share of welfare costs, and said he hoped to lead his fellow Governors in a fight to persuade the President to live up to his commitment.

title: Philadelphia Transit Fares Up
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 17 (A.P)1t now ?costs 45 cents, instead of cents, to ride a bus, trolley or subway operated by the Southeastern Pennsylvania Transportation Authority in Philadelphia. Judge James Cavanaugh of Common Pleas Court cleared the way for the SEPTA increase yesterday. It went into effect at 12:01 A.M. today and will affect some 400,000 daily riders. The fare rise had been scheduled to take effect last Sunday. but a citizens group filed a lawsuit that temporarily blocked the rise.

title: LUCIA BALDWIN COLLINS, 73, MADEMOISELLE EXECUTIVE
description: Lucia Baldwin Collins, retired promotion director of Mademoiselle magazine, died at her home in Ft. Lauderdale, Fla., on Monday. She was 73 years old and was the widow of Arthur Collins, president of Collins & Tuttle, a New York real estate firm.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: If the good old days seem better with each passing year, there's probably no better way to bring ???? back, at least temporarily, than with records. And not just any record butare you ready for itBulldog Drummond, the Lone Ranger, Fibber McGee and Molly, the Green Hornet and Uncle Miltie on Radio. There's also Al Jolson in The Jazz Singer and The Shadow and Gang Busters and.... Some of the records are available in record stores and shops around and about, but scores of these golden oldies can be had by mail at a discount price. A single longplaying record is $4.95 and a tworecord set is $8.95 and then there's 75 cents postage. The address is Radiola, Box H, CrotononHudson, N.Y. 10520. A call to 9147376831 will get you the complete list from which to order.

title: Files of S.E.C. Show Slush Funds In Use Decades Before Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, May 17  American companies began creating slush funds from which they made political contributions and other secret payments decades before the practice was exposed during the Watergate scandal, according to Securities and Exchange Commission files made public today.

title: Wells Will Conduct State's Tourist Drive
description: Governor Carey and leaders of the State Legislature gave their support yesterday to a $4.3 million tourist program that will be conducted by Wells, Rich, Greene. This will require supplemental legislation.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Mayor Paul T. Jordan of Jersey City received permission yesterday from a Superior Court judge to have his name removed from the ballot for the Democratic gubernatorial primary on June 7.

title: CARTER RENEWS VOW FOR U. S. HEALTH PLAN
description: LOS ANGELES, May 17President Carter mounted a spirited defense of his domestic policies today, using an enthusiastic labor meeting as a backdrop for his response to recent liberal Democratic criticism that he was ignoring human needs.

title: How to Exit Smiling
description: NEW HAVEN, Conn.Former President Ford came back to Yale here the other day and demonstrated what we mean in this country when we talk about a classy guy. The occasion was the 276th Commencement of the University, where he had been a freshman football coach and law student, in that order.

title: House Bars Cut in New York State Lunch Program
description: WASHINGTON, May 18The House today narrowly rejected amendments to cut New York State's share of the fraudscarred, free summer feeding program for needy children, and then voted, 393 to 19, to extend the program for two more years with tighter controls.

title: HELMAN PLEADS GUILTY TO STOCK AND MAIL FRAUD
description: William A. Heiman, a former vice president of S. J. Salmon & Company, a defunct securities concern, pleaded guilty yesterday in New York Federal Court to three counts of stock manipulation and mail fraud. Mr. Heiman had previously pleaded innocent to the charges contained in two indictments handed up earlier this year.

title: VANCE AND GROMYKO OPEN GENEVA PARLEY
description: GENEVA, May 18Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance and Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko today began another round of negotiations aimed at overcoming the stalemate on a new agreement limiting strategic weapons.

title: FLORENCE D. HEINLEIN
description: Florence D. Heinlein, a retired lawyer and former president of the Evangelical Home For the Aged in Brooklyn, died Tuesday in her home, 47 Continental Avenue, Forest Hills, Queens, after a long illness. Her age was 73.

title: Swiss Credit Bank Appoints New Chief
description: GENEVA, May 18Swiss Credit Bank announced today the appointment of Rainer E. Gut, a member of its top levelgeneral management since 1975, to succeed Heinz R. Wuffli as its chief executive. Mr. Wuffli resigned a week ago in the wake of the scandal at the bank's branch at Chiasso, on the Italian frontier, where $880 million in funds of Italian investors was channeled in an irregular fashion to a holding company registered in Liechtenstein.

title: Claims Court Bars Judges' Pay Plea
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (AP)The United States Court of Claims rejected today the contention of 140 Federal judges that their salaries had been reduced unconstitutionally by the effects of inflation.

title: Fuqua's Plan to Buy I .T. T's 47% of Avis Facing a Hindrance
description: Fuqua Industries, a diversified manufacturer and distributor in the leisuretime products industry, announced plans yesterday to acquire 47 percent of the Avis Rental Car Company for about $50. million. Fuqua, in Atlanta, offered $15.50 a share for the 3.7 million shares owned by the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation. It said also that it would try to work out a plan under which other Avis stockholders could sell their shares on a taxfree basis at not less than the price paid for the I.T.T. stock. Avis closed yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange at 14, up 1 for the day.

title: Robber Takes Cab, Bank for a Ride
In Memoriam
description: MITCHELLSamuel. In cherished memory of my beloved husband. May 19, 1967. STAR

title: ABCTV Concedes Loss On Showing of Ali Bout
description: ABC Television lost about $1 million on its production of the Muhammad AliAlfredo Evangelista heavyweight boxing title fight Monday night, a rival network source said yesterday.

title: Crafted in Graceful Layers
description: WHERE THE edge of the sea meets the land, that is the most perfect of all drawingsand it changes all the time. That edge is my path, that is where I begin.

title: F.D.I.C. Chairmanship Seen for LeMaistre
description: WASHINGTON, May 18George A. LeMaistre, a 65yearold native of Alabama, is the heavy favorite to head the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, sources at the agency say.

title: Disks: Gould Makes It Spell Pure Bach
description: Glenn Gould now confines his playing to the recording studio out of some odd conviction that the public concert is no longer a place where any sensible musician needs to he found. Arguable though that proposition may be, the Canadian recluse continues to be one of our most fascinating artists, whose every new recording is seized upon and discussed hotly by fanciers of piano virtuosity.

title: Dollar Shows a Decline in Europe
description: LONDON, May 18 (AP)The dollar lost value today against several European currencies including the Dutch guilder. which rose in value amid speculation it would be revalued.

title: Film: 'Breaker!' Stalls
description: TRUCKING, citizen's band radio and movies may help swell the gross national product, but they don't do a thing for "Breaker! Breaker!" a shoddy amalgam of those elements that crashed into local theaters yesterday. Terry Chambers's rudimentary script about an indomitably good guy of a trucker who takes on a whole corrupt town to rescue his kidnapped younger brother, is matched by Don Hulette's wooden direction of a sophomoric cast.Chuck Norris, a program note states, is the undefeated American karate champ and he is also blond, square-jawed and about as emotional as a statue as the Zen master and martial-arts maven, who kicks or beats up practically all the sleazy citizens of Texas City, Calif. George Murdock is just as believable as the town's drunken, Shakespeare-spouting judge and boss.Chances are most moviegoers over the age of 12, say, might have the urge to shout "Breaker! Breaker!" long before fellow truckers come to the aid of our jailed hero via that C.B. radio call for help.The film is rated PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)" probably because of some explicit dialogue and some violence, neither of which is as startling as these juvenile proceedings.

title: Finest to Tackle the Bravest
description: There will he a football game played at Shea Stadium on Sunday. Yes, a football game.

title: John J. Ryan, 55, Publisher
description: John J. Ryan. publisher and writer, died Monday of cancer at South Nassau Communities Hospital in Oceanside,. L.I. He was 55 years old and lived in Baldwin, L.I.

title: Western By Four
description: IT WAS A LITTLE HARD to remember Tuesday night at Carnegie Hall that what was really going on was a glorified promotional event for countryandwestern musicians signed to the ABC/Dot record label. The affair was broadcast to country radio stations nationwide and to the Armed Forces Radio and the Voice of America, and the slightly overexcited announcers were talking about a potential audience of half a billion people, this memorable event and Roy Clark as the greatest entertainer in the world.

title: Music: Shigeoka A Romantic at Piano
description: RAYMOND SHIGEOKA, a pianist who made his New York debut a year ago, came to Alice Tully Hall on Tuesday night to play a second recital. The makeup of the program and the manner in which he played it indicated that this Hawaiaan born graduate of the Manhattan and Juilliard schools is a Romantic at heart.

title: Rising Decibels Barrage the Home
description: SHHHHHH! That's the message some ear specialists and government officials are giving to makers of household appliances, as the American home becomes noisier and noisier.

title: State Officials Foresee $70 Million
description: The action by the House follows similar tightening of regulations for this summer's program by the Department of Agriculture and by both state and local officials in New York. State officials say that they expect to receive $70 million for the program this summer.

title: It Isn't True All His Movies Are About Him
description: ARAINY NIGHT in a dimly lit Greenwich Village bar, and in the booth in the corner the director Paul Mazursky is a study in protective coloration. His tanned skin, sable hair and dark turtleneck blend uncannily into the wood paneling of the walls behind him, so that most of the time the only clear impression of his face is of two light eyes like camera lenses, with his voice coming out of the void, the substance of his conversation the only thing that might excite public recognition as he sits over a plate of broiled sole and a glass of water, his wife, Betsy, beside him.

title: Food Town Chain Gets Outside Agency
description: The management of the Food Town Stores, a chain of 50 supermarkets in the Carolinas, decided it needed an outside agency for its multimedia advertising program. Sc they chose one in Los Angeles, Eisaman, Johns & Laws, which also has a New York office.

title: Around the Nation
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 17 (AP)Overwhelmingly black schools in Wilmington, Del., and predominantly white schools in Wilmington's suburbs must achieve more racial balance by 1978, the United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit ruled today. But to what degree is not clear.

title: School Board Eats Its Words
description: Leave it to the grownups to mess up a good thing. Students at the Roslyn, L. I., Junior High School, like their counterparts across the country, ate their junk food lunches with relish and without complaint.

title: A Burglar Alarm for Almost Any Budget
description: HEAVY PRICECUTTING in home burglaralarm systems has brought them within relatively easy budget reach of almost everyone, includingwelleven burglars.

title: Hope Against Hope
description: BOSTON, May 18We have allowed ourselves to hope, this year, that there was at last a real chance for settlement in the Middle East: a way out of the political danger and human misery of the last thirty years. To those hopes the election in Israel has dealt a numbing blow.

title: Arlen Realty Says Fund Received By Unit May Be Considered Rebate
description: WASHINGTON, May 18The Arlen Realty and Development Corporation has found $609,328 received by its Hong Kong subsidiary that it says may be considered shipping rebates, according to an Arlen filing made available at the Securities and Exchange Commission today.

title: Hers
description: EVER SINCE Norman Lear's new TV show about sexrole reversal went on the air, I've been worried. All That Glitters, for those who don't stay up past Mary Hartman, is another soapsatire, in which powerful women run the world, and men are reduced to cleaning it, going for its coffee, or just hanging around it looking cute.

title: Project Aimed at Sprucing, Union Square
description: An unlikely combination  Mayor Beame, gospel singersand Robert Merrill, the opera star, accompanied by a Salvation Army bandturned out at Union Square Park yesterday for the start of a Wednesday performance series that has more than entertainment as its goal.

title: TV: Galbraith Offers A Personal View
description: DRAPED in the admirable ambitions of a major British Broadcasting Corporation production, the science of economics remains surprisingly, if not distressingly, dismal. The 13episode series, which begins tonight at 9 on Channel 13, is The Age of Uncertainty, written and narrated by John Kenneth Galbraith. The prodlucer is Adrian Malone, who steered Kenneth Clark's Civilsation and Jacob Bronowski's The Ascent of Man to impressive levels of electronic success. This time, the formula fails.

title: In Quest Of a Chair
description: THE SEARCH for the perfect office chair had been going on for months. I hounded office supply houses, department sto??es garage sales, thrift shops and the classified advertisements.

title: The Chelsea Flower Show: A Hothouse Triumph Over Nature
description: LONDON THE wellmannered ladies with plastic cherries in their hats came out yesterday for the opening of the Chelsea Flower Show, and a perfumed breath of manmade springtime wafted through this icy May.

title: Giving Indoor Plants A Vacation Outside
description: IF A RESPITE in the great outdoors does us a world of good, then it should follow that a summering outside for house plants is ideal, right? Not necessarily.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Officials of WNET Channel 13 and New Jersey Public Television signed formal agreement in Newark to coproduce a nightly pews program covering the events of the day in the state and their effect tin the people of New Jersey.

title: Nixon Says a President Can Order Illegal Actions Against Dissidents
description: WASHINGTON, May 18Richard M. Nixon declared, in an interview to be aired tomorrow night, that he had inherent power to order burglaries, eavesdropping or other illegal conduct against American dissidents when he was in the White House.

title: Setback Is Seen in Plans for Geneva Conference
description: GENEVA, May 18The surprising outcome of the Israeli elections has, at the minimum, further set back the Carter Administration's timetable for reconvening a Geneva conference on the Middle East, American officials declared today. But beyond the procedural problems, which would have been difficult to surmount even if Shimon Peres and the Labor Party had been returned to power, much more profound and farreaching difficulties may have arisen.

title: ARETHA KITTLE
description: Aretha Kittle, a member of the board of directors of the National Urban Crisis Task Force, a socialservice agency with headquarters in the Bronx, died Monday in Lincoln Hospital, the Bronx. She lived at 3080 Park Avenue, the Bronx, and was 75 years old. She is survived by a nephew.

title: It's a Shop for All Senses
description: Never underestimate the power of design to draw crowds. After a year of design excitement in hair salons and restaurants, New York now has a retail shop that is worth the trip, even you don't need a wine glass or a bonbon dish.

title: Carter Briefs Bipartisan Group From Congress on Arms Talks
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (UPI)President Carter today briefed Congressional leaders on United States strategy at the newly resumed strategic arms talks with the Soviet Union and noted that the Russians had the world's most destructive missile.

title: Javits Backs Roy Goodman
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (AP)Senator Jacob K. Javits announced today his endorsement of State Senator Roy M. Goodman for the Republican nomination for Mayor of New York City. Mr. Javits also said the city had earned the right to an extension of the Federal loan program that was approved in 1975.

title: Oregon Rejects Plan to Allow Schools To Operate if Tax Levies Are Defeated
description: PORTLAND, Ore., May 18Oregon voters have soundly defeated a finance plan designed to keep schools operating in districts that reject operating levy requests.

title: Rev. H. S. Hill, Active in Harlem As a Baptist Educator, Was 84
description: The Rev. Horatio Seymour Hill, who was the director of the Baptist Educational Center in Harlem from 1930 to 1965, died last Saturday at the Amsterdam Nursing Home. He was 84 years old.

title: Theater: Aeschylus Alive
description: WHAT IS THE PURPOSE of tragedy? Can we, even now, with the gloss of some sophistication sliding around us like a cloak, experience that naked cleansing the Greeks called catharsis? Can we ritualistically accept the whippingboy suffering of puppets as if they were surrogates for our own souls? I doubt it.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: New Minicomputer Line
description: The Data General Corporation's introduction of a line of small computers has intensified competition in the fastgrowing minicomputer industry. Page D9.

title: Screen: Von Sternberg's Coda
description: THE "RECONSTRUCTED" version of Josef von Sternberg's "The Saga of Anatahan," which opened yesterday at the Thalia Theater, is virtually a one-film retrospective of that great, idiosyncratic, often off-putting director's work. The film, in a fine new print, has been put together from footage that was originally released here in 1954and reviewed in The New York Times on May 18, 1954, as "Ana-Ta-Han"with supplemental nude footage that von Sternberg cut into the first version in 1958.The amount of care and money that have gone into this reconstruction is testimony to the success of the keepers of the von Sternberg legacy. When he died in 1969, the reputation of the director appeared to be based entirely on the seven films he had made with Marlene Dietrich, beginning with "The Blue Angel." Mostly forgotten were "Underworld" (1927) and "The Docks of New York" (1928), and seldom ever mentioned was "Anatahan," which was his last production, though "Jet Pilot," begun in 1949, was not released until 1957."Anatahan" is not a film to use as an introduction to the von Sternberg work. One can snicker at the pomposities of its voice-over narration, written and spoken by the director, which recalls the conventions of silent movies, but even this narration, as much as visual style, constitutes a kind of coda to the von Sternberg career.The film, which the director made in Japan with an entirely Japanese cast and crew, must have been supremely satisfying to the director's ego, even if he was obviously somewhat short of studio space. Von Sternberg wrote, directed and photographed the film and speaks the only dialogue that can be understood.The story is about a group of Japanese sailors and one woman who are marooned on a Pacific island for something like five years after World War II.How this little society, dominated by one female, goes to pieces is depicted in what amounts to a series of virtually actionless tableaux. The melodrama is as passionless as a parable. Instead of being erotic, the film is obsessed by the idea of eroticism.It's not easy to accept Akemi Negishi as a femme fatale. She is sweetly pretty and rather chubby-kneed, and when she does a seductive, hip-swinging dance that is meant to drive the men out of their minds with desire, she looks more like a preteen practicing an awkward hula. We do see, however, von Sternberg's obsession with a concept of sexual desire as a destructive force.The obsession is reflected in the romantically highlighted black-and-white photography, as well as in the tightness of the space in which he had to work. Except for stock footage of the sea, there's hardly a long shot in the film. The marooned sailors and their queen bee are locked as much into the medium-shot frame as they are on their island. There are some sequences that are bound to prompt giggles from newcomers to von Sternberg, but there are others that immediately evoke some of the best work ever done by this great motion-picture stylist.The effect of the film is simultaneously sad, beautiful and a bit outrageous. Only von Sternberg would think to insert an opening-credit card informing us that the film had been produced entirely in "a studio constructed for this purpose in Kyoto, the ancient capital of Japan." He was a fellow who needed the proper vibrations."The Saga of Anatahan," which has been rated PG ("Parental Guidance Suggested"), contains some discreet female nudity photographed with the sort of impersonal prettiness one used to see on pinup calendars.

title: NEW & USEFUL
description: Wire Storage

title: Israel's Election Victor
description: TEL AVIV. May 18As a former guerrilla, 63yearold Menahem Begin has a fiery past, but his courtly personal style contrasts sharply with his image. Mr. Beginhe name is pronounced Baychinheads the rightwing Likud bloc, which, after its victory in yesterday's general elections, is the largest party in Parliament. When I am Prime Minister, he said, I plan to work night and day, and I pray that God will give me the strength.

title: Long Island to Lead Tribute to Lindbergh Tomorrow
description: Tomorrow is the 50th anniversary of the nonstop flight from New York to Paris by Charles A. Lindbergh. In tomorrow's issue, The New York Times will publish a number of articles about the flight and about Lindbergh's contribution to aviation history.

title: South Carolina Girl's Death Linked to Swine Influenza, But Is Seen as Isolated Case
description: ATLANTA, May 18 (UPI)The death e a 17yearold South Carolina girl last month was attributed today to a probable deadend swine influenza virus that is not expected to affect Government inoculation recommendations for next fall and winter.

title: Somalia Denies Giving Its Support To Activities by Terrorist Groups
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia, May 18 (Reuterrs)Somalia has denied a State Department report listing it among Arab countries giving support to terrorist groups, railing the report a baseless lie.

title: Met, Philharmonic Set Nassau Dates
description: ROSLYN, L.I., May 18The Metropolitan Opera and the New York Philharmonic will perform in Nassau County's Eisenhower Park in East Meadow this summer as part of the county's concert season, Ralph G. Caso, the County Executive announced today.

title: GENERICDRUGS LAW IS BACKED IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, May 18The State Assembly approved with surprisingly little dissent today a bill that would encourage physicians to prescribe drugs by generic rather than brand name. The bill would require physicians to include the generic name of the drug on every prescription they write, but would allow them to specify a brand if they felt it was necessary.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Advertising
description: Philip H. Geier Jr. Is the new president and the first person to serve as chief operating officer of the vast worldwide marketing corporation known as the Interpublic Group of Companies. He also has a small office. The two don't seem to go together.

title: Studio in a Stable
