description: Although JanisRozena Peri has sung with some frequency in New York, her concert last Sunday afternoon at Carnegie Recital Hall marked her formal recital debut. The soprano chose an unusual and demanding program, but she was more than equal to the occasion.

title: Controversy Over Power Lines Spreads Across Upstate New York
description: ALBANY, May 21From the St. Lawrence River to the lower Hudson Valley, a bitter controversy over the construction of 765,000volt power transmission lines is spreading throughout upstate New York in court, and at protest meetings, at safety hearings.

title: Anthony Store is author of The Dynamics of Omit. Son and clinical lecturer in psychiatry at Oxford.
description: Anthony Store is author of The Dynamics of Omit. Son and clinical lecturer in psychiatry at Oxford.

title: If You Go
description: Pack your clothes in saddle bags, available at many bike stores. The best bags are bright colored for visibility and nylon for 1repellent lightness. American Youth Hostels sells many accessories useful for touring: a water bottle, tool kit and headlight are essential. Clothes to take include long pants and shirts for both men and women (shorts are not acceptable for women in Ireland), sneakers and a pair of flat shoes for evenings. A light rainproof windbreaker is all the cover needed for any rain light enough to cycle in. Gloves help keep tender hands from blistering on long trips

title: Paperback Best Sellers
description: Massmarket paperbacks are softcover books sold at newsstands, variety stores, supermarkets, as well as in bookstores. This analysis is based on reports from representative wholesalers and chains with more than 10,000 outlets in the United States.

title: Associated Press
description: RECREATE LINDBERGH FLIGHT: David Gray, left, and Joe Wolf toasting each other at Le Bourget Airport near Paris after landing within 15 minutes of each other in solo flights across Atlantic. Completing flight in 23 hours, pair chopped ten hours off time of Charles A. Lindbergh.

title: HARVARD ADOPTS GUIDE ON C.I.A. RELATIONSHIP
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 21 (AP)Harvard University promises not to spy or recruit for the Central Intelligence Agency but will allow faculty members to engage in Government propaganda under euidelines issued yesterday.

title: Births
description: Dr. end Mrs. Paul J. Manchek of College Park Md. Joyfully announce the engagement of their daughter, Sherry Lynn, to Andrew I. Levy, son of Mr. end Mrs. Ell A. Levy, of the Greenhill In Lower Merlon Apartments, Lower Merion, Penna. There are no Immediate wedding plans.

title: On the Battlefield of Beauty
description: TOKYOI'll tell you the secret, said the saleswoman. First, you give the woman a compliment. That slows her down. Then right away you point out something wrong with her face. That worries her. Then you say: But wait! I have an idea that one of our products just might help.

title: Penn Crew Wins Burk Cup
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 21The University of Pennsylvania's varsity heavyweight crew set a Charles River course record in winning the Burk Cup regatta today from Northeastern. It was the last race on the Charles for Northeastern's retiring coach, Ernie Arlett.

title: Vance Rescheduling China Visit for August
description: MILDENHALL AIR FORCE BASE, England, May 21Reporters aboard Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance's aircraft were told today that he plans to visit China sometime in August, about three months earlier than he had first said was likely.

title: Vorster Meets With Ambassadors
description: VIENNA, May 21Prime Minister John Vorster today briefed South African ambassadors to North America and Europe on his talks with Vice President Mondale here Thursday and yesterday and reportedly urged them to help improve their country's image in the United States and the West in general.

title: Parents Battle Chicago Schools Over Educating Blind Girl
description: CHICAGO, May 21Arms spread out shakily, Heidi Musser moved cautiously across the low bar in her gymnastic class at the Leaning Tower Y.M.C.A. She did not have the grace of Olga Korbut, but Heidi was not bad.

title: Miss Karlen Fiancee Of E. B. Gardner 3d
description: Mr. and Mrs. William J. Karlen of Poultney, Vt., formerly of Locust Valley, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Judith Anne Karlen, to E. Benjamin Gardner 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Gardner Jr. of Darien, Conn.

title: ART
description: Ros LYN WOOD is a sculptural material that over the centuries has not enjoyed the esteem and prestige of bronze and marble. Perhaps we have looked up to the latter because they represented permanence or indestructibility. Art, after all, should be a permanent and indestructible phenomenon, not subject to the vagaries and vicissitudes of mortal objects.

title: Mary Stockman Is Betrothed
description: Mary La Branche Stockman, who expects to receive a degree on Friday from Wellesley College, and Mark Livingston Wainwright, who was graduated last Monday from Yale, will be married June 25 in Locust Valley, L. I.

title: Miss Porter's Cleans Out Its Attic
description: THE PORTRAIT of the Duchess of Ancaster, painted by Sir Joshua Reynolds in 1772, used to hang over the toaster in the dining room of Miss Porter's School in Farmington. Now it belongs to Leonard Udolf, West Hartford clothier and art collector, who bought it at public auction on the campus last Saturday for $5,750, tucked it into the back seat of his white Cadillac, and headed home to friendly cries of Drive carefully!

title: Connecticut/This Week
description: BRIDGEPORTMeet the Artists art show, Lafayette Plaza, Friday 10 to 9, Saturday 10 to 6.15672.

title: FISHING
description: STRIPED BASS, bluefish and fluke, all regarded as New Jersey's principal gamefish, are converging along the shoreline. And the next few weeks should set the pace for the season.

title: New Rochelle's Theater for the Young
description: THE double bill of Cinderella (a modern version) and Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs that started a threeday run at the New Rochelle High School Auditorium on Friday represents only half the productions planned for the season by the Children's Repertory Company, one of the largest and most ambitious children's theater groups in Westchester. The New Rochelle company is directed by Beverly Kenny, a former New York casting director who lives in New Rochelle.

title: Boom in Boating Alters Sound Coast
description: BOATING gets bigger and bigger ecery year,and there's no place to keep the boats. Robert Koh lasch, a boatyard owner, gazed about him at the hulking, yachts crowded onto his land in New Rochelle, drew his weathered face onto a squint and added: The waterfront is getting shorter and shorter.

title: Michael Halberstam, a practicing physician, is coauthor of A Coronary Event.
description: Michael Halberstam, a practicing physician, is coauthor of A Coronary Event.

title: Miss Ayvazian Fiancee of Stephen Anderson
description: Andrea Jo Ayvazian and Stephen Andrew Anderson, graduates of Oberlin College, plan to be married Aug. 21 in Chapel Hill, N.C. Their engagement has been announced by Dr. and Mrs. L. Fred Avyazian of South Orange, N.J., parents of the bridetobe.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: BruccoliClark Books has been in business for only five years and, amid the giants of the publishing industry, is understandably an obscure operation. Except that great namesHemingway, Fitzgerald, O'Neillgrace its list of authors.

title: Sports Today
description: Final day of time trials for Indianapolis 500. (TelevisionChannel 7, 6 P.M.)BASEBALL

title: FOOD
description: JUST as the bluefish announces summer, the weakfish has become a local late spring fixture to anglers, commercial fisher men and diners. It is also called sea trout, but markets that refer to it by that more pretentious title invariably charge more for it.

title: Catholic U., St. John's Meet for E.C.A.C. Title
description: PRINCETON, N. J., May 21Catholic University and St. John's advanced to the Eastern Collegiate Athletic Conference District Two baseball playoffs today. Columbia, which lost by 32 in 10 innings to Catholic and by 30 to St. John's, was eliminated from further E. C. A. C. competition.

title: Whitworth Holds Lead By Stroke
description: JAMESBURG N.J. May 21The righthanded Kathy Whitworth had to hit one shot lefthanded today. She also sank a 30foot putt, which made her exclaim with joy, I don't know where that came from. But she managed through it all to hold to her onestroke lead after two rounds of the 577,000 CocaCola Classic, a Ladies Professional Golf Association event at Forsgabe Country Club.

title: School Results
description: BOY'S BASEBALL

title: Tufarielo Captures 440 in 47.6
description: SCHENECTADY, N.Y., May 21Tony Tufariello, who credits a broken collarbone with getting him a scholarship to Villanova, continued his sensational spring running today when he won the 440yard dash in the meetrecord time of 47.6 seconds.

title: Italy's Communists In Official Talks
description: ROME, May 21The governing Christian Democrats and the Communist Party are engaged in talks on a joint program that could mark a new chapter in Italian politics.

title: TV Looks at RapeAnd Distorts It
description: Rape is an ancient crimeand because it combines a sexual and a violent aspect, it has always shocked, disturbed and simultaneously titillated people. This Wednesday evening at 10, Channel 13, as well as other publicTV stations across the country, will present The People vs. Inez Garcia, a 90minute docudrama on the subject of rape. The script for the production was created from the transcripts of the actual Inez Garcia trial held in Monterey, Calif., in August of 1979. The case became a cause clbre in California and elsewhere because it was concerned with a rape victim who had fought back. Inez Garcia went after her alleged rapist and his accomplice with a shotgun; she found both men but succeeded in shooting only the accomplice, wounding him fatally. That such a dramatization will be viewed nationwide, with its street language and vivid description of sex acts, is not surprising in 1977. Yet, only a few short years ago, it would have been inconceivable on television.

title: Republican Governors to Meet
description: NORTH CONWAY, N.H., May 21 (AP)The National Republican Governors Conference is to be held here in the White Mountains Oct. 24, at the height of New Hampshire's foliage season, Gov. Meldrim Thomson's office announced today. Former President Gerald R, Ford is expected to address the session.

title: Mexico's OldNew Resort
description: Eight years ago Zihuatanejo, 125 miles north of Acapulco on Mexico's west coast, was a cluster of adobe houses and unpaved streets on a serene blue bay, with a few simple hotels scattered along outlying cliffs. We want to keep the atmosphere as it is, thenMayor Jorge Bustos told me at the time. We will have here new investment, of course, but it will be planned development.

title: He Says Merit Does
description: WASHINGTONDespite his difficulties with Congress, President Carter has so far eschewed a traditional technique used by previous chief executives to coopt the legislators, defuse opposition and enlist support. The technique is political patronage in the broadest sense, the exercise of the discretionary powers of government in exchange for political support.

title: LETTERS TO THE CONNECTICUT EDITOR
description: The Connecticut Supreme Court has spoken on the issue of school funding in the State of Connecticut. It has clearly stated that the state has an obligation to equalize funding so as to provide necessary funds for a quality education throughout the state. The Governor and legislature must now assume the responsibility to act in light of the Supreme Court decision.

title: A Little Worship From a Friend
description: MARCI LEMPERT, 16 years old, shares a bedroom with four 7 1/11tall men. Her mother, Carole, a teacher, didn't like the idea at first, but her father, Norman, an optometrist, thought it would be all right. Her older brother, David, 18, was skeptical, and her little sister, Cheryl, 10, was entranced.

title: Headliners
description: President Carter has appointed Eleanor Holmes Norton to head the Equal Opportunity Commission. Mrs. Norton formerly was chief of the New York City Commission on Human Rights. She will have her hands full in Washington: The Federal office has a backlog of more than 130,000 cases.

title: Storm Signals Flagged Down By Technology
description: A centuryold navigational systemthe display of storm warnings by day and by nightis about to pass into history to be replaced by more modern technology. Storm warnings estabblished for the benefit of merchant shipping, but in recent years of more immediate value to pleasure boat operators, were put into effect in October 1871 by the National Weather Service, then part of the War Department's Signal Corps. That year the system was put into operation on the East Coast. In 1882 it was extended to the Pacific Coast. It was simplified in 1958 and the decision to phase it out was made three years ago.

title: Piracy on the Low Seas
description: The Pirate's Lady left New Orleans in late January another American yacht preparing for a routine Caribbean pleasure cruise. There were two crewmen aboard, both experienced and known to he reliable. They were taking the Lady to south Florida, where it would pick up the owner, New Orleans businessman Charles Slater, and then proceed to the islands. The yacht refueled at Apalachicola, a tough fishing town on the Florida panhandie, before embarking on the easy eighthour run to Clearwater. No one has seen it since. A Coast Guard search of the upper Gulf, during a period of high visibility, turned up no life rafts no floating debris, no flares or other signals of distress, nothing the active search has been suspended, though Charles Slater continues trying to track down his missing boat. Three months earlier, the Flying Dutchman, a 57fool pleasure yacht with four Alabamians aboard, also disappeared out of Apalachicola.

title: Q: What Have You Been Doing Since Texas Trilogy? A: Been Working, Pal
description: DALLAS Preston Jones lifts the brim of his Stetson and undramatically blows his nose. It's hayfever time and the rainy season in Dallas, and Jones, like most Dallasites, is an annual victim of these dismal rites of spring.

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: I have just finished reading Alice Brand's article on motherhood (May 8), and I want to tell her how very sad I feel for her.

title: The Gypsy Comes Home
description: THE young people who dance behind the stars in a Broadway musical are called gypsies. They are wellnamed, because theirs is a rootless life as they move from show to show, with stops at the unemployment line in between.

title: Meredith Roosa Becomes Bride
description: Meredith Ann Roosa, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert V. Roosa of Harrison, N. Y., was married yesterday afternoon to Karl Frederick Inderfurth, son of Mr. and Mrs. Karl H. Inderfurth of Myrtle Beach, S. C.

title: His Money, Her Children
description: LAST year a Suffolk County judge was provided with an opportunity to accomplish something for female justice. The challenge was not met, which was no surprise to women who are living under the judicial stipulations of more mundane matrimonial cases. Women who have been through the divorce courts no longer expect precedentsetting decisions on their behalf.

title: Anne Higgins Benedict Wed To Ralph D. Lowenstein Jr.
description: Anne Higgins Benedict and Ralph David Lowenstein Jr. were married yesterday afternoon in the Tilman Chapel of the Church Center for the United Nations. The Rev. Dr. Melvin Hawthorne, the chaplain, performed the ceremony.

title: IN AMERICA
description: PITTBUROH Bottle in hand, I rise to offer a loast. Here's to Pittsburgh, the home of Iron City Beer. The home also, once upon a time, of Fort Pitt Beer (Fort Pitt, that's it!) and Duke (The Prince of Pilsners) and Silver Top and Old Shea and Tube City and Dutch Cluband sundry other brews, long defunct and now fading from living memory. But Iron City still livesthe last of its lineage, the last of the Pittsburgh beers.

title: John Hopkins 22, Maryland 12
description: BALTIMORE, May 21 (AP)Johns Hopkins jumped to a 3.0 lead and was never threatened as the Blue Jays coasted to a 2212 victory over Maryland in a semifinal of the N.C.A.A. Division One lacrosee tournament. today.

title: Rev. John Vincent Curry, 67, A Jesuit Teacher of Theology
description: The Rev. Johen Vincent Curry. a member of the staff of Mount Manresa, the Jesuit Retreat. House on Staten Island, died at Fordham University's MurrayWeigel Hall Infirmary on Friday following a long illness. He was 67 years old.

title: Chronic Crooks and Simple Justice
description: POLITICIANS in Connecticut seem to yearn more and more for a society in which criminals, are punished for their crimes, especially the violent ones. Voters, who are making themselves heard on the subject sa they want to live in a world in which punishment for serious crime is unavoidable and equal.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: MANY homeowners do not realize that they can have running water around the outside of their houses without much difficulty. Using widely available and easytohandle flexible plastic pipe, any doityourselfer can install extra outdoor faucets, a utility sink on his patio or terrace, a backyard shower or a drinking fountain. Or he can run Water lines to supply permanently installed lawn sprinklers, eliminating the need to drag wet hoses around several times a week.

title: Ritual Music on Record
description: Time means nothing in the East and time means something very different to the African are shopworn cliches, but Asian and African music indicate that they contain at least a grain of truth. The sense of time which pervades nonWestern traditional music is very different from the time sense one encounters in Western art and popular music.

title: CITY COLLEGE UNIT BACKS PLAN TO LINK UNIVERSITIES
description: The City College Faculty Senate has passed a resolution supporting the primary recommendations of the Wessel Commissiona blue ribbon panel appointed by Governor Carey last year that called for the consolidation of the state and city systems into two new universities grouped along educational functions.

title: CrossCountry Bus: Mom, 2 Kids, $150
description: Stephanie: Hey, how is Mommy going to take us to see the country? Daniella: I clunno. Stephanie: Clue! Like the birdies go! Daniella: We're gonna fly? Whoopie! Stephanie: No, dummy! Cheep! Cheep!

title: Species
description: one of those museum types, buried under plants and shells). More seriously, I find three important weaknesses. First, though I hate to say it, the book is too short. Its telegraphic style renders it fully accessible only to those who already know most of the material. It is a superb refresher course, but not a manual for the uninitiated. Second, I am puzzled by the omission of chapters on what I regard as the two greatest frontiers of modern biology: the brain and its function, and the genetic regulation of embryonic development. The chapter on development comes in the right place, as a link between evolution and DNA, but it focuses on classical and peripheral material, omitting nearly all reference to genetic programs and the orchestration of development.

title: Sunday Observer
description: I had a toothache. It refused In go away. There was no getting out of it. Dentistry was called for. I phoned Pr. Needles, D.D.S. Walter Cronkite answered the telephone. What is your question to the doctor? he asked.

title: Concert: Plangency and Exotica
description: The New York Philharmonic's second Promenade program, fancifully if rather unaccountably entitled Fantasy Promenade, passed the time agreeably enough at Avery Fisher Hall on Friday night. As he usually does, the conductor, Andre Kostelanetz, had a couple of novelties up his sleeve for the audience, two recently composed American works that received their New York premieres.

title: Joe Frazier's Week That Was: Death Watch Dies for Now as Mets Revive
description: FRIDAY, MAY 13  The bottom half of the first inning feels like a reprieve for Frazier as Lenny Randle and Dave Kingman hit homers staking Jon Matlack to a 30 lead. Matlack, who has recently scoured the Mets front office for failing to trade for or buy a topquality hitter, knows what to do with a threerun lead; he shuts out the best team in baseball, and the Mets, who don't score again, win, 30.

title: Getting Things Left
description: MEMBERS of one of the world's largest and most neglected minority groups have been offering a lot of lefthanded compliments to Peter Neiman of Westport and he doesn't mind it at all.

title: Article 20  No Title
description: Robert B. Parker's most recent novel is Promised Land. Three Weeks in Spring will be published in February.

title: When Oil and Waterfowl Mix
description: STRETCHED out and lying on dry cloths in crates, the water birds were clearly drunk. Now, like humans, they would go through a hangover stage lasting from 24 to 48 hours. A week to 10 days after that, they would be transferred to holding ponds, and in time they would take off and return to their natural habitats. Through human patience.and skill, more waterfowl would be saved from certain death after exposure to oilpolluted waters.

title: Future Events
description: Tickets to the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Cannes, Still a Film Magnet, Screens New New Wave
description: CANNES, France, May 21One of the kindest remarks about the films shown so far in the annual Cannes film festival came from Peter Ustinov. He said of the Soviet entry The Orpihans that ft shows us how far we've come from the doctrinaire days, both the film makers and the audiences.

title: Radio
description: 89 A.M., WKTU: Mellow Magazine. Children's songs and stories.

title: To Be Young, Rich and a Spy
description: PALOS VERDES ESTATES, Calif. Just before noon last Jan. 6, Thomas Ferguson, a vice consul at the United States Embassy in Mexico City, received a request to assist a short, brownhaired American who had been arrested near the Soviet Embassy. It was a routine call. Young Americans were always being arrested in Mexico on drug charges, and it was Ferguson's assignment to help them deal with the Mexican authorities.

title: The Region
description: President Carter's election last November raised hopes among many New York City officials that they would have a ready ally for Federal help to ease the city's finanical difficulties. Various programs have yielded more than $500 million in extra aid for the city. But increasingly it appears that the sort of unique assistance New York needs will be cautiously, if not grudgingly, given.

title: That's the Way It Was in 27
description: OLD WESTBURY THIS has been the busiest year of John Frogge's 76 years on this planet. At an age when most men are happy to be pushing a shuffleboard stick, Mr. Frogge has been running all over the Island giving speeches about another year in his life= when he covered Charles A. Lindbergh for The New York Times.

title: If You Rent the Scene
description: When Martha Hayden looked at an apartment at 253 West 72d Street and West End Avenue, she wondered if a studio was going to be big enough. Still, it was all she could afford, the neighborhood was good and the building even had a doorman.

title: Dog Show Calendar
description: TodayLong Island K.C. 75th allbreed show and obedience trial, campus of Hofstra University, Fulton Avenue, Hempstead, L.I.; 1,590 dogs; 8 A.M. to 7 P.M.

title: Picture Credits
description: 1CARL FISCHER

title: STAMPS
description: In the Old Testament, the names of musical instruments and expressions, and even the names of musicians, are recorded, because musk and its instruments have been part of the Hebraic heritage since an cient times. This heritage is evoked in a set of three stamps from Israel.

title: No One Cheers for The Girls
description: I AM a senior at Byram Hills High School in Armonk. I was the center on our girls' varsity basketball team. Everyone in my familymy mother and father, my two brothers and younger sisterare active and interested in sports.

title: INVESTING
description: For thousands of potential commodity ispeculators, the mvitation to financial disaster begins with a telephone caller imploring forgiveness for not calling soonerin time to cash in on the enormous profits then being reaped.

title: Ideas &Trends
description: Two bills in the New York State legislature would provide for the substitution of generic drugs for brandname drugs in doctors prescriptions. Generic names are chemical or otherwise scientifically recognized names for a drug, while brand names are applied by specific manufacturers; dextroamphetamine sulfate, for example, is the generic name of the stimulant usually known by the brand name Dexedrine.

title: Laura S. Forgeron Married To John C. Warren, Lawyer
description: Laura S. Forgeron and John C. Warren were married yesterday in the Duke University Chapel in Durham, N.C. The Rev. Andrew J. O'Brien performed the Roman Catholic ceremony.

title: Unemployed at 62: The Big Void
description: TWENTYONE years with the same company in an executive position and suddenly the big void. Liquidation, termination and the search for a new job at the age of 62. A financial and emotional crisis.

title: The Senate Committee, After a Year, Is Grappling With What Should Be Kept Secret, and What Shouldn't
description: WASHINGTONThe Senator from Hawaii Is concerned that knowing too many secrets could prove psychologically unhealthy. The Senator from Maine is concerned that too many persons are being told sensitive information. The Senator from Delaware, the youngest and one of the more liberal of the group, is concerned that the intelligence agencies have been so willing to share their secrets that their very cooperation may be sapping some of the zeal for reform.

title: World News Briefs
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, May 21 (AP)A joint ZairianMoroccan force has recaptured the strategic rail town of Dilolo and has attacked the last two villages in rebel hands, the Government announced today.

title: The Summaries
description: NonSporting (Henry Stoecker, Judge)1, Joy Groul standard poodle, Ch. Dancer Beige Bedouin; 2, Mar. garet P. and John T. Hassell's miniature poodle. Ch. Hassell's Velvet Ferdinand; 3, Mrs. Harold Armstrong's Keeshond, Silver Frost Huger Bear; 4, Barbara Wood's Lhasa Apso, Ch. Anbara's AbraKaDabra.

title: Paperbacks: New and Noteworthy
description: THE TIN CAN TREE, by Anne Tyler. (Popular, $1.95.) Because of its author's mounting reputation, this second novel of Anne Tyler seems liely to have a wider readership than when it was first published in 1965. As always with her work, it is a story of family relationships, in this case of a woman who is almost shattered by the tragic accidental death of a small daughter but who in the end is saved by her 10yearold son. The effect is dry and sharp, like a fine snapshot.

title: 4.3 Miliion. Youths Are Expected To Enter Labor Market in Summer
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 (AP)An estimated 4,3 million persons age 16 to 24 are. expected to join the labor force this summer, about 600,000 more than a year ago.

title: Doberman Proves a Star in Bermuda
description: Ch. Dobergals Princess Royal is clearly a standout at any show. As the third and last of Bermuda's allbreed championship shows drew to a close last weekend, Pete ]{hoop instructed the handlers of the Doberman pinscher, Irish setter and standard News poodle to keep the dogs on a loose lead, but not et to handle them. Princess Dogs Royal, the Doberman, struck a statuesque stance that could only be described as sheer perfection. All eyes were on the working group finalist, and she claimed the bestinshow laurels.

title: CHILDREN'S BOOKS
description: Realism is the order of the day in these three novelsrealism with an ethnic garnish. All are by authors whose credentials certify the books as authentic. Any one of the three would provide a profitable unit to a highschool social studies class. But not all would be equally welcome in the classram across the hallthe one with Literature on the door.

title: Amer. Soccer League
description: Los Angeles at Santa Barbara. Rhode Island at Connecticut.

title: CAMERA VIEW
description: Since Upper Paleolithic man first painted on the walls of his caves more than 30,000 years ago, there has been basic set of concepts that artists have found useful. seeing, these concepts are called the rules of composition.

title: Women Hope to Be N.C.A.A.'s Friend
description: Up until now, there's been too much emphasis on whether everyone should get married, Margo Polivy said last week. But what we should be thinking about is everyone becoming friends. The lawyer for the Association for Intercollegiate Athletics for Women was speaking about her hope that the bonds between the national organizations that oversee men's and women's intercollegiate athletics are strengthened. Her focus was turned to that subject and other matters of current importance in women's athletics by the A.I.A.W.'s. executive board meet ing last week.

title: THE CHILDREN: SOMETIMES POKER CHIPS
description: Children are in the vanguard of those favoring the option of paternal custody: They'll go wherever they feel loved and wanted.

title: She Was Consistently Joan Crawford, Star
description: Iknow it sounds odd, but somehow I didn't believe that Joan Crawford could ever die.

title: DANCE VIEW
description: Last week there were five major dance companies appearing in New York Cityand this took no account of the various, almost innumerable concerts that were also around town. We had Twyla Tharp and her Dancers at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, New York City Ballet at the New York State Theater, American Ballet Theater just across the Lincoln Center plaza at the Metropolitan Opera House, Alvin Ailey's American Dance Theater at City Center, and the Martha Graham Dance Company on Broadway at the LuntFontanne Theater. Even a dance critic with a bicycle could not have gotten to everything. (In fairness, at time of writing, Martha Graham had not opened.)

title: Cold Comfort for Coffee Lovers
description: Until last Tuesday morning, most coffee roasters, a group that includes all major food companies, had expected the retail price of the beverage to rise gradually to about $5.50 a pound by September and then spurt upward as world supplies of beans fell with the temperature.

title: MAJOR SNAGS REMAIN AS PARLEY IN GENEVA ON ARMS ACCORD ENDS
description: GENEVA, May 21Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance and the Soviet Foreign Minister, Andrei A. Gromyko, said today that despite agreement on a new formula to break the deadlock in the negotiations for a treaty limiting each side's strategic arms, major substantive differences were still holding up the conclusion of a new treaty.

title: Georgess McHargue is currently at work on a novel set in Scotland.
description: Georgess McHargue is currently at work on a novel set in Scotland.

title: Yanks Beaten in 12th, 43; Reds Win, 87, From Mets
description: In an eventful battle for first place in the American League East, the Orioles outlasted the Yankees, 43, in 12 innings yesterday afternoon at the Stadium.

title: NUCLEAR SAFEGUARDS ASSESSED AT MEETING
description: SALZBURG, AustriaIn a world that has people desperate enough to blow up airliners, mow down bystanders in an airline terminal or abduct high officials for ransom, how can explosive nuclear materials be safeguarded against theft?

title: Editors' Choice
description: A FEAST OF WORDS, by Cynthia Griffin Wolff. (Oxford University Press, $15.95.) Psychologicalcritical study of Edith Wharton.

title: Donald Brooks dreams up a new Qiana collection and tops it with a froth of lace.
description: You'll want to wear his luscious satiny plunge under absolutely everything.

title: Votes in Congress
description: 1. Vote on military procurement authoriization bill, authorizing funds for military procurement for fiscal year 1978, passed, 190 to 3, May 17.

title: Questions/Answers
description: My dwarf calamondin orange plant is huge. One of us may have to go. Can prune it in anyway and if so, when? P.L., Princeton, N.J.

title: The World
description: Vice President Mondale and Prime Minister Vorster of South Africa have met in Vienna, and what was expected to happen has happened: They agreed in a general way on how to bring black majority rule to Rhodesia, but stumbled in discussing racial policies in Mr. Vorster's country.

title: Room at the TopLots of It
description: GRADES, those infamous sym bols of the academic establishment, are on the rise at Hofstra University. While the existence of grade inflation is present at many other institutions of higher education, administration officials here are trying to solve a tangible problem to which there may be no tangible answer.

title: In Memoriam
description: ABRAMS GEORGE May 19, 1973. In Loving Memory of a dear husband, cevoted father and adoring grandfather.

title: U.S. Aides Face 143 Suits on Spying
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 (AP)Improper Government spying and harassment are the basis for more than $1 billion in damage claims from individuals who have filed 143 civil suits asserting that their rights were violated, the General Accounting Office reports.

title: Harlem Center Aims at Problems Of Parents in LowIncome Areas
description: Laura Graham is a 24yearold mother of two who inherited the responsibility for four brothers when her mother died recently. She lives with them in Harlem, close to the edge of despair.

title: INTERVIEW
description: REMEMB ER those movie scenes where a tall dignified man, wearing a black hat, black suit, white shirt and black string tie, would ride into town and someone would say, That's the judgehe's all the law we've got in this territory?

title: Estelle Scores Upset Of Siderowf in Travis
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., May 21The 67th Travis Memorial golf tournament took a shocking turn this afternoon when littleknown Chris Estelle of Southward Ho eliminated Dick Siderowf of Connecticut's Aspetuck, one of the world's finest amateur players.

title: ABOUT NEW JERSEY
description: IT HAPPENS near the end of the Broadway show Annie, which we know is about an ageless little girl with no real eyes and a Daddy named Warbucks. Annie, who always thought she was an orphan, is told by Daddy Warbucks that her parents have been found on a New Jersey chicken farm and that she is soon to go to live with them. It is a happy moment, Daddy Warbucks suggests to Annie.

title: Also Swat the Grasshopper
description: THIS translation of the manual used by China's barefoot doctors in Hunan province provides a fascinating, puzzling glimpse into today's China. The manual is not intended as textbook, but is apparently used by the barefoot doctors as a combination reference guide, diagnostic manual and herbal. For the Western physician, the book provides a bewildering mixture of Western scientific thought, folk medicine and purely Chinese anatomic and therapeutic theories. What is most intriguing, however, is that the manual offers the Chinese physician each and all of these approaches simultaneously, without any doctrinaire teaching that one is the correct approach. Thus, rickets is discussed in one sentence as being the result of calcium and/or vitamin D deficiency, and in the next sentence as the result of spleen and kidney insufficiency. The suggested treatments include exposure to sunlight, additional calcium and vitamin D in the diet, along with and as well as acupuncture and herbal therapy.

title: Rosemary E. Vavasour Is Married to Paul Richards
description: Rosemary Elizabeth Vavasour, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John E. Vavasour of Rye, N. Y., and Paul Andrew Richards, son of Mrs. Neville Blake Richards of Scarsdale, N. Y., and the late Mr. Richards, were married yesterday in Rye. The Rev. Robert A. Connor of Scarsdale performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of the Resurrection.

title: They Talk to Rex
description: GEORGE CUKOR had his food flown to Russia from Fortnum and Mason's. Jacqueline Susann's ashes are preserved in a copperbound volume between The History of Dirty Words and The Brothers Karamazov in her husband's apartment. Rex Reed would be dead today if he'd accepted the invitation to Sharon Tate's doomed party. Instead, he scavenges the bones thrown to him by the rich and famous.

description: Leigh Barnes Day of New York and Warren Nash Ponvert of Locust Valley, L. I., were married yesterday in Oyster Bay, L. I. Judge Warren Doolittle of Nassau County District Court performed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Reginald Rose.

title: CALIFORNIA RIVERS A FOCUS OF DISPUTE
description: LOS ANGELES, May 21The 18month drought in California has touched off a legislative tussle over the question of abandoning the state's scenic rivers preservation program so that dams and reservoirs might be built on the rivers.

title: History of American Film, a Play, Is Glorious Montage of U.S. Myth
description: WASHINGTON  America, as teen in Christopher Durang's play, A History of the American Film, is not just moviemad, it is moviemade. Sexism, militarism and sendmentality inhabit the delirious film palace of Mr. Durang's mind. And the House UnAmerican Activities Committee has Ma Joad executed fnr cma te vi n P  re We the People.

title: Atlantic City Casino Plans Lagging; Only One May Be Ready This Year
description: ATLANTIC CITYEven if the Atlantic City casino gambling bill pending in the New Jersey Legislature becomes law within the next month, only one casino is considered to have a chance of opening this year, and may be two to five years before the resort city has enough casinos to become a rival of Las Vegas.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SCREEN SCENE Registration for the 19th annual American, Film Festival, starts at noon today at the New York Hilton Hotel. The public again is invited to look in on the daily competitive screenings tomorrow through Friday at the sixday audiovisual assembly of teachers, producers and writers. This is the largest conclave of nontheatrical moviesfilm fare rarely seen in commercial showcasesin the world.

title: 19 Homers in Pittsburgh, Boston
description: Power, in the form of 19 home runs, ran wild in three major league baseball games at Pittsburgh and Boston yesterday. The Pirates routed the Dodgers, 114, and sent Don Sutton to his first loss in seven decisions. Ten of the Pirates runs were produced on homers by Omar Moreno, Dave Parker (two, including a grand slam), and Al Oliver.

title: Tons of Bad Shrimp Treated in Mexico And Shipped to U. S.
description: HOUSTON, May 22Seafood salvage buyers, using a Mexican sanctuary, are recycling into the United States large volumes of foreign shrimp and other frozen ocean products that Federal food inspectors rejected as spoiled or contaminated.

title: U.S. Reported Lax On U.N. Sanctions
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 The United States Governmentespecially the Departments of Commerce, Transportation and Treasuryhas not emphasized enforcement of the United Nations sanctions against Rhodesia, the General Accounting office reported today.

title: Patio Is Staged at Cherry Lane; One Must Suspend All Disbelief
description: Robert Wilson does nothing by quarters. The last time we encountered him he was at the Metropolitan Opera House with a cast of millions performing an operatic nonopera, Einstein on the Beach. Last night, leaving the Met, leaving Einstein, even leaving the Beach, he turned up, accompanied vaguely by Lucinda Childs, OffBroadway, at the Cherry Lane Theater.

title: Return to Forever Is Pulling Its Fans to Verities of Jazz
description: It must be God talking to us, a young listener at one of Return to Forever's three weekend concerts at the Palladium exclaimed as Stanley Clarke, the group's bassist, launched into a rapidfire solo an the string bass. Other members of the audience whooped and screamed, like fans at a rock concert. But more and more, Return to Forever is drawing its youthful fans toward an appreciation of some of the verities of jazz, including song forms, swinging 4/4 time, and acoustic instruments.

title: The Quantity and Quality of Justice
description: There was a time when the Chief Justice of the United States let the work of the Supreme Court speak for itself. But no more. Besides speaking out vigorously for administrative reform of the court system and for fair pay for judges, Chief Justice Burger has begun to speak in defense of the Court's decisions against its. critics.

title: President to Vow Strong Support To Protect Nation's Environment
description: WASHINGTON, May 22  President Carter, in a message to be submitted to Congress tomorrow, will pledge the unsparing support of his Administration to the protection of the nation's environment and the preservation of its resources.

title: High Tides Around New York
description: DAYLIGHT SAVING TIME

title: CARTER SAYS FAILURE ON THE MIDEAST NOW COULD BE DISASTROUS
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., May 22President Carter said today that it was now a propitious time for a settlement in the Middle East and warned that failure to act could be disastrous not only for the Middle East but perhaps for the international political and economic order as well.

title: Delay Urged in Albany Action on Sunset Law Plan
description: ALBANY, May 22 The chief proponent of sunset lawsregulations intended to force government agencies and programs to justify their existence or face cancellationhas urged the Legislature to wait until next year before adopting a plan for the state.

title: Saudi Prince Meets Callaghan
description: LONDON, May 22 (Reuters)  Crown Prince Fand of Saudi Arabia and Prime Minister James Callaghan of Britain, flanked by their senior Cabinet ministers, met today to discuss the ArabIsraeli dispute, oil questions, trade and other major Middle East issues. Prince Fand will leave London tomorrow for Washington for talks with President Carter on prospects for reconvening the Middle East peace conference in Geneva.

title: Children Find a Ballet an Easy Nut to Crack
description: Children are irresistibly drawn to The Nutcracker at any time of the year, as one could clearly observe Saturday afternoon at the Metropolitan Opera House on a hot day in May. Hordes of them came to see Mihail Baryshnikov's production of the story, which had its first clutch of performances in New York last week by American Ballet Theater and no doubt will be receiving many more.

title: Arson for Profit Reported on Rise, With Cost of $2 Billion Last Year
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 22'The sky is red.

description: Belmont's race track, which has been shut by a strike of ticketsellers, will open today. Fans will be admitted free, but there will be no betting on races.

title: U.N. Conference Will Attempt to Break Deadlock on Seabed Mining
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 22 Seven years after the United Nations decided that the deep seabed resources are the common heritage of mankind, negotiators from 150 countries are about to make a new try at breaking a deadlock over who is to mine ocean floor minerals potentially worth billions of dollars and how the profits are to be shared.

title: Foes of Channel Plan In Tennessee Contend A Catfish Is Imperiled
description: MEMPHIS, May 22 (AP) West Tennessee's madtom catfish, like its cousin to the east, the snail darter, is an endangered species that threatens to tangle a Federal water project.

But the International Whale Day rally near United Nations headquarters celebrated the life, not the harvesting, of whales and was aimed at the attention of the 150nation Law of the Sea conference, which reconvenes here today.

title: This Horse Doesn't Stop
description: BALTIMORE, May 22This is written in the Cross Keys Inn about a mile and is furlong from Pimlico, where Laz Barrera was encountered a year ago taking an evening stroll in the courtyard. A few hours earlier Angel Cordero Jr., aboard the Kentucky Derby winner, Bold Forbes, and Braulio Baeza, riding Honest Pleasure, had mistaken the lOist Preakness Stakes for a twohorse match and hooked up in a duel of speed that wore out their mounts and enahled Elocutionist to overhaul them both. Finishing with deep gash on his left rear ankle, Bold Forbes hung on for third money but HonSports est Pleasure beat only one horse. of Cordero is a great jockey, said BarThe Times rera, who trained Bold Forbes, but he think he just has to beat Honest Pleasure. He forget there are four other horses. When I see 1:09 for threequarters, I know I cannot win.

ContribuLions may be made to the American Cancer Society or Northern Westchester Hospital Center, Mt. Kisco, N.Y.

title: Chile Still Violating Rights, O.A.S. Group Charges!
description: WASHINGTON, May 22Chile's military Government has been accused in a report by the InterAmerican Commission on Human Rights of continuing to carry out arbitrary arrests, torture and murder of Chilean citizens suspected of being its enemies.

title: Top Candidates Run Heated Race In Campaign for P.B.A.Presidency
description: For more than 18,000 New York City police officers, the big election the one that is really importantdoes not involve Abraham D. Beame, Mario M. Cuomo. Bella, S. Abzug and the other mayoral hopefuls but candidates named Samuel DeMilia, Ken McFeeley and Philip Caruso.

title: European Steel Industry Battles Worst Crisis in emory

title: CORRECTION

title: Kent State Students Camp at Site To Bar Construction Where 4 Died
description: KENT, Ohio, May 22 Students protesting Kent State University's plans to build a gymnasium near where four students were killed in an antiwar protest on May 4, 1970, have camped on the site for 10 days and are vowing to stay until the site is changed or they are evicted.

title: MRS. LOWS M. HACKER
description: Beatrice Hacker, wife of Louis M. Hacker, the retired dean of Columbia University's School of General Studies, died Saturday at ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center after a brief illness. She was 77 years old and lived at 430 West 116th Street.

title: Squires First From Yonkers To Win Its Race
description: YONKERS, May 22Pete Squires became this city's first resident to win the Yonketi Marathon today. He led from start to finish in the 42d annual event and triumphed in 2 hours 31 minutes 15 seconds. The race, run under a hot sun, drew 416 starters, including 22 women, 334 of whom finished.

title: RURAL BANKS EXPAND GRAIN TRADE LENDING
description: Several mysteries that have perplexed grain futures traders for months were solved last week by the Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City.

title: Young, in Johannesburg, Urges lloycott by Blacks
description: JOHANNESBURG, May 22Andrew Young suggested today that South African blacks mount an economic boycott against apartheid and said that it would be hypocritical of the United States, born in a revolution, to condemn violence by blacks seeking freedom from white minority regimes here and in Rhodesia and SouthWest Africa.

title: Clausen, in Tokyo, Backs Economic System
description: TOKYO, May 22 (Reuters)  A. W. Clausen, president of the world's largest commercial bank, said today the prevailing low level of confidence in the world economic community was wholly unjustified.

title: Resolving the Doctor's Dilemma
description: With the approval of the New York State Medical Society, the state Assembly has unanimously passed one of the most stringent measures ever written to police the conduct and competence of physicians. It would require hospitals and all healthcare professionals to report any knowledge of misconduct or impairment, such as alcoholism, drug abuse or mental illness. Physicians would have the highest obligation to report on their peers; they could lose the license to practice if they withheld pertinent information. The bill would also protect those who make reports in good faith against legal action or retribution.

title: Court to Offer JetsMets Plan
description: Justice Harold Baer is expected to attempt to end the long cityJetsMets dispute in State Supreme Court today by suggesting the Mets allow the Jets into Shea Stadium before the baseball season ends.

title: Party Founder Planned to Run
description: Mr. Eda, a whitehaired man of courtly manner, left the party in March, planning to form his own more moderate political organization, and he had intended to run in the July elections for a seat in the upper house of Parliament. He lost his seat in the lower house in the general election last December.

title: Smoking of Marijuana Wins Wider Acceptance
description: WASHINGTON, May 22  There are those who consider Mississippi socially backward, but something startling happened there the other day: The Mississippi Legislature voted to end criminal penalties for possession of small amounts of marijuana for personal use.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: It is odd, the avenues the mind can travel if you work in this particular field called food. Years ago my colleague Pierre Franey and I read a newspaper account dealing with a Frenchman who had pleaded guilty to smuggling some $12 million worth of heroin to New York. The account added that he whiled away his time in jail and became famous for his tuna souffles.

title: With a Homecoming Speech. !
description: BILBAO, Spain, May 22Wiping away tears, Dolores ibarruri, presiant of the Spanish Communist Party, today made an emotional public return to her native Basque province of Vizcaya, which she last saw in 1936 just before the Spanish Civil War exploded.

title: Goldin Says Students at Hostos Misused Financial Aid Program
description: More than a third of the disadvantaged students at Hostos Community College in the South Bronx got financial aid under City University's College Discovery Program while improperly collecting publicassistance funds, City Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin said yesterday.

title: Orient Express Rolls In At End of 94Year Run
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, May 22 (AP)The Orient Express, an 94yearold legend of the golden age of railroading, rumbled into instanbul's Sirkeci station today on its last 1,900mile run from Paris.

title: Trenton Ready To Debate Bill About Casinos
description: TRENTON, May 22 The New Jersey State Senate has scheduled debate and a possible vote tomorrow on a bill to regulate casino gambling in Atlantic City.

description: NEW LONDON, Conn., May 22 Harvard's varsity crew beat Yale for the 15th straight year tdday in the nation's oldest intercollegiate sports event, this time raced over two miles on the Thames River, which has been the race site for many of the last 99 years.

title: ALBANY CONSIDERS LAWS ON JUVENILES
description: ALBANY, May 21 The Legislature is considering a series of adjustments to the laws governing juvenile justice, intended to forestall moves for more sweeping changes in the Juvenile Justice Reform Act from some legislators who feel the act does not go far enough in handling juvenile crime.
