description: NEW DELHI, May 26 (Reuters)The ne American Ambassador to India, Robert F. Goheen, presented his credentials to Acting President B.D. Jattitoday and said his country looked forward to working his country looked forward to working closely with India on international problems

title: Blind Mathematician Applies Analytical Method to Bowling
description: Larry Wos, a 46yearold mathematician who has been blind since birth, discovered bowling in 1958 and says that the sport means more to him now than the intricate discipline of auto mated theorem proving, which is his specialty. He bowls three times a week and has 430 pages of notes at home containing detailed analyses of all his games, frame by frame, spare by spare.

title: Thomas E. Mullaney
description: There was a distinctly different tenor at the annual convention of the nation's steel executives that ended last night. In the past, domestic issues usually dominated the discussions of industry leaders, but this time they placed par

title: The U.N. Today
description: SECURITY COUNCIL

title: PRESIDENT CAUTIONS CONGRESS HE'LL VETO EXCESSIVE
description: WASHINGTON. May 26  President Carter threatened today to use his veto power if Congress voted what he called excessive increases in spending, but Congress did not appear to he in a mood to heed such warnings.

title: Toymaker, 27, Never Scared On the Way Up
description: It's a very appealing wall, so to speak. It looked unscalableI thought I'd like to try it, George J. Willig said when it was all over.

title: Carter Said to Want 5% Steel Price Rise
description: Bert Lance, director of the Office of Budget and Management, said here last night that the Carter Administration wanted the recent steel price increase to come in at 5 percent instead of 6.

title: art. Two Painters On the Same Plane
description: TWO YOUNGISH and relatively unexposed California paintersJohn Miller and James Hayward are making their first major appearance here at the Sidney Janis Gallery, 6 West 57th Street; and if the occasion isn't exactly one for bellringing, it's nice to see this Establishment bastion present some ,lessthancosmic reputations.

title: Board of Estimate Postpones Action on Request by Beame for Job Funds
description: The Board of Estimate yesterday postponed action on Mayor Beanie's request for $1 million in Federal job funds for the B'nai Torah Institute, a Brooklynbased socialservice agency that is under investigation by three Federal agencies

title: PennDixie Industries Dismisses Castle From Three Top Positions
description: PennDixie Industries Inc., a producer of steel products and cement, said yesterday it had removed Jerome Castle as chairman, president and chief executive of the company.

title: L.I.R.R. Reports 91.69% of Trains Have Been On Time
description: The Long Island Rail Road, whose 80,000 daily commuters are always skeptical, yesterday reported that its ontime performance had improvedit said 91.69 percent of its trains had arrived within five minutes of schedule this monthand that ridership had gained.

title: The Pop Life
description: VALERIE CARTER, who opens the show for a threenight run by Country Joe McDonald at the Bottom Line, 15 West Fourth Street, starting tonight, put out her first record a few months ago. It was called Just a Stone's Throw Away, and it was warmly received by most of the press, even by those normally resistent to the Los Angeles woman singersongwriter genre. Since

title: Jury to Hear Case of Patient Carrying Pills
description: WOODRIDGE, May 26The case of a Manhattan cabinetmaker arrested here on Mother's Day for illegally carrying eight prescribed tranquilizers in an unmarked vial was referred tonight to the county erand fury.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, May 26Atlantic City and state officials agreed today to make an immediate effort to build housing for Atlantic City's poor and elderly residents in response to finding that hundreds are being forced from slum areas by land speculators who hope to raze lowcost housing to make room for gambling casino hotels.

title: Cook Executive Quits
description: Willard R. Sparks resigned his posts at Cook Industries Inc., a commodity trading house and grain exporter. The company has reported losses in recent quarters and forecast a loss for the quarter ending May 31, Page D3,

title: Lucky Stores in Plan To Acquire Atherton
description: Lucky Stores Inc. of Dublin, Calif., said that it had agreed in principle to acquire all of the stock of Athertob Industries Inc. of Menlo, Calif., in exchange for three million shares of Lucky Stores valued at $43.87 million. Lucky

title: Television
description: Neil Sedaka will be the host and perform in The Midnight Special show, tonight at 1 A.M. on NBC.

title: Bond Prices Are Steady Despite Sizable Growth in Money Supply
description: The nation's money supply showed a sizeable increase in the week ended May 18, the Federal Reserve reported yesterday, but the growth apparently did not surprise the credit markets. Bond prices, which had declined slightly early in the day, showed no particulai Credit reaction to the weekly figures. The Federal Reserve also disclosed that commercial bank loan demand still has not shown the strength

title: United Press International
description: Assemblymen Howard Kupperman, !eft, and Stephen P. Persicie congratulating each other in Trenton after vote on casino gambling legislation.

title: Jury Finds No Crime In Pastorini Boat Crash
description: LIBERTY, Tex., May 26 (AP)  A Liberty County grand jury ruled today that there was no criminal responsibility involved in an accident in which a jetpowered boat driven by Dan Pastorini. Houston Oiler quarterback, crashed into a crowd in Liberty County last Sunday. rwo persons died as a result of the mishap.

title: Young's African Trip: Reactions Are Positive and Negative
description: LONDON, May 26Like an itinerant preacher affirming the perfectability of man, Andrew Young has swept through eight African countries in 16 days, proclaiming the advent of a new age of American foreign policy toward Africa and the world. It was an ambitious and complicated mission, and though the returns are not fully in, the United States delegate to the United Nations seemed gratified with the way things went as he flew to London from the Sudan, the last stop on his African trip.

title: Israeli Firing on Lebanon Charged;
description: NABATIYE, Lebanon, May 26For the last week, this important market center in southern Lebanon has come under intensified shelling from heavy artillery reportedly stationed in Israel.

title: AJazzman From Poland
description: For Adam Makowicz, the redbearded, blueeyed, 36yearold Polish jazz pianist, who is making his first American appearance at the Cookery, University Place at Eighth Street, every day is totally music. In addition to playing five hoursfrom 8:30 P.M. to 1 A.M.every night (except Sunday) at the Greenwich Village nightclub, he practices three to four hours every day and also

title: Music: Faure's Last Testament
description: THE FINAL works of major composers have a firm gripone might say a death gripon our magination. All sorts of doleful, tragic messages are read into these pieces, even in instances where the composer may have died extraordinarily young, in the middle of a cheery Allegro con spirit. Gabriel Faure. however, was almost 80 when he died in 1924 and had been in poor health, so his String Quartet in E minor may bear consideration as a last testament.

title: Senate Unit Clears Carter Choices For Envoys to Soviet and France
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 (Reuters)The Senate Foreign Relations Committee today cleared President Carter's nominations of Malcolm Toon as Ambassador to the Soviet Union and Arthur A.Hartman as Ambassador to France.

title: What to Do, Where to Go, Why It's Fun
description: IN MOST PLACES, festivals are a sometime thing, but the festival that is Greenwich Village goes on without end. The Village, which constantly changes, is on an upturn at the moment, and on weekends its sidewalks are thronged with visitors looking for the runway that offers the best takeoff for their particular flight of fancy. This weekend, with the opening today of the big Washington Square Outdoor Art Exhibit, the Village assumes a particularly folksy and friendly role.

title: At the Movies
description: THOSE SCREAMS coming from the sanitarium are not coming from the patients, they're coming from me, confessed Harvey Korman, the joyously sadomasochistic chief psychiatrist at the PsycoNeurotic Institute for the Very, Very Nervous in High Anxiety. Mr, Korman's fellow kooks in Mel Brooks's cockeyed tribute to Alfred Hitchcock include Madeline Kahn, as a mysterious damsel in disarray; Cloris Leachman, as the naughty Nurse Diesel; Howard Morris, as a scatterbrained shrink, and Mr. Brooks himself, as a debonair, Cary Grantlike mind healer who lives in secret horror of heights.

title: Carter Reaffirms He Expects Israel to Give Up Occupied Territory
description: WASHINGTON, May 26  President Carter said today that the United States expected Israel to withdraw from occupied territory on the West Bank of the Jordan River even though the likely next Prime Minister of Israel has vowed never to give up that land.

title: Theater: Dear Liar, Shaw in Love
description: WHEN JEROME KILTY stitched together the correspondence between George Bernard Shaw and the actress Mrs. Patrick Campbell for the play Dear Liar he was building ingeniously, but upon sand.

title: HALDEMAN CRITICIZES NIXON'S EXPLANATION
description: LOS ANGELES, May 26H. R. Halde man, White House chief of staff under President Nixon, today expressed displeasure with Mr. Nixon's explanation of the Watergate affair and said that his own version of the coverup would be presented in a book scheduled to be published this fall.

title: World News Briefs
description: GENEVA, May 26Underground and other guerrilla forces operating inside enemyoccupied territory are to be treated as prisoners of war when capturedeven though they are not wearing regular uniformsunder a new rule of war approved today by a 109nation conference here.

title: Stiff Penalty for the Use of Children In Pornography Gains in Albany
description: ALBANY, May 26A bill that would make it a felony to use children under the age of 16 in a sexual performance was passed by the New York State Assembly today and is expected to receive approval in the Senate next week.

title: Books of The Times
description: IN PATRIOTIC GORE Edmund Wilson wrote of Harriet Beecher Stowe: [She] had got rid of Calvinism; she had dramatized the teaching of Jesus. Yet her God was still a God of Justice rather than a God of Love. Her pity runs to sentimentality, which is to say that it sometimes seems false; but she is never an obnoxious moralist: Her judgment of men is quite sober and her judgment of ideas quite mind

title: Cuban Fishing Vessels To Be Allowed in U.S. Under Maritime Accord
description: HAVANA, May 25 (Reuters)  Cuban fishing vessels will be able to call at United States ports to obtain supplies and equipment and to undergo repairs under a fishing agreement between the two countries published here today.

title: Nehru's Sister Campaigning for Presidency of India
description: NEW DELHI, May 25Vijaya Lakshml Pandit, the 76yearold sister of Jawarhalal Nehru, is campaigning hard to become the president of India.

title: Hartford's Day Of Furious Fiddling
description: For a day in the openfor picnicking or shuffling or swinging or just lying on the grass and listeningan oldtime fiddling contest in Hartford tomorrow may be just the thing for you.

title: Coop City Is Checked Each Day For Gas Leaks to Bar Emergency
description: Gas leaks have been so frequent at the huge Coop City housing projects in the Bronx that Consolidated Edison now checks each of the development's 35 highrise buildings every day to prevent the situation from getting out of hand and creating a possible emergency, the utility said yesterday.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Up 5.3%
description: WASHINGTON, May 26The Assocint;on of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States. railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 17 billion tonmiles, up 5.3 percent from the yearearlier level. Carloadings in the same period totaled 495353 cars, a rise of 2.3 percent from last vear. The American Trucking Association Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage rose 5.2 percent from a year ago.

title: Nordiques Trounce Jets, 82, for Title
description: QUEBEC, May 26 (AP)The Quebec Nordiques erupted for six goals in the second period, including Real Cloutier's 14th of the playoffs, and whipped the Winnipeg Jets tonight, S2, to win the World Hockey Association's championship series in seven games.

title: Storm Halts Atlanta Golf With Round Incomplete
description: ATLANTA, May 26 (AP)With 57 players in the field of 156 unable to finish because of a late afternoon thunderstorm the first day of the $200,000 Atlanta Classic golf tournament ended with the opening round incomplete.

title: House otes Amendment to Avert Tolls on New York's Free Bridges
description: WASHINGTON, May 26The House approved an amendment to its new cleanair legislation today to relieve New York State from imposing tolls on the free bridges across the East and Harlem Rivers.

title: GOLD IS OFF SHARPLY IN EUROPE TRADING
description: LONDON, May 26 (AP)The price of gold fell sharply in Europe today while he dollar was narrowly mixed.

title: In Memoriam
description: KRAMERMurray. In cherished and everlasting memory of a beloved and devoted father who left me June 4, 1971. Forever In my heart. Rest In Race.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: You could say that everything about this company is up in the air. Or, as the Multigravitational Aerodance Group describes its sphere of activity, virtually none of the dancing is done on the ground, The halfdozen or so dancers move through choreographed patterns while suspended from a network of structures that hang from a large scaffold. Starting this weekend, the group is performing its new 1977/Homage to Picasso each Thursday through Saturday until June 25 at its studio, 260 West Broadway (at Beach Street, one block south of Canal Street). Adtnission is $2.50 (no reservations). Performances tonight and tomorrow at 8:30 and 10 P.M. (Thursdays at 8:30 P.M.). Last year, the group played to standing room only at the Guggenheim Museum with its Homage to Picasso. The new work is totally different, they say, adding: There is more In it, And why not? Picasso did a lot.

title: Judge in Wisconsin Calls Rape by Boy Normal
description: MADISON, Wis., May 26 (UPI)When a 15yearold boy raped a girl in a stairwell at West High School, Judge Archie Simonson ruled yesterday, he was reacting normally to prevalent sexual permissiveness and women's provocative clothing.

title: Trade Deficit for April Up To a Record of $2.6 Billion
description: WASHINGTON, May 26The United States had a record trade deficit of $2.6 billion in April and may register an unprecedented $20 billion deficit for the full year, the Commerce Department said today.

title: United Way Merges Its Drives In New York, Jersey, Connecticut
description: A consolidation of United Way campaigns in the New YorkNew JerseyConnecticut areawhich sponsors  believe would more than double total contributionswas announced yesterday.

title: Books: Grass Roots
description: ELIOT WIGGINTON'S Foxfire project began as an attempt to interest his Appalachian high school students in learning about their past. Taking his cue from the oral history programs that have been popping up at colleges and universities around the country, Mr. Wig;;into sent his charges to interview the oldest residents of their communities. The results, predictably enough, were heartwarming. Books were published, Fcbrfire projects sprang up in high schools across America, and eventually Mr. Wigginton was able to establish a Foxfire Foundation.

title: Gun Battle Linked to Rastafarians Leaves One Dead and 4 Wounded
description: One man was killed and four others, all believed to be members of the Jamaican religious sect known as the Rastafarians, were wounded last night in an exchange of gunfire in Brooklyn, the police renorted.

title: 2 Hurt as Jet Leaves Runway
description: DETROIT, May 26 (AP)A twinengine jet ran out of runway on a landing today and crashed through the fence at City Airport, skidded across a busy street through another fence and into a cemetery where it burned. The two pilots aboard were slightly injured, according to the Chrysler Corporation, which had the Learjet under lease. They were identified as Anthony Adanski, 36 years old, of Ypsilanti and Karl Neumairer, 41, of Livonia.

title: SOVIET PLANE SEIZED, DIVERTED TO SWEDEN
description: STOCKHOLM, May 26 (AP)  An unarmed hijacker who pretended to be carrying explosives seized a Soviet domestic airliner today and forced it to fly to Sweden.

title: Toymaker, 27, Never Scared On the Way Up
description: It's a very appealing wall, so to speak. It looked unscalableI thought I'd like to try it, George Willig said when it was all over.

title: Menahem Begin, on Extremism and Terrorism
description: Following are excerpts from a dialogue between Menahem Begin, head of the rightwing Likud Party and the man likely to be Israel's next Prime Mmister, and Dr. William Berkowitz, rabbi of Congregation B'nai Jeshurun here. The discussion, last Nov. 15, was part of a program under the synagogue's institute of adult Jewish studies. The transcript was made by B'nai Jeshurun.

title: HOUSE VOTE DELAYS AND ALSO WEAKENS CURB ON AUTO FUMES
description: WASHINGTON, May 26The House of Representatives passed today a bill to amend the Clean Air Act of 1970 after first adopting a provision that would further delay and permanently weaken controls on automobile exhaust fumes that constitute a potential health hazard.

title: GeneSplicing
description: The SloanKettering Institute for Cancer Research plans to begin a controversial type of genetic experimentation known popularly as genesplicing, executives of the midtown Manhattan institute said yesterday.

title: 13YearOld Boy Drowns
description: TRENTON, May 26 (UPI)  Rescue crews using grappling hooks today recovered the body of a 13yearold boy who drowned in the Delaware River while playing with friends. The victim, Juan Torres of Trenton, fell into the river late last night whila playing with three friends who believed his initial cries for help were a hoax, according to authorities.

title: Ballet: Hot Ticket
description: 0 NCE UPON A TIME, on April 24, 106G, if you children out there insist on some kind of precision, New York City Ballet made a great financial discovery. It was a magic formulaand the wise men of City Ballet stumbled on it by chance, just as Sir Alexander Fleming blundered into penicillin. The formula was: Swan Lake, Firebird, Afternoon of a Faun and Western Symphony. And the result was a Nutcracker without nuts and without cracks.

title: Court Accord Keeps Football Jets at Shea Stadium
description: The city won its fight last night to keep the Jets in New York, when the Mets bowed to court pressure and permitted the football team into Shea Stadium during the baseball season.

title: 9 KILLED IN BATH FIRE IDENTIFIEDBYFRIENDS
description: The nine known dead in the Everard Baths fire were identified yesterday, mostly by friends rather than family members, as District Attorney Robert M. Morgenthau of Manhattan announced an investigation as to whether criminal violations of the fire and building codes might have caused the blaze Wednesday.

title: Owners of Caesars Palace in Las Vegas Move to Lease 2 Boardwalk Properties
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 26  Caesars World Inc. of Los Angeles was reported today to be completing negotiations to lease two Boardwalk properties for a new casino hotel. Such a purchase would be the first of Atlantic City property by owners of a Las Vegas casino hotel since Nevada adopted a law last week permiting companies holding Nevada casino licenses to conduct gambling businesses in other states.

title: Vote in Miami Blow to 3 Democrats
description: MIAMI, May 26Three top Florida Democrats with close ties to the White House suffered a considerable loss of prestige with the defeat of their handpicked candidate yesterday in Little Havana's community election here.

title: 2State Bid
description: ALBANY, May 26The New York State Senate passed today, by a vote of 36 to 14, a bill that could increase an industrial competitivebidding war that has developed in recent months between N.?.w York and Pennsylvania.

title: Market Place
description: A block transaction in stock of the lightly traded Facet Enterprises Inc. at a 1977 high last Monday was made up largely of shares from the New York Stock Exchange specialist's inventory, it was learned yesterday.

title: Court Accord Keeps Football Jets at Shea Stadium
description: The city won its fight last night to keep the Jets in New York, when the Mets bowed to court pressure and permitted the football team into Shea Stadium during the baseball season.

title: TV WEEKEND
description: THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND begins on a note of quiet charm with an interview with Anne Morrow Lindbergh, her first for television, tonight at 8 on CBS. It ends in unexpected disappointment Monday night at 9 with a new producton of Thornton Wilder's Our Town. The generally subdued schedule also includes a profile of South Africa's Afrikaaners in The White Laager, a Swedish documentary carried on Channel 13 at 9 this evening.

title: Badillo, Buoyed by Vote Estimate, Weighs Entry in Contest for Mayor
description: Convinced that the vote mix in New York City would put him into the mayoral runoffand that he would win itRepresentative Herman Badillo, who lost to Mayor Beame in the Democratic mayoral primary runoff in 1973, has all but decided to declare for the Democratic nomination.

title: A Thoroughly Professional Soldier
description: WASHINGTON, May 26The prose is dry but the Army's biography of Maj. Gen. John Kirk Singlaub portrays a soldier's soldier. He has fought in three wars and been decorated in each and wounded in two. He has led regular troops and guerrilla teams. He is a paratrooper, a Ranand a helicopter pilot. He has attended the right military command schools, had the right command and staff assignments and has a chest full of medals and ribbons to show for his 34 years in the profession of arms. As a fellow officer said, Jack Singlaub is a thoroughly professional soldier.

title: Jersey Adopts Casino Controls, Paves Way for Gambling Houses
description: TRENTON May 26The State Assembly completed today legislative approval Of casino gambling in Atlantic City, opening the way to the first legal gaming casinos in the East before the end of the year. The Assembly passed the Casino Control Act by a rollcall vote of 43 to 26, two more votes than necessary for passage, after attempts to amend the measure failed. Governor Byrne is expected to sign the bill next Thursday in Atlantic City.

title: To Erik Bruhn, It's Important to Fall
description: Erik Bruhn, the distinguished Danish ballet star who resumed his stage career two years ago after a premature retirement in 1972, will dance the title role in American Ballet Theater's Petrushka at 8 o'clock tonight at the Metropolitan Opera House.

title: Construction Contracts at a Record
description: A combination of rising industrial production, strong consumer spending and an ample supply of mortgage money pushed construction contracts to a new high in April, the McGrawHill Information Systems Company reported yesterday.

title: Albert King Calls Timeout In College Guessing Game
description: Albert King made a decision yesterday, but it wasn't the one that had been expected. The basketball star from Fort Hamilton High in Brooklyn decided to withhold the announcement of where he would go to college. The reason for the interest is that King is considered the best scholastic basketball player in the country. He averaged 38 points and 20 rebounds a game last season and he has been the subject of one the hottest recruiting battles in years.

title: FERDINAND J. JURCIK
description: Ferdinand J. Jurcik, a retired restaurateur, died Wednesday at St. Vincent's Hospital. He was 74 years old and a resident of Manhattan.

title: Screen: Tempest In a Tokyo Teapot
description: WATARU HIRAYAMA (Shin Saburi), the hero of the late Yasujiro Ozu's 1958 film, "Equinox Flower," is a successful Tokyo businessman, contentedly married to an old-fashioned wife who never argues and who picks up after him, the father of two pretty daughters, one of whom is reaching the marriageable age.When we first meet him at the wedding dinner for the daughter of one of his old friends, Hirayama delivers an amused, affectionate toast to the bridal couple, noting that theirs is a love match, not a "prosaic, unromantic" arranged marriage, as his own had been. When the guests laugh, even his wife giggles.To the world at large Hirayama seems as flexible and resourceful as the nation that turned the military defeat of World War II into economic victory. At home, though, he's still a rigid 19th-century tyrant."Equinox Flower," which opened yesterday at the Cinema Studio, is about Hirayama's desperate attempts to thwart his liberated daughter, Setsuko (Ineko Arima), from making just the sort of love match that he has encouraged when the daughter was not his own. Hirayama at first refuses to allow any marriage at all. He resorts to comically transparent stratagems to find out the worst about the young man, who is revealed to be without blemish.When Hirayama's wife (Kinuyo Tanaka) points outvery delicatelythat her husband is not being consistent, he explodes that this has to do with parental love and, besides, inconsistencies are the way of the world. It's a witty scene and a very moving one."Equinox Flower"a particularly inscrutable title even for this great Japanese directoris one of Ozu's least dark comedies, which is not to say that it's carefree, but, rather, that it's gentle and amused in the way that it acknowledges time's passage, the changing of values and the adjustments that must be made between generations.Hirayama is as charming a character as Ozu has ever given usintelligent, thoughtful, sensitive, impatient with pretense, practical, a good friend and a dutiful parent, and, when it comes to his own children, a total hypocrite. His defense of traditional values, which Ozu again and again saw in terms of the relations between fathers and daughters ("Late Spring," "Autumn Afternoon," "End of Summer"), is doomed from the start, yet there is in "Equinox Flower" less a sense of defeat than in any of the other films."Equinox Flower" is uncharacteristically buoyant, as in a crucial sequence when his daughter Setsuko's best friend tricks the father into giving his consent to Setsuko's marriage. The trick is farcical, though its implications are genuinely dramatic, creating the mixture of contradictory emotions that make Ozu's meticulously observed family dramas unique in film literature.The performers are flawless, including Chishu Ryu, the leading player in a number of other Ozu works who here plays a supporting role, that of Hirayama's best friend, a gentle man completely baffled when his own daughter moves out of her home to live with her lover. But even this father and daughter are reconciled by the end. Neither understands the other, yet there is acceptance, which is Ozu's way.One word about the print being shown at the Cinema Studio: "Equinox Flower" was Ozu's first color film, which makes the drearily purplish cast of this print so disappointing. Ozu used color with the same discipline that he devoted to all other aspects of filmmaking, though it's impossible to tell here.

title: DEATH PENALTY IS VETOED BY MARYLAND GOVERNOR
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., May 26 (AP)Gov. Marvin Mandel today vetoed a bill that would have restored the death penalty in Maryland, saying that the measure was so poorly drawn that it would lead to a series of court challenges.

title: Private Colleges Found Holding Their Own In Competition With Public Counterparts
description: A study of 100 private colleges and universities has concluded that, contrary to widespread belief, independent institutions are holding their own in competition with their public counterparts.

title: Accountant Is Cleared of Preparing Unaudited Matter
description: A certated public accountant was ac quitted of charges of mail fraud, stock fraud, and conspiracy by a Federal jury in New York yesterday in a case that raised the issue of the responsibility of an accountant in the preparation of unaudited financial statements.

title: Music: Dances at the Prom
description: IT IS TRADITIONAL by now with the Nev: York Philharmonic's Promenades that one group of concerts each season is devoted to dance music of various kinds, This year's installment was introduced at Avery Fisher Hall on Wednesday night for the first of tour performances.

title: Case of Patient Carrying Pills Directed to Jury
description: WOODRIDGE, N.J., May 26The case of a Manhattan cabinetmaker arrested here on Mother's Day for illegally carrying eight prescribed tranquilizers in an unmarked vial was referred tonight to the county grand jury.

title: S.E.C. ACCUSES FALSTAFF OF FRAUDULENT 1975 DEAL
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 (AP)The Securities and Exthange Commission accused the Falstaff Brewing Corporation, its chairman and two former officers today of violating securities fraud and reporting laws.

title: Climber Conquers 110Story Tower
description: Using equipment he designed and built himself and tested in secret at night, a 27yearold toymaker and mountain climber from Queens scaled the South Tower of the World Trade Center yesterday morningto the delight of thousand of pedestrians who watched his threeandahalfhour effort.

title: Possibility of Two Gunmen In Robert Kennedy Killing Discounted by Investigator
description: LOS ANGELES, May 26Those who contend that there was a second gunman in the fatal shooting of Senator Robert F. Kennedy fail to take into consideration the results of ballistics tests or eyewitness reports, the special counsel investigating the case testified today.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: To Strike Another Social Balance
description: COVENTRY, England  Material growth can no longer deliver what has long been promised for itto make everyone middle class. Raising the level of the ladder as a whole no longer provides those on the lower rungs with the same lift as those climbing higher on the ladder.

title: New Face: John Considine
description: In The Late Show, the Art CarneyLily Tomlin movie playing in neighborhood theaters, there's a perfect moment of poetic justice when Mr. Carney, as

description: RESULTS

title: President Signs Treaty Declaring LatinAmerica NuclearFree Zone.
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 (Reuters)President Carter today signed the Treaty of Tlatelolco, which established Latin America as the world's first nuclearfree zone.

title: 76ers Win Again,10789, Fight Erupts
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 26Interrupted by an ugly brawl that was more competitive than the game, the Philadelphia 76ers overwhelmed the Portland Trail Blazers tonight, 10789, in the second game of the National Basketball Association's championship round.

title: Elderly Interns Take Over on Capitol Hill
description: WASHINGTONTheir average age is 70, but they are running about Washington like a bunch of college kids. They are a group of 90 elderly people participating in a Congressional internship program that emphasizes governmental services for the aging.

title: Stage: Earth Worms,
description: EARTH WORMS at Playwrights Horizon is the third play by the furiously talented Albert Innaurato to surface in New York this season. In common with its predecessors, The Transfiguration of Benno Blimpie and Gemini, currently at Broadway's Little Theater, the new play ds a black comic version of a rapacious society consuming its young.

title: Belmont's Betting Effort Foiled As Electricians Walk Off Job
description: Belmont Park's labor dispute took a turn for the worse yesterday when electricians complaining of death threats blocked an attempt by management to use administrative personnel as parimutuel clerks.

title: The Case of Andy Young
description: WASHINGTON, May 26Andrew Young, the United States Ambassador to the United Nations, has emerged as the most talkative and controversial member of President Carter's Cabinet as well as the most aggressive and consistent. Seldom a day goes by that he doesn't make the headlines with some vivid criticism of some country, including his own, about how they are being beastly to his fellow blacks.

title: Albany Agrees to Ease Tax Burden of Trotters
description: A statewide harness racing strike was averted yesterday when the Legislature agreed on a relief bill that was promptly attacked by the tracks, labor and Governor Carey.

title: YOUNG ENDS HIS TRIP ON A DISSONANT NOTE
description: WASHINGTON, May 26  Andrew Young flew back today from a trip to Africa and Britain, in the last 24 hours of which he managed to enrage the Swedes, the Russians, the British, the Borough of Queens and almost certainly the State Department.

title: Dibbs Upset By Norberg; Solomon Gains
description: PARIS, May 26 (AP)Rolf Norberg of Sweden upset Eddie Dibhs, 63, 36, 75, 6.4, in the second round of the French open tennis championships today. Dibbs was seeded fourth and had reached the semifinals the last two years.

title: An EightCollege Man Packs It In
description: Red Smith

title: PRESIDENT CAUTIORS CONGRESS HE'LL VETO EXCESSIVE
description: WASHINGTON, May 26  Presiiiont Carter threatened today to use his veto power if Congress voted what he called excessive increases in spending, but Congress did not appear to be in a mood to heed such warnings.

title: Beaths
description: ALLENJoseph. The Jewish Community Center of Harrison, N.Y. records with sorrow the passing of the beloved father of our esteemed member, Mrs. Edward Neustadter and extends heartfelt sympathy to members of the bereeved family.

title: Joining Up in Space
description: Washington and Moscow announced the other day that their scientists will soon begin joint studies for two types of possible cooperative space ventures, One will explore the potentiality of using our space shuttle and the Soviet Union's Salyut space station for joint projects in the early 1980's; the second concerns the possible later usefulness of a SovietAmerican station in space.

title: Lives of American Women On Display
description: Up a flight of marble stairs, past the hallowed halls of the NewYork Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, at 77th Street, there is a room teeming with memorabiliaboth impudent and sacredof women's lives over the last 190 years:

title: Music: From Argentina
description: ACURIOUS but pleasant program was presented in Alice Tully Hall on Wednesday night by Action Cultural Argentina, an organization formed by Argentines in the United States to promote the culture of their country. It was the first concert it had sponsored, and it fell on the 167th anniversary of the establishment of Areentina's first eovernment.

title: Management
description: The figures are as stark as the bare bones of a dead tree: Out of 400,000 small businessfailures each year, more than 90 percent are rooted in management weaknesses.

title: Heimann Is Nominated by Carter As Comptroller of the Currency
description: John G. Heimann, a Democrat and early Carter supporter, was nominated yesterday as Comptroller of the Currency. The appointment by President Carter, which was expected, is subject to confirmation by the Senate.

title: CARTER TO SAIL TODAY IN SUB WITH RICKOVER
description: ST. SIMONS ISLAND, Ga., May 26 (UPI) President Carter climbed into blue jeans today as soon as he got to the retreat where he will spend the weekend, adding that he was looking forward to a ninehour trip on a nuclear attack submarine.

title: Skateboards Soar, and So Do the Accidents
description: Outside Charlottesville, Va., they don crash helmetsessential to avoid death or injuryand career at 50 miles per hour down Highway 250 off Afton Mountain. On California hills, they do close to 60. In the dry swimming pools around Los Angeles, they sweep down the sloping bottom, rocket up the vertical side at the deep end, and just before soaring over the edge, swing around the edge of the pool and plunge back down again.

title: Conference on the Disabled. Ends With Many Delegates Disillusioned
description: WASHINGTON, May 27Delegates to the first White House Conference on Handicapped Individuals, who came to Washington this week hoping to adopt a national agenda of issues that concern the disabled, left for home today, many of them angry, disillusioned and wonderinn what had been accomplished.

title: PENTAGON TO WITHHOLD :TAXES FOR 13 STATES
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (AP)The Defense Department said today that planped to start withholding state taxes July 1 from the pay of service personnel with lezal residences in 13 states.

title: Surrogate Samuel A. Spiegel of Manhattan Dies at 6?
description: Surrogate Samuel A. Spiegel of Manhattan, who in 21 years as an Assemblyman and judge devoted himself to fighting the battles of such little guys as public housing tenants, widows, and orphans, died Thursday night of a heart attack. He was 63 years old.

title: Kidnapping Victim Suffocated in Box, Autopsy Indicates
description: On the basis of an autopsy, Ulster County authorities said yesterday that, Gertrude Resnick Farber died of suffocation after she was kidnapped and buried alive in a wooden box near the remote Catskill Mountain town of Grahamsville,, N_Y._ last Ttipsriay.

title: Ivoryton Playhouse Will Not Open This Season as Buyer Is Sought
description: ESSEX, Corm., May 27The Ivoryton Playhouse, a mainstay of the summer strawhat theater circuit in New England for 47 years, will not open this season, Kenneth Krezel of Mamaroneck, N.Y., its owner, said yesterday.

title: Breakthrough Is Reported Near In U.S.Panama Talks on Canal
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (AP)The United States and Panama may be near a breakthrough in their negotiations for a new treaty for the Canal Zone, an American source said today.

title: 401 Seized at College In Apartheid Protest
description: SANTA CRUZ, Calif., May 27 (AP)A total of 401 sitin demonstrators at the University of California, Santa Cruz, were arrested before dawn today, capping protests at several of the university's campuses where dmands included ending university ties with companies with financial interests in South Africa.

title: SAMUEL G. NADEL
description: Samuel G. Nadel, who retired three years ago as president of the Pickle King Company of Paterson, N.J., died yesterday in St. Mary's Hospital in Passaic, N.J., after a long illness. He lived at 105 Kensington Terrace, Passaic, and was 65 years old. He leaves his wife, the former Esther Arons; three sons, Dr. Bruce, Howard and Richard; five grandchildren; one brother, and two sisters.

title: HARRY L. LEWIS
description: Harry L. Lewis, a realestate developer and lawyer, died Tuesday at his home in White Plains. He was 71 years old.

title: Army of Nomads Being Used To Exploit Amazon's Riches
description: TROMBETAS, BrazilJose Carvalho Santos left his small town in Brazil's dusty, impoverished northeast six years ago. He could have followed many of his unemployed neighbors to the booming industrial centers of Rio de Janeiro and Sao Paulo. But instead he headed west to the Amazon frontier where early in the 1970's the military Government began the first serious effort to conquer the jungles that extend over more than half of the country.

title: Dollar Turns Firm In Modest Trading As Gold Rebounds
description: LONDON, May 27 (AP)The dollar rose or held steady against several major European currencies in modest trading today. This performance was in contrast to the dollar's overall decline in the four previous sessions this week.

title: PESSIMISM IS VOICED ON BEAME'S BUDGET
description: The state's Meal watcnaog for New York City said yesterday that if everything that could go wrong did go wrong, Mayor Beame's proposed budget for next year would be out of balance by as much :as. $970 million. This view was publicly attacked by the Mayor's aides and privately scorned by the State Emergency Financial Control Board staff.

title: New York Region Officials Assail Move to Ease AutoFume Curbs
description: WASHINGTON, May 27Northeastern urban communities, already hard hit by air pollution, got left out in the smog, disappointed spokesmen for New York State and New Jersey said today in commenting on key parts of the new cleanair bill passed by the House yesterday.

title: ARREST OF PATIENT STIRS LEGISLATURE
description: WOODRIDGE, May 27As the Bergen County Prosecutor's office began considering today the possible indictment of a. Manhattan man charged with a drugviolation for carrying prescription tranquilizers in an unmarked container, support seemed to be growing in the State Legislature for a new amendment to exclude thousands of legitimate medical patients in New Jersey from the law's provisions and penalties.

title: Bridge:
description: The defending champions, headed by Michael Becker of New York, clashed in the final of the Reisinger knockout team championship at the New York Hilton yesterday with a quintet headed by Alan Greenberg of New York.

title: EthnicIdentity Education Began In the 1930's, Five Pioneers
description: Long before the groupidentity movement of the last decadewhich made such things as AfroAmerican studies, Asian studies and Slavic studies common features of college and high school curriculums  there was an ethnicstudies movement, and according to its initiators, it generated controversy even then.

title: Girding to Battle Federal Hydra
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 It's like looking at one of those 17thcentury books about sea monsters, said W. Harrison WeIlford. You see all those marvelous shapes that you really didn't imagine existed in quite those forms.

title: Fly
description: Mayor Beame yesterday accepted si iu to settle the city's $250,000 suit against George H. Willig, the Queens mountain climber who, on Thursday, became New York's newest folk hero by scaling the 1,350foot South Tower of the World Trade Center.

title: Miss Porter Cards 63 for Lead
description: CAMP HILL, Pa., May 27 AP)Mary Bea Porter shot the best round of her career, a sevenunderpar 63, and took a oneshot lead today in the $50,000 I ady Keystone open at Armitage Golf Club. Miss Potter stormed through the front nine with four consecutive birdies, added three on the back nine and didn't have a bogey.

title: Entegration Suit by Kansas City Board Could Open Way to Interstate Schools
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., May 27A desegeegation suit filed yesterday by the Kansas City Board of Education took the legal battle over school integration to another level by seeking desegregation not just across district lines but also cross state boundaries.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In an article on the Clean Air Act in The Times on Thursday, it was incorrectly reported that Representative George E. Brown Jr., Democrat of California, was a supporter of an amendment introduced by Representative John B. Breaux, Democrat of Louisiana. Mr. Brown backed another amendment, proposed by Representative Gunn McKay, Democrat of Utah.

title: George Bryant, Former Dean Of Graduate School at C. W. Post
description: George E. Bryant, former executive dean of the Graduate School of Education of the C. W. Post Center of Long Island University in Brookville, L. I., died Wednesday at St. Peter's Hospital in Albany after a brief illness. He was 70 years old and lived in Clinton Corners, N.Y.

title: HOUSE UNIT PROPOSES $27 BILLION IN CUTS IN DEFENSE BUDGET
description: WASHINGTON, May 27The House Defense Appropriations Subcommittee today recommended cuts of $2.7 billion in President Carter's proposed defense budget, making a long series of small reductions without eliminating any major weapons system Mr. Carter had sought.

title: Barbara H. Jacobs Is Bride of Gary Sussman
description: Barbara H. Jacobs, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Steven M. Jacobs of Paramus, N.J., was married yesterday to Gary L. Sussman, son of Mrs. Ruth Sussman of Teaneck, N.J., and Jerome Sussman

title: Rights, Rights, Rights
description: CENTEREACH, N. Y.In his few months in office, President Carter has made human rights a household phrase. It is an I'm for concept that grabs even stronger than the support of motherhood and flag. Human rights has been a household term in my world since I learned to think.

title: I Took Panama
description: Historical grievances can make good theater, but the stage is better for dramatizing them than for settling them.

title: Winifred Feldman Is Married To Thomas Lavely, Executive
description: The marriage of Winifred Feldman, daughter of Judge and Mrs. Robert J. Feldman of Washington, to Thomas G. Lavely, son of Mr. and Mrs. Hal Lavely of Story City, Iowa, took place yesterday. Superior Court Judge Florence Murray performed the ceremony in her chambers in providence, R.I.

title: THOMAS L. PARSONNET
description: Thomas L. Parsonnet, counsel for the New Jersey State Federation of Labor from 1937 to 1961 and for the New Jersey State A.F.L.C.I.O. from 1961 to 1973, died Thursday at his home at 420 Center Street, South Orange, N.J. He was 75 years old.

title: The Great Mute and Politics
description: PARISOne of the major if hitherto unasked questions of worried France is what will the army do if, as is likely,. next year's legislative elections produce a leftwing parliamentary majority and a Cabinet including Communist ministers, In other words, would there be any possibility of army Intervention to frustrate the nation's expressed will?

title: The Dow Slips Below 900 As Wall Streeters Yawn
description: The Dow Jones industrial average sank yesterday below 900  considered a psychological barrier by many investors but Wall Street reacted with apparent calm.

title: REORGANIZATION IS BEGUN IN FEDERAL MANAGEMENT
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (AP)The budget director, Bert Lance, and the Civil Service Commission chairman, Alan K. Campbell, announced today the start of a toptobottom study leading to reorganization of Federal personnel management.

title: T.W.A. Registers Offering
description: Trans World Airlines has filed a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission relating to a proposed $100 million public offering of equity securities. The securities would consist of units comprising, one share of a new series B preferred stock combined with a fractional share of common. The proposed offering price of each unit is $20.

title: NYQUISTS TOP AIDE WILL SUCCEED HIM
description: ALBANY, May 27The State Board of Regents. which voted six months ago to dismiss Ewald B. Nyquist as State Education Commissioner, today chose his executive deputy, Gordon Mac Kay Ambach, to succeed him.

title: U.N. SUGAR PARLEY ENDS WITHOUT ACCORD ON PRICES
description: GENEVA, May 27The United States today urged all sugar exporting and imting countries to rethink their positions in preparation for a new effort to reach an agreement on a pricestabilizing pact that eluded them during a sixweek conference here.

title: About New York
description: Paralyzed from the neck down for years and years in his room and linked to breath by machinery and to hope by Beethoven, R. Marshall Loftus took the sippingstrawlike steering mechanism of his new batterypowered wheelchair in his lips and gently huffed and puffed a course out of doors two months aao.

description: For a while, they thought Long John Silver would get along with Miss MacNasty. Never mind get along. They thought they would get together, fall in love. But Long John Silver ignored Miss MacNasty, and so they sent him ,packing to Milwaukee.

title: India to Get U.S. Uranium Again
description: NEW DELHI, May 27The United States, making a good will gesture to the new Government of India, announced today that it had decided to resume the interrupted supply of enriched uranium for a nuclear power plant near Bombay.

title: Burger Warns About a Society Overrun by Lawyers
description: The Chief Justice of the United States, Warren E. Burger, warned yesterday that unless new ways were found to settle disputes, the country might be overrun by hordes of lawyers hungry as locusts.

title: Seton Hall Nine Ousted By St. John's, 3 to 2
description: MIDDLETOWN, Conn., May 27 (AP) St. John's posted a 3.2 victory today and eliminated Seton Hall from the National Collegiate Athletic Association Northeast regional college baseball tournament.

title: DUTCH PSYCHIATRISTS PRESS TALKS TO FREE 60 ADULT HOSTAGES
description: ASSEN, the Netherlands, May 27A team of psychiatrists continued negotiating today with South Moluccan terrorists who have freed 106 children and a teacher from a village school but are still holding 60 hostages there and in a commuter train they seized Monday.

title: EDOUARD VAN REMOORTEL
description: PARIS, May 27 (AP)Edouard Van Remoortel, director of the St. Louis Orchestra from 1958 to 1962, died in Paris yesterday, according to friends. He was 51. Mr. Van Remoortel, a native of Belgium, was conductor of the Belgian Orchestra at the time of his death.

title: Excessive Markups on Eyeglasses Said to Cost $400 Million a Year
description: WASHINGTON, May 27  A Senate committee, the Federal Trade Commission and the Justice Department are investigating alleged monopolistic practices in the sale of eyeglasses that may cost American consumers as much as $400 million a year in excessive prices.

title: Nan E. R. Malkin Is Wed To Dr. Donald L. Shapiro
description: Nan Elizabeth Rypins Malkin, a psychiatric social worker at the Center for Mental Health of the Manchester (Conn.) Memorial Hospital, and Dr. Donald L. Shapiro, the medical director of the center, were married yesterday. The ceremony was performed at the home of Drs. Sylvia and Francis Helfrick in Manchester by Rabbi Neil Kominsky.

title: L.I. Defendant Guilty of Killing Girl
description: A State Supreme Court jury In Riverhead, L.I., last night found Walter B. Carey guilty of the fatal beating of Long Island teenager, turning aside the defense contention that she died when doctors removed her from a respirator, four days after the beating.

description: ST. PETERSBURG BEACH, Fla., May 27 Worth C. Coutney, a former publisher of The Chicago Herald American, vice president of the Hearst Publishing Company and Hearst Publications Inc. and an advertising and business agent executive of The Toledo NewsBee, Toledo Blade and Cleveland Press, died here Wednesday. He was 79 years old.

title: Hunter Chased, Jackson Homers as Yanks Win, 86
description: Bob Lemon, the congenial manager of the Chicago White Sox, spent only one season as a coach with the Yankees. But that was long enough for him to get to know most of the characters in the Yankee cast that has become so entertaining to the rest of the baseball world.

title: Trudeaus Separate; He Keeps Children
description: OTTAWA, May 27Pr'me Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau and his wife, Margaret, announced jointly today that they had separated and that Mr. Trudeau, would retain custody of their three sons.

title: U.S. Five Gains Final
description: BARCELONA, Spain, May 27 (AP)The United States beat Yugoslavia, 9978, and Spain beat Turkey, 93.63, today in the semifinals of the sixth world college basketball championships. The United States and Spain will meet in the final tomorrow.

title: The Race for Governor
description: EAST ORANGE, May 27In the 1973 Democratic gubernatorial primary, Ralph C. DeRose, a former State Senator and a relative unknown, ran third in a fiveway race, with 95,085 votes to Brendan Byrne's 193,120 votes and Anne Klein's 116,705.

title: Carter, After Nuclear Sub Dive, Declares There Is No Finer Ship
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., May 27President Carter descended into the murky depths of the Atlantic today on a nuclear submarine cruise that mixed the politics of national defense with the nostalgia of his naval career.

title: Cubs Top Pirates, Move Within HalfGame of Lead
description: The Chicago Cubs have been a hitor miss proposition in the National League during the last three decades. They have not won the pennant since 1945 when Charlie Grimm was the manager.

description: Dave Anderson

title: Senate to Receive Arms Information,
description: WASHINGTON, May 27  President Carter has worked out an arrangement with Senator Henry M. Jackson to provide key Senate leaders with uptodate information on strategic arms negotiations through Mr. Jackson's subcommittee in an effort to prevent a major fight on the Senate floor if a treaty is ever signed with the Soviet Union.

title: Conspiracy of Silence Facilitates Abortion in Brazil
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, May 24Nervous but alleviated, and looking older than her 33 years, Marla turned to her girlfriend and said:

title: After 18 Months of Nearly Absolute Rule, Bangladesh's Leader Is Holding Plebiscite
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, May 27Maj. Gen. Ziaur Rahman, who has been running this impoverished country under strict martial law for 18 months, is going to the people for a vote of confidence.

title: P.&G. Increases BabyCare Leave To Six Months for Either Sex
description: CINCINNATI, May 27Both the men and women of the Procter & Gamble Company are getting the option of taking a sixmonth childcare leave when they adopt or have a baby.

title: Mentmore. Furnishings Auction Brings Surprising $10.3 Million:
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Nationalist in Soviet Georgia Is Battling the Army to Save Monastery
description: TBILISI, U.S.S.R.The Soviet Army is gradually destroying an ancient cave monastery in southern Georgia by refusing to shift the site of an artillery range, according to a former government official who lost his job after waging lonely campaign to save the complex.

title: New Education Commissioner
description: ALBANY, May 27In the private office of Gordon Mac Kay Ambach at the Sate Department of Education stands a tabletop sculpture in metal showing a stnall figure poised on a thin wire. When Mr. Ambach was asked today

title: Finley Halves Seat Prices
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 27 (AP)Charles O. Finley, owner of the Oakland A's, announced today he was cutting ticket prices in half for Monday .through Thursday games in hopes of raising attendance. I know that eventually there will be only one baseball team in the Bay area. I'd like to be that club. I think this move proves my sincerity, said Finley, whose American League team competes in the same market with the National League's San Francisco Giants. The A's have drawn about 153,000 fans in 22 dates this year, the Giants 183,000 for 17 dates.

title: Los Angeles Official Cites Role of Organized Crime In Child Pornography
description: LOS ANGELES, May 27 (AP)The explicit depiction in movies, books and magazines of children engaged in sex acts is a big business venture involving organized crime and as many as 30,000 children in this city alone, witnesses told a Congressional committee today.

title: Personal Investing
description: With stocks trading, in terms of earning power, at their lowest point since the bearmarket bottom of 1974, analysts cite as reasons, fears of inflation and a contracting business cycle. Concern over the quality of reported earnings was also called a factor. Page 29.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: A Commitment to the Environment
description: President Carter's message on the environment is more than a comprehensive list of unarguable goals. It is a vigorous commitment to carry out the specific environmental programs that the nation has adopted in the past six yearsand to press Congress for more. It is very different, indeed, from the rhetoric that has emanated from the White House since 1970. The Environmental Protection Agency in particular frequently had to act without the least assurance of adequate funding or political backing from the Chief Executive; it could count only on pious generalities. Here are a few examples of Mr. Carter's departures:

title: Vance and Gromyko to Meet
description: ST. SIMONS ISLAND, Ga., May 27 (UPI)President Carter said today that Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance and the Soviet Foreign Minister, Andrei A. Gromyko, would meet two more times before the middle of September to try to negotiate a new agreement.

title: The Standings
description: Saturday, May 28, 1977

title: Trudeaus Separate; He Keeps Children
description: OTTAWA, May 21Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau and his wife, Margaret, announced jointly today that they had separated and that Mr. Trudeau would retain custody of their three sons.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In an article on the Clean Air Act in The Times on Thursday, it was incorrectly reported that Representative George E. Brown Jr., Democrat of California, was a supporter of an amendment introduced by Representative John B. Breaux, Democrat of Louisiana. Mr. Brown backed another amendment, proposed by Representative Gunn McKay, Democrat of Utah.

title: Exchange in Kuwait Plans for Big Future
description: KUWAITThe Kuwait Stock hXchange will probably never challenge the supremacy of the Big Board, but on the basis of trading activitythe lifeblood of any marketits backers believe the future is assured. On one frenetic day last fall, the infant exchange recorded a higher volume of transactionsby valuethan the venerable London exchange.

title: Mets Bow As Hutton Drives In 4
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 27If the Mets ever run out of money to pay Tom Seaver's $225,000 annual salary, Tommy Hutton of the Phillies might. willing to contribute a little from his $50,000 or so to keep the rightbander around.

title: Apples Beat Friars
description: SAN DIEGO, May 27 (AP)Sandy Mayer beat Rod Laver, 63, last night to lead the New York Apples to a 2922 World Team Tennis victory over the San Diego Friars. Mayer broke Laver's service in the sixth game as the San Diego standout doublefaulted at game point. It was Laver's first loss to Mayer in five W.T.T. meetings.

title: The Next New York City
description: Many New Yorkers, leaders as well as followers, keep telling themselves that the city's financial crisis resulted from faulty bookkeeping, questionable fiscal practices and instil ticient subsidy from Albany and Washington. They want to believe that once these flaws are corrected, the city will resume its normal growth: The Big Apple will become the Ever Bigger Apple.

title: Most Banks Lift Primes to 63/4% From 61/2% Rate
description: Citibank yesterday raised the basic rate it charges on loans to corporations by a quarterpoint to 63/4 percent, the second such increase this month. By early evening most of the country's other giant banks followed the move.

title: World News Briefs
description: Special to The New Yule Timea

title: Arms Talk Session in Geneva
description: GENEVA, May 27 (Reuters)Unitad States and Soviet negotiators met for an hour and 40 minutes at the Soviet mission here today in an effort to bridge major differences over a new strategic arms limitation treaty. It was the second session since Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance and the Soviet Foreign Minister, Andrei A. Gromyko, held three days of talks in Geneva earlier this month.

title: A Village
description: Like many newcomers to New York Cityand more than a few nativesGeorge Weller of Kentucky was quickly stupefied by the intricacies of the subway system and the rainbowhued spaghetti strands that purport to trace its tangled underground course.

title: Around the Nation
description: NORFOLK, Va., May 27 (AP)W. Graham Claytor Jr., Secretary of the Navy, said today that the White House had endorsed a plan for putting women on oceangoing Navy ships in peacetime.

title: Tensions Increase Between Labor And Environmentalists Over Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, May 27The United Automobile Workers, long considered by many to be one of the nation's more progressive labor organizations, joined with the auto industry this week to help defeat stringent controls on car exhaust fumes.

title: Lou Graham Shares Lead With Stockton, McLendon
description: ATLANTA, May 27 (AP)  Dave Stockton, who won two P.G.A. national championships with some effective scrambling, resorted to that tactic today in shooting a threeunderpar 69 that staked him to a share of the secondround lead in the $200,000 Atlanta Classic golf tournament.

title: Allen Merrill Weds Gwendolyn G. Wall
description: Gwendolyn Grace Wall, daughter of Grace Audrey Wall of Huntington, L.I., and C. Robert Wall of New York, was married yesterday to Allen Kent Merrill, son of Mr. and Mrs. Allen H. Merrill of New York.

title: News Summary
description: SATURDAY, MAY 28, 1977

title: Cardinal Cooke Urges Help, Not Jail, in Marijuana Cases
description: Terence Cardinal Cooke's office said yesterday that young people using marijuana need help and jail does not seem to have been an effective way to help them.'.

title: RADIUM TO CAMPAIGN ON THE URBAN EXODUS
description: Representative Herman Badillo said yesterday that New york City could stop the flight of middleclass people to the suburbs by rebuilding the slums so that the poor would want and be able to stay where they live now.

title: The OneMan Gang
description: The reason for the high rate of unemployment is Henry Kissinger. Every time a new job opens up, Kissinger grabs it before anybody else can apply.

title: SINGLAUB REASSIGNED TO1MAJOR POST IN U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, May 27Maj. Gen. John K. Singlaub was named chief of staff of the Army's largest command today, less than a week after President Carter had relieved the officer of his post in South _ Korea for challenging the President's plan to withdraw American troops there.

title: Books of The Times
description: The ongoing upheaval in the Roman Catholic church has predictably evoked extremes of response, Since Vatican II began in 1962 to update traditionbound attitudes and practices, both clergy and laity have manifest lovehate reactions to the passing of the old and the emergence of the new. Some Catholics like what they see, others remain loyal but anguished, still others leave.

title: Smith Gains Round of 32 In France
description: PARIS, May 27 (UPI)Stan Smith overcame his dislike of clay courts today for a 64, 63, 75 victory over Juergen Fassbender of West Germany to join three other Americans in the round of 32 of the $330,000 French open tennis championships.

title: GE's Plants a Symbol of TV Output Decline in Northeast
description: SYRACUSE  Ten years ago, John Lockett, the president of Local 320 of the International Union of Electrical Workers, recalled, thousands of workers would arrive up to an hour early to get a parking space close to their plants in the gigantic parking lots surrounding General Electric's Electronics Park here.

title: 5 Charged With Of Soldier in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 27, (AP)Five men were charged tonight, with the murder of Capt. Robert Na1.1 rac, a British intelligence officer whop disappeared May 14, the police said,

title: COLLAPSE OF ACCORD ON COOP CITY IS SEEN
description: Leaders of the Coop City housing project in the Bronx say that their compromise agreement with New York State which last summer ended a long bitter residents strike over maintenance chargesis on the verge of breaking up.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Horse Shows
description: AT DEVON, PA.

title: Hess's Due on Amex
description: The American Stock Exchange has approved for original listing 1.4 million common shares of Hess's Inc., an operator of department stores. Trading in the stock will begin June 3., The stock currently is traded in the overthecounter market.

title: Soviet Jet Crash at HavanaKills 66
description: HAVANA, May 27 (Reuters)A Soviet airliner crashed as it was coming in to land at Havana Airport today, killing 56 passengers and 10 crew members, according to an official communique from the Cuban Government.

title: Dartmouth Struggles With Coeducation as Students Press for More Women
description: An outside candidate was recently defeated in a bid for election to Dartmouth College's board of trustees, and while few are willing to ascribe the candidate's defeat to her being a woman, and a black, and an outsider, the nomination itself reflected unhappiness among many Dartmouth undergraduates with the progress that the college is making toward coeducation.

title: General Who Criticized Regime in Argentina Is Reported Arrested
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 27 (AP)A rightist army general who had issued veiled criticism of the plans of the Argentine military junta to eventually restore civilian govenment has been arrested, the newspaper Cronica said today.

title: Cannes Prize to Italian Film
description: CANNES, France, May 27 (Agence FrancePresse)The Grand Prix at the Cannes Film Festival was awarded today to Padre Padrone of Paolo and Vittorio Taviani. The award for best actress was shared by the United States Shelley Duvall for her role in Robert Altman's 3 Women and Canada's Monique Mercure for her part in J. A. Martin Photographe. The best actor award went to Spain's Fernando Rey for his performance in Carlos Saura's Elise Mia Vida.

title: Going out Guide
description: MIDTOWN MEMORY LANE Weekend visitors to the Times Square area interested in seeing the new Songwriters Hall of Fame Museum can do so now, because today it begins opening its doors on Saturdays from .11 A.M. to 3 P.M. This is in addition to the regular weekday hours, at the same times Monday through Friday.

title: French Speck in Africa Lazes in Sun Waiting to Go Free
description: DJIBOUTI, Territory of Afars and Issas, May 22In the stultifying afternoon heat, the grimeencrusted ceiling fans at the Cafe de Paris spin wildlyto no avail. At the bar offduty soldiers of the French Foreign Legion, in rolledun Tshirts and cutoff

title: Maine Black Wins Place Names Battle
description: AUGUSTA, Me., May 27 (AP)A bill aimed at removing the word nigger from the names of brooks, hills and islands in Maine was passed in the State Senate today and was sent to Gov. James B. Longley.

title: Events Today
description: Music

title: Chamber Music a Hit at Spoleto U.S.A.
description: CHARLESTON, S. C., May 27The second major event of the Spoleto Festival U.S.A. 1977 was a performance of Gian Carlo Menotti's The Consul last night at the Gaillard Municipal Theater. But the events closest to the hearts of the audience so far have been the noonday chambermusic recitals. There have, been two so far at the 480seat Dock Theater. Both have been sold out, and have been greeted with enthusiasm little short of frantic.

title: Dayan Resigns From Labor Party In Furor Over Nomination by Likud
description: JERUSALEM, May 27Moshe Dayan quit the Labor Party today as the furor over his acceptance of the post of Foreign Minister in a prospective Likud government increased.

title: U.S. Open Site Goes Public for 78
description: Under the memorandum of agreement signed between the City of New York and the United States Tennis Association, the 1978 United States Open championships will shift from the West Side Tennis Club in Forest Hills, Queens to a public tennis center to be built in Flushing MeadowsCorona_Park, Queens.

title: Attempted Coup in Angola Is Reported Suppressed
description: JOHANNESBURG, May 27 (AP)President Agostinho Neto of Angola announced today that his forces had crushed a revolt by army extremists after street fighting that killed many men and women.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, May 27Representing what it described as the 1,180,799 citizens who voted against casino gambling, a coalition of church organizations and other citizen's groups appealed to Governor Byrne today not to sign the Casino Control Act until it is substantially strengthened against infiltration by organized crime.

title: GreatGrandmother, 58, Is an Advocate for the Poor
description: Florence Rice is a perpetually angry, onewoman consumer movement.

title: Detroit Adding 700 Policemen
description: DETROIT, May 27 (AP)Worried about a resumption of youth gang violence, the city is hiring 700 policemen to bring the force to record strength of 5,700. They will begin a training program next week, Mayor Coleman Young said yesterday.

title: O'Brien Fines Dawkins, Lucas $2,500 Apiece
description: Larry O'Brien, the commissioner of the National Basketball Association, fined Darryl Dawkins of the Philadelphia 76ers and Maurice Lucas of the Portland Trail Blazers $2,500 each yesterday for their parts in the fourthquarter brawl in Thursday night's game. O'Brien also ordered Gene Shue and Jack Ramsay, the coaches, to hold a meeting with their teams before tomorrow afternoon's third game of the championship series in Portland, Ore., to review the seriousness of the situation.

title: PrescriptionDrug Law Studied
description: WOODRIDGE, N. J., May 27As the Bergen County Prosecutor's office began considering today the possible indictment of a Manhattan man charged with a druglaw violation for carrying prescription tranquilizers in an unmarked container, support seemed to be growing in the State Legislature for a new amendment to exclude thousands of legitimate medical patients in New Jersey from the law's provisions and penalties.

title: Recital: Robert Black Enriches Works He Plays
description: The piano recital at Carnegie Recital Hall on Thursday night was advertised and presented as a League of ComposersInternational Society for Contemporary Music event, but Robert Black, the sole performer of the evening, made it his own night, and rightly so.

title: Appeal Ruled Out In Dismissed Writ On Cunningham
description: New York State's special anticorruption prosecutor, John F. Keenan, announced yesterday that he would not appeal the dismissal of an indictment against Patrick J. Cunningham, but would continue to seek evidence against the Bronx leader and his law partner, Joseph S. Kaming.

title: Patents
description: WASHINGTON Jacob Rabinow, a consultant to the National Bureau of Standards, got his 210th patent this week for a rocket designed to be fired rearward against a pursuit plane without tumbling.

title: Judge Calls for National Inquiry Into Leak
description: A Federal Court judge in Manhattan called yesterday for a national investigation into the disclosure in The New York Times of nonpublic information relating to terrorist bombings.

title: kiwi]. Increase Of 0.5% Shown By Key Index
description: WASHINGTON, May 27After a sharp upward revision in the first quarter's growth rate, the Government signaled today through an index designed to predict future trends that the economy may continue to grow strongly, but at a somewhat slower nace.

title: Plavinz Don Ouixote at the Supermarket and Fruit Stand
description: Until recently, I have never tried to be a hero. As a nonnative, but thoroughly indoctrinated New Yorker, I have learned the art of stepping around trouble. The conflict with a stranger, the unpleasant experience, the sharp exchange of wordswhen smell these coming, I back off.

title: The Ballet: Unadorned Spectacle
description: Theatrical spectacle that draws approving gasps from audiences is usually associated with sumptuous productions, but George Balanchine has elicited those pleased reactions frequently with the simple deployment of dancers on an unadorned stage. His Symphony in Three Movements opens on a long diagonal line of 16 young women poised for action; the line has a special vibrancy before anyone so much as moves a musde. New York City Ballet presented the work for the first time this season at the State Theater Thursday evening.

title: Flushing Line Trains Coasting
description: In an effort to cut costs, the New York City Transit Authority announced that it would begin testing a timehonored powersaving technique known to every teenager with Dad's borrowed car and little money for gasolinethat is coastine.

title: Two Die in Brooklyn Factory Fire
description: An explosion ripped through a paint factory in the Greenpoint section of Brooklyn yesterday afternoon, killing two employees and injuring nine others, including two firemen who fought the blaze which raged for nearly two hours.

title: Greyhound Is Best at Jersey Show
description: ROSELLE, N.J., May 27Ch. Grey Roc Winged Victory, a brindle greyhound bitch, scored over 952 other contenders today for her third bestinshow award at the Union County Kennel Club's 39th allbreed dog show at the Warinanco Park ice skating rink.

title: HOUSE UNIT PROPOSES $2.7 BILLION IN CUTS IN DEFENSE BUDGET
description: WASHINGTON, May 27The House Defense Appropriations Subcommittee today recommended cuts of $2.7 billion in President Carter's proposed defense budget, making a long series of small reductions without eliminating any major weapons system Mr. Carter had sought.

title: Takeover of Gerber Is Delayed by Court
description: The Michigan Court of Appeals yesterday postponed a proposed stock takeover of the Gerber Products Company by the Anderson, Clayton Company of Houston.

title: Associated Press
description: TANKER READY FOR SERVICE: The Aquarius, shown during recent sea trials, was officially named yesterday in ceremony at General Dynamics's Quincy, Mass., ship

title: Lebanon Right Says Palestinian Accord Is No Longer Valid
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 27 (Reuters)Lebanese rightwing leaders announced tonight they considered the 1969 Cairo agreement that regulates the activities of Palestinians in Lebanon as null and void and the Palestinian presence as illegal.

title: A Fine Quartet By Max Roach Is at Storyville
description: Max Roach, the drummer, whose engagement this week and next at Storyville, 58th Street at Madison Avenue, marks his first performance in a New York club in seven years, is leading a quartet that is a surprising and fascinating reflection of his own approach to drumming.

title: New Economic Units Sought by Canada
description: OTTAWA, May 27Forecasting an early end to the controversial wage and price controls instituted at the end of 1975, the Canadian Government proposed today that a new agency be established to monitor increases in pay and costs here after the present restrictions are

title: Joan Baez's Voice Has Become Richer
description: The opening moments of Joan Baez's Thursday evening concert at the Palladium could not have been improved upon. A soprano saxophonist wearing a red jumpsuit rode onto the stage on a unicycle playing the saxophone and honking bicycle horns. You know the words, he shouted out gruffly at one point. I know the melody.

Nine Are Arrested by Dutch Police:: On Suspicion of Abducting American.
description: AMSTERDAM, May 27 (Reuters)Nine persons were arrested here this week on suspicion of kidnapping an American cid.. zen for ransom, the police reported today.
