title: ANDREW A. BOCK
description: Andrew A. Bock, a member of the editorial board of International Reports on Finance and Currency, a financial service publication, died last Friday in a hospital in Glen Rock, N.J., after being struck by an automobile. He was 84 years old and a longtime resident of Glen Rock.

title: Schlitz Workers End Strike
description: WINSTONSALEM, N.C., May 29 (AP)Workers from the Joseph Schlitz Brewing Company's container division approved a new threeyear contract today, ending a monthlong strike, against the company, union spokesmen said. More than 1,000 members of the United Steelworkers had been on strike at plants here and in Los Angeles, Tampa, Fla., and Oak Creek, Wis.

title: Ramirez, Vilas Gain In Paris
description: PARIS, May 29 (AP)Raul Ramirez and Guillermo Vilas advanced easily to the final 16 today in the $300,000 French open tennis championships.

title: Consumer Advocate on French Radio Shouts for Attention, and Gets It
description: PARIS  In private, as she is so often in public, Anne Gaillard was angry.

title: 2,838 AT FORDHAM ARE GIVEN DEGREES
description: Fordham University conferred degrees on 2,838 students yesterdy at its 132d commencement exercise before an audience of 5,000 on the campus's sundrenched Edwards Parade Ground in the Bronnx.

title: Brock, Despite Unwritten Political Code, Cautiously Taking Sides in G.O.P. Primaries
description: WASHINGTON, May 29  Under the new leadership of Bill Brock, the Republican National Committee is venturing cautiously into a politically perilous area: backing one Republican among two or more competitors in a party primary.

title: HostageExchange Offer Rejected
description: ASSEN, the Netherlands, May 29 (AP)The Dutch police today turned back about 20 people who offered themselves in exchange for 55 hostages still held on a commuter train by South Moluccan terrorists.

title: Universal Stages a Poker Game To Publicize a Reissue of Sting
description: LOS ANGELES, May 29It was dvertised as a 14hour poker game, with the winner to receive the covted Sting trophy and Universal Studios to receive as much publicity as possible for the reissue of its 1973 Academy Awardwinning movie, The Sting.

Stitt, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert W. Stitt of Crestwood, N.Y. The Rev. Arthur Barton performed the ceremony. The bride graduated from the University of Colorado and the bridegroom from St. Anselm's College in Manchester, N.H.

title: SARA WINSTON
description: Sara Winston, an artist and a teacher, died Friday of a heart attack at Columbus Hospital. A former resident of South Orange, N.J., she had lived in Greenwich Village for the last 16 years. She was 79 years old.

description: All banks in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut will be closed today for the Memorial Day holiday. Security and commodity exchanges throughout the country will also be closed today.

title: India's Resorts: Raj is Gone but Victoriana Lingers
description: DARJEELING, IndiaAs the baking heat of summer creeps across the broad, flat Ganges River valley, pushing the temperature toward 120 degrees, Indians by the thousands are heading for the hills, as they do every year at this time.

title: Alex Haley Honored at His Roots Hamilton College
description: CLINTON, N.Y., May 29Alex Haley returned to his own roots today, delivering the commencement address at Hamilton College, where he was on the faculty for two years and where he wrote the first rough draft of his bestselling novel Roots.

title: Jonathan Merrill Marries Sandra Clyman in Jersey
description: The marriage of Sandra Joan Clyman to Jonathan Merrill, son of Mr. and Mrs. Yale Merrill of Baltimore, took place in Tenafly, N.J., yesterday at the home of Dr. and Mrs. Martin J. Clyman, parents of the bride. Rabbi Herschel Cohen performed the ceremony.

title: It Was a Spring of Swirls and Billows
description: It started a year ago with Yves Saint Laurent's romantic peasants. Now everyone is on a romantic kick.

title: Coast Guard Rescue Ship Sinks
description: ERIE, Pa., May 29 (AP)A 40foot, dieselpowered Coast Guard ship sank 200 yards off the shore of Lake Erie last night while attempting to rescue three persons from a capsized sailboat. Stan Sipniewski, a Coast Guard executive officer, said the four officers aboard abandoned ship, swam to the civilian sailors and towed them unharmed to the beach. The Coast Guard vessel, loaded with valuable electronic equipment, was submerged in about five feet of water, he said.

title: Quebec Separatists, Now Ruling, Decide to Moderate Their Policy
description: MONTREAL, May 29Under strong pressure from the Quebec government, the province's ruling party moderated its program today in an effort to attract domestic and international support for its goal of independence.

title: Consumer Notes
description: Joel R. Jacobson, president of the State Board of Public Utility Commissioners, has accused the nation's oil and gas producers of using the sharp increases in prices by the Arab oil countries as a smokescreen behind which they sharply increased their prices and profits, while simultaneously appearing to be free of any responsibility for the gouging being imposed on the American consumer.

title: Esther R. Weil Is Married To Harold Sturm, Student
description: The marriage of Esther R. Weil, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. David S. Well of New York, to Harold Sturm, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sandor Sturm of Toronto, took place at the New York Hilton yesterday. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi M. Weiss, assisted by Rabbi Bernard Rosensweig.

title: Watchdog Economic Unit Assails Europe's PayPrice Curb Policy
description: PARIS, May 29  A switch to tighter monetary policies is the only way Western Europe can achieve the twin goals of low inflation and more jobs set by the recent economic summit meeting in London. That was the conclusion of a newly formed watchdog group of private economists which met here Friday. The economists, monetarists all, strongly criticized the economic policies being pursued in most European countries as well as those advocated by international bodies such as the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development in Paris and the International Monetary Fund in Washington.

title: Byrne Signs Pinelands Order
description: BATSTO, May 29 (UPI)Governor terday signed an executive order yesterday creating a committee to supervise and regulate development in the Pinelands in South Jersey.

description: ATLANTA, May 29 (AP)Hale Irwin, faced with an unexpected challenge from Steve Veriato, who had made the cut in a tournament only one other time this season, had to birdie the final hole for a fiveunderpar 67 and a onestroke victory today in the Atlanta Classic golf tournament.

title: A Republican's Grave Misgivings About His Party's Leadership
description: WASHINGTONAbraham Lincoln once said, The Republican Party is filled with strange, discordant and even hostile elements. The performance of Republican leaders lately leads one to conclude that Mr. Lincoln's observation is still valid.

description: ENTRIES

title: RHODESIANS REPORT RAIDING MOZAMBIQUE
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, May 29 (AP)Rhodesian troops backed by jet fighters raided a black nationalist guerrilla base camp inside neighboring Mozambique today, killing at least 20 guerrillas and seizing a large quantity of war material, security officials announced.

title: Nuclear Weapon Use Discussed by Carter
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (Reuters)President Carter said in an interview published today that the deployment of American tactical nuclear weapons in the Pacific implied their possible use, if necessary, to defend South Korea in case of an invasion from the North.

title: MRS. CARIER LEAVES ON LATIN TOUR TODAY
description: WASHINGTON, May 29  Rosalynn Carter is leaving tomorrow on a 12day tour of the Caribbean and Latin America to tell leaders there that the United States cannot solve the problems of the world and that we need the help of these countries.

title: MRS. ABM TO BACK WINNER OF PRIMARY
description: In advance of announcing her candidacy for Mayor of New York City, Bella S. Abzug sought yesterday to remove the issue that some politicians believe cost her the nomination for United States Senator last year.

title: PAUL McCLELLAN JONES
description: Paul McClellan Jones, the president of the Carpet Wool Council since 1968, died yesterday of cancer at St. Agnes Hospital in White Plains. He was 68 years old and lived at 27 Hotel Drive in White Plains.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: STAY HOME, KING KONG Circusminded New Yorkers who have wondered how it would be, to performand haven't we all?have their chance tomorrow morning at 147 Spring Street, starting at 8:30. Acts of all kinds and ages are invited to audition for the city's first resident sawdust company, the Big Apple Circus, which makes its debut the weekend of the Fourth of July in Battery Park. The new onering project, which has partial civic and business backing, will be quartered in a spacious tent at the Battery for seven weeks, performing thereafter in other boroughs.

title: Joseph Reiss, 67, Philanthropist And Brooklyn Community Leader
description: Joseph Reiss, a philanthropist and Brooklyn community leader, died Friday of cancer at Beth Israel Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived at 1237 East 23d Street in the Midwood section of Brooklyn.

title: Ambitious on Ties With France
description: PARIS, May 29Leonid I. Brezhnev said on French television tonight that relations between the Soviet Union and France were good, but we are ambitious for more, and we think unused possibilities for that exist.

title: 3 U.S. Golfers Seeded In British Amateur Today
description: GANTON, England, May 29 (AP)Fred Ridley, 34yearold law student from Winter Haven, Fla., who won the United States Amateur title two years ago, tees off tomorrow afternoon in a bid to win the 1977 British Amateur without having played any serious golf in months and with only one day's practice on the Ganton course.

title: Anthony J. DePace, Architect Of Catholic Churches, Was 84
description: Anthony J. DePace, an architect who worked closely with the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York and the Diocese of Brooklyn, died Saturday at the Astor Gardens Nursing Home in the Bronx. He was 84 years old and had lived at the home for more than a year.

description: DEVON, Pa., May 29Icey Paws, who never has quite reached the top in Rod Jenkins's stable of jumpers, captured the first open jumper class tonight at the Devon horse show.

description: WASHINGTON, May 29The delivery of the nation's packages has changed dramatically in recent years and appears headed for even bigger changes.

title: LAWYERS DEBATE USE OF PUBLIC DEFENDERS
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 29Chief Just tice Richard J. Hughes of State Supreme Court invoked the biblical phrase Blessed are the peacemakers (Matthew 3:17) in a plea to his fellow lawyers to avoid polarization within the profession.

title: Upgrading Expected to Take 3 Years
description: A plan to replace New York City's fragmented and outmoded ambulance services with a unified and highly skilled corps of paramedic teams has been initiated by the city's Health and Hospitals Corporation.

title: I Am the Law
description: In the third of his television interviews, Richard Nixon spoke of the benefits of his foreign policy for Cambodia. For five years, he told David Frost, from 1970 till 1975, Cambodia enjoyed . . . enjoyed is not the best wordit had what you call a flawed neutrality.

title: List of Victims of Kentucky Fire
description: SOUTHGATE, Ky., May 29 (AP)Following is a list of victims identified so far in yesterday's fire at the Beverly Hills Supper Club:

title: Paper Says Brezhnev Will Be Chief of State
description: VIENNA, May 29 (Reuters)An Austrian newspaper today quoted East European sources as saying the Soviet Communist Party had voted last week to name the party leader, Leonid I. Brezhnev, to the additional post of chief of state.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: Because of an editing error, an article in yesterday's Times incorrectly stated that the one issue not discussed in negotiations for a new Panama Canal treaty was the role the United States would play in the defense of the canal after the treaty expires. The issue that has not been discussed is the compensation the United States will pay Panama for use of the canal during the period of transition of control.

title: Oerter Wins Discus Again, New York A.C. Takes Title
description: Al Oerter won the discus throw for the second year in a row and led the New York Athletic Club to the team title at the Metropolitan Amateur Athletic Union outdoor championships at St. John's University yesterday.

title: A New Foreign Policy: Cash or Charge?
description: In the end, the only measure of a foreign policy lies in the claims it is allowed to make on domestic interest. Worthy goals do not begin at the water's edge; they usually cost something that society is or is not persuaded to pay. War is the extreme example; free trade the almost daily test. Without a domestic price, a policy of wishing other nations well and bidding them cooperate is so much piety.

title: Outer Critics Give Stage Prizes
description: Liv Ullmann and Ntozake Shange are among those who have been honored in the annual awards of the Outer Critics Circle, the organization whose members write about the New York theater for outoftown newspapers. Miss Ullmann was honored for her role in Anna Christie, and Miss Shange as author of For Colored Girls Who Have Considered Suicide/When the Rainbow Is Enuf.

title: Businessmen Tell Troubles to Diplomats
description: Anne Cox Chambers, the newly appointed Ambassador to Belgium, took time out last week from a hectic round of Government briefings to spend a day in New York. The Atlanta publisher met here with top executives of four American corporations with interests in Belgium.

title: 9,000 Marathon Bicyclists Pedal in Park
description: Horsedrawn carriages, Joggers and a furtive moped rider or two jammed Central Park's East and West Drives yesterday morningalong with more than 9,000 bicyclists competing in the sixth annual PepsiCola Bicycle Marathon.

description: Music

title: Maddox, as Interracial Comedian, Brandishes Laughter Instead of Ax
description: ATLANTA, May 29Well, says the black guitarist, here we are, in living color.

title: Graduates Reassured By Mrs. Eisenhower
description: Mamie Eisenhower, speaking at commencement exercises at Eisenhower College in Seneca Falls, N.Y., said she may not be able to attend another graduation.

title: Foyt Takes Indy 500 for Record 4th Time, With Tom Sneva 2d
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 29The lineup listed 33 in the field, but it soon worked out to a twoman auto race today and in the end A.J. Foyt beat Gordon Johncock and won the Indianapolis 500.

title: Telescope Is Devised To Offset Distortions Atmosphere Causes
description: BERKELEY, Calif., May 29Scientists at the University of California here have developed a telescope that for the first time virtually eliminates atmospheric distortion.

title: MEMORIAL DAY
description: Today is Memorial Day. Schools, banks, securities and commodities exchanges will be closed and there will be no refuse collections or regular postal deliveries. Subway, bus and commuter lines will operate on holiday schedules with half fares in effect, and Sunday parking rules will pertain.

title: MOLUCCANS REFUSE DUTCH PLEA TO FREE A PREGNANT CAPTIVE
description: GLIMMEN, the Netherlands, May 29South Moluccan terrorists holding 56 hostages at gunpoint on a train here refused this afternoon for the second time to release one of them, who is seven months pregnant.

title: In Memoriam
description: GILMARTINMabel. Gone three years May 30, 1974, but not fogotten. She was a ??2 Florence Nightingale. JERRY VOGEL.

title: JOSEPH A. THOMAS, BANKER, DIES AT 70
description: Joseph A. Thomas, a senior partner in the investment banking firm of Lehman Brothers, died last Saturday after a long illness at his home in Old Brookville, L.I. He was 70 years old.

title: Commodities
description: Traders in commodity futures are often described as people who either buy goods they don't want or sell goods they don't have. Actually, what they buy and sell are contracts involving the future delivery and acceptance of commodities.

title: ALCOA REACHES ACCORD WITH ALUMINUM WORKERS
description: The Aluminum Company of America announced over the weekend that it had reached a threeyear labor contract agreement with the Aluminum Workers International Union affecting 14,000 hourly workers at eight facilities. The new contract was described as essentially like the agreement reached last week with the United Steel Workers Union, representing 10,000 Alcoa workers.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (AP)Douglas Fraser, newly elected president of the United Automobile Workers, says that George Meany, the 82yearold leader of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations. should step down when his term ends. in December.

title: Summaries of Indianapolis 500
description: 1A. J. Froyt Jr., Houston, Tex., CoyoteFroyt; 200 laps; 500 miles; 161.331 miles per hour.

description: Negotiators reportedly were making good progress last night in the labor dispute between the New York Racing Association and striking parimutuel clerks.

title: Upgrading Expected to Take 3 Years
description: A plan to replace New York City's fragmented and outmoded ambulance services with a unified and highly skilled corps of paramedic teams has been initiated by the city's Health and Hospitals Corporation.

description: Ambassador William H. Sullivan used his meeting with businessmen to pick their highly paid and widely experienced brains on the situation in Iran.

title: Mets' Lapses Costly as Phils Win by 76
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 29With just a taste of those inexplicable lapses that bedeviled their early years, the Mets turned in another dismal performance at Veterans Stadium this afternoon and lost again to the Phillies, 76.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: A Wagner Produces Modern Fidelio in Beethoven's Home Town
description: BONNHere, in Beethoven's birthplace, where every note of the master's scores is regarded as sacred, a starkly contemporary production of his only opera, Fidelio, is bound to raise controversyall the more so when the producer is making his professional debut, and especially when that producer is the greatgrandson of Richard Wagner and the son of Wolfgang Wagner, director of the Bayreuth Festival.

title: BERGER EGENES
description: Berger Egenes, a vice president of the investment firm of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, died Saturday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home. He was 59 years old and lived at 636 Clark Street in Westfield, N.J.

title: Denver Post Names Editor
description: DENVER, May 29 (UPI)Robert Pattridge, was named managing editor of The Denver Post Friday.

title: Major League Scores
description: LOBPittsburgh 4, Chicago 10. 20Parker 2, Mtterwald 1, Reuss, Murcer. 3BGarner. HROliver (6). SBOntiveros. SFCardenal.

title: Brezhnev Says New Arms Talks Achieved No Serious Movement
description: MOSCOW, May 29Leonid I. Brezhnev said today that no serious forward movement had been achieved at Geneva in negotiating a new treaty to limit strategic nuclear arms. As in the past, he blamed the United States for the impasse, arguing that the Carter Administration was still seeking an advantage.

title: 1873 Chandelier In White House Is Capitol Asset, Senate Insists
description: WASHINGTON, May 29President Grant bought it President Theodore Roosevelt got rid of it. Congress acquired it. Jacqueline Kennedy borrowed it. And now the United States Senate wants it back.

title: MOLUCCANS REFUSE DUTCH PLEA TO FREE A PREGNANT CAPTIVE
description: GLIMMEN, the Netherlands, May 29South Moluccan terrorists holding 56 hostages at gunpoint on a train here refused this afternoon for the second time to release one of them, who is seven months pregnant.

title: Senator Tower Weds A Washington Lawyer
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (AP)Senator John G. Tower, Republican of Texas, was married today to Lilla Burt Cummings, a Washington lawyer, in a private ceremony on the campus of Southern Methodist University in Dallas, his office announced.

title: Four Groups on Children's Causes Score Cuts Asked in Beame Budget
description: A coalition of four leading groups advocating children's causes has asserted that Mayor Beame's budget reduces direct service for childrenbut leaves administrative spending relatively untouched.

title: Petty Captures World 600 by Wide Margin
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., May 29 (UPI)Richard Petty, challenged only after caution flags permitted his opponents to catch up briefly won the $302,550 World 600 stock car race today by 30.8 seconds over David Pearson, the runnerup.

title: Temple Nine Beats St. John's for Title
description: MIDDLETOWN. Conn., May 29 (AP) Temple University today won the Northeast regional baseball championship of the National Collegiate Athletic Association by defeating St. John's University. 86.

title: Horse Shows
description: AT GLADSTONE, N.J.

title: Boxer Judged Best in Show At Metuchen
description: METUCHEN, N.J., May 29Four of he six finalists at the Plainfield Kennel Club's 35th allbreed dog show tonight were previous bestinshow winners, but a young boxer followed up his first working group victory with the top award. Handled by Jane Forsythe of Southbury, Conn., Ch. Sa1gray's Market Wise surpassed a total entry of 1,725 dogs on the grounds of St. Joseph's Hiph School.

title: Nightclub Toll of 491 in Boston in 1942 Was Highest
description: The blaze that swept through the Beverly Hills Supper Club in Southgate, Ky., Saturday night was the worst nightclub fire since 1942. when 491 persons perished in the Coconut Grove in Boston.

title: Dispute on Selection of Principal Is Raging in BedfordStuyvesant
description: Larry McBride has been staying away from school for nearly four weeks now. So have Domingo Reyes, Joanne Ocean and more than a thousand other students of the Alexander Hamilton Vocational and Technical School. They nave been drawn into a rancorous squabble of succession over who will be the principal of the school in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn.

title: Graham, Mitchell in Final
description: ATHENS, Ga., May 29 (UPI)  Tony Graham of U.C.L.A. upset secondseeded Bruce Manson of Southern California, 64, 76, and topseeded Matt Mitchell from Stanford defeated Chris Lewis of Southern California, 62, 64, in the National Collegiate Athletic Association tennis semifinals today.

title: Oil Price Control Enforcement Pushed
description: WASHINGTON, May 29Taking up where the Ford Administration left off, the Carter Administration plans to end price and supply controls for gasoline next fall.

title: Pop: Miss Carter at Bottom Line
description: For her wellreceived debut album a couple of months ago, Valerie Carter enlisted the assistance of a number of folkrock luminaries. This past weekend she's been opening for Country Joe McDonald at the Bottom Line, and one of those luminaries showed up Friday for her formal New York debutJohn Sebastian, who obliged with a harmonica solo. And there were others in the audience for the late show, too, among them Phoebe Snow and Mick Jagger. After all that, it's a disappointment to report that Miss Carter didn't live up to expectations.

title: Bob Gassoff of Hockey Blues Dies in Motorcycle Accident
description: VILLA RIDGE, Mo., May 29Bob Gassoff, defenseman on the St. Louis Blues of the National Hockey League, was killed tonight in a motorcycle accident in Franklin County, about 30 miles West of St. Louis, the Missouri Highway Patrol said. He was 24 years old.

title: Letters
description: Americans do not take kindly to retrenchment and skimping. The Administration and the Congress must shift the emphasis from the conservation of the dwindling supply of oil to the creation and development of new sources of energy. Exploration of cleaner methods of using coal may well be the place to start. But experimentation with wind and water power on a large scale and with ways to make nuclear power safe must not be delayed. The time calls for rapid action. Whether by high taxes or even mandatory rationing, conservation will work for short periods only, when the end of parsimony and restraint is clearly in sight. For Americans seriously to reduce extravagance and waste of oil will require assurance of a chance for less niggardly use of other forms of energy just around the corner.

title: ALBANY WILL APPOINT A TAXSTUDY PANEL
description: ALBANY, May 29Bipartisan agreement has been reached on appointment of a temporary state commission to study the question of equitable practices in propertytax assessment.

title: Carter's Chilean Policy
description: WASHINGTON, May 29  The Carter Administration has gone out of its way on several occasions to demonstrate its coolness toward Chile's military Government while continuing to maintain correct relations. Meanwhile, Chile's democratic forces of the center and left, both at home and in exile, have stepped up efforts to bury their old differences and forge a broad front to oppose the junta in power and to prepare an alternative government should the occasion arise.

title: Recital: Guitar
description: Andres Batista, who gave a guitar recital at Carnegie Recital Hall on Saturday night, is steeped in both the classical and flamenco guitar traditions. As a composer for the guitar, he draws freely from those sources as well as from the gypsy music that helped shape the flamenco style.

title: Scandal Could Alter Swiss Banking
description: ZURICHThe Swiss banking industry, that legendary world of numbered accounts and anonymous millions, has reached a turning point. Here in the industry's capital, bankers are increasingly convinced that the future will bring them tighter controls, less secrecy, a more hostile political environment and slower growth than they have enjoyed in the past.

title: Dr. Donald McGraw Weds Meredith Sutter
description: Meredith Anne Sutter, daughter of Mrs. John J. O'Connor of Setauket, L.I., and BarSurLoup, France, and Dr. James T. Sutter of New York, was married yesterday to Dr. Donald J. McGraw, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert N. McGraw of Adena, Ohio.

title: Charlotte Bernstein Is Bride
description: Charlotte Baer Bernstein and Abraham Nowick were married yesterday at the Young Men's Philanthropic League by Rabbi Judah Naidich of the Park Avenue Synagogue. The bride, whose previous marriage ended in divorce, is a daughter of Mrs. Abel Baer and the late Mr. Baer, composer of Lucky Lindy, a song commemorating Lindbergh's flight across the Atlantic in 1927. Mr. Nowick is a son of Mrs. Ida Gribetz and the late Philip Nowick. His first wife died.

title: Emergency Services in U.S. Found Uneven
description: By the end of this holiday weekend, ambulances will have been called upon to rescue some 20,000 persons seriously injured in motor vehicle accidents and another 40,000 who suffered other urgent, possibly lifethreatening injuries or illnesses.

title: Brooklyn Girl in Critical Condition After Attack by 2 Great Danes
description: A 9yearold Brooklyn girl was attacked and bitten by two Great Danes while playing near her home in the Bushwick section last night, the police reported.

title: Philadelphia Women Win
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., May 29The Philadelphia District First Team captured its third national title in the United States Women's Lacrosse Association tournament today at Brown University. The District team defeated the Philadelphia Colleges First Team, 102, and the South First Team, 84.

title: Business and Municipal Officials To Discuss FloodPlain Regulations
description: BERGENFIELD, May 29Business and municipal leaders in North Jersey will meet in Bergenfield High School on June 11 to weigh proposals for changes in Federal and state floodcontrol regulations that ban construction in areas described as floodprone.

title: The Standings
description: Monday, May 30, 1977

title: Girls' Teams Make Debut In AllStar Basketball Event
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., May 29Col lege basketball's recruiting circus played the Borscht Belt today. The scene was the seventh annual Seamco High School Basketball Classic, and it brought together the cream of the high school playersboth boys and girls.

title: ExSiberian Prisoner Welcomes 2 Daughters to His Native U.S.
description: An American sat in the garden of the Tavern  on  the  Green yesterday, speaking Russian with his daughters. eating filet mignon and reminiscing about the years he had spent eating rats in Soviet prison camps.

title: 20,000 Roll Into Poconos For CB, Trucks and Music
description: LONG POND, Pa., May 29Tens of thousands of people calling one another generally Good Buddy and specifically Cowboy Snoopy or Green Goblin rolled through the hills into the Pocono Raceway grounds here for a holiday weekend dedicated to three great American obsessionscitizens' band radio, bigrig trailer trucks and country and western music.

description: ENTRIES

title: ExSiberian Prisoner Welcomes 2 Daughters to His Native U.S.
description: An American sat in the garden of the Tavern  on  the  Green yesterday, speaking Russian with his daughters, eating filet mignon and reminiscing about the years he had spent eating rats in Soviet prison camps.

title: How Will Work and Welfare Work?
description: Permit us to suspend, for a moment, our frustration at President Carter's determination to reform welfare without spending an additional nickel, a determination that indicates the Federal Government will not, afterall, lighten New York City's heavy welfare burden. Beyond that dissatisfaction with the Administration's emerging reform plan may lie a political rarity. Like moving planets,the views of conservatives and liberals on the issues ofwelfare and work seem to be coming into conjunction. If so, the country is approaching an unprecedented opportunity for true reform.

title: 44 Die as Train in India Falls From Rail Line Weakened by Rain
description: NEW DELHI, May 30 (AP)An express train fell into a floodswollen river in northeastern India today, killing at least 44 persons and injuring many others, railroad officials reported.

title: PRESIDENT WILL SEEK. $375 MILLION MORE FOR NEEDY NATIONS
description: PARIS, May 30Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance said today that the Carter Administration would ask Congress for an emergency increase of $375 million in American foreign aid this year to help meet the most acute needs of the world's poorest nations.

title: The Standings
description: Tuesday, May 31, 1977

title: World News Briefs
description: MOSCOW, May 30 (UPI)Leonid I. Brezhnev accused Western leaders today of clinging to coldwar concepts that impede the progress of dtente.

title: Chaminade, Trinity Gain
description: SMITHTOWN, L. I., May 3Chaminade defeated St. Anthony's 21, today in the NassauSuffolk Catholic High School baseball league semifinal playoff, and will meet Holy Trinity in the twoofthreegame championship series. The Titans beat Maria Regina, 61, at Eisenhower Park in East Meadow to gain the final. John Rogan, the winning pitcher for Chaminade, and John Mortillaro, the loser, gave up three hits each. Dan Bartley pitched a fivehitter for Holy Trinity.

title: Earliest Pictures Of Slaves Found In Harvard Attic
description: Fifteen daguerreotypes, believed to be the earliest known photographs of American slaves, have been discovered in an unused storage cabinet in the attic of Harvard University's Peabody Museum of Archeology and Ethnology.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, MAY 31, 1977

title: Handicapped Children Held Victims of Layoffs Of New York Teachers
description: A child advocacy group has issued a report charging that, as a result of the financial crisis in the city's public schools, many handicapped children are now being taught by teachers who have seniority, but no experience in special education.
